Job Description:
SUMMARY OF POSITION

The Associate Creative Strategist is a key member of the Creative team, focusing on supporting the development of insightful, big ideas that exceed client expectations, achieve results and win business for the agency. Associate Creative Strategist demonstrate exceptional clarity around research and show an ability to generate strong insights from that research in order to drive creative thinking. This role also must show an affinity for creative ideation and actively contribute unique ideas to brainstorms and concept development.

Associate Creative Strategists assist senior Creative team members in organizing multiple contributors, helping to manage and copy write large scale RFP responses and project concepts. This position will also independently drive concept development for select projects and RFPs, working in collaboration with other Creative team members (Design & Digital) as well as cross-departmental teams in Account and Production.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

RESEARCH & INSIGHTS
Conducting research from a variety of sources, including primary research such as focus groups and interviews as well as secondary research from databases and industry sites, for projects & RFPs.
Developing insights from research that inform and fuel creative brainstorms.
Proactively researching client brands and industry trends to support Creative and Account teams in building organic and new business opportunities.
RFP RESPONSES & CONCEPT DEVELOPMENT
Developing measurable objectives and Key Performance Indicators to help ground and guide overall concept and proposal development.
Identifying key insights for creative concepting and brainstorms.
Contributing to the development of big, brave creative ideas as part of RFP responses and Concept Development phases of won business.
Crafting well-articulated plans and points of view, including comprehensive pitch decks for select opportunities and projects that include clear insights, strategies and creative concepts in a thoughtful, compelling and cohesive storyline. Support more senior Creative team members in this process for large opportunities and projects.
Managing multiple stakeholders as part of the proposal development process, supporting the organization and creation of concept decks, monitoring and collecting content deliverables across the cross-functional team.
Collaborating with Design team members to create cohesive and visually-inspiring presentations.
Participating in client pitch presentations as needed.
MEASUREMENT & ROI
Developing Measurement Plans for new and ongoing proposals and projects, discerning measurable objectives and Key Performance Indicators related to hose objectives, as well as identifying data collection methods for capturing data related to each KPI.
Supporting the Account team in collecting and analyzing KPI-related data in efforts to calculate ROI/ROE and provide insightful recommendations to improve and optimize our project executions.
OBE MARKETING SUPPORT
Monitoring industry trends for the agency (experiential and marketing trends) to share out internally as well as contributing to external agency thought leadership
Assisting Marketing Coordinator and New Business teams in creating targeted capabilities presentations for specific clients by leveraging case study library and capabilities overview.
Contributing to OBE Social Media presence in collaboration with Marketing Manager and Digital Content Marketing Manager.
Supporting internal brand marketing initiatives in collaboration with VP People & Operations as needed.
DAY TO DAY TASKS COULD INCLUDE:
Overall Strategy & Creative team support
Participating in client discovery calls
Architecting and presenting capabilities
Copywriting support for both internal and project-specific deliverables (i.e. email marketing copy, signage copy support, etc.)
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

EDUCATION

Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, Business Administration or related field.

EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 2 years agency experience.
Experience in event/experiential marketing to include generating ideas and concepts for innovative programs.
Advanced education degrees will be considered to supplement candidate's work experience.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Excellent research and insight development skills.
Strong creative and proposal writing skills.
Excellent client presentation skills.
Ability to understand client's business issues.
Deep knowledge in brand positioning, awareness and consideration.
Firm understanding and familiarity of working with Brand Guidelines and Style Guides.
BIG thinker, strategic in your approach.
Up-to-date on current media, industry and consumer trends that affect audiences.
Strong understanding of social media marketing.
Ability to travel.
OTHER QUALITIES AND SKILLS
Strong work ethic and ability to thrive and enjoy a fast-paces dynamic work environment.
Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.
High energy and flexibility in working non-traditional hours as needed (some nights and weekends).

SUMMARY OF POSITION

The Designer (Digital) is an integral member of the Creative Department, primarily responsible for the creation of immersive digital experiences for both live and virtual events for a range of brands. This consists of driving the design process, integrating with strategists and designers from within the Creative team, and collaborating with internal cross-functional teams, and external partners to ensure client needs are being met with premium design ideas and creative solutions. The Designer (Digital) will be a critical component in the generation of 360 marketing campaigns, developing art direction and new branding, creating still and motion graphics, and other creative tasks as assigned.

The hands-on nature of event marketing work requires a willingness to observe, adapt, research, explore, execute, revise, and refine creative elements in a fast-paced environment. The superstar that fills this role will embrace interdisciplinary creative projects, multi-tasks with ease, have an insatiable appetite for design, thrive when working with top-notch brands, and have an excellent attitude that inspires others.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
CONCEPTING: Offer strategic design solutions and create working drawings, storyboards, layouts, mood boards, and mockups to evaluate and present ideas in initial project phases.
DESIGN: Generate top notch designs across existing and emerging digital and experiential platforms. Create 2D and/or 3D designs to demonstrate concepts in support of strategies developed for assigned projects. Efficiently manage presentation documents, digital assets, print assets, and all other creative components on assigned projects.
PRESENTATION: Develop presentation skills by being involved in both internal and client presentations and conversations.
INTERNAL COMMUNICATION: Coordinate with internal teams leading up to and during activations to ensure approved creative materials are delivered on a timely basis, always maintaining consistency and quality.
EXTERNAL COMMUNICATION: Coordinate with outside resources, including vendors, printers, and contractors as needed for completion of the design and build out. Coordinate with freelance or contract creatives, supporting their integration into the team and streamlining design deliverables for client when relevant.
PROJECT & TIME MANAGEMENT: Work with cross-functional teams to establish and manage creative deliverable timelines to ensure work is on-time and of high quality.
INSPIRE: Seek out inspiration and share insights with internal teams to help educate and inspire.
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

EDUCATION

Bachelor's Degree in Graphic Design, UI/ UX design, Product Design, or similar discipline.

EXPERIENCE
2+ years experience as a digital designer creating digital assets (websites, banner ads, marketing emails, social media content, apps etc.)
Strong portfolio of creative work to demonstrate design for both digital + physical applications, +mobile or interactive design skills.
ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
2D DESIGN: Expertise in Adobe CC (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.), proficiency required. Knowledge of print file prep, printing techniques and materials is a plus.
UI/ UX: Experience in design prototyping tools (Adobe XD, Sketch, etc. ) + working knowledge of HTML and CSS. Knowledge of JavaSCript and other coding languages or software is a plus.
MOTION GRAPHICS + VIDEO EDITING: Expertise in After Effects, Final Cut Pro, Premiere, or similar animation and editing software.
SOCIAL MEDIA + INFLUENCER: Understand the ideation, development and deployment of content for Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc. PRESENTATION: Keynote, Powerpoint, Google Docs/Slides, proficiency required.
ADMIN: Microsoft Office, Google Docs, Dropbox, proficiency required.
OTHER QUALITIES AND SKILLS
Possess excellent organizations, interpersonal, and written communication skills.
Articulate design solutions to team members and clients effectively.
Translate strategic vision into tangible project design deliverables that meet project needs and garner approvals.
Multi-task while coordinating multiple projects + resources.
Embody a strong work ethic and ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic workplace.
Make smart decisions in accordance with company policies + procedures.
Be a team player who collaborates easily + brings creative momentum to projects.
High energy and stamina and flexibility in working non-traditional hours as needed (some nights and weekends).

Job Title: Tour Manager, Luxury Brand – National Driving Experience
Job Description:
THE JOB / Tour Manager,
Luxury Brand – National Driving Experience

EXPERIENCES / Responsible for planning and executing event and experiential marketing
programs.
The Tour Manager will assist the National Program Management
team based out of Stamford, CT in the execution of a nationwide driving
program running from May through September 2020.

The tour will consist of (4) teams that will each travel
to dealerships across the country and facilitate driving events that provide a
unique “behind the wheel” experience for consumers. Each team will consist of
(6) members including (1) designated Tour Manager.

Events will take place on both
weekdays and weekends; travel days as well as off days are built into the
schedule. Tour lengths will vary – exact tour routes and dates are not yet
finalized. All staff members will participate in a mandatory multiple-day
training session on the luxury automotive brand and event logistics prior to
departing for tour.

The Tour Manager will be
specifically responsible for leading their team and overseeing all aspects of
the tour schedule, logistics, and execution of daily events. The Tour Manager
will also be responsible for daily communication with the Management Team in
Stamford, CT, as well as advance communications with dealerships. The Tour
Manager is also expected to assist in all aspects of event execution on-site.

and assist in executing all on-site activities

that tour staff is meeting all event execution expectations

in advance with hosts of upcoming events

team members

for maintenance and security of all tour equipment
Set
daily schedules and assignments
Oversee
and verify all staff hours logged

product related questions

and approve weekly submitted expense reports
Diplomatically
solve any personnel issues within the tour team

that event attendees have a positive and engaging experience while
on-site

related duties as reasonably assigned

We are what we believe. And we believe

Even daunting.
That’s where we come into play.

our people to see the world for all its potential. We then help break down the

have a passion for and expertise in sports, entertainment, gaming, music

onsite management skills

JPL’s Live Experience Design team creates large- and small-scale live experiences, experiential marketing, and digital presentations for a host of clients across the world.
We are looking for a freelance designer who has the ability to translate complex information into visually stunning and impactful presentations. In addition to designing top-notch presentations, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many aspects of event design including theming and space design.
You are able to digest complex processes and reimagine them into simple visuals
You have some experience designing presentations but want to collaborate with an experienced team to learn all the tricks of designing stellar decks in PowerPoint
You understand the importance of an in-person experience at events or conferences and want to learn what goes in to making it all happen
You jive with strategists, designers, creative, tech, motion artists, account management, and clients to ensure creative vision is carried through
You’re a balanced left-brain / right-brain thinker with the ability to think in the clouds and quickly land ideas into the practical world
You’re an outgoing people person
You welcome other’s opinions and input and are constantly looking for ways to make your designs even better
You’re great as a cross-functional team player and understand the “all hands-on deck” mentality
A fast-past environment is your comfort zone, and you’re capable of moving rapidly between mediums, projects, and tasks
You thrive and stay cool as a cucumber under pressure
You’re never satisfied with the work but have the ability to move on and put effort toward improving the next piece based on what you just learned
You totally get the importance of beautiful typography and hierarchy of design
You wish every presentation you saw was as badass as your favorite TED Talk

The skills you bring:
Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud programs (e.g. Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign)
Proficiency with Microsoft Office and Acrobat
You understand the importance of great customer service
Designing in PPT doesn’t scare you
Positive can-do attitude and excited to venture into new realms of the design world
Great organization and communication skills
Are you experienced?
2+ years of experience working as a designer in any medium
Associate degree in a design-related field
Portfolio of work showcasing your designer chops, specifically, how you translate the complex into a cohesive story or theme
Applications must include a portfolio of work samples. Résumés received without work samples will not be considered.

What the work may look like:
Collaborate with account managers and strategists to understand the goals of a specific presentation or event
Participate in brainstorming the big idea for presentations or events and help plan how the team can bring it to life
Work with senior presentation designers to develop design themes and templates in PPT
Concept and design print pieces that tie into the overall theme to be used throughout the event space
Getting creative with Photoshop to mockup event signage within a space
Think through how attendees will flow through the event space and translate insights into all the interaction points: pre-event, during the event and post-event
Collaborate with senior designers and motion teams to create stunning content in PPT that make the presenter shine onstage
Tell compelling stories through the visuals you create in PPT

What you will be doing:

Managing both internal and external event production utilizing audiovisual technology for various events serviced by Five-Star. This includes participating in on-site visits by prospective clients, solicitation of new business, administrate duties, and supervising execution to ensure that our customers receive the proper equipment needed to accomplish their objectives and realize their vision.

Events Manager
New YorkMarketingExperienced
Responsibilities
About TikTok
Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.
We have global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Events Manager to join our growing Marketing team.
As an Events Manager, you will be tasked with building brand equity through event experiences, accelerating sales pipeline and promoting TikTok’s culture and values. The ideal candidate has a deep passion for events and a hands-on approach.
This is a highly cross-functional role that will partner closely with stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, Communications, Operations and more to bring activations to life and achieve organizational goals.

Responsibilities:
•Ensure TikTok’s event experiences bring the TikTok brand to life and align with business priorities, executive vision, product roadmaps and event messaging pillars
•Work with cross-functional teams to ensure positioning, goals, deliverables, and tactics are achieved before, during, and after each event, both at the messaging and client experience levels
•Manage a diverse portfolio of event activations that create a differentiated experience - from tradeshows and conferences to VIP receptions and speaking engagements
•Lead the event agency/sponsor relationships and build processes for repeatable/future event activities
•Own all aspects of event coordination including strategy, objectives, asset creation, event messaging, on-site production, logistics, etc.
•Track results and impact of all event activity, optimizing future events accordingly
Qualifications
•5-7 years of the event, experiential, brand and/ or field marketing experience
•Excellent project management experience, including experience managing budgets and ability to manage and execute multiple projects simultaneously
•Strong stakeholder management skills and comfortable managing expectations and keeping teams on track
•Ability to work across various levels of the organization to build trust and foster collaboration
•Deep understanding of marketing/sales funnel and methods by which to increase opportunities
•Strong foundational knowledge of tracking, measuring and reporting on ROI
•A proactive approach to handling any challenges that might arise and the ability to quickly troubleshoot
•Collaborative attitude and a strong eye for detail
•Ability to work well under pressure with tight deadlines
•Bachelor’s degree required

Job Title: Brand Activation Manager, Absolut, Malibu, & Kahlua
Job Description:
Position Title: Brand Activation Manager

Position Location: Remote

Position Summary:
An opportunity to work on an outstanding portfolio of brands which contribute significantly to the over all volume and profitability of Pernod Ricard USA. Portfolio includes: Absolut Vodka, Malibu Rum, and Kahlua Coffee Liqueur. All three brands have a strong innovation strategy and a trade advocacy force of 130+ individuals; this represents an opportunity to build and execute programming with a high level of impact and reach.

The Brand Activation Manager will play a critical role on the headquarters marketing team as the bridge between strategic planning and in market execution. As a key representative of all 4 brands, this individual must be highly skilled communicator with the business acumen to collaborate with and influence various cross functional stakeholders (i.e. PRUSA Sales, Field Activation, Chains Division, Brand Marketing, Finance, upper level Sales and Marketing management, Operations and Support Agencies).

The Brand Activation Manager Spirits Marketing is responsible for the delivery in market of “Below the Line” strategies & programs, in line with each brand’s strategy and is responsible for assisting the field to ensure these programs are tailored to channels and markets’ needs.

He/She is also in charge of leading communication to the Chain group and supporting the Chain team.

Major Responsibilities / Accountabilities:
Provide support and guidance to the Sales teams for the localization & market-level execution of brand plans through a regular communication flow. Ensure activation playbooks, priority calendars and selling tools are catered to relevant channels & subchannels allowing for effective localization.
Ensure upfront alignment with Sales teams, by integrating their feedback and needs early in the process, through regular communication and also direct in Market field observation.
Manage a portion of the priority market A&P budgets across the portfolio in partnership with the Market Activation Managers and Directors. Ensure that A&P is optimized in each market to deliver against the annual plan objectives.
Analyze performance of each program and derive learnings from it, in collaboration with Brand Marketing and Sales teams.
Define role, objectives, KPIs and priorities for sampling agency. Monitor their activity and provide them with regular support and information on each brand’s priorities throughout the year.
Analyze competitors’ activations, in collaboration with Sales teams across different Markets.
The role requires a deep understanding of the U.S. On-Premise & Off-Premise universe and dynamics, as well as wide knowledge of Adult Beverage brand activations in that channel. It also expects strong relationships, communication and influence with internal stakeholders, namely Brand Marketing teams, Division/Chains/Field Marketing & Sales teams, Digital and Prestige teams, as well as with external agencies. Individual should have a working knowledge of digital marketing (Social, Ecomm, etc).
This position may travel up to 30% of the time.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business or related field. MBA is a plus.
Minimum of 4-5 years' experience, minimum 2 years U.S. Adult Beverage experience. Trade Marketing, Marketing or Sales experience required. Strong presentation / communication skills.
Preferred:
Experience in developing brand activations.
Experience in managing agencies.
Experience in managing Experiential Agencies.
Experience in Adult beverage sales.
Experience in project management and ability to work within a cross-functional team of diverse stakeholders.
Event and/or experiential marketing a plus.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; particularly skillful in Excel & PowerPoint
Fluency in written and spoken English
Who are we?

Pernod Ricard USA is the premium spirits and wine company in the U.S. The company's leading spirits and wines include such prestigious brands as ABSOLUT® Vodka, Chivas Regal® Scotch Whisky, The Glenlivet® Single Malt Scotch Whisky, Jameson® Irish Whiskey, Malibu®, Kahlúa® Liqueur, Beefeater® Gin, and Avión™ Tequila (through a joint venture with Tequila Avión); such superior wines as Jacob's Creek® and Brancott Estate®; and such exquisite champagnes and sparkling wines as Perrier-Jouët® Champagne, G.H. Mumm™ Champagne and Mumm Napa® sparkling wines. Learn more about our history, values, strategies and organization by visiting us athttp://www.pernod-ricard-usa.com/

Working at Pernod Ricard

Working for Pernod Ricard USA means working for the co-leader in the global wines and spirits industry – and having the opportunity to work with great people and great brands in diverse and challenging roles. Our success is the result of the passion and creativity of our people, our exceptional portfolio of leading premium brands, and a shared commitment to our values of entrepreneurship, mutual trust, and a strong sense of ethics. Pernod Ricard USA rewards both individual initiative and a spirit of collaboration, and encourages ongoing professional development. Pernod Ricard USA recognizes the importance of continuously building upon our diverse workforce and inclusive culture. We believe in championing an inclusive culture that embraces differences and encourages employees to challenge themselves and their colleagues.

Benefits

Pernod Ricard USA offers competitive compensation, performance bonuses and domestic & international career development opportunities.

* Pernod Ricard USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.

* Offers will be subject to United States local terms.

Position Summary:
The duties and responsibilities of an Event Manager center on planning and managing events of varying sizes and purposes. Managers must demonstrate the understanding of what it takes to make sure event logistics are flawlessly executed upon, keeping everything within the allocated budget and ensuring that the event itself is carried out smoothly.
The Event Manager must possess an extensive skill set and qualifications that work together to manage events efficiently. The following are the specific skills and qualifications required for the Event Manager to be successful:
Communication and Interpersonal Skills: The Event Manager is required to network with a wide variety of entities in the course of their job. Vendors and venues must be established, and an entire staff must be managed in order for an event to function properly. They will need to have a general knowledge of what our guests expect.
Team Management: The Event Manager will carry out many tasks on their own, but a major aspect of the job is working with a team. Delegating to a team properly and making sure everyone has what they need to do their job requires team management and leadership skills.
Budgeting: The Event Manager will be responsible for keeping costs within the allocated budget. This will require a degree of financial skill as well as the ability to create accurate reports.
Logistics: The Event Manager must possess a degree of skill in logistics to properly plan the details, track progress, measure results, and anticipate potential problems that may arise.
The position supports the mission of the organization by demonstrating excellent interpersonal skills and incorporating sound customer service fundamentals for the Cardone Ventures team and its clients.
About Cardone Ventures:
This company operates nationally and is growing by the day. You’ll be an integral part of our growth as you help to streamline existing recruitment and HR processes. You will enjoy working for a true leader in the industry alongside a very supportive team of business professionals. Our core values are the backbone of our business; we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, intentional, and results oriented.
Performance Objectives:
Maintaining and monitoring event plans, event schedules, work hours, budgets and expenditures.
Establishing and maintaining relationships with vendors and venues
Planning event details and aspects, including seating, dining, and guests
Remaining under budget with all costs
Managing events and addressing potential problems that may arise
Planning for potential scenarios that could impact the integrity of the event
Maintaining a working knowledge of the complex needs of a wide variety of events
Organizing, attending and participating in stakeholder meetings in regard to event.
Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings.
Preparing necessary presentation materials for event meetings.
Ensuring event project deadlines are met.
Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project.
Assess event risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.
Create and maintain the events management calendar.
Capabilities/Key Competencies:
Demonstrated excellence in organization, planning, problem solving, decision making, communication, project management and effective management of resources.
File management, transcription, and other administrative procedures.
Ability to work on tight deadlines.
Ability to be a self-starter and work independently with minimal supervision.
Skills in database management and record keeping.
Must be able to analyze information, identify solutions, and resolve problems in a timely manner.
Excellent interpersonal skills that allow effective working relationships with a diverse customer, colleague, and vendor population.
Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Office environment including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook; Google Drive including Notes, Sheets, Slides, and Gmail.
Creative thought, critical thinking, and analytical skills.
Team orientation and strong collaborator.

The Digital and Corporate Communications Officer is responsible for audience growth and the optimization of Broadway
Bank's social media platforms, community development, and innovative brand
communication in support of marketing and communication objectives. The ideal
candidate for this position is well versed in cross-channel strategy including
public relations, social media, search engine optimization, content and email marketing
to increase overall brand awareness, content reach, audience engagement and
thought leadership.

This role will be a key member of the Marketing Communications
team at Broadway Bank, and will partner with internal and external teams to
develop digital communications plans that support the short-term and long-term strategic
goals of the bank.

Candidate will need to lead digital channel initiatives and
continue to take a data-driven approach to optimize strategies to ensure
ongoing success.

Key Accountabilities:

Brand Communications

Responsible for the execution of strategic and tactical initiatives for Broadway Bank’s external communications efforts for best-in-class storytelling through traditional and digital channels.Work closely with VP, Corporate Communications Services Officer to develop tactical. recommendations and creative execution for innovative content to plan, develop and promote messaging that reinforces the Broadway Bank brand to existing and future customers, as well as media.Develop strategic messaging and distribution, and reporting capturing insights, learnings and recommendations to enhance strategy and implementation.Preparation and delivery of content including media materials, social content, internal and employee content, email copy, and other materials as needed.Manage content and editorial calendar to manage media and social media initiatives.Apply skills to manage multi-channel campaigns, strategies and tactics that reflect channel differentiation and audience reach.Interface with and own key piece of our Digital Communications agency relationship, including weekly management and reporting.

Public Relations

Build awareness and customer loyalty by generating targeted media coverage through storytelling and the development of creative PR programs.Monitor media environment to recognize real-time opportunities to capitalize on brand alignment while identifying potential threats to the company’s reputation.Develop content for media and customers through collaboration with multiple stakeholders and partners.Assist with crisis communication plan execution.Experiential marketing, community sponsorship activations and event support for special projects.

Social Media

Provide strategic management and dissemination of compelling storytelling in support sales goal across multiple platforms and audiences—social, online reputation management and more—tailored to meet the objectives of each channel. Develop and maintain an industry-leading social media “voice” that leverages established brand attributes and accentuates them for platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn and You Tube. Responsible for developing and implementing the company’s social medial strategy, including developing brand awareness, generating inbound traffic, expanding reach and encouraging product adoption.Manages presence in social media networking and community sites posting relevant blogs, videos, etc., and seeding content into social applications as needed.Manages social media initiatives and day-to-day activities.Duties include online advocacy, writing editorials, community-outreach efforts, promotions, etc. Coordinates with MarCom team, Social Media Active Response Team (SMART) and other bank personnel to support initiatives.Community management including advocates, influencers and bloggers.Develop and monitor effective benchmarks for measuring the impact of social media programs, and analyze, review, report on effectiveness of campaigns to maximize results.Monitors and maintains appropriate records and audit files as outlined in the Social Media Policy to meet corporate compliance and ERM requirements.Ensures all postings are compliant.Guides and develops the SMART to manage monitoring and response needs; provides guidance and training as outlined in the social media policy. Makes appropriate recommendations. Marketing Communications

Work collaboratively with Line of Business leads in Marketing and Communications to define content workflows and project support. Assist with management of complex projects to launch new products, new services and new experiences. Consult on other digital projects and initiatives as needed.

About This Role

As Via's Events Marketing Manager, you'll join an energetic team that thrives on getting our innovative mobility technology in front of as many potential partners as possible. The Events Marketing Manager will be responsible for shaping the annual event strategy for Via's B2B and B2G business (at Via this is known as our "Platform Business"), creating campaigns to support the events, managing the event experience, and measuring results. You will partner closely with the global Platform Sales team and the broader marketing organization. You should be a strategic and scrappy thinker with exceptional attention to detail, a focus on creating great brand experiences that deliver measurable results for Via as we define the future of transportation in cities around the world.

What You'll Do
Drive Via's events strategy and manage all aspects of event coordination including: strategy, objectives, materials creation, event messaging/marketing, signage, giveaways, contract negotiation, vendor relations, site selection, registration, agenda scheduling, staffing, etc...
Conduct post-event/campaign evaluations and ROI analysis; report and share results and recommendations with sales and marketing teams.
Research industry events and evaluate sponsorship opportunities based on Via's objectives and target markets.
Partner with PR to write and submit clear and concise proposals for speaking opportunities
Maintain event and campaign documents - budgets, calendars, checklists, run-of-show, etc.
Complete budget reviews and ROI analysis; pivot strategy to align with findings.
Achieve benchmarked ROI metrics by working with the sales and demand generation teams, managing and analyzing campaign data in Salesforce.
Collaborate with Marketing team to create high-impact marketing materials
Travel to events to provide onsite management as needed
Who You Are
Have 5+ years of experience with event planning and/or field marketing in a B2B or B2G environment
Collaborative; Strong ability to work seamlessly across departments and geographies with business and creative teams (internally and externally)
Demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal. Business-level proficiency in another language (i.e. French, German, Spanish) a plus.
Possess a campaign-oriented approach to events
Highly detail oriented, with strong project management and organizational skills
Self starter with eagerness to take initiative
Able to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Committed to customer service and fostering relationships, both internal and external
Creative and innovative thinker
Enjoy multitasking and operating under pressure to meet deadlines
Critical thinker, able to use sound judgement and data-driven decision making to drive business objectives
Resourceful, and enjoy creating success by being efficient with resources
Have experience with tradeshow environments and logistics
We're Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. Our guiding principle is simple: we know that the future of transportation is safe, dynamic, shared public mobility the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, compliments existing transit infrastructure, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around. Through intelligently designed operating systems and sophisticated routing algorithms, we build localized and customizable solutions for each and every one of our global partners (100 and counting, last we checked)

Long story short: we're very proud to be championing the transportation evolution of cities around the world and modernizing mobility. Ready to join the ride?

Via offers above market compensation packages and benefits, including equity, health insurance, and relocation assistance.

Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Overview


Lincoln Military Housing – A company for Growth and Opportunity!



Lincoln Military Housing was formed in 2001 through a Department of Defense (DoD) contract with parent company Lincoln Property Company. Our mission has always been to increase the quality of military housing for our nation's service men and women. Lincoln Military Housing now provides more than 36,000 family homes for military members across the US. Our Team Members are passionate about the work they do and take pride in our mission of providing our military families with exemplary service in a quality home environment.

When you join the LMH team, you will be working amongst a team of talented and passionate individuals while being provided with unparalleled opportunities for personal and professional development and career growth. Every day with LMH, you have the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of our service members and their families by demonstrating our core values of INTEGRITY, COMMUNICATION, EMPOWERMENT, RESPECT, BALANCE, and COMMITMENT.

Responsibilities


A Day in the Life of an Event Coordinator:

As a Lincoln Military Housing Event Coordinator, you will plan, create, coordinate and host events and programs for residents that build connections within their community, create memories for the family, and provide rewarding experiences and opportunities. Your position is responsible for effectively producing high quality and well planned events and managing all aspects of the event planning process. Your role requires strong organizational skills, self-starter with high energy, ability to travel to various locations within the region and deliver on our mission of providing exemplary service in accordance with Lincoln Military Housing’s customer satisfaction standards.

Your Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Event Planning- develop and coordinate all phases of the event planning process (research, design, planning, coordination, and evaluation) with delivering quality and creative.
Event Management – ability to manage and execute multiple events simultaneously. This includes but not limited to timelines, production schedules, risk assessment, creative design, vendor/venue management, event team coordination, and logistics management.
Event Production Coordination – responsible for executing on and off site events including but not limited to event team coordination, event set-up, day of hosting, event and risk brief, managing logistics throughout the event, and event tear down.
Budgets and Contracts - oversee, review, and process assigned accounting and financial matters based on assigned event budgets. (i.e. processing invoices in Payscan, MEC’s/IEC’s, PAF’s, PO’s, requesting quotes from vendors).
District Support- support District Teams within the event planning process to ensure the success of the event experience and entire planning process.
Marketing Coordination- develop, design, and create effective and comprehensive marketing plans and materials to market events and programs (i.e. flyers, website content, social media content, newsletters, banners, posters, email, event photography, event registration management).
Partnership Coordination- collaborate with like-minded military organizations, agencies and businesses on partnership and/or sponsorship opportunities to meet the needs of the residents through programing, events and other resident events.
Record Keeping- maintaining accurate event folders and records both online and in paper form and submit required items by deadlines (i.e. event recaps, attendance stats, evaluations, event photos).
Department Support – support through special projects, team members, and collateral duties as assigned.

Talentline is hiring for a full-time Experiential Market Manager to remotely manage and develop a team of 12 Experiential Product Specialists (XPS) in the Central Region.

Museum of Ice Cream seeks a Creative Producer to join our Creative Production team. You should be a design savvy creative with a passion for experiences and popular culture. Remember those crazy ideas you dreamed up as a kid? Museum of Ice Cream is the place where whimsical ideas and products are transformed into real life experiences, and you will be the one who will help us bring it all to life! Our mission is to design environments that bring people together and provoke imagination while creating lasting memories.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


You will be responsible for owning our creative projects from start to finish - this might mean figuring out how to build a sprinkle pool or a cherry cloud room, or running and organizing all of the details of a National Ice Cream Day Celebration.
You will concept and develop all physical installations, while tying environmental principles into your designs, and developing creative solutions to common design problems.
You will manage project budgets, and will be responsible for ensuring projects are completed on time and under budget.
You will source all of our materials, researching different ways we could accomplish our projects, and coming to a conclusion on which best suit our needs.
You will construct presentation/design proposals to clients or managers.
ABOUT YOU:
Bachelor's in graphic design, architecture, art or related field
4 - 10 Years experience in production design, fabrication or industrial design
Ability to work in fast paced environment with tight deadlines
Strengths in time management, project management and multitasking,
Ability to produce results (on time and under budget) in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
Natural problem solver
Mastery of Adobe CS
Ability to travel to all new locations and relocate for short periods of time.
Knowledge of fabrication, materials and lighting
A passion for art, design, and ICE CREAM is key. A desire to build, dream and inspire is mandatory.
ABOUT MUSEUM OF ICE CREAM:


Museum of Ice Cream is an inclusive and immersive brand, designed to captivate your sweetest fantasy and sugar-filled daydreams online and IRL. At Museum of Ice Cream, we invite you to believe in the magic of creativity, to remind you that inclusive spaces do exist and to show you that childlike wonder is worth savoring. In our world, ice cream is the agent of change and the vehicle to ignite the creative spirit that lives in all of us. Fueled by the power of imagination, MOIC is a universe of possibilities with tons of room for you to explore.

Job Description

Director, Experiential Event Marketing

The Director of Experiential Event Marketing is responsible for a variety of marketing activities that support VMware global events. Primary leadership areas include 1) all marketing initiatives from brand to journey plan to onsite execution, 2) curation and production of various digital event activities (including online events and other digital programs, etc.), and 3) all operational activities for VMware’s corporate marketing events, including: VMworld US, VMworld Europe, marquee partner events, launch events and more. This person will work closely with the VP of Global Events & Experiences and other marketing leadership, graphic and content teams, digital experts and other stakeholders/contributors to strategically bring excitement, innovation and excellence to our events to better amplify and support VMware’s strategy and key initiatives. Ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker and experienced leader who has broad marketing experience and is able to be solve business needs through creative event planning, and successful managing multiple and evolving priorities – all to meet the needs of and delight attendees.

Responsibilities:
Understand and articulate marketing objectives and company vision.
Articulate business value for all recommendations/decisions, develop appropriate KPIs and establish regular cadence of analysis/reporting for areas of ownership.
Lead and manage teams, suppliers and other contributors on flawless execution of all assigned deliverables and programs – on schedule and within budget.
Oversee development, design and execution of all event themes, brand and creative journey elements, and ensure all in line with event objectives and strategy. Ensure creative amplification across various digital platforms and cross channels.
Set strategy and manage all marketing communications to achieve audience acquisition and other event goals with concise, effective communication programs through all appropriate channels (including internal communications).
Develop and execute plans for web strategy and presence. Direct development of event specific websites/microsites, vmware.com, internal sites and appropriate external sites to support event objectives.
Define and provide strategic event metrics for all marketing and other key event activities.
Provide strategic direction relative to the operations of all events and lead operations team and vendors in flawless execution of all activities.
Develop and enforce comprehensive operational standards, and act as key advisor to team and other stakeholders to ensure optimal business outcomes and achievement of event goals.
Manage research programs to gain intelligence and create better event programs.
For all events, define video strategy aligned to current VMware messaging and strategy.
Design creative plans to expand and extend VMware’s reach through digital events, using net new, curated or complementary content. Demonstrate strong understanding of various digital and virtual event technologies and applicability to different programs.
With VMware’s advertising team, define appropriate advertising plan, including on- and off-premises print, online media, paid search and all other OOH options.
Produce VMware launch events, VMworld live streams and replays, and other VMworld digital activities, as needed.
Define technical requirements and manage solutions and providers that deliver infrastructure or other supporting technology for all video and digital experiences.
Define plans and oversee any third-party relationships that supports audience acquisition or other event marketing initiatives.
Manage event budgets and P&L plans in collaboration with VP, Events team area owners, finance, sourcing and third-party vendors.
Develop strong relationships with cross functional teams.
Effectively lead staff, creating a positive and inspirational workplace; ensure individuals are enabled to succeed and develop professionally according to role and capabilities.
Required Skills/Experience:
Minimum of ten years successful marketing and/or event management experience that spans across multiple event disciplines – preferably for a high-tech, fast-paced company. Five-plus years staff management experience required. High attendance (10,000+), global conference experience preferred.
Proven experience with multi-million dollar revenue modeling and expense management.
Success in managing and negotiating with third-party vendors.
Ability to work on multiple projects at once, set priorities, work independently, problem solve, improvise, and function as part of a team that must perform under pressure.
Show desire to continually improve processes and think outside the box with creative approach to new projects.
Foster collaboration and teamwork across cross-functional teams that are not under direct control.
Be a team player skilled at both managing and working as part of a team.
Demonstrate superior communications skills, both written and verbal, including ability to present and effectively interact with all levels (including executives).
Minimum undergraduate degree required.

To make all that great work happen takes a lot of coordination and organization behind the scenes.

THE TEAM DIFFERENCE

People may forget your witty hashtag and your latest campaign tagline, but they will never forget how you made them feel. Thats because what a brand does is much more important that what is says. Actions speak louder than advertising and marketing. Experiences are what create real connections that lead to brand love and thats what we do at TEAM. Were a fun, collaborative, hard working group with a great office environment who takes care of our employees, to ensure that both in work and in life you experience something greater.

TEAM Enterprises is looking for a PART TIME Brand Ambassador. The Brand Ambassador will build strong relationships with Bartenders and industry professionals in order to deliver rich experiences that bring the brand to life. As an employee of TEAM Enterprises, youll be in direct contact with retail customers focused on promoting distribution, menu placement, consumer samplings and more. Your earning potential can be $3k or more per month.

This program runs from now until September 2020. To apply submit your resume via email to sjeter@teamenterprises.com

WHAT YOULL DO
Achieve monthly business objectives by selling to premium bars, restaurants and hotels.
Build new relationships and selling opportunities
Maintain a positive working relationship with all key accounts for specific SKUs
Create menu placements as permanent or temporary offerings
Train bar management and staff on product and serving methods
Execute consumer samplings
Complete weekly reports, account activity
Achieve client brand standards, objectives ad growth goals
WHAT WERE LOOKING FOR (QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS)
Existing relationships in the assigned market with at least 8-10 bars/restaurants
Must be able to dedicate at least 10 hours per week
Bar tending and beverage Industry knowledge required
Strong ability to execute appropriate promotional plans in targeted bars/restaurants/liquor stores
Familiarity with the market and key accounts catering to the targeted consumers
Well-connected with a variety of influential groups and individuals in the focus market
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
WHO WE ARE

TEAM is a topnotch experiential marketing agency who develops and executes creative marketing campaigns rooted in strategy, insights and decades of learning. We partner with the best brands and people to deliver experiences that create inspiration at the point of engagement. Our roster of talent is essential to executing quality campaigns which live up to our high standards, for more information visit us on our website, Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter .

Please be advised this is a part-time, seasonal position. Most events take place on Fridays and Saturdays, although some midweek events may occur. The location of events varies and includes Phoenix, AZ and surrounding cities.

Tentative Start Date: Immediate

Job Description: OneCause Onsite Event Managers are responsible for executing and managing OneCause events onsite.

The essential job functions for the person in this role include:
Manage/Execute OneCause events on location.
Manage OneCause staff.
Setup and manage the OneCause technology including: OneCause/ BidPal proprietary software, laptops, tablets, credit card readers, OneCause handheld devices, printers.
Manage and resolve all OneCause related client expectations.
Provide software training to client's staff, volunteers and guests.
Review all client auction and guest data and make appropriate changes where necessary onsite.
Work with client to ensure software is fully utilized to maximize event revenue.
About OneCause Inc.
Are you passionate about creating a positive change in the world? Come join our team of change-makers!

We are on a mission to help nonprofits across the country feed the hungry, fight cancer, promote the arts, educate young people and everything in between. Our commitment to helping nonprofits use technology to more efficiently manage their fundraising efforts, engage more donors and raise more money has fueled steady growth in OneCause's software and services.

Leading the industry, OneCause first revolutionized charitable fundraising in 2007 by introducing mobile bidding to silent auctions. Today, OneCause has an expansive product line of mobile and online fundraising software which has helped our clients raise over $1 billion and connect 1 million donors to their causes. Think you have what it takes to help lead us toward more Technology for Good®? Then keep reading!

Desired Skills & Experience
BS/BA required.
2 years total work experience in event management desirable
Management of external event staff, volunteers and guests
Strong leadership skills
Exceptional customer relationship skills
Exceptional communication skills – including: written, interpersonal and public speaking
Highly organized with the ability to meet multiple concurrent deadlines in a fast-paced environment
High level of initiative
Comfortable with using intuitive web based software as well as smartphone technology (iPhone and Android)
Basic knowledge of setting up hardware (tablets/laptops/printer) using Wifi technology
The Opportunity:

In 2011 charitable giving in the U.S. was estimated to be more than $298 billion. OneCause is well positioned to assist its not-for-profit partners to capitalize on the opportunity to maximize their fundraising capability.

You bring the drive to succeed and professional consulting experience to maintain OneCause's position in the marketplace as the leader in auction automation. We deliver the products, support and career growth you desire.

Overview


Experiential Marketing Program Manager

Talentline is hiring for a full-time Experiential Market Manager to remotely manage and develop a team of 12 Experiential Product Specialists (XPS) in the Central Region.

Our team is comprised of tech savvy, and highly professional product experts who are able to simplify the clients' brand message for the everyday consumer at local events in their communities, at retail, and at large-scale events like CES.

Perhaps the most important quality of our team is that they are brand experts and passionate about educating consumers on the advantages of technology available to them. We are in the business of creating advocates of the clients' brand by way of leaving them with a fun and memorable experience.

Experiential Market Managers (EMM) truly care about the people that they’re responsible for, lead with empathy, have a knack for driving sales and a “do whatever it takes to win as a team” mentality. We measure success by overall team performance, top talent retention, and team satisfaction.

This job is for you if…

You’re good at:
Advocating and empathizing
Creating a winning team culture
Solving problems (and enjoy doing it!)
Creating sales strategies to drive results among your team
Communicating complex ideas in a simple way
Gaining buy in on your ideas
Developing yourself, and others
Building strong professional relationships
Using data to drive strategy in your business
Using sound judgement to make decisions
Working with remote leadership
Organization of all things
Written and verbal communication
Salesforce systems

Individual development plans for direct reports
Development of sales strategies
Implementing contests to drive engagement and results among the team
Weekly team performance and activity tracking

New hire interviews , onboarding, and training

Conduct regular ride alongs in market with team members
Ensure compliance with company policy and procedures
Maintenance of team product knowledge assessments
Host regular team calls
Job Contact
jgarcia@2020companies.com

Support internal executives and department heads in managing client relationships; including, business development, account management, training, and operations in order to maximize program impact and efficiency.
Partner with various marketing agencies and present to their leadership teams in order to expand Talentline’s current portfolio of staffed events

Job Description:
Daybreaker is a Brooklyn-based social enterprise and morning dance and wellness move-ment in 23 cities around the world with a community of 500K+ and growing. Our bread and butter are weekday morning events that start with a one hour yoga + fitness experience followed by a 2-hour dance party all before going to work. We are a substance-free community and are reimagining how humans socialize (in the morning / without alcohol or drugs). We are experience designers and community builders with a results-oriented management team that is set on building a lasting movement that solves a major societal problem: loneliness and isolation. Ultimately, our goal is to invite more play, more wellness, more community, more dancing and more belonging. daybreaker.com

Our events are: Zero Carbon Emissions | Multi-generational | Woman-Owned business

THE ROLE //

As a member of the Daybreaker team, you will be welcomed into our global family of epic humans, dedicated to spreading love and mischief around the world. We like to think of each Daybreaker event as a "love bomb" that explodes onto the city as the sun rises, and inspiring people to live with positivity, opens,shift their perspective.

As a Daybreaker Event Producer & Community Catalyst (we'll call you a "Producer" for short), you are the face of Daybreaker in your city! That means you will be the face of Daybreaker in your city, responsible for building an engaged and passionate community, producing mind-blowing experiences, and promoting the events to relevant audiences. You will be supported by the hardworking Daybreaker HQ team, who will coach and train you to be the best Producer you can be. We’ll provide you with the skeleton of what you need to produce Daybreaker events, grow your community, and uphold the global brand. It’s up to you to bring the hustle, passion, and creative zeal to create unique and refreshing events that participants will love. You'll be in charge of finding venues, sourcing talent and performers, cultivating a volunteer production team, coordinating with vendors and sponsors, creating local partnerships, and producing monthly events. We’ll provide marketing, communications, operations, branding, sponsorship, financing, and PR support so that you can concentrate on creating experiences that participants will never forget.

This is a paid part-time role, approximately 10 hours per week.

Requirements

The ideal Producer should live a healthy, conscious lifestyle. You should have a big heart and love dance music. You should be detailed and hard-working — a savvy and competent professional. You should be active in the startup/tech industry, the health & wellness world, and/or local arts & culture community. You should have a big network of millennials you can tap into, already be leader in your community, and know how to produce a great event start-to-finish that immerses people and transcends the commonplace. Ideally (but not required), you are a Burning Man participant. :)

YOU'LL NEED //

+ An entrepreneurial mindset and independent approach to your work — you should be an organized self-starter

+ Several years of large-scale event production experience

+ A strong network of influencers, creatives, doers and people who say YES to amazing experiences

+ Phenomenal community-building background — you should be a natural organizer of people

+ Cultural savvy in your city — you should be plugged into the local arts + music scene in your city to know what's cool and who's talented

+ A flexible schedule

+ A big heart, a clear mind, and a voracious appetite for all things that surprise and delight

Benefits

+ Insights and hands-on coaching on experience design, event production, brand management, and community development -- all best practices that have grown Daybreaker into a global movement

+ Access to a global network of artists, DJs, and musicians who are excited to participate and add to the experience

+ Collaborate with an international community of amazing Producers committed to the Daybreaker movement and creating unique experiences around the world — you can consider these folks your new global family

+ Monthly strategy sessions with Daybreaker co-founders and serial social entrepreneurs Radha Agrawal and Matthew Brimer

+ Invitations to exclusive events such as art exhibitions, underground dance parties, startup mixers, family dinners, and mindful experiences

+ Local and global support from our PR team, who has landed Daybreaker major features in leading publications like The New York Times, GQ, and The Washington Post.

If this sounds like your dream job, and you're serious about the role, then we would love to receive your application. We're excited to chat with you!

Job Title: Membership & Events Manager, Soho Works - 9000 Sunset
Job Description:
Who we are…

Soho House & Co is a collection of members' clubs, restaurants, hotels, workspaces, and cinemas, catering to those in the film, media, fashion and creative industries. The company has unique ventures throughout the UK, North America, Europe and Asia, with new openings planned globally.

The Mission…

Soho House is a platform for creativity and a space for its diverse members to have fun, connect, discover and grow. Our passion is people, and we put members and our team at the heart of everything we do. We promote equality, respect and kindness within our walls, and in every community, we create around the world. At Soho House, culture is everything and we believe that our Houses are only as good as the people who work within them.

The Role…

At Soho House the Membership & Events Manager for Soho Works (“Works”) is responsible for directly building and defining the local membership community, as well as ensuring the culture, experience and profits are maximized through events and partnerships. In addition to being a direct contact and resource for members, the Membership & Events Manager is a custodian presiding over access to the Works site and preserves shared workspace rules and conduct. They personally drive and maintain the productivity of the membership community and take an active role in members’ events and benefits.

A successful Membership & Events Manager at Works oversees membership and events, responsible for event curation and ensures membership intake targets are achieved and the overall experience within the shared workspace is elevated, approachable and rememberable.

The Membership & Events Manager will report to the General Manager with a dotted line reporting structure to the Head of Membership & Communications and Head of Events (or Events Manager) for your region, with whom they will work to ensure we recruit creative, quality members, curate high caliber Works-focused events, and keep the “magic” throughout all Works properties.

This role will be based at the Works you are hired for.

Requirements

Requirements/ Qualifications:
Minimum of 4+ years’ relative experience with a proven track record of leading a professional, efficient, high quality, service-oriented operation.
Minimum of 2+ years Management experience.
A long-term city resident with extensive knowledge of the local area, local politics and a personal network of contacts in different industries including but limited to; film, television, music, media and culinary, etc.
An essential part of the job is being available on a flexible schedule and being willing to work outside “office hours”. For example, nights, weekends and holidays (as needed and when applicable). This may or may not be required on a regular basis, but is mandatory when needed.
Strong organizational and project management abilities.
Daily use of the Microsoft Office Suite, Salesforce and other systems.
Adaptable in various situations.
Professional manner and attitude.
Friendly and approachable.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Leadership skills to motivate and develop staff and to ensure accomplishment of goals. Able to set priorities, plan, organize, delegate, and control.
Ability to work effectively under time constraints and deadlines.
Passionate about the Soho House and Soho Works upholding its standards and core ethos.
Physical Requirements
Must be able to seize, grasp, turn and hold objects with hands.
Must be able to work on your feet for at least 8 hours.
Fast paced movements are required to go from one part of the club to others.
Must be able to move, pull, carry, or lift at least 30 pounds.
Occasionally kneel, bend, crouch and climb as required.
Benefits

Why work with us...

Soho Works offers competitive compensation packages that feature global benefits and perks. Whether you’re seeking entry-level employment or a new opportunity to expand your profession, we offer training to develop the technical and managerial skills necessary to enhance your career.
Health Care + 401K: Full time employees are eligible for full benefits; Medical, Dental & Vision as well as Retirement fund with a 2% match
Paid Time Off: Full- Time Employees have sick day's + vacation days
Career Development: Soho Works can progress your career internationally.
Learning & Development: An extensive range of internally and externally run courses are available for all employees.

Job Description
Event Manager

We are looking for an enthusiastic and self-motivated person to work in our energetic and driven marketing department, as the Event Manager. You will bring your organization, creative skills and imagination to manage effective marketing communications, events and projects in order to maximize brand awareness and desirability. You will likely be a big music fan. You will be a key player in improving the work flow and efficiency of the marketing department. You will be responsible for managing marketing inventory, orders, loans, and organizational procedures.

Working with the wider marketing team, you will be responsible for the development, management, promotion, implementation, and scheduling of all US events, from large tradeshow style exhibitions to smaller, tabletop displays.

The successful candidate will
Have at least 3 years experience in event management.
Pay great attention to detail and be skilled in working within tight deadlines and budgets, and be very comfortable juggling multiple projects and requests at once.
Be able to show management proficiency with tradeshow exhibitions, from conception and planning through to on-site booth and team leadership.
Understand the importance of setting event KPIs and objectives, and reporting on them after an event.
Not get flustered easily, proving your organizational skills are your strongest asset.
Be meticulous, and believe that good enough is never good enough. You strive to achieve excellence in all activities.
Be able to develop multiple concepts in tandem, always looking for more streamlined and effective ways of connecting with our customers at events.
Be confident in front of peers and can lead planning meetings in order to generate plans all stakeholders agree with.
Key Role Responsibilities
Drive and develop the US events strategy, continually questioning and improving our current roadmap.
Lead event planning meetings with key stake-holders, to determine event propositions and plans.
Manage all event implementation activity including but not limited to; event booking, layout/design, graphics, product, audio and cabling needs, prize giveaways, point of sale, packing lists, outbound and return shipping, and in-attendance staff
Develop success metrics (KPIs) for events and provide feedback after each event
Maintain, coordinate and adhere to individual event budgets
Order, distribute, and manage all event materials and execution items
Coordinate all event promotional activity pre-, during, and post-event, including social media posts (IG (live & feed), Facebook), attendee invite and thank you ecomms, and media channels.
Keep our marketing events calendar up-to-date
For large tradeshows, book hotels and ground transport for company Directors, and company dinners
Develop tradeshow and staff schedules and information packets
Manage timely delivery of event equipment to avoid rush shipping charges
Facilitate artist/industry product loan procedures including creation of loan forms, organizing product testing, outbound and return shipping, ordering of new demo inventory as needed
Manage office inventory system. Awareness of movement of gear and logging items in and out of the office.
About us

Our audio technology brands stand together, seeking to enrich lives through music by removing barriers to creativity. We want to create opportunities for everyone to enjoy making music, from musicians trying to capture their unique sound, to the professionals delivering the greatest shows on earth.The Focusrite Group has an illustrious history with four Queen's Awards for Enterprise among a host of other accolades. We comprise six successful and rapidly growing brands: Focusrite, Focusrite Pro, Martin Audio, ADAM Audio, Novation and Ampify Music. With a high-quality reputation and a rich heritage spanning over four decades, our brands continue to shape the music-making world.

Focusrite leads that world in audio interfacing technology more musicians record through Focusrite than any other brand. The Focusrite Pro team are focussed on the complex needs of the audio professional for whom sound is not just a passion, but a way of life. Martin Audio have been uniting audiences for almost five decades with their awe-inspiring touring and installation loudspeaker systems. Based in Berlin,ADAM Audioare precision innovators in the field of professional monitoring and loudspeaker technology, made famous by their unique ART ribbon tweeter. Novationis obsessed with helping electronic music makers find new ways to produce and perform new music. Born out of that team and based in Tileyard, King's Cross, London,AmpifyMusic make innovative music-making apps that are highly accessible, yet extendable and deep.

Music technology is an enriching space to work in, and thats not about to change. We embrace its evolution, and that means remaining open to new ideas. We enjoy a Group-wide open-door culture, where we can all contribute and everyone is heard as we grow and develop, both as individuals and as a team. We encourage innovation and fresh-thinking and are passionate about the inspirational solutions we create. Behind our success is a tightly knitted, like-minded family of music and audio lovers. Were always pulling together to try and make a difference; our frequent appearance in The Sunday Times 100 Best Small Companies to Work For is testament to this.

As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage people to apply regardless of religion, ethnic background, nationality, sexual orientation or gender identity. We recognise the diversity shortcomings of our industry and are committed to driving change. Equally, we recognise the major impact that climate change is having on our world and work every day towards being industry leaders in a carbon neutral future.

Benefits include: company 401(k) plan, life insurance, healthcare, employee purchase scheme, company making things easy days, lunch and learns were all about innovation, fresh thinking and great, great products. We work hard, were professional and we select really, really talented people. We absolutely love our work. So if you think you can bring something new to the mix, well be looking forward to hearing from you.

Boise, ID

Description

We are looking for Event Manager to help us grow our business at various events in the greater Boise area. You will work in the field managing our event marketers and building your own team. Our marketers generate leads and appointments for our design consultants by attending events such as home shows, showroom seminars, open houses, and other organized gatherings.

You will work closely with the Non-traditional Marketing Manager in building and motivating your team. You need to be organized, energetic, flexible, assertive, engaging and have a competitive spirit.

Job Description

The purpose of this position is to cost effectively drive non-media lead generation and local awareness through the following marketing tactics: events and trade shows, corporate partnerships, business partnerships, referrals, community groups and more. The Event Manager is responsible to manage and execute local marketing efforts which include events such as home shows, outdoor fairs/festivals, business expos, etc.

Key responsibilities:
Lead, motivate and train staff in a competitive, high-energy environment.
Creates and plans local calendar of events where RbA products and services can be showcased with the sole purpose of creating exposure and generating qualified leads
Build and maintain a team that can GENERATE LEADS.
Daily communication with manager.
Follow up and measure team performance, generate regular reports for management
Work in the field at various events.
Set up events when needed.
Routinely check marketer’s performance in the field.
Role playing with marketers to ensure using script.
Set an example for work ethic, integrity, team play and professionalism.
Coach team to reach their full potential.
Meet goals and performance objectives.

Requirements

Experience and qualifications:
Ability to demonstrate strong leadership skills.
Ability to self-manage resources (time and budget) to achieve objectives.
Ability to analyze effectiveness of events, sponsorships & local programs.
Bachelor’s degree in marketing/communications preferred or equivalent demonstrated skills and abilities
Ability to proactively approach consumers in an event setting.
Excellent communication skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office products.
Must be able to work weekends and some nights.
Must have reliable transportation.
Must be able to travel 100 miles outside of the greater Boise area to attend events.
Overnight travel possible.
At least 2-years experience in field marketing or promotions.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The Event Manager will consistently deliver exceptional service to our client through excellent operational and logistical facilities management. This position will be responsible for managing, supporting and/or executing the coordination of various events within the client’s meeting spaces. The role requires strong operational understanding and practical experience in event logistics and venue management.

Along with other FIRST team members, the Event Manager will represent the FIRST Solutions brand on-site within a well-known tech company. In this role you’ll work with internal teams to coordinate the logistical needs of the event space. This role will report directly into the Team Lead.

This role is not currently available, but we are always eager to speak with qualified individuals who want to learn more about working with FIRST.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provides consultative ‘one stop shop’ planning support for Event Hosts to ensure exemplary event experience
Discovery of Event Host objectives and requirements for meeting.
Review budget and offer suggestions to maximize ROI
Create working budget for Event Host
Organize logistics, decor, entertainment, catering and all other event needs
Ability to recommend event enhancements to achieve desired event objectives
Review of all meeting space to ensure proper space assignment
Informs Space & Service Coordinator of space need changes and cancellations
Forecast each group spend as assigned as required
Update group information in internal systems in a timely manner
Periodically checks event spaces and setups to ensure event services are appropriately delivered
Communicate event needs with Event Associate and checks in throughout group event on any additional needs and serves as an on-site contact for clients during an event
Create all services communication to be distributed on a timely basis to all service departments
Conduct post event survey with Event Host (as outlined in post survey SOP) and communicate comments/compliments/issues to service levels.
Report on budget spent and objectives met and how to build on these for future events
Plan events from conception to budget reconciliation to ROI tracking, according to goals and objectives, target audience, and strategy
Work closely with all departments to develop and be responsible for event requirements and deliverables, including but not limited to communications, calendars, registration needs, feedback surveys, and wrap up reports
Coordinate with facilities, arranging and overseeing all event details, such as audio and visual, decor, catering, security, entertainment, premiums/swag, and transportation
Create in depth event based on strategy but pushes the boundaries of creativity and innovation
Manage multiple programs/events, across various industry verticals, with creativity, innovation, and strategy, delivering world class creative execution
QUALIFICATIONS:
3 – 5+ years’ event management and/or corporate meeting planning experience required
Strong meeting coordination experience for meetings/conferences ranging between 50 – 300+ people
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Experience working cross-functionally with all levels of stakeholders in a fast-paced environment
Ability to understand the meeting/event objective and mission, business, and audience in order to align with the overall vision and strategy of the needs of the Event Host and event
Organizational and time management skills
Ability to execute tasks independently and efficiently
Creative problem solver, resourceful, team player
Adaptability to situations and ever-changing demands
Highly organized with the ability to handle multiple tasks to meet strict deadlines
Excellent time management and multi-tasking skills
Ambitious and proactive with a calm and flexible approach to handling pressure
Experience working on large and complex databases
ADMINISTRATION & GENERAL:
Assume responsibility for own environment, ensuring adherence to health and safety policies while having clean smart surroundings
Work intelligently and ensure management is aware of problems or issues which negatively affect productivity
Build excellent relationship with team through positive communications
Ensure knowledge is shared within the team to enable them to work smarter and more efficiently
Work on ad hoc requests from clients as required
