Job Summary:

Were seeking an energetic, ambitious marketing and account professional to join our global marketing team in Chicago as Esports & Influencer Marketing Manager. The role encompasses marketing and management of Influencers, content creators & programs with esports teams with a special focus on the Americas region. Tasks include developing campaigns to support brand awareness, new product launches, and sales.

The role reports to the Director of Global Esports & Influencer Marketing and will be based in our headquarters in Chicago, IL. The ultimate candidate will thrive in and foster a fun and fast paced environment and have an entrepreneurial spirit and drive. You must possess a passion for the gaming world, and experience managing influencers and sponsorships and be both creative and analytical.

Business Function and Responsibilities:
Manage all components of our global influencer programs and account relationships with Esports teams with special focus on the Americas.
Assess, recruit, and on-board new influencers into the SteelSeries Influencer program.
Partner with regional marketing leads from around the world to build locally relevant campaigns that leverage esports and influencer content to help drive sell out as well as brand or product awareness.
Drive continuous improvement through analysis and reporting of programs while achieving key milestones and targets.
Support the development of integrated marketing plans with Influencers and Esports teams for all key product launches and marketing campaigns.
Minimum Requirements:
3+ years experience working within the Esports/Gaming sector.
Experiencing managing multiple influencers and negotiating partnership deals or affiliate programs
Strong understanding of social networking platforms and associated marketing.
Understand gaming, streaming and esports culture and expertise on gamer audiences.
Excellent understanding of account management and ROI driven campaigns.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills to clearly articulate ideas and present results.
Project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Bachelors degree (or equivalent) in Marketing or related field required.
Experience with Microsoft Office.
Consumer hardware, ecommerce or gaming related experience preferred
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite and social analytics tools also a plus.
Open to US Residents, sorry we cant do any visa sponsorship at this time. This position is located in our office in downtown Chicago.

Summary

Whether we're working with major financial institutions on improving data access for their customers, or fueling a fully digital lending process, here at Finicity, we're fortunate to spend our days improving people's financial lives and organization's financial decisions.

As the events coordinator, you will be instrumental in driving successful outcomes at industry trade shows and Finicity hosted events as well as creating a welcoming culture and environment in our Salt Lake City office. We're seeking someone with excellent communication skills, the ability to multitask and problem solve, and who works well under pressure. The position will primarily focus on events coordination, but there will be front desk duties associated with this role, including greeting and checking in visitors.

What you’ll do
Support marketing events by assisting with event booking and set-up tasks, arranging travel, preparing tradeshow booth assets, and other logistics
Execute all general front desk tasks such as ensuring all visitors have a pleasant check-in experience, anyone entering our secure office has the proper credentials, and answering incoming calls and directing them to the right person
Work with third-party vendors to gather pricing and contract details for review by our Marketing leaders
Help track, measure and report metrics across event marketing efforts
Assist with internal events/operations as needed.
Assist marketing with other special projects including presentation and document creation, expense tracking, budget monitoring etc.
Assist with clerical tasks including drafting documents and emails, creating presentation slides, contributing to reports, scanning, faxing, etc.
What you’ll need to be successful
6-12 months of experience performing clerical or administrative work in a professional environment with college coursework or equivalent experience in marketing and/or events planning
Prior successes in the planning and coordination of corporate events, as well as in contributing to multi-phase professional projects
Positive attitude and disposition with a willingness to take on additional tasks and projects, if needed
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with common word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software (Microsoft Office or Google Suite)
Why Finicity?

Finicity is a well-established pioneer in the fintech space, but we have grown significantly in the last few years with the development of our data access and financial insights platform. We partner with major financial institutions and lending powerhouses to transform the ways in which consumers access credit and how financial institutions make lending decisions.

The fintech industry and financial services space requires top-notch security used by today’s leading financial institutions and lenders. In order to innovate with our solutions, investing in the latest technologies is required. You’ll be a part of creating and using solutions that will build the foundation for the future of data sharing.

The Director bears responsibility for the team’s performance.

This position reports to Vice President, Production.

Job Responsibilities:
Lead a team of event production individuals to deliver the best product for the client and the work group
Strategic ability to conceive, develop and implement programs that build client brand and provide a foundation to drive client business growth
Develop and maintain an effective organization through selection, training, compensation, motivation, and performance management
Manage internal and external staff on execution and delivery of programs
Is highly proficient in budgeting and tracking of multi-million dollar accounts and ensure financial management of each meets agency standards
Possess and can develop key vendor/partners related to our business so we are delivering the best product and pricing for our clients
Ability to lead large scale live events with multiple agency, vendor, and client involvement
Able to position yourself as a leader within the team and company to help lead growth and development of organization
Can apply best practices and learnings from previous projects to elevate performance level
Will create accountability practices within company

Minimum 10 years event marketing, show service and team management experience
Production of live events, tours, and fabrication of event elements a must

Strong planning and organizational skills to effectively manage numerous programs and resources simultaneously- Microsoft Project or similar planning tool experience preferred
Sound decision-making and problem-solving skills based in agency, client and industry knowledge
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
A thoroughly developed knowledge of our industry, products and services, as well as those of our competitors and clients
Willing and able to work nonstandard work hours, weekends and travel as required

Microsoft Office proficient (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

About We're Magnetic
We're Magnetic is an experiential marketing firm headquartered in NYC with outposts in Los Angeles and London. We work in partnership with the world's leading brands, crafting real world experiences that resonate across shared, earned and owned media. We've created meaningful experiences for brands including Facebook, Netflix, KIND Snacks, The Female Quotient/The Girls'? Lounge, Uber, Sony, Nike, and Crayola, among others.Our firm is a collective of experiential marketers from diverse backgrounds, ranging from strategic and creative leads and producers to architects, engineers, industrial designers, and construction and lighting experts. Our unique capabilities enable us to provide a one-of-a-kind offering to our clients, blending the skills of an experiential agency as well as a production shop. This allows us to offer solutions to our clients that solve their creative and real-world problems, and allow them to forge meaningful connections with their consumers. Were proud of our successes, growth and expansion and look forward to great things on the horizon. We hope to meet you soon!

We have developed a new opportunity for an engaging, confident, and innovative leader to join our team. Job Description: OneCause Onsite Event Managers are responsible for executing and managing OneCause events onsite.

The essential job functions for the person in this role include:
Manage/Execute OneCause events on location.
Manage OneCause staff.
Setup and manage the OneCause technology including: OneCause/ BidPal proprietary software, laptops, tablets, credit card readers, OneCause handheld devices, printers.
Manage and resolve all OneCause related client expectations.

About OneCause Inc.
Are you passionate about creating a positive change in the world? Come join our team of change-makers!

We are on a mission to help nonprofits across the country feed the hungry, fight cancer, promote the arts, educate young people and everything in between. Our commitment to helping nonprofits use technology to more efficiently manage their fundraising efforts, engage more donors and raise more money has fueled steady growth in OneCause's software and services.

Leading the industry, OneCause first revolutionized charitable fundraising in 2007 by introducing mobile bidding to silent auctions. Today, OneCause has an expansive product line of mobile and online fundraising software which has helped our clients raise over $1 billion and connect 1 million donors to their causes. Think you have what it takes to help lead us toward more Technology for Good®? Then keep reading!

Desired Skills & Experience
BS/BA required.
2 years total work experience in event management desirable
Management of external event staff, volunteers and guests
Strong leadership skills
Exceptional customer relationship skills
Exceptional communication skills – including: written, interpersonal and public speaking
Highly organized with the ability to meet multiple concurrent deadlines in a fast-paced environment
High level of initiative
Comfortable with using intuitive web based software as well as smartphone technology (iPhone and Android)
Basic knowledge of setting up hardware (tablets/laptops/printer) using Wifi technology
The Opportunity:

In 2011 charitable giving in the U.S. was estimated to be more than $298 billion. OneCause is well positioned to assist its not-for-profit partners to capitalize on the opportunity to maximize their fundraising capability.

You bring the drive to succeed and professional consulting experience to maintain OneCause's position in the marketplace as the leader in auction automation. We deliver the products, support and career growth you desire.

Job Description


About Endeavor Global Marketing:

Endeavor Global Marketing (EGM) is the cultural marketing agency within the Endeavor network, which includes preeminent talent agency WME, sports and fashion industry pioneer IMG, and other leading organizations from across the cultural landscape.

Its position within Endeavor provides EGM and its employees with unrivaled cultural insight, access, and understanding of the audiences the world’s leading brands need to reach.

Our approach to cultural marketing generates elevated ad campaigns, relevant PR strategies, humanized digital marketing platforms, and unparalleled experiences, with more than 9,000 experiential events around the world annually. In short, we build brand- and business-driving platforms and programs, rooted in human and cultural insights.

Being a part of the team that delivers these solutions means being a part of the agency that is defining the new frontier of marketing. For anyone with the drive to seek out new challenges and the commitment to craft effective solutions shaped by insight and defined by excellence, the opportunities for growth and exploration are endless.

Endeavor Global Marketing is now more than 700 employees strong globally, providing expertise in brand strategy and activation, advertising, digital and social marketing, public relations, sports and entertainment marketing, social impact marketing, influencer strategy, experiential marketing, original content and business intelligence. We work with major brand clients including Audi, AB InBev, Marriott, Visa, Coca-Cola, Papa John’s, Bumble, E. & J. Gallo Winery, and Microsoft, among more than 200 others.

Overview:

This position is for a VP, Strategy & Insights role at Endeavor Global Marketing working with the Experiential division. The Vice President of Strategy and Insights will lead a wide range of brand, experiential, and cultural marketing solutions. We are looking for a true leader that can inspire not only a team of analytical thinkers who quickly turn large amounts of information into actionable insights, but also promoting strategy and partnering with internal teams company-wide. A creative innovator who can use strategic frameworks to design and implement compelling plans that meet a diverse set of brand needs and objectives.

Job Responsibilities:
Collaborate with clients as well as internal account and creative team members to ensure that all agency outputs deliver on brand objectives and meet internal quality standards
Author and review all strategic deliverables – from creative briefs to final presentations
Lead brainstorms, pitches, strategy workshops and original research for new business and organic growth opportunities
Lead advisement on current industry trends and strategies for internal and external audiences
Motivating the strategy team and promoting innovative new approaches for continued team development of best practices for insight development, brand strategy, consumer insights/analytics to support ongoing strategy team growth and development
Travel to different office and client locations
Education and Skills:
10+ years of work experience; experiential and agency preferred
5+ years managing and mentoring a team
Bachelor’s degree in marketing psychology, sociology/anthropology, communications or related field.
Experience leading the integration and development of strategic processes
Confident communication and presentation skills
Proven experience building strong relationships, advising and collaborating with inter-agency leadership, internal teams and client contacts
MUST be personable, creative, flexible, resilient and eager to do great work in a collaborative setting.
Passion and empathy for the consumer's perspective and identifying new trends
Ability to guide development of, build and deliver compelling presentations to both clients and internal teams.
Self-starting drive to take on challenging internal and client initiatives.
About the Team:

The Strategy and Insights team believes in striking the perfect balance between science and art. We dig deep into the minds and aspirations of the people we seek to reach, combining research, insights and inspiration to find creative solutions that shift perceptions and change behavior. We search for the big ideas hidden in everyday life to bring brands closer to consumers and consumers closer to their dreams, measuring every step along the way.

About BrightTALK
BrightTALK brings professionals and businesses together to learn and grow. Over 8 million professionals engage with 100,000 free talks and 1,000 online summits to discover new technologies, learn from trusted experts and grow their careers. Thousands of businesses acquire and inspire their ideal audience with BrightTALK's AI-powered content and demand marketing platform.

We are looking for talented and passionate Events Managers to join BrightTALK’s Managed Services Department, working on our Summits Team based in Manchester, Denver or Phoenix. The Summits Team is responsible for the management and logistics of our global, virtual (and sometimes physical) events. We have varied and challenging responsibilities and work alongside with almost every team throughout BrightTALK.

The Event Manager will provide deep insight into our platform and our communities to structure and deliver high performing Summits. They will provide project management expertise throughout while working closely with Event Producers, Content Managers, Customer Success, Sales, speakers and sponsors. This role involves creating event programs and managing the whole summit process from planning, execution, follow up and data analysis. The Event Manager is also responsible for completing each project leveraging data to improve programs and empower sales opportunities.
Role Requirements & Responsibilities:
Working with Event Producer to deliver at least 2 Summits per month to deadlines within an 8 week production cycle
Taking end-to-end ownership of the summit process & delivery
Oversight of bookings, pipeline and revenue associated with the Summit business
Produce sales hype meetings/email enablement about upcoming Summits and opportunities
Provide updates to the Sales and Customer Success teams about upcoming Summits’ inventory, stats and other relevant information
Manage availability of Summit sponsorship inventory with Sales team to provide transparency of available sponsorship slots
Manage relevant event documents and databases for all Summits’ progress
Answer enquiries related to the Summits’ inventory, time slot availability, Summit pipeline and sponsorship availability, recognizing areas for improvement and strategizing solutions.
Identify target speaker personas with Event Producer and Content Managers for each Summit by reviewing topics within Summit, existing speakers, etc.
Collaborate with Event Producer to identify and recruit speakers and partners
Elevate new speakers in line with BrightTALK’s speaker vetting process and maintain the Speaker Bureau
Train new presenters on the presenter platform
Conduct live day support with each presenter as needed

Project Management:

Follow established workflows to ensure successful events
Manage Wordpress Summit landing page
Manage all summit deliverables and timelines efficiently
Liaise with and fully brief thought leaders/speakers, acting as a point of contact and general project manager and ‘face’ of the Summit
Lead post event review and provide summaries for internal teams
Lead internal communications before the event and during live day(s)
Prepare and send out post-Summit data recaps
Provide recommendations on improving the Summit experience for clients and users

Skills:

Very good attention to detail
Familiarity with process and workflows
Clear communicator
Organized and efficient
Quick learner
Collaborative
Flexible/Can think on their feet
Preferred understanding of salesforce
Preferred understanding of Qlik Sense
Preferred understanding of Wordpress
Preferred use of Airtable or other project management tools

Expertise or Qualifications:

Experience in online and/or physical event management
Experience in dealing with commercial partners
A good commercial understanding

Why we like working at BrightTALK:

Friendly, talented, collaborative and entrepreneurial teams
Generous and comprehensive health and dental benefits, including 100% healthcare coverage for employees
Generous holiday policy, flexible schedule and 4 weeks of PTO in the U.S. and 5 weeks of PTO in the U.K. in your first year at BrightTALK
401k matching program in the U.S. and pension contribution in the U.K.
Offices located in top destination cities
Training allowance and regular innovation days
Team building and paid volunteer time
We are dedicated to learning and growing, going after big dreams, taking ownership, remaining open and honest while recognizing we are in it together. We are committed to hiring individuals with a diversity of perspectives, backgrounds, and beliefs who can use their passion to help us build a world changing audience and thrive along the way. Join BrightTALK and experience a collaborative and engaged team who works together to provide learning and growth opportunities for businesses and professionals.

BrightTALK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

Job Description
POSITION SUMMARY

Assists in the development and oversight of resident services, including planning and coordinating opportunities for residents that promote a level of health, well being, engagement and growth.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The following duties are normal for this position. This list is not to be construed as exclusive or all inclusive. Other duties may be required and assigned.
Assists in planning, scheduling and conducting programs that provide physical, intellectual, social, emotional and spiritual opportunities for the residents.
Assists, invites and encourages residents to participate in activities.
Assesses, plans and manages facilitation of a comprehensive activities program utilizing team members and volunteers.
Attends all community planned functions and coordinates event from beginning to end including set-up, running, and breaking down for the event.
Helps plan appropriate programs for holidays and special events.
Coordinates holiday decorations for the community.
Coordinates with other departments to ensure that all equipment and supplies are available for activities and special events.
Plans, coordinates and facilitates appropriate mixed group (assisted living and Garden) activities.
Facilitates regularly scheduled and specialized activities in the Garden.
Maintains activity areas in an orderly manner.
Assists in maintaining an inventory of activity and programming supplies, games, programs and craft services.
As applicable, responsible for daily care of any animals and/or plants within the activities program and services.
Prepares and organizes a calendar of events. Submits the calendar to the Executive Director for final approval. Posts and distributes the calendar.
Distributes community newsletter.
Meets with new residents to introduce the program.
Assists Director in leadership of wellness program.
Organizes and supervises a volunteer staff.
Addresses resident groups and other groups on subjects of common interest.
Maintains a database and prepares reports on resident assessments, participation and satisfaction.
Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Educational Requirements and Experience:
Associate’s degree or equivalent from two-year college or technical school is preferred
One to three years experience preferred in assisted living, long term care or experience/exposure to the senior population.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Language Ability:
Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.
Ability to write simple correspondence.
Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
Ability to read and write using English language.
Must demonstrate excellent telephone communication skills.
Mathematical Skills:
Ability to add and subtract two digit numbers and to multiply and divide with 10’s and 100’s.
Ability to perform these operations using units of American money and weight measurement, volume, and distance.
Cognitive Demands:
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions.
Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.
Computer Skills:
Ability to use Microsoft Windows, including Word and Excel. Ability to use email and the Internet.
Demonstrates general office skills such as use of copy machine.
Competencies:
Must demonstrate an interest in working with a senior population.
Interacts with guests, residents and staff in a courteous and friendly manners
Supports organization’s goals and values.
Balances team and individual responsibilities.
Responds promptly to resident and visitor needs. Responds to requests for service and assistance.
Completes administrative tasks accurately and timely.
Ability to handle multiple priorities.
Must demonstrate good organizational, time management and record keeping skills.
Demonstrate good judgment, problem solving and decision making skills
ENVIRONMENTAL ADAPTABILITY
Works primarily indoors in a climate controlled setting.
Possible exposure to chemicals as identified in the SDS Manual.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands described below are representative of those that must be met by an individual to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the Team Member is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The Team Member is frequently required to stand; walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The Team Member is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance. The Team Member must regularly lift and /or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance vision.

Company Description
Vantage Point Retirement Living is a family-owned and -operated organization born out of the belief that seniors deserve more when it comes to senior living. More independence, more caring, more amenities, more opportunities to embrace life and make the most of each day. EOE

While Vantage Point may be considered a family business, its founders, Greg and Rita Stevens, have decades of industry experience behind them – bringing together the best of both worlds to provide area seniors with the most extraordinary retirement living experience possible.

We believe that family-owned is better than publicly traded when it comes to senior living. We’re proud of our roots and our family tree, which consists of team members who’ve been with us decades and a second generation that will carry on our legacy for years to come.

Here, we understand that family bonds are created by more than DNA. Our bonds are formed both by decades-long relationships and first-time handshakes. They’re formed by celebrations of successes and support through loss.

At Vantage Point, we’re family because we share a common belief that a lifestyle community can be more than just a place to live. It’s a place to love, to thrive, to enjoy, to IMPROVE... To celebrate, to laugh, to cry... and to do it all together...
EOE, ADA

Please go to our company website at https://www.vpretirement.com/careers to read an open letter from our Co-Founder, Rita Stevens.

Pelco is a global leader in the design, development, and manufacture of predictive video security solutions including cameras, recording and management systems, software, and services. Our personal engagement with customers, resellers and technology partners drives the development and deployment of surveillance and security solutions with meaningful innovation. Its the foundation that Pelco has built its brand upon for over 25 years.

From the recently introduced VideoXpert video management platform to our industry-leading selection of IP cameras and accessories, Pelco is committed to designing and delivering a broad range of high-quality, IP video security solutions, products, and systems that make The World Safer.

Position description:

We are looking for a tradeshow and events expert that can take our strategy to the next level as we re-introduce Pelco to the marketplace. This position will play an integral role in working with key stakeholders to ensure the events strategy is in-line with our GTM and of course executing on the vision for tradeshows and events. This position will have broad visibility across the organization especially Marketing, Sales, and Product functions and will also partner across the ecosystem with other relevant groups.

The position is located in Fresno, CA and reports to the Senior VP of Global Marketing.

Essential functions:
Plan and execute online (ie: webinars) and in-person events (ie: conferences, trade shows, private VIP events) that build our brand awareness and accelerate pipeline development for sales
Plan and execute internal events SKO, offsites, customer events
Work with Global Marketing Managers and Marketing Operations to capture leads at key events, working with stakeholders to determine lead qualification criteria and provide support in post-follow-up strategy and lead nurture activities
Coordinate speakers for events with clients and sales
Manage all aspects of event coordination including: strategy, objectives materials creation, event messaging/marketing, signage, giveaways, contract negotiation, vendor relations, site selection, registration, agenda scheduling, staffing, on-site production and F&B, & logistics
Track budgets, work with vendors and agencies, provide requirements and oversee implementation of the event/experiences for related events
Collaborate with cross functional teams such as corporate and marketing communications, operations, and finance, to take the project from creation to activation.
Create and maintain communications in a harmonious and professional manner with all levels of staff and clients.
Skills and experience
Experienced professional with a passion and deep knowledge of the events industry and event planning.
5+ years marketing and event management experience leading creative projects and executing briefings.
Expert social skills, particularly influencing management and conflict resolution
Strong presentation and interpersonal skills.
Experience with Budget management, financial tracking and contract negotiations.
Proactive with strong project management skills.
Possess extraordinary customer service, clear communication and meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and as a valued and contributing member of a team.
Flexible and agile; able to take on last minute requests calmly and prioritize as necessary.
Ability to work on multiple projects at once, set priorities, and consistently meet deadlines.
Microsoft Office literate required. Salesforce, Pardot, JiffleNow and Netsutie tool software knowledge a plus.
Experience fostering collaboration and teamwork.
Superior communications skills, both written and verbal; able to communicate successfully across many levels across the company.
Marketing/Communications background desired.
Ability to travel within North America (25% or more of time). Undergraduate degree or similar required.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

MKTG, part of the Dentsu Aegis Network, is a global experiential marketing agency comprised of pioneers and practitioners of lifestyle marketing. We specialize in delivering strategic, business-oriented marketing solutions for leading brands via sport and entertainment, live experiences, retail marketing, enterprise/business-to-business engagement and sponsorship marketing. One of the guiding principles upon which MKTG was founded is that our people matter – to the work we do and the environment we've built. We are committed to constantly evolving, refining and inventing innovative brand engagements through deeper understanding of how people think, work and live their lives. Headquartered in New York City, we have 1,600 employees and 7,000 Brand Ambassadors operating in 32 offices globally, with reach in 19 markets across the Americas, EMEA and APAC. Visit MKTG for more information.

Job Title:

MKTG - VP, Field Activation

Job Description:

MKTG VP Activation is an industry leader in experiential marketing and event activation. This role is responsible for guiding and supporting the activation business, and overseeing a team of Regional Directors across on & off-premise retail sampling, as well as sponsorships & events. The VP of Activation has strategic understanding and tactical expertise of consumer facing brand experiences. The right individual possesses dynamic leadership skills, the ability develop and mentor a team of regional activation directors, and make sound business decisions. VP Activation leads a cross channel team, guides multiple departments, and functions as a strategic business partner to key client stakeholders, to ensure event activation exceeds high standards of excellence.

Position Responsibilities:
Interface at the executive level, develop and maintain client relationships
Provide long-term perspective for brand and business growth
Function as strategic business partner to key client stakeholders
Demonstrate a thorough understanding and a passion for client’s industry brands
Lead and manage team of Regional Directors across retail sampling and events & sponsorships to ensure flawless execution of 70K+ events
Develop; retain and motivate team Regional Directors and ensure actionable steps are taken in succession planning
Ensure activation teams and local staff are armed with market leading experiential strategies, and activation / production guides
Ensure activation team is adhering to standard operating procedures, and event protocols
Provide continuous and constructive feedback to direct reports; conduct performance reviews
Provide national oversight of sponsorship negotiation and event approvals including comprehensive knowledge of events that best match brand goals and investments
Lead weekly communications with regional, local, and central teams
Ensure markets are performing and achieving program KPIs
Provide ongoing quantitative and qualitative insights / feedback to client stakeholders
Develop and implement process and timelines for event contracts, submissions, supporting documentation and approvals
Organizational Purpose:

Oversee sponsorship, scheduling, and execution processes
Oversee retail sampling, booking, and execution processes
Work in conjunction with Client Lead and Central Planning & Activation team(s)
Regularly visit in-region markets to carefully monitor and evaluate events
Lead regularly scheduled status meetings with MKTG in each major market
Work closely with operations, talent, data, and tech teams, to ensure systems and guidelines for event management, trainings, debriefings and budget maintenance are followed
Interface regularly with direct reports to provide status updates, event guidance and leadership
Facilitate an effective flow of communication with relevant local stakeholders
Financial Responsibility:
Oversee all respective activation budgets with the inputs from Regional Directors and Central Planning teams
Forecast and reconcile activation budget(s)
Oversee client & program budgets including creating, tracking, billing, reporting and client approvals
Review and ensure RD budgets and expense reports / submitted timely and within parameters provided by finance/client
Management Responsibility:

Reports to MKTG Client Lead
Direct reports – Regional Directors
Effective development of 8 remote direct reports (approx.)
Effective management across 4 regions (approx.)
Collaborates with central planning, operations, talent, data, and tech teams
Enforcement / adherence of state sampling legalities in activations
Ensure direct reports follow policies and procedures established
Responsible for the hiring of MKTG employees (f/t and p/t)
Outputs:
Evaluate effectiveness of current activation tactics / methods to assist in developing new tactics specific to market needs
Oversee RDs in enforcing deadlines for activation scopes and paperwork
Meet regularly with client stakeholders and MKTG regional teams
Ensure that activation personnel are trained on systems, processes and adhere to policies and procedures
Provide qualitative feedback to MKTG Central teams, and client stakeholders

Job Description:
Destination Caldwell/Indian Creek Plaza

EVENT MANAGER

OVERVIEW

Full-time exempt (salaried) position - $35,000 to $40,000 per year DOE. Monday through Friday, nights and weekends required. Reports to Indian Creek Plaza Director.

The Indian Creek Plaza (ICP) Event Manager plans, directs, and manages all ICP events, concerts, and community events, and oversees all aspects of the ICP ice ribbon and skate rental shop. The ICP Event Manager creates and monitors event and ice ribbon budgets and reconciliations, and negotiates all necessary contracts. They will drive all aspects of ICP events: development of a strategic plan, messaging and communications, logistics, staffing, collateral, vendors, shipments, invoices, schedules, and timelines. They are also responsible for hiring and managing external agencies, vendors, and part-time event staff. They will develop and maintain a strong working relationship with city departments in coordinating shared areas of responsibility and will establish connections with local community groups and civic organizations to utilize ICP.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Manages the development, planning, and facilitation of all events from conception to implementation
Gathers accurate event information and ensures event setups and operations are accurate for all events
Expected to be onsite the day of the event to oversee and/or assist in set-up and tear-down of events
Directs ICP staff, sponsors, and vendors and collaborates with the volunteer coordinator to manage volunteers the day of the event.
Collaborate with the ICP Marketing/Communications Coordinator and ICP team to develop promotions to increase sales
Disseminates timely and accurate pre/post event information to all staff regarding the essential aspects of each event
Ability to see the big picture and develop event strategies
Ability to supervise, delegate and motivate staff
Ability to work with minimal direction; to make independent judgments and/or decisions and to discern when the action of a higher level is required
Complies with local city, county, police and fire personnel to ensure event compliance with Caldwell City Code provisions and any state policies relevant to event type
Track success of each event
Creating, managing, and complying with an overall event budget and individual event budgets
Responsible for managing petty cash, training staff, and enforcing the cash handling policy
ICP Ice Ribbon and Skate Shop Management
Assist the Director of the Plaza with the hiring of ice ribbon supervisors, associates, and volunteers
Oversee daily operations of ice ribbon rental shop and ice ribbon staff and volunteers
Train, supervise, and schedule ice ribbon associates, supervisors, and volunteers
Develop an inventory management system of skates, supplies, and merchandise
Manages all aspects of Sk8 Coalition programming
KEY COMPETENCIES
Excellent customer service skills
High level of ethical standards
Strong oral and written communication skills
Creativity to think “outside the box”
Strong organizational, time management and prioritization skills
Flexible attitude, diplomatic, quick learner
Ability to interact with guests and staff warmly and professionally with a pleasant demeanor
Self-motivated
Must have the ability to stay calm in stressful situations
Experience dealing positively and effectively with conflict resolution
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines
Ability to adapt to continual changes and growth
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
High school diploma or equivalent
Two + years in the event field
Customer service experience
Computer skills and knowledge of all Microsoft Office and Adobe
Experience with cash handling management and POS systems preferably Square
Ability to navigate a variety of floor surfaces and areas including stairs, concrete and wet surfaces
Ability to work outdoors in a variety of environments including but not limited to heights, in darkened corridors, around crowds, loud noise, and flashing lights
Ability to stand for extended periods of time
Able to lift and move up to 50 pounds
Must be flexible as evening, weekend
Strong knowledge of, or willing to quickly learn about Idaho Wine and Tourism
Valid drivers’ license
Experience working with, and recruiting and/or managing staff
Must be able to pass a background check
Work Environment
Both indoor and outdoor work environment
Subject to constant hot or cool temperatures with an outdoor ice rink in the winter and water features and events in the summer
Will be exposed to extreme heat, cold, dust, and/or pollen when performing maintenance duties outdoors
Will be subject to mechanical, electrical, and chemical hazards associated with equipment, wiring, and other areas related to plaza repair and maintenance work
BENEFITS
Health Insurance
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
401K Options with company 3% match
TO APPLY- Send a cover letter and resume with a minimum of three professional references via email. Be sure to reference the job title in the subject line.

Premier Packaging provides innovative packaging solutions through a combination of curiosity, drive, and a culture that embraces an entrepreneurial spirit. We are responsive to our customers’ needs, responsible to one another and the environment, and improve our processes to deliver quality products. We ask ‘Why’ so we can deliver the ‘How’.

We are currently seeking an experienced Event Coordinator to manage our small and large scale events company-wide. This position would also be responsible for booking travel and hotel accommodations, as well as managing the company store. Our events occur both on and off-site, and the Event Coordinator will manage and oversee all aspects of event planning and management, including internal and external events.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Maintain a working relationship with nationwide vendors and venues.
Negotiate with vendors on rates, pricing, etc., for all events, travel (hotel options, etc).
Understand the complex needs of different events.
Plan event aspects - venue, seating, menus, guest list, RSVP’s, hotel, transportation, etc.
Able to delegate event planning tasks to other staff members when necessary (ie, work with the custodial, marketing team, I.T. group, etc)
Strong knowledge of venues and vendor offerings
Coordinating event entertainment to include music, performers, and guest speakers.
Attentive to the value of staying under budget while planning event specifications.
Working with the accounting department with the issuance of payments in a timely manner, and providing reports of expenses for events.
Managing and overseeing day-of-event coordination to include problem-solving, welcoming guests, directing event set-up, communicating with staff, organizing vendors, and managing take-down.
Communicate with the marketing team to create effective communications for each event
Anticipate and plan for all possible scenarios.
Other duties as assigned
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience.
Degree in event planning or hospitality preferred
2-3 of previous event planning experience
Team management experience
Extremely organized and be able to manage the logistics of multiple events simultaneously
Ability to meet with different teams within the organization to work out event details, plan with the team, scout and book locations, food, entertainment, staff, and cleanup
Negotiate with all vendors. Some to include:
Hotels
Travel Partners
External Marketing Partners
Responsible for communicating and working with internal Marketing Team to ensure all aspects are properly marketed and branded in congruence with our branding policies
Strong communication skills, and the ability to present event ideas and plans.
Here at Premier, we offer a competitive wage, complete benefits package including health, dental, life, and disability insurance, paid vacation and holidays, as well as a company-sponsored 401K retirement plan. So needless to say, Premier has you covered!

The Special Events Manager is responsible for the successful planning implementation of all Live events, as well as invitational promotional programs and offers. Successful special events are an integral part of Live Casino being the #1 regional gaming and entertainment experience.
*Pending PGCB Approval

Core Service Standards
CLEAN: Must make the property shine and look impeccable while maintaining a neat CLEAN and crisp personal appearance
SAFE: Must make guests feel SAFE and comfortable through creating a worry free, carefree experience.
Fast: Provide FAST and efficient service with accuracy. Meet service time requirements and anticipate guest needs.
FRIENDLY: Greet each guest with FRIENDLY welcomes, making eye contact and smiling. Use H.E.A.R.T. steps to ease guest concerns. Say thank you to departing guests.
FUN: Work passionately as a team to create a FUN experience both for everyone who works and plays here
Specific Responsibilities and Duties
Manages Live! Casino’s special events to outpace the competitors in the region. Will provide ongoing cost benefit analysis and return on investment for all major programs. Will monitor the competition by consulting newspapers, trade journals and other publications to learn about contemplated promotions, social functions and activities of casino and offers.
Manage the special events life-cycle for both on property and off property events, including research, planning, implementation, evaluation and analysis. Utilize internal resources as well as external resources.
Organize all special events efforts to drive rated play, stimulate slot and table games play, with slot and table tournaments, dinners, gift giveaways and tier based promotions, etc.
Create a warm, welcoming and exciting environment for each program.
Effectively communicate, measure and report the effectiveness of each program.
Lead as point of contact for special events ideas to achieve specific challenges.
Build relationships and meet with other department directors and managers as necessary. Plan, evaluate and execute.
Source and acquire vendors and resources that support the operational and budgetary needs of the department.
Manage a team consisting of Coordinators and/or Representatives. Ensure training, development and performance management.
Interview potential new hires and make sound hiring decisions based on company values.
Develop, maintain and balance an annual budget.
Travel to off-site locations and networking events as necessary.
Promote and practice excellent public relations and customer service.
Other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements (skills, knowledge, and abilities)
Ability to analyze and interpret departmental needs and results.
Ability to solve complex problems.
Ability to perform assigned duties under frequent time pressures and deadlines in an interruptive environment.
Ability to work a flexible and irregular schedule including weekends, evenings and holidays.
Educational Requirements
Five (5) to seven (7) years’ experience in special events in a high-volume hospitality business. Casino industry experience is desired.
A four (4)-year degree in a related field or equivalent work experience.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a valid gaming license as determined by the State Gaming Agency for the position.

Physical Requirements
Ability to stand 25% of the time
Ability to sit 75% of the time
Ability to lift 50 lbs.

Working Conditions
24/7 high energy casino with over 300,000 sq. ft of gaming and entertainment space and approximately 2000 employees
Exposed to alcohol, cigarette and cigar smoke, bright lights, and loud noises.
You will work in an environment where smoking is allowed.
Competitors: Dover Downs Gaming, Rocky Gap Casino

Our marketers generate leads and appointments for our design consultants by attending events such as home shows, showroom seminars, open houses, and other organized gatherings.

COMPENSATION

Base Salary - $40,000 to $45,000 + Bonus

Full benefits Lap Top Phone Allowance Company Credit Card

You will work closely with the Non-traditional Marketing Manager in building and motivating your team. You need to be organized, energetic, flexible, assertive, engaging, and have a competitive spirit.

Job Description

The purpose of this position is to cost-effectively drive non-media lead generation and local awareness through the following marketing tactics: events and trade shows, corporate partnerships, business partnerships, referrals, community groups and more. The Event Manager is responsible to manage and execute local marketing efforts which include events such as home shows, outdoor fairs/festivals, business expos, etc.

Key responsibilities:

· Lead, motivate, and train staff in a competitive, high-energy environment.

· Creates and plans a local calendar of events where our products and services can be showcased with the sole purpose of creating exposure and generating qualified leads

· Build and maintain a team that can GENERATE LEADS.

· Daily communication with the manager.

· Follow up and measure team performance, generate regular reports for management

Experience and qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in marketing/communications preferred or equivalent demonstrated skills and abilities

· Ability to proactively approach consumers in an event setting.

· Excellent communication skills.

· Proficient in Microsoft Office products.

· Must be able to work weekends and some nights.

· Must have reliable transportation.

· Ability to travel 100 miles outside of the greater Boise area to attend events.

· Some overnight travel.

· At least 2-years’ experience in field marketing or promotions.

· At least 2-years’ experience managing and coaching people.

· At least 2-years’ experience recruiting and hiring people.

IDEAL CANDIDATE

· Lead, coach, motivate and develop a team

· Ability to manage a small marketing/lead generation team

· Hold team meetings

· Ability to meet metrics and hold the team accountable

· Excellent communication and persuasion skills

ON24 is on a mission to transform the way marketers’ market, powering the live, always-on and personalized webinar and content experiences that businesses need to create engagement, deliver data, find demand and drive revenue.

Through the ON24 Platform, marketers can build data-rich, interactive webinar and content experiences, understand audience behavior and turn that intelligence into action. Informed by more than a billion engagement minutes — including 12 million polls, 1.3 million surveys, 1.5 million conversations, and conversion of over 17 million resources — marketers drive more revenue from ON24 experiences than any other digital channel. Headquartered in San Francisco, ON24 has a wide global footprint with eight offices in key regions, including London, Munich, Singapore, Stockholm and Sydney.

The ON24 Event Manager is responsible for the delivery of customer events using ON24’s virtual product suite. Event managers are responsible for:
Providing an enhanced ON24 experience to ON24’s customers and attendees
Strategic consultation and planning of a customer’s event
Event setup and live event support
Event de-brief and strategic review of success metrics.
This role requires a responsible and detail oriented individual. Customer service, a keen understanding of technology, and interest in thriving in a deadline driven environment are critical components of this role.

ON24 encourages employee career growth and rewards those with a passion for success. At ON24 you will work with the most talented individuals in the industry and our customer base includes the world’s largest and highest profile companies.

Position Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Experience with Adobe Creative and Microsoft Office product suites
Strong technical skills and some knowledge of HTML and/or CSS
Essential Skills
Well organized and able to provide high quality work 100% of the time
An interest in learning about virtual events technologies and services
Integrity, creativity, high standards, persistence, and achievement oriented
Ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment
Sense of urgency to provide a rapid response to customer requests
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively
Understanding of project management fundamentals
Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities
Provide consultation, preparation, planning, and execution of events
Perform event related tasks, such as conference bridge scheduling, data input, answering event audience member inquiries, location design edits and custom reports generation
Act as product and subject matter expert
Actively participate and contribute in strategy discussions ensuring customers meet program goals and success metrics
Providing technical support and guidance during project implementations
Drive customer satisfaction with excellent customer service
Coordinate with all point of contact persons to manage the delivery of key event related elements
Perform webinar and virtual event related activities as necessary
Create and maintain collaborative customer documentation
ON24 is proud to be an equal employment opportunities (EEO) workplace to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. Hello friend. We are Daybreaker, a community of early risers whose mission is to stitch the world back together through dance, self-expression, music and mischief. We are a team of Community Architects, Experience Designers, Artists, Performers, and Mischief Makers — and we create experiences IRL so that we can get back to connecting with one another through all five of our senses, not just two (our phones) — and in the morning when our bodies are the most energetic and awake. With the isolation epidemic our most pressing global problem — that bleeds into every aspect of humanity (when we don't belong, we don't care about the environment, animals, we lack empathy etc.) — we are solving this problem with the most POTENT solution: DANCE. When we bring movement, music, fun, aliveness, play and dance into the conversation, all of a sudden, eradicating isolation begins to feel achievable. Daybreaker is now in 27 cities with a community of 500K+ activated members who wake up at sunrise to dance with reckless abandon, all without substances.

And now, we are launching in ATX and are looking for YOU — the most passionate, creative, curious, and service oriented Community Architect and Experience Designer who is as excited as we are to level their city up and create a space for all ages, all shapes, all genders and sexual orientations to come together, connect and dance.

Daybreaker is a 3-hour experience, typically from 6am to 9am where the first hour is yoga or fitness and the next two hours is a full-on, immersive, performative dance party. Imagine seeing breakdancers, aerialists, fire spinners and dueling violinists — all before going to work.

A few words from our community:

—

"Daybreaker is a SPIRITUAL experience. It's the first dance floor I've truly let go on and have felt years of trauma leave my body. Dancing is medicine and I never understood that until I went to Daybreaker. Thank you for creating such an inclusive, substance-free judgement-free space. I never miss one now."

"I didn't realize how co-dependent having fun and drinking was for me until I went to Daybreaker and had the best morning of my life, completely sober!

"Dancing is truly the BEST way to stay healthy and active! I probably burn 1000 calories at Daybreaker! I forgot that "working out" could actually be FUN!"

"I met my now best friend on the dance floor. We made eye contact on the dance floor, smiled and twirled each other around! It took real courage for me since I usually only get wild when I'm on something. It was SO freeing to meet someone AS ME. Thank you Daybreaker!"

"Daybreaker inspired me to come out to my family. After feeling so included and so free, I had the courage to share with my family who I really am. Thank you for changing my life in such a pivotal way."

—

This is a critical moment for humanity. We can go in two directions — into a VR headset or into our most present human experience. It's time to shed all the layers and get back to dance. We believe dance is the antidote. Let's make magic.

THE ROLE //

As a member of the Daybreaker team, you will be welcomed into our global family, dedicated to spreading love and mischief around the world.

As a Daybreaker Event Producer & Community Architect ("Producer" for short), you are the face of Daybreaker in your city. You will be responsible for building an engaged and passionate community, producing mind-blowing experiences, and promoting the events to relevant audiences. You will be supported by the Daybreaker HQ team, who will coach and train you to be the best Producer you can be. We’ll provide you with the skeleton of what you need to produce Daybreaker events, grow your community, and uphold the global brand. It’s up to you to bring the hustle, passion, and creative zeal to create unique and refreshing experiences that participants will love. You'll be in charge of finding venues, sourcing talent and performers, cultivating a volunteer production team, coordinating with vendors and sponsors, creating local partnerships, and producing monthly events. We’ll provide marketing, communications, operations, branding, sponsorship, financing, and PR support so that you can concentrate on creating experiences that participants will never forget.

This is a paid part-time role, approximately 5-10 hours per week.

Requirements

The ideal Producer should live a healthy, conscious lifestyle. You should have a big heart and love dance music. You should be detailed and hard-working — a savvy and competent professional. You should be active in the startup/tech industry, the health & wellness world, and/or local arts & culture community. You should have a big network of millennials you can tap into, already be leader in your community, and know how to produce a great event start-to-finish that immerses people and transcends the commonplace. Ideally (but not required), you are a Burning Man participant.

YOU'LL NEED //

+ An entrepreneurial mindset and independent approach to your work — you should be an organized self-starter

+ Several years of large-scale event production experience

+ A strong network of influencers, creatives, doers and people who say YES to amazing experiences

+ Phenomenal community-building background — you should be a natural organizer of people

+ Cultural savvy in your city — you should be plugged into the local arts + music scene in your city to know what's cool and who's talented

+ A flexible schedule

+ A big heart, a clear mind, and a voracious appetite for all things that surprise and delight

Benefits

+ Insights and hands-on coaching on experience design, event production, brand management, and community development -- all best practices that have grown Daybreaker into a global movement

+ Access to a global network of artists, DJs, and musicians who are excited to participate and add to the experience

+ Collaborate with an international community of amazing Producers committed to the Daybreaker movement and creating unique experiences around the world — you can consider these folks your new global family

+ Monthly strategy sessions with Daybreaker HQ

+ Invitations to exclusive events such as art exhibitions, underground dance parties, startup mixers, family dinners, and mindful experiences

+ Local and global support from our PR team, who has landed Daybreaker major features in leading publications like The New York Times, GQ, and The Washington Post.

+ Milestones to earning partner status and global profit interest units

+Invitation to Global Producer Summit

If this sounds like your dream job, and you're serious about the role, then we would love to receive your application. We're excited to chat with you!

Can you be bold, professionally disruptive and irresistible like the brand we represent? Can you engage with individuals and create an authentic connection? We’re looking for energetic and passionate self-starters to engage with consumers at both large scale and smaller events. You must enjoy the experience of promoting a brand and possibly act as Emcee in a performance based environment as well as manage your team, schedules, logistics and client communication. Senior Event Manager

Location:
Branson Convention Center

Job Description:
Position Summary

Provides professional client services support in the planning, organization and management of events within the facility, including weddings, trade shows, sporting events as well as private meetings, and monitors the logistics of these events, and all event coordination tasks, from booking through to conclusion.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

* Acts as the key facility operational liaison for clients and tenants assisting them with planning and organizing events; guides clients in preparation of events by interpreting and explaining contract provisions, policies and procedures.
Meets with client groups to plan and organize assigned meetings and/or events.
Keeps clients informed as to status of deadline schedules, including but not limited to floor plan submissions, meeting room set-up specifications, insurance requirements and other relevant details.
Monitors in-house events, maintaining close contact with clients and facility staff to ensure successful events. Follows-up on all client requests, concerns, and problems.
Supervises staff and oversees all aspects of facility operations as they relate to the management of an assigned event.
Coordinates activities with the various service contractors for assigned meetings and/or events.
Provides clear, concise, and timely communication of detailed requirements to operational departments. Assists in scheduling operation set-ups to provide equipment or service needs. Monitors and supervises facility set-up when necessary.
Researches, reviews and recommends equipment, materials and supplies required in providing event services and planning.
Attends appropriate planning, organization and other event and facility meetings in support of facility operations.
Works flexible and extended hours, including nights, weekends and holidays, in addition to normal business hours.
Serves as manager on duty as required.
Provides support and assistance as needed in the area in which the event is being held.
All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience

* Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university.
2 or more years related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge in facility capabilities and event related services.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications required.
Excellent verbal, written, problem solving and interpersonal skills required.
High aptitude for figures.
Skills and Abilities
Highly motivated, self-directed, personable, positive and hard working.
Detailed oriented and able to perform independently with minimal supervision.
Strong communication skills and works well in a team-oriented environment.
Excellent organizational, planning, communication and inter-personal skills.
Ability to undertake and complete multiple tasks.
Maintain an effective working relationship with clients, employees, exhibitors, patron and others encountered in the course of employment.
Organize and prioritize work to meet deadlines. Work effectively under pressure and/or stringent schedule and produce accurate results.
Be licensed and insured to operate a motor vehicle in the United States.
Remain flexible and adjust to situations as they occur.
Computer Skills
Operate a personal computer using Windows, Office and other standard office equipment.
Must have strong computer skills, Excel and Word.
Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to move around the facility; to stand for long hours during events; talk and hear. This position may require work inside or outside of the building, as needed for events.
Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting and other activities necessary to perform job duties. Ability to lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
This position requires minimal stooping and lifting, but substantial walking. Must be able to stand or sit for long periods of time.
Ability to work in both inside and outside environmental conditions.
NOTE: The essential responsibilities of this position are described under the headings above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Also, this document in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position.

Job Description:
OPPORTUNITY


We are the Partnership for Public Service, a nonpartisan, nonprofit organization with a big mission. Were working to ensure the federal government is dynamic, innovative and that it effectively serves the American people.

One of our signature programs is the Samuel J. Heyman Service to America Medals (Sammies) also known as the Oscars of government service. The Sammies highlight excellence in our federal government and inspire other talented and dedicated individuals to go into public service. The program has been featured in national media outlets including a Full Frontal with Samantha Bee piece in 2019. Building on that momentum, we now seek a Senior Communications and Events Manager to strategically expand the impact of the program.

We have set the bar high: Our objective is to find the right person to oversee the strategic direction, planning and execution of the Sammies program, including an annual black-tie gala. As a member of the Partnerships communication team, the successful candidate will also conceive, design and implement new programming focused on recognizing excellence and enhancing public knowledge about the great work of the federal government. We are seeking an experienced candidate who has strong event planning and program management skills, and who wants to help shape the direction of recognition programming in a dynamic, growing organization.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop, implement and manage all aspects of the Service to America Medals program.
Plan and manage the annual black-tie Sammies gala including vendors, guests, run of show and program content, printed materials and audience development.
Conceive, design and implement new programming to foster a stronger culture of recognition in government and to enhance understanding of our nations federal workforce.
Work across the Partnership to coordinate key deliverables for the Sammies program, including communications, fundraising, audience building, analytics tracking and relationship management.
Manage Sammies program calendars and deadlines, budgets and workflow traffic across a wide variety of channels, platforms and partnerships.
Ensure Sammies programming is focused, delivers value and can live beyond the in-person events in a variety of formats.
Build strong relationships with stakeholders; keep external partners (e.g. sponsors, vendors) and internal teams on deadline, providing creative input while ensuring they provide quality service and content.
DESIRED COMPETENCIES AND POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Bachelors degree in events or nonprofit management, public relations, communications, marketing or similar field, or equivalent professional work or military experience.
A minimum 8 10 years experience in project management and event planning, preferably with nonprofit experience.
Action oriented, resilient, collaborative, communicates effectively, drives engagement and results.
Has the ability to think big picture and strategically, while also possessing the ability to take a hands-on approach and implement tactics.
Has a service mindset; is a team player with empathy, curiosity and has a deep commitment to the mission and values of the Partnership for Public Service.
Able to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and to organize multiple and varied projects simultaneously.
Can demonstrate success in executing and growing large-scale events such as fundraising galas.
Strong experience with program budgeting and strategic planning.
Experience using complex database software to manage and communicate with organizational contacts; experience using Salesforce and MailChimp preferred.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY/REPORTING STRUCTURE

This position reports to the Vice President of Communications and may supervise junior staff.

TRAVEL


If travel occurs, it is usually during the business day. Some out of the area and/or overnight travel may be required as well.

SALARY AND BENEFITS


The Partnership offers a compensation package that includes a competitive salary; medical, dental and vision coverage; life insurance; long- and short-term disability insurance; a 401k program with a 4 percent employer match; opportunities for training and development; 15 days of annual leave per year, 10 days of sick leave per year, plus all federal holidays and the day after Thanksgiving off; and use of an on-site exercise facility.

AAP/EEO STATEMENT


The Partnership is an inclusive organization that fosters learning, collaboration and respect. We actively recruit for diversity in our workplace, believing that a range of backgrounds, perspectives and experiences contributes to our mission of revitalizing government. The Partnership for Public Service is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any applicants for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability; or on any other basis prohibited by law.

REQUEST FURTHER INFORMATION/SUBMIT AN APPLICATION


Due to the pace of this search, candidates are strongly encouraged to apply as soon as possible. Applicants seeking more information are encouraged to view the full position description attached and contact Walter Baker at WBaker@ourpublicservice.org.

Talented, self-directed senior leader sought to develop and implement worldwide field marketing strategy for the Energy industry for Amazon Web Services (AWS).

In this position, you will build a strategy for our targeted top accounts in Energy, as well a plan to market to Energy customers globally. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role developing an important market segment within an exciting, fast growing business.

This role will gather market and customer insights, collaborate with internal stakeholders such as Energy Product Marketing, Sales, Business Development, and use these insights to develop and execute a marketing strategy for the industry. Partnering closely with sales and regional functional leadership to define the marketing strategy and plan, you will have a strong focus on defining programs that facilitate Energy adoption of AWS services and opportunities to partner on co-marketing activities.

You will work with industry marketing and other teams to create and execute marketing programs and campaigns, with a strong digital focus, targeted to drive awareness, acquisition, and adoption in assigned Energy accounts and for the industry worldwide. The right candidate will have successful experience in results-driven marketing and partnering with sales teams to drive account growth and a scrappy, entrepreneurial spirit. You will have a track record of hiring and retaining talent, and will manage a small but nimble team to support this growing customer segment.

This role is in Houston, Texas. Relocation assistance within the US.
Responsibilities
· Own the all-up Energy field marketing strategy for AWS
· Manage a small field marketing team
· Identify and set up mechanisms for gathering market and customer data and insights to inform business direction
· Partner with functional stakeholders to develop a differentiated Marketing strategy and plan for AWS Energy
· Build Account-Based Marketing programs for select top accounts
· Implement the plan leveraging shared services, virtual teams, and agencies as needed
· Drive customized, high value customer experiences focused on the customer needs and progression through the buyers journey
· Identify opportunities to leverage existing materials, campaigns and resources and drive inclusion and participation of accounts in programs led by other organizations
· Work with the industry product marketing team to deliver custom messaging, assets, and campaign deliverables as needed to support marketing programs and address customer challenges
· Deliver detailed reporting and metrics on activity results, campaign effectiveness, and ROI; use data to make real-time adjustments and proactively identify trends and opportunities
Travel: Up to 40%, including internationally





Basic Qualifications

· 12+ years experience in a high-tech B2B sales-facing marketing role such as field marketing or partner marketing, cloud marketing preferred
· 7+ years experience working in or with the Energy industry
· Account-based marketing experience
· Hands-on experience developing and implementing integrated marketing campaigns including live events, virtual events, industry and account specific content, and nurture programs
· Experience hiring and managing others, remote management a plus
· Bachelors degree or 4+ years equivalent relevant professional experience

Preferred Qualifications

· Account-based marketing experience to top Global Energy companies
· Global work experience
· A career trajectory that demonstrates increasing levels of responsibility and proven success delivering measurable marketing results
· Proven experience finding creative ways to do more with less, and a track record of staying on budget
· Superior oral and written communication skills with an innate attention to detail
