Job Description


About Endeavor Global Marketing:

Endeavor Global Marketing (EGM) is the cultural marketing agency within the Endeavor network, which includes preeminent talent agency WME, sports and fashion industry pioneer IMG, and other leading organizations from across the cultural landscape.

Its position within Endeavor provides EGM and its employees with unrivaled cultural insight, access, and understanding of the audiences the world’s leading brands need to reach.

Our approach to cultural marketing generates elevated ad campaigns, relevant PR strategies, humanized digital marketing platforms, and unparalleled experiences, with more than 9,000 experiential events around the world annually. In short, we build brand- and business-driving platforms and programs, rooted in human and cultural insights.

Being a part of the team that delivers these solutions means being a part of the agency that is defining the new frontier of marketing. For anyone with the drive to seek out new challenges and the commitment to craft effective solutions shaped by insight and defined by excellence, the opportunities for growth and exploration are endless.

Endeavor Global Marketing is now more than 700 employees strong globally, providing expertise in brand strategy and activation, advertising, digital and social marketing, public relations, sports and entertainment marketing, social impact marketing, influencer strategy, experiential marketing, original content and business intelligence. We work with major brand clients including Audi, AB InBev, Marriott, Visa, Coca-Cola, Papa John’s, Bumble, E. & J. Gallo Winery, and Microsoft, among more than 200 others.

Overview:

This position is for a Director role at Endeavor Global Marketing working on the Strategy team.

The Director of Strategy and Insights will serve as a key architect of a wide range of brand, experiential, and cultural marketing solutions. That means we need a true hybrid – an analytical thinker who can quickly turn large amounts of information into actionable insights, and a creative problem solver who can use strategic frameworks to design and implement compelling plans that meet a diverse set of brand needs and objectives. The Director of Strategy & Insights will report to the SVP of Strategy and Insights.

Primary Responsibilities:
Collaborate with clients as well as internal account and creative team members to ensure that all agency outputs deliver on brand objectives and meet internal quality standards
Author all strategic deliverables – from creative briefs to final presentations – on select accounts
Lead pitches, strategy workshops, and original research for new business and organic growth opportunities
Serve as a thought leader on industry trends and strategies for internal and external audiences
Work with VP of Strategy and Insights to support ongoing strategy team growth and development
Requirements:
5+ years of marketing strategy experience
Solid understanding of the tools and frameworks that support brand and experiential marketing strategy development
Ability to translate research into consumer and cultural insights that inspire award-winning work
Ability to develop, sell, and implement strategic plans that support creative solutions
Ability to maintain and grow internal and external client relationships at all levels of the organization
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent creative problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills
A persuasive and engaging presentation style
Strong interest in and understanding of the cultural forces and trends that impact consumer behavior
About the Team:

The Strategy and Insights team believes in striking the perfect balance between science and art. We dig deep into the minds and aspirations of the people we seek to reach, combining research, insights and inspiration to find creative solutions that shift perceptions and change behavior. We search for the big ideas hidden in everyday life to bring brands closer to consumers and consumers closer to their dreams, measuring every step along the way.

The Company

Rescue provides behavior change marketing services (or "social marketing") to government, non-profit and corporate organizations. Rescue's current work focuses on tobacco, obesity, violence and alcohol prevention; the promotion of exercise, fresh foods and after school programs; and other products and services that promote healthy living. Rescues behavior change campaigns focus on diverse populations within teen (13 - 17), young adult (18 - 26), and adult (18+) populations in both rural and urban areas, resulting in a vast array of campaign styles and strategies.

Rescue is a full-service agency, providing research, strategy, creative, production, web, traditional media, social media, policy change, youth engagement and experiential marketing services to clients in over a dozen states and provinces, as well as to federal government agencies.

We believe that marketing can do more than sell goods, it can create good.

The Job

We are looking for a dynamic, high performing Sr. Strategist with experience in writing briefs/presentations for both established and new campaigns and guiding creative along the way. The ideal candidate has a passion for behavior change, a history of innovative thinking, and is capable of coming up with multiple ways of solving a problem. This role starts our creative development off on the right foot so were reaching the right audience with the right message.

Day-To-Day Activities:

Developing strategies for public health brands to achieve behavioral health outcomes;
Writing creative briefs and decks for both established and new campaigns that include overall strategy, positioning, messaging, and creative inspiration;
Using qualitative/quantitative research and cultural trends to tell a story and activate against fresh audience insights;
Partnering with creative teams to deliver against the strategy;
Collaborating with cross-functional teams (research, creative, paid media, social, web, cultural experts) to ensure strategy shines through in creative development;
Finding solutions by using a big picture approach.
Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree +4 years relevant experience OR 9 years relevant experience OR Master's Degree +2 years relevant experience;
Marketing/ad agency experience;
Extensive writing experience to guide creative teams;
Experience on a range of client accounts - small and large, new and long-standing;
Experience with 360 accounts including digital & experiential;
Experience with client-facing work.
Location: San Diego, CA or Seattle, WA

Status: Full-time Position

Benefits: Learn more about the benefits of working at Rescue here: http://rescueagency.com/careers/

Travel: Once per quarter or less

If youre ready to join our team of mission driven talent challenging the status quo, wed love to meet you! Check out our Careers page at rescueagency.com/careers for more information about what its like to work at Rescue, and the benefits that we offer to our team members.

The Fine Print

Environment:


All business-related environments are tobacco-free. Must have valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and computer and Internet access. Must be available to work non-traditional hours such as late nights and weekends.

Physical Requirements:


Able to remain in a sitting position for prolonged periods of time and stoop, bend, reach, climb stairs, and move freely throughout the building for the performance of duties. Able to read from a computer or laptop monitor for several hours at a time including fonts of various sizes from a variety of sources. Able to speak publicly and give presentations on a laptop. Travel nationwide as needed to meet with clients, coworkers, or attend meetings and seminars.

The Application

All applications must be submitted through Rescues online careers system (unless you qualify to request a reasonable accommodation, as detailed at RescueAgency.com/careers). We do not accept applications via email, mail, fax or in-person delivery. Please send questions to careers@rescueagency.com.

PLEASE NOTE: All email correspondence that you receive from Rescue Agency will be sent through an @rescueagency.com email address. We recommend that you disregard any emails posing as authentic Rescue Agency accounts (e.g. @rescueaggency.com or rescueagency.jobs@gmail.com). If you receive a message from a Rescue employee, you can verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us at careers@rescueagency.com.

Job Description: OneCause Seasonal Assistant Event Managers are responsible for helping to execute and manage OneCause events onsite.

The essential job functions for the person in this role include:
Help manage/execute night and weekend OneCause events on location.
Help manage OneCause staff.
Help manage the OneCause technology including: OneCause proprietary software, laptops, tablets, credit card readers, BidPal handheld devices, printers.
Help manage and resolve some onsite inquires.
Train client's staff, volunteers and guests (when necessary) before events begin.
Assist the Lead Event Manager to ensure clients are maximizing their event revenue.
Desired Skills & Experience
BS/BA encouraged.
2 years total work experience in event management preferable within the nonprofit sector
Availability to work 3 to 5 events per month, approximately 10 hours a day
Management of external event staff, volunteers and guests
Strong leadership skills
Exceptional customer relationship management skills
Exceptional communication skills – including: written, interpersonal and public speaking
Highly organized with the ability to meet multiple concurrent deadlines in a fast-paced environment
High level of initiative
Comfortable with using intuitive web based software as well as smartphone technology (iPhone and Android)

About OneCause Inc.
Are you passionate about creating a positive change in the world? Come join our team of change-makers!

We are on a mission to help nonprofits across the country feed the hungry, fight cancer, promote the arts, educate young people and everything in between. Our commitment to helping nonprofits use technology to more efficiently manage their fundraising efforts, engage more donors and raise more money has fueled steady growth in OneCause's software and services.

Leading the industry, OneCause first revolutionized charitable fundraising in 2007 by introducing mobile bidding to silent auctions. Today, OneCause has an expansive product line of mobile and online fundraising software which has helped our clients raise over $1 billion and connect 1 million donors to their causes. Think you have what it takes to help lead us toward more Technology for Good®? Then keep reading!

The Opportunity:

In 2011 charitable giving in the U.S. was estimated to be more than $298 billion. OneCause is well positioned to assist its not-for-profit partners to capitalize on the opportunity to maximize their fundraising capability.

You bring the drive to succeed and professional consulting experience to maintain OneCause's position in the marketplace as the leader in auction automation. We deliver the products, support and career growth you desire.

Project Manager


Tagkast, a social word-of-mouth software platform for event & experiential marketing, seeks an exceptional Project Manager to oversee the strategic planning and operational execution of Tagkast supported activations.

Our overall objective is to encourage consumer sharing of event brand experiences on social media and to increase word-of-mouth awareness for our customers. The Project Manager will be responsible for managing and implementing event activations to meet this objective. The ideal candidate is experienced in leadership, client management and managing critical situations, has high energy, and is results-oriented with a creative and analytical mind. The candidate should be passionate about the event-marketing industry.

Major Responsibilities/Activities
Effectively lead projects to integrate Tagkast into client’s event marketing strategy while building positive professional relationships with client teams.
Work with client to define objectives, requirements, and assumptions necessary to structure activations.

Plan, schedule, and control project timelines with active problem-solving to course correct any missed deadlines.

On-site management and coordination of key client event activations.

Strong competencies in planning and organization with the ability to lead multiple activities and resources while maintaining a focus on quality.
Experience developing, leading and managing field teams and working remotely.

Ability to produce and present clear, concise and professionally written communications and presentations.

Able to work extended hours, late nights and weekends as dictated by events and willing to travel as much as 80% – 90% of the time.
To apply, e-mail sean@tagkast.com with resume and cover letter.

Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Job Title: Proposal Writer / BizDev Support (for Web and MarComm Projects)
Job Description:
First, a quick blurb about Taoti…

Established in 1996, Taoti Creative is a boutique, full-service creative agency located on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC.  We are privately owned and have no corporate overloads (nothing personal, WPP.)  We do stuff like web development, social media management, branding, experiential marketing, video, AR/VR, etc.  Our mission is to ‘move the needle’ for our clients.  We leverage technology, creativity, and innovation to generate meaningful and measurable results for our clients—that’s what drives us.  Speaking of clients, they’re about 60% non-profits, 20% commercial, and 20% federal government.  Some of our customers include World Bank, USAID, DC Water, Discovery Education, American Chemical Society, Jane Goodall Foundation, and dozens of ‘National Association of _____________,’ etc.  Our full-time team of about 50 employees is about 65% in-house and 35% remote.  We hail from over 14 countries.  And for the last four years in a row, we’ve made the Inc5000 list of fastest growing companies in the United States.  There’s of course plenty of additional information on our website.  If you’ve not done so already, be sure to check out our culture video: https://vimeo.com/289302105.  Or if you’re feeling virtual, here’s guided tour of the office in 360 video! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7KkzdmSGTM (Warning: not suitable for printers.) You may also enjoy https://www.instagram.com/taoticreative/?hl=en.

Job Summary

It’s one thing to have brilliant ideas and technical knowledge to put together a solution for a client.  But it’s another thing to be able to write it down and articulate it in a way that is clear, concise, and compelling.  That’s your job: to be a driving force behind writing our proposals and submitting them to clients.  Our sales process is extremely collaborative, so it’s not like we throw an RFP at you, lock you in a dark room, and say, “here, write a response to this.”  As our opportunities come in, our team evaluates, qualifies, and strategizes about them.  As a team (of which you will be part), we decide which opportunities to pursue and what our big ideas are.  That’s where you step up.  You borrow bits form old proposals, take ideas from our team, add in your own two cents, and set out to write the world’s best proposal that will get us in the room with the client (metaphorically speaking) to win the work.

Let’s be clear: this is a business development role.  But it’s not your job to go find leads or be the leading voice in pitch meetings (though if you want to do that stuff, there’s definitely a chance to do it).  It will take a while for you to fully get what we do, how we do it, and what makes Taoti special.  A lot of what we do is highly technical, but depending on your comfort level with technical writing, you’ll start to understand what makes us tick. We think a part of being a good proposal writer is getting inside the head of the client. You will need to have calls with them (if they aloe) to determine if we are the right fit and to identify what needs they have. You will also need to research them to understand how to connect their needs to what we propose, creating a proposal that emotionally connects with the client.

Even though we are 100% working remotely right now because of Covid, please note, we are looking for a full time, in-house employee that would have less than a 45-minute commute to our office.

What we're looking for
You write unbelievably well.
You have 4 - 6 years of proposal writing experience in the world of web development, strategic communications, marketing, etc.
You eat 80-page RFPs for breakfast.
You WANT to write proposals.  It’s not a chore.  Not something you have to do as punishment.  Not something you do when you run out of other things.
You are organized.
You can handle the pressure & pace of working in a creative agency.
Tight deadlines don’t scare you.
You have experience selling websites based in WordPress and Drupal.
You like to get focused, and put your head down and write.
You’re not afraid to let some personality show through and know just how much is the right amount of ‘edgy.’
And you know how to adjust the edgy based on audience.
You’re a little bit technical (particularly with regard to web development) and don’t scare easily when faced with jargon you don’t know.
You know Word inside and out.  You’d never dare individually format a heading without applying a style.  You know how to create dynamic TOCs.  You could teach Clippy a thing or three.
While you may not be an artist, you know how to make a fine lookin’ document.
You’re collaborative.  You’re not afraid to get out of your chair and go ask a dev about why a client would want SOLR and how you should position it in the proposal.
You can take your colleague’s lame, 8-page, rambling resume that’s impossible to read and turn it into a beautiful one-pager that makes him or her look like Einstein.
You can work directly with clients to refine and revise proposals, scopes, and other documents.
Is there room for career growth?

That’s one of the best parts about this role, specifically at Taoti.  In a larger shop, the team structure hierarchy is usually large, layered, and not-so-flexible.  Or at a smaller shop, you may have lots of flexibility, but not enough of a team to really benefit from true collaboration (or have enough upward mobility to keep you interested.)  Taoti is the Goldilocks of creative agencies.  We have enough structure so that you understand what the team looks like and where you fit in.  But we’re small and agile enough to let employees carve out new roles and niches where it makes sense to do so.  Your value and career trajectory is not defined by a line or box on an org chart.  Our teams and roles are constantly evolving as the team grows, so if you want to grow into a role that doesn’t exist, you can help create it!  Our growth rate alone (targeted at 50% this year) means that the team will keep growing, which means we’ll be hiring additional people across all departments.  And our hiring philosophy is all about hiring the next wave of employees that best supports the existing team.  In other words, we grow the team around what we already have—not according to some org chart or spreadsheet.  So career paths are not rigid and finite.  We have a history of shaking things up, making rather bold HR moves, and adapting our hiring processes (as well as the roles of our existing employees) in a way that makes strategic sense for the employee and the company. So your career trajectory has far more to do with your own aptitude and initiative than it does with an org chart or who’s above you.  In this particular role, you’re already coming into a new role that will start as just you, grow into a team, then maybe a department, eventually a division, etc.  We don’t have to explain how the idea of being in on the ground floor of a growing agency’s public sector sales department has a lot of potential upside if you’re successful.

What about benefits?
3 weeks PTO for starters.  You gain more with tenure.  And if you’re really big in to PTO, you can even trade back some salary for more.
Telework options (which work like PTO… you accrue days with each paycheck.  TELE days increase with tenure as well.  By your fourth year, we don’t even count them any more.)
100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance.  (50% for qualifying dependents.)  And we have good insurance.
Paid family leave for men and women (including PTO plus short and long term disability options.)
3% retirement plan matching (plus access to a financial advisor).
Home buyer help (including a $1200 closing credit)
Mobile phone reimbursement
You can opt for a company-supplied PC or Mac laptop.  Or if you want to use your own, we’ll reimburse you for it.
Charitable contribution matching
Tax-free metro benefits
A sincere respect of work-life balance
Money and time off allocated for professional development (also increases with tenure)
A diverse team hailing from over 15 countries last time we checked
A very hip/cool/funky/quirky office space on Barracks Row, in the heart of Capitol Hill.  Just 2 blocks from the metro!  (With the office space doubling in size next year as we build a new building in the parking lot next door to our building.)
Fun perks like a roof deck, wine/beer always on tap, regular company boat outings (boat is walking distance from the office), chill work environment, etc.
No real dress code (within reason, as long as you can be an adult about getting dressed for work)
Weekly yoga and meditation classes
Annual global retreat (where we bring the whole team together for fun, games, and teamwork)
Of course, the above is a quick list.  Ask to see the handbook for all the gory details.



What’s the corporate culture like?

Taoti is a pretty casual shop.  You can generally wear whatever you want.  Lots of telework flexibility.  You’ll have access to anyone/everyone in the company, including the CEO.  Not only is it okay to question decisions and policy, but it’s part of your job to do so when you see a better way.  The team is fun and social.  We do a lot in and outside of the office together—from boat trips to happy hours to yoga.  There are all sorts of perks and benefits, but culture isn’t about perks and benefits—it’s about a way of thinking.  And our way of thinking goes back to the mission: to move the needle.  We’re all about doing great work that gets results for our clients.  And everything else that we do here, be it fun or work, in some way drives towards that objective.  (As one employee puts it, “We’re fun, but focused.”  That sums it up pretty well. There are some pictures of the office on the website and our Instagram account: https://www.instagram.com/taoticreative/?hl=en.  Always feel free to drop in and see for yourself.

Next steps…

If you’re qualified and interested, please apply on our website (www.taoti.com/careers) and not Indeed or Glassdoor or other such sites (as we cannot respond to those applications.) While we do not have a fixed salary in mind, we're shopping somewhere in the $50-75K range based on experience, seniority, and lots of other factors.  That's just a range--not a hard limit. Also, please know that once the corona virus stuff dies down, this will be an in-house (most of the time) job.



Equal Opportunity Employer

Taoti is an equal opportunity employer and actively embraces building a diverse and inclusive team!

We invite you to be part of our team of trailblazers dedicated to helping people discover and enjoy the outside. Come join us. Because on the inside we’re all outsiders. And if it’s outside, we’re all in.

NOTE: While these are certainly challenging times right now, our temporary jobs will remain posted so that we are ready to move forward when the time comes. Please apply and we will be in touch with you as soon as it makes sense to do so. Thank you for your understanding.

WHAT'S OUR STORY

Engine Shop is a global sports and entertainment marketing agency built for the modern era of engagement. We specialize in connecting our clients with their audiences through the passion points of sports, music, film, television, gaming and arts and culture. Through live experiences, content and branded entertainment, we create meaningful engagements that drive our clients' business objectives.

But that's not our only focus. Our culture is a consideration in everything we do; from our casual work environments to our creative benefits and our acclaimed annual retreat. It's a part of how we treat one another, how we have each other's backs and how we welcome people who are different.

Engine Shop knows work must fit in to life and life into work.

WHAT'S YOUR STORY

You are looking for a limited short term (6 month position) to explore Engagement Marketing, whether it be sports, music, entertainment, arts, culture or gaming. This role needs a multitasker who is detail oriented, extremely organized, collaborative, motivated, and has a constant "no job is too small" attitude. You can identify potential challenges, create solutions on your own, and your confident in consulting with clients and agency partners. Job Description
At CVS Health, were reinventing our front store to be the front door to healthcare. For millions of Americans, that journey begins with one of our 9,900+ retail stores, and we want to help each of our customers take the right first or next step in his or her healthcare journey. To help us achieve this goal we are looking for innovative marketing leaders who think big and push boundaries to drive results, for the consumer, and for the business.

As the Senior Manager, Experiential Marketing Strategy, you will play a critical role as we create new and exciting store formats and specialized experiences within some of our retail stores. Specifically, you will lead the store experience and marketing strategy development in partnership with cross-functional teams to bring unique shopping experiences to life, such as our Beauty in Real Life stores, CVS y Más formats, and more.

You will be responsible for creating an inspiring shopper journey for our customers, both in-store and online for these unique retail experiences. In partnership with leadership and the Insights team, you will help unlock customer insights to understand how shopper behavior is changing and leverage those insights to develop hypothesis continually learning and optimizing the shopper experience. This role is critical in representing the consumer and helping her make confident choices in these new and exciting store experiences, through signage, digital tools, and more.

Additionally, you will be responsible for building a data driven Marketing communications strategy, ensuring execution, and optimization to communicate with consumers and drive them into these specialty experiences, and keep them coming back. Through structured tests, you will explore opportunities to increasingly motivate shoppers to visit our stores.

Primary Role and Responsibility:

Develop exceptional retail experiences and execution plans:
Leveraging insights from a variety of internal and external data sources, outline key shopper journeys for these experiences, particularly outlining the decision making points and pain points that our retail experience design needs to consider
Drive the experience strategy development in partnership with Director/Sr. Director and Creative design teams, to ensure we design experiences that optimize consumer decision making/adoption and drive revenue
Manage cross-functional teams to deliver experience strategy on time and on budget including, but not limited to, creative brief development, collaboration with Procurement on creation and delivery experience elements, collaboration with Construction and Operations on store readiness, and legal and business review and approval process
Once experiences are in a prototype phase or live environment, continually understand consumer NPS, barriers to trial and barriers to retention to outline optimization plans Execution and Optimization
Marketing Strategy and execution that drives results:
Collaborate with Director/Senior Director to build marketing strategies, rooted in data, that are designed to get the consumer into tailored retail experiences and get them moving more of their retail trips to these store
Outline the most ROI positive way to engage consumers
Own the development of the strategic marketing brief and partner with internal and external creative and media partners/channel experts on the execution of the marketing plan, inclusive of both paid (media, events) and owned assets (signage, email, digital)
Once strategies are developed, ensure they can be operationalized and scaled, with flawless execution (including roll out at store)
Partner with other Marketing teams to integrate, where it makes sense, with other communication in market, versioned for these unique retail experiences
Manage cross-functional teams to deliver marketing campaigns on time and on budget
Partner and Inspire Cross-functionally:
Core cross-functional relationships to build and establish include Merchandising, Store Design, Construction Creative, and Analytics.
A clear, effective, and collaborative communication style is critical to success.
A can do attitude and a passion for removing barriers is key, as many of the specialized retail format projects run on fast timelines and are subject to change as we go.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of retail marketing experience with a strong foundation of business and consumer understanding
3+ years of cross-functional leadership experience
2+ years of digital marketing experience including examples of testing and validating emerging opportunities
2+ years of store experience strategy & execution
Preferred Qualifications
Proven track record of the ability to work collaboratively with internal and external business partners in delivering positive ROI
Intellectual curiosity and rigorous analytical experience and a strong familiarity with the digital environment
Self-motivated, high capacity individual who can function and win in a demanding, performance-driven environment
Excellent communication skills that can be effectively articulated in both written and oral forms across a diverse audience base
Creative problem solver who can incorporate new learnings into existing plans and act decisively and independently
Experience working in a highly matrixed organization
Deep appreciation of end-to-end consumer shopping experience
Experience with relevant marketing technology and channels
Online and offline marketing experience
Strong PC knowledge including Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Education
Bachelors degree in Business, Marketing, or related field preferred. Ideally, an MBA

Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, were pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, youll be at the center of it all.

CREATIVE DIRECTOR
Embedded onsite within a Fortune-500 CPG, the Creative Director is responsible for building, leading, inspiring, and mentoring the design team. The Creative Director ensures that every step in the creative journey is as good as it can be. This role sets the bar for the quality of the creative product of the team and is responsible for coaching the designers to ensure their success.
Our agency unit is a fast-paced and dynamic environment, fueled by design thinking. Embedded within the PepsiCo organization, our team is passionately focused on delivering outstanding design work which drives the organization’s business forward. Our teams flex their problem solving and design skills across all channels – including off-pack, experiential marketing, marketing campaigns, digital and social media platforms. We are proud to produce creative work that is amongst the top tier in the industry.
Our team members possess an open mind, positive attitude, and are adaptable to change. We pride ourselves on challenging ideas – not people.
Role Overview
They are responsible for building, leading, inspiring, and mentoring the design team. The Creative Director ensures that every step in the creative journey is as good as it can be. This role sets the bar for the quality of the creative product of the team and is responsible for coaching the designers to ensure their success.
The Creative Director is focused on the continuous growth of their team members – who may be located onsite and/or within our agency’s studios alike. They provide guidance and tools to elevate the quality of their designer’s work. The Creative Director is a champion for the creative process and fosters collaboration with a positive approach and atmosphere. The Creative Director leads by example, unifying the teams within our organization to work harmoniously for the greater good of the agency. They are the driving force behind building a creative culture, brand, and community at large.
The Creative Director is expected to put forward suggestions and strategies that positively move the agency forward. This requires a genuine understanding of and opinion on the creative industry landscape, and the drive and determination to get us to the top tier and keep us there.
Responsibilities

The specific details of the role will vary, but common activities include:
Adapting to perform any role or function which supports the development of the team
Bringing people together and breaking down departmental walls
Creating a team spirit that extends beyond the design department to unite and inspire the entire agency to care passionately about our clients and our work
Acting as a liaison between the client’s onsite team and our agency’s design and accounts teams
Identifying big picture opportunities and driving our client’s business forward
Striving for excellence and instilling pride and passion in our teams
Helping account handlers write inspiring briefs and (positively) questioning those briefs that don’t
Managing, filtering, and working with scheduling department to assign design projects, and ensuring that jobs are appropriately staffed to deliver on the client’s brief
Participating in brainstorms and playing an active role in shaping strategy
Motivating and leading designers to achieve brilliant execution and making sure that creative work is presented for maximum clarity and impact
Providing support to Creative and Adaptive teams alike
Fostering a collaborative approach between our client, our agency studios, and other agencies within the our organization.
Ensuring the team is resourced and trained appropriately
Providing senior level support with clients
Supporting, guiding, leading, nurturing
Communicating consistently with the Executive Creative Director, Management Team, and our agency Teams to drive business goals
Managing the department’s budget in a financially responsible manner, with respect to staffing, travel, and expenses
Ideal Candidate Will Possess
Expertise in off-pack, experiential marketing, marketing campaigns, digital and social media platforms
The drive to elevate creative quality and build a creative culture
The ability to lead, coach, manage, and develop team members
Great design chops and a killer portfolio (which reflects your leadership across a broad range of work)
Strategic and insightful thinking
Creative problem solving that is among the top tier of the industry
Expertise in branding
Expertise in packaging design (Consumer Packaged Goods) is an asset
Expertise across other channels and disciplines is a must
Expertise in food and drink
Experience estimating hours, budgets, and timelines is an asset
Clarity of thought and the ability to mobilize teams efficiently
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills at a senior and executive level – both written and verbal
Qualifications
12+ years of experience as a graphic designer in a packaging studio or creative firm, and experience leading creative talent
College or University diploma in graphic, packaging, or communication design is preferred
Proficient using Mac OS, Adobe Creative Suite (Expert knowledge of Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign), Microsoft Word, Excel, and Powerpoint (or Keynote)
A valid passport and ability to travel – to work in conjunction with our sister studios, clients, and photoshoots

Company Overview:

Vital Proteins is an emerging, dynamic brand consisting of a team of passionate individuals who believe whole-food-based nutrition is essential for overall health, fitness and wellbeing. Our team is comprised of intelligent and innovative talent who work collaboratively to ensure creativity, success, and global growth. At Vital Proteins, our mission is to empower our company, team, and customers to live a full, vibrant life. We seek to develop and support the right people, with the right chemistry, who continually ask questions, and in turn will develop and tactically execute good ideas. We are looking for individuals to help us think smarter and put a lot of ideas on the table in a short amount of time. Building a great company is our goal. Quality individuals and getting the team right is our business plan.

Role:

We are looking for a high energy, passionate and extremely communicative Influencer Marketing Coordinator to help us establish and grow our influencer relationships and build a true online community. This person will touch the wellness, fitness, and beauty communities to reach and connect with the right people, both on and offline. In a nutshell, this person will help us carry our marketing strategy through to the consumer by creating his/her own network of influencers to speak about the brand. The Influencer Marketing Coordinator role will operate out of our West Loop office and be assisting a team of Influencer Marketing Relationship Managers, reporting to the Senior Manager of Influencer Relationships.

What you will be responsible for:
Marketing Vital Proteins product to influencers, brand ambassadors and consumers through various social media platforms and email outreach
Cold outreach through social platforms to foster partnerships and help the team grow our social network
Assisting the social media and influencer teams with their daily objectives to meet key quarterly milestones
Having an active understanding of influencer/digital marketing knowledge & social media trends
Being an evangelist of the brand, coming up with new and inventive ways to promote the products to our network
Collaborating with the warehouse on product shipments to influencers and brand ambassadors
Who you are:
Bachelors degree in marketing or a related field
You have a minimum of 1+ years of experience in Marketing.
You have 1-2 years of experience in influencer marketing, preferably in the CPG industry
You are passionate about the fitness, beauty, wellness, fashion, and lifestyle
You are a self-starter with proven ability to take initiative, define what needs to get done and multi-task
You are a people person you enjoy communicating & are happiest when youre corresponding with others and forming new relationships
You are social, outgoing, personable and friendly
In your spare time, you always find yourself scouting new people to follow on Instagram or are out and about making new connections with like-minded individuals
You celebrate your success, and the success of the team even more
You have strong written and oral communication skills
Minimal travel required (tentatively once a quarter)
Must have strong business acumen and entrepreneurial spirit
You must be able to read, write and understand English
Vital Proteins is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer

Job Description:

We are looking for a rockstar all-in-one experiential marketing ninja to oversee a high-power market as part of our Brand Experience Team. This individual will serve as Brand Activation Manager, working closely with Marketing HQ and lateral Brand Experience Teams as the day to day manager of all experiential activity for the GTs Living Foods portfolio in their given market. This will involve overseeing a Brand Activation Specialist and managing success through events, networking and partnership sourcing, development of the brand in off premise channel through sampling/360 programming, brand education, vehicle/storage/asset responsibilities and thorough recap/budget management. This role will be responsible for overall performance of their local market, driving growth and increasing market share year over year in a high-powered market on behalf of the largest and most respected kombucha supplier in the world.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Retail Activation
Participate in strategic oversight of off premise sampling initiatives, ensuring product and educational materials are properly displayed in-store and overall team is selling and converting consumers with volume at every demo.
Develop strong business relationships with stores, retail outlets and foodservice accounts in order to gain and drive distribution and visibility for our brand.
Identify opportunities at market level to help elevate the GT brands via targeted POS and merchandising. Optimize shelf set when appropriate.
Develop a relationship with our key distributors to understand key needs and business opportunities.
Oversee programming for larger scale pop-up retail experiences, collaborating with sales and executing to the highest standard.
Event Activation
Plan, organize and execute beautiful, high-touch lifestyle events at various venues. Venues may span retail locations to full sponsorships and may involve creation of our own owned events from scratch.
Partner with Marketing HQ to identify key events with brand aligned companies to build a solid presence for the GTs portfolio.
Participate in strategic coordination and execution of sampling initiatives.
Oversee all guerilla marketing impact and success, managing your Brand Activation Specialist in sourcing an extensive calendar of high traffic, high impact sampling locations to utilize our tap truck/mobile billboard for visibility and brand awareness.
Contribute to campaign launches thinking creatively outside of events for how we can activate a new innovation item in your region
Smartly leverage sponsorship budget to negotiate high value on-brand partnerships.
Managerial
Coach, mentor, train and grow your Brand Activation Specialist (BAS) to perfection. Youre responsible to create the dynamic-duo partnership that will bring your market to the top.
Oversee a best-in-class, high quality, high performing Brand Ambassador team ensuring BAS has all tools and guidance to succeed with their team.
Be responsible in sourcing key tools and materials for demos/events as well as assist with the evolution of our demo and event aesthetic.
Brand Activation Manager will be responsible for the planning, coordination, and allocation of product for events as well as premium items to be given or sold to consumers.
Serve as the principal point of contact and driver to attend various sampling events, sponsorships, etc.
Act as a key role model for the GTs portfolio of brands helping to spread the love for the entire brand family.
Be analytical with activations results. We need you to look at the data, pivot quickly when something is not working and double down when we are seeing success.
Market Guru
Be incredibly in-tune with our local competition, looking for every opportunity to leverage our brands credibility, gain competitive relationships and find occasions to better showcase our brand.
Work hand-in-hand with our Strategic Accounts Manager or regional sales team to drive awareness in our critical high-touch/high-visibility accounts and collaboratively create programming that adds value.
Analyze key information from consumers to better understand any challenges and hurdles with GTs portfolio of brands.
Identify market trends and interpret how those trends will affect the marketplace in real time
Capture activity at every high-profile event for social elevation and 360 consumer brand experience.
Be. The. Expert. The buck stops with you for regional growth through field. We expect you to know all of the right places, people and opportunities to expand at all times.
Administrative Etc.
Create detailed activation recaps including success stories, key learnings and areas for improvement post events.
Compile and analyze key consumer insights and takeaways to help influence our strategy and marketing tactics for all GT brands.
Be fastidious in maintaining receipts and keeping track of own and team expenses to submit for reimbursement.
When we say ninja we mean it be someone that can get analytical, present strong recaps that show value and can understand how to show ROI on experiential marketing through data.
Work collaboratively with counterparts, superiors, juniors, finance, HR, fulfillment and more from the top to the bottom.
Manage regional budget for overall activity hours, storage, vehicle, supplies etc.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Excellent written, organizational, critical thinking/analytical, problem solving/troubleshooting, and communication/interpersonal skills.
Great taste is a MUST! Ability to find what is new and on-trend is critical.
Creativity is required both visual creativity but also creative/independent problem solving
Able to set and meet multiple and simultaneous deadlines.
Able to manage high pressure situations and challenges with grace.
Able to plan and align resources - make magic with few tools, stretch every dollar and asset to its highest value.
Be enthusiastic about kombucha, and raw, organic, living foods
Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.
Be dynamic and able to juggle multiple tasks.
Be passionate, be bold, be persistent. Nothing great was ever achieved by accepting the status quo. We expect you to continue to improve Brand Experience and our company as a whole.

Who We Are

The Charlotte Regional Visitors Authority will leverage our hospitality marketing and management expertise to maximize the impact of the Charlotte Regions economycreating opportunities and jobs for our community. http://www.crva.com/what-we-believe

Job Summary

The Event Manager acts as the primary liaison between the Charlotte Convention Center or NASCAR Hall of Fame and clients from the initial booking of events through the conclusion of events.

Essential Job Duties

· Manages routine events to ensure the execution of services which include public safety, cleanliness of facility, room set-up, power distribution, lighting, and air temperature.

· On-site Building Manager during events directly overseeing all departments and service contractors in relation to the Execution of the Event.

· Exercise tact and courtesy in performing duties in achieving the common goal of customer satisfaction.

· Produces event agendas by scripting client event specifications and distributes agenda to appropriate departments for execution.

· Create & Revise room layouts with knowledge of fire code regulations and building resources.

· Monitors event as it occurs to ensure that all event activities are executed in a timely manner.

· Enforces event regulations and handles emergency situations.

· Meets deadlines with limited supervision.

· Conducts site visits with clients prior to events to identify any areas of concern or adjust the itinerary if needed.

· Conducts pre-event meetings with clients to discuss the flow and overview of the event.

· Prepares post-event summaries, provides billing information, and critiques execution of event and general client service experience.

· Prepares reports for Risk Management in the event of patron accidents.

· Assists Event Managers as necessary.

· Must be able to work a flexible schedule which may consist of nights, weekends and possibly holidays.

· May perform other duties as required.

Scope of Responsibility

· This job has no budgetary responsibilities.

· This job will have periodic access to confidential data including company records and/or minutes, customer quotes, product costs, and company plans, designs, and/or programs.

Supervisory Responsibility

· This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Knowledge and Skill Requirements

· Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with people of diverse backgrounds

· Service oriented style with professional presentation skills

· Entrepreneurial spirit

· Motivational leader

· Effective in providing exceptional customer service

· Ability to improve the bottom line

· Clear, concise written and verbal communication skills

· Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and administrative skills

· Creative and Innovative

· Keen eye for detail

· Excellent time management skills

· Passionate, Enthusiastic, Flexible, Energetic

· Project management experience

· Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.

· Ability to anticipate customer needs.

· Builds positive relationships with customers and vendors, goes the extra mile to satisfy and exceed customer needs.

· Treats all customers and vendors with highest degree of respect and courtesy, and delivers exceptional service to internal and external customers.

Education and Experience

Bachelors Degree (B. A.) or equivalent from four-year college or technical school

2+ years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Physical Demands

Job Description

• Conceptualize and lead strategic client programs

Excellent communicator with strong presentation skills

Frequent travel

Job Description:
Job Description
Title: Event Coordinator
Location: Bellevue, WA United States

Engineering & Operations Talent Acquisition
Event Coordinator
Our Engineering & Operations Pivotal Talent Sourcing team scours the globe for talent that is in the top of their field, is aligned to our mission and growth mindset culture, and driven by teamwork and excited about the prospect of empowering billions. The Pivotal Engineering Talent Acquisition team is looking for an Event Coordinator to help execute on our industry events strategy across the globe. We are looking for someone with creative interest and passion for flawless execution.

Responsibilities include the following:
Be the "face” of engineering industry events to internal and external partners including business leaders, Global Talent Acquisition, marketing, Global Diversity & Inclusion, external conference organizers, speakers, and organizations.
Venue support such as booking and paying for event space, working with VenueSource to choose appropriate locations, conference planning, and room scheduling, etc
Logistical support such as scheduling, leading and scribing meetings, and coordination with vendors such as photographers, video, A/V, etc.
Catering support such as menu planning, payments, etc.
Supplies and event materials management: working with vendors to get price quotes and assure seamless, on time delivery, PO creation, storage, and print/copy support.
Attendee support such as invite coordination (i.e., Microsoft Forms) as well as uploading leads into our system.
Business support such as on-site scheduling, coordinating speakers and helping to ensure that day of event support (registration, event staff, F&B, etc) are prepared.
Content editing for conference and event collateral and landing pages, working alongside marketing and brand teams
Budget tracking and updating
Other duties as assigned

Previous experience with events logistics such as scheduling and working with external parties.
Strong written and verbal communication skills – to include negotiations and presentations.
Experience using Microsoft PowerPoint, Publisher and Excel.
Excellent communication skills and experience communicating between multiple parties.

“We are innovators who make purpose-built gear for life's most demanding missions.”

Our ethos defines our culture– Trusted, Responsive, Accountable and Committed.

5.11 Tactical has established itself as the fastest-growing and most well-known brand of tactical apparel, gear and functional products in the world. Through a commitment to operator-led product innovation, quality and compelling value, 5.11 has developed a loyal following among some of the most demanding and discerning end-users of apparel and gear.

At our Operations Center in Manteca and Development Center in Irvine, we leverage our deep relationships with Law Enforcement, Special Forces Operators and First Responders to gain unique insights. The results are products that break new ground combining ruggedness, speed, range of motion and ultimate comfort in professional duty, tactical training, adventure, women’s tactical, fitness and industrial professionals.

POSITION SUMMARY:

We are looking for an Influencer Marketing Strategist to help build, grow, and manage our influencer program and ambassador relationships. This person will be responsible for the day to day management of all influencer partnerships across all tiers including; ambassadors, retail influencers, brand advocates and local experts. This person will execute influencer programs and campaigns that achieve brand marketing’s KPIs. The ideal candidate will have a broad understanding of the influencer marketing space, is an extremely effective communicator, and has a passion for networking and building relationships with other people.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage all influencer processes from start to finish, including recruiting, onboarding, content approval process and performance tracking, as well as, routinely analyzing internal processes to make the influencer program more efficient.
Maintain all influencer tools, documentation, and databases.
Assist in developing core KPIs and build reporting dashboards to track, optimize, and report on partnerships and campaign’s performance.
Research and collaborate with marketing team members and district/store managers to identify new ambassadors, influencers, local experts and retail influencers.
Assist in drafting all proposals, contracts, and additional forms as needed.
Coordinate, schedule, and assist with contract negotiations.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with influencers, as well as, manage the day to day communication.
Partner with content strategy, PR, media, and brand marketing teams to craft influencer marketing strategies and tactics that support brand marketing campaigns and product launches.
Maintain influencer marketing calendars in collaboration with brand marketing.
Identify relevant influencers for events, campaigns, giveaways, and other programs that maximize ROI and achieve campaigns KPIs.
Clearly communicates influencer calendar, campaign releases, and reports any changes to all stakeholders and marketing teams in a timely manner.
Work closely with social team to support growth of our own channels through influencer content, takeovers, contests, etc.
Monitor alerts and influencer streams for activities, overall sentiment, and potential brand damaging activities.
Keep abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and influencers strategies.
Book travel arrangements and accommodations, as well as, assist with expense reporting as needed.
Other duties may be assigned to accomplish company or department objectives.


QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in English, Communications, Public Relations, or Marketing.
2-3 years’ experience preferred in influencer marketing and/or public relations roles.
Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills.
Strong time management, organizational skills and ability to coordinate multiple projects/activities.
Quantitative skills to analyze and assess the success of your influencer marketing efforts.
Experience working with various tech platforms and social listening tools.
Exceptional attention to detail.
Enjoys working with people.
Self-starter, highly collaborative, true team-player.
Ability to be flexible based upon evolving priorities and objectives.
Ability to travel weekends, evenings and overnights as needed, or requested.
Values the tactical lifestyle, an outdoor enthusiast, and/or is a person who pushes the limits of personal endurance and strength is a plus!


ETHOS:

At 5.11 Tactical, everyone has the opportunity to be a leader and perform in an exceptional manner. We strive to uphold ourEthos which defines our culture–Trusted,Responsive,Accountable andCommitted.
Trusted
Strive to create trust in everything we do, starting with self-trust and relationship trust. We work on the components of integrity, intent, capability and results.
Responsive
Listen to the needs of our end-user Professionals, then develop, produce and deliver solutions to their problems. Each of us chooses to be a leader and takes charge of what is within our circle of influence.
Accountable
Seek to achieve results with a bias for action. We like to compete and be measured against the most demanding standards to ensure our continued success.
Committed
Overcome obstacles to accomplish our goals and support our team members when challenges arise. We complete commitments and seek to‘over-deliver” relative to expectations.
5.11’s practice is to hire at 18 years of age and older only

We are 350+ employees from diverse backgrounds, that hail from more than 50 countries, and speak 15 languages. But, we all share one thing in common: we’re passionate about accelerating software innovation. Our vision is to put Nexus products at the center of every open source decision made by modern engineering organizations. We’re one of the fastest growing tech companies in America and have been named both a Deloitte Fast 500 and Inc. 5000 company three years in a row. We pride ourselves on being an open and supportive company, which is why we were named to Fast Company’s list of 50 Best Workplaces for Innovators in 2019. Learn more at www.sonatype.com.

We are Sonatype, and we have assembled a world-class team of employees, investors, and partners. With over 120,000 installations and counting, Nexus products are helping modern development organizations intelligently source, manage, assemble, and maintain open source and third-party components, so they can improve the quality, security, and speed of their software supply chains.

The Field Marketing Manager is responsible for leading Sonatype's marketing strategy in assigned regions. Your role focuses on building awareness in specific markets and driving leads from named accounts in each territory. You will work cross functionally with sales leadership and regional sales managers to develop and execute in territory campaigns that align to an account based marketing strategy.
Day to day responsibilities include:
Evaluate and analyze marketing programs and sales pipeline to effectively make decisions on programs that drive the most regional impact
Work with sales management and regional directors to create quarterly territory plans that generate market awareness and drive leads in territory
Lead campaign efforts through earned, owned and paid media strategies that drive account and territory goals·
Work closely with marketing peers across the department to build needed campaign materials including landing pages, emails and automation that enable effective sales qualification·
Serve as the go-to-resource for territory managers. Prepare regular communications to sales directors to ensure proper campaign alignment and execution.
Develop co-branded marketing activities with in territory partners that uncover joint opportunities for sales to pursue
Identify and execute regional events that support marketing goals across vertical and horizontal audiences
Leverage and tailor corporate digital media strategies to scale market awareness and education for new, evolving and mature regions
Manage quarterly regional budgets for 4-5 individual territories that prioritize spend based on regional needs and corporate priorities
Who you are...
4- 7 years experience in field marketing. Proven track record executing effective marketing campaigns that drive sales pipeline.
Education. BS/BA degree; marketing or equivalent related degree preferred
Experience working with marketing automation technology, preferably Hubspot. Comfortable with marketing tools and technologies that enable businesses to scale lead generation efforts.
Knowledge and understanding of CRM systems, preferably Salesforce.com. Capable of interacting with data in CRM systems to analyze campaign effectiveness.
History of partnering directly with field sales to achieve shared objectives.
Highly organized, detail oriented and deadline driven.
Thrives on fast pace working environment, enjoys environments where no 2 days are the same.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Visionary with ability to see the bigger picture and prioritize accordingly.
Ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects and tasks.
Customer service oriented in engaging and supporting the sales team.
Motivated to learn and grow with a fast-paced company primed to do big things.
What We Offer
The opportunity to be part of an incredible, high-growth company, working on a team of experienced colleagues
Competitive salary package
Medical/Dental/Vision benefits
Business casual dress
Flexible work schedules that ensure time for you to be you

Job Summary

Duties and responsibilities of the Marketing Manager – Kid Trax, include managing the brand’s strategic growth through developing and maintaining a consistent positive image for the brand both online and offline. Supporting and assisting the Director of Marketing in all activities related to the brand.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Brand Marketing Responsibilities (30%)
Assists Director of Marketing in building a 1-3 year marketing strategy that connects the passion points of our consumers with our brand, product, and corporate strategies and objectives.
Defines, plans, and launches annual and seasonal campaigns and priorities for the business.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of the brand, category, competitors, and consumers to ensure relevant insights to fuel all marketing elements.
Manages internal and external partners to support the activation of integrated marketing plans. Establishing strong partnerships and processes with our internal teams (Creative services, PR, Sales, Retail, Product, Legal, Customer Service, and Finance) to effectively execute marketing campaigns.
Tracks and manages brand business performance. Analyzes and reports key marketing metrics with a view to strengthening marketing plan / activities for the future.
Manages the Kid Trax marketing budget, spending efficiently to achieve our marketing goals.
Strategically assesses current activation of assets across media, experiential marketing, spokespeople, festivals, and event properties to identify strategic white spaces where our brand should be.
Kid Trax Ecommerce Merchant (30%)
Define and execute our direct to consumer sales strategies for KidTraxToys.com.
Work collaboratively with sales and product management to establish and manage the online assortment including establishing pricing.
Build and execute digital marketing programs and campaigns to drive traffic and profitable sales on KidTraxtoys.com.
Collaborate with the digital marketing team on enhancing SEO and UX.
Manages and executes the Email Marketing program delivering growth in email database and growth in sales conversion.
Content Marketing Duties (20%)
Leads the creation and execution of consumer programs, campaigns, and annual high-profile product launches.
Evaluates creative ideas and thinking with a critical eye and understanding of the brand equity, vision and strategic priorities.
Manages the influencer program, seeking out, vetting, and selecting appropriate individuals to represent the Kid Trax brand.
Develop content for the brand website; keeping in mind brand voice and consumer journey optimization.
Maintain awareness of brand standards and guidelines, and make sure they are implemented for all assets before they are deployed to digital channels.
Measures/analyzes performance of all web activity; including traffic, content views, and demographics, and provide insights and key learnings to affiliated teams.
Social Media & Digital Marketing (10%)
Drives a holistic social media channel strategy that considers brand & product representation.
Build and manage all aspects of multiple social media accounts, including community development and content creation.
Create sharp, enticing content (including, but not limited to Facebook posts, Tweets, Instagram Posts, Instagram stories, and short format videos) which engage the brand’s audience across social channels.
Manage and implement a paid digital and social paid media advertising plan, using data, driven decision making.
Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.
Other Duties Assigned (10%)
Assist in presenting at key customer meetings on key Kid Trax initiatives.
Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
Follows internal controls and company policies set by Pacific Cycle Inc. and Dorel Sports.
Contributes to the success of Pacific Cycle Inc. by leading or assisting with other projects and tasks as assigned.
Minimum Requirements
College education ideally with degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications.
Masters study or degree a benefit.
At least five years experience in marketing role with social media responsibilities.
Experience in selling directly online

Passionate about marketing
Outstanding communicator and writer
Exhibit Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) computer skills
Must have own transportation
Will work on site during regular business hours
Team player who enjoys working with others
Dependable

Generates original ideas, encourages new ways of thinking, explores options, and develops innovative solutions

Remains current in their area of expertise and serves as a resource in that area of the organization
Change Agility
Adaptable
Embraces needed change and modifies their behavior when appropriate to achieve organizational objectives

Results Orientation
Maintains an appropriate focus on outcomes and accomplishments
Motivated by achievement, and persist until the goal is reached

Influence

Galaxy Draperies is a custom window covering company servicing the greater Los Angeles area. We are a family owned and operated company founded in 1976. We are hyper focused on growth and exceeding our client’s expectations. To continue excelling in these two areas, we are looking to grow our events department and hire an Event Manager. The Event Manager will manage our events department and the brand ambassador team. They will be responsible for the success of the brand ambassador team and the lead generating events, along with recruiting, onboarding, and training all new and existing team members. They will be the point of contact with out event partners and responsible for growing the relationship with each of our 12 locations.

Essential Responsibilities include:
Work directly with the director of Marketing and the Sales manager to understand and support the overall business objectives of the department.
Recruiting, onboarding, training and terminating staff.

Submit payroll and commission to management
Coordinating set up and tear downs on a weekly basis
Ensuring events have all the necessary supplies
Ensuring that the display and supplies are in good condition
Coordinating all advertising at each event locations are up to date and accurate
Requesting additional events to ensure a consistent lead volume
Communicate with Sales manager and scheduling manager on a weekly basis to ensure all duties are being performed correctly
Communicate with our event partners as needed
Coordinate all marketing material as needed at each event location
Develop and maintain KPI’s to show the success of the division
The ability to think outside the box to enhance the department
Additional responsibilities may be asked by management
Additional skills & Experience we like
5+ years experience and success in a lead generating or direct marketing environment
Experience in recruiting
Ability to mulit-taks and work on several projects simultaneously
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Very detail oriented
Experience with a CRM and all Microsoft platforms
Experience managing a team of 5-20 people
Experience in recruiting
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience is a plus
Why do you want to work for us?
Galaxy has a set of core values that really drive our culture. If you are a dedicated, driven, team player, and a growth oriented person, you would fit great on our team
A great base salary plus commission environment to ensure the success of you and your team
An environment that really promotes creativity and problem solving ideas.
Stability in a career and industry – been serving Southern California for 44 years
We care about the success of our team and provide hands on leadership training and skill development
If this sounds like the perfect fit for you please submit your resume and a cover letter to indeed. To learn more about our company and culture please visit our careers site at galaxydraperiescareers.com
