OUR MISSION: To build and support mentoring relationships to ignite the biggest possible futures for youth.

As the nation's first and NYC's largest youth mentoring agency, Big Brothers Big Sisters of New York City is recognized for our high standards and effective delivery of life changing programs. With the vision that all youth achieve their full potential, we have provided safe and impactful mentoring experiences to NYC youth since 1904.

JOB SUMMARY:

Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYC is seeking an experienced fundraising professional to serve as a Manager of Special Events overseeing a portfolio of revenue generating events. This position is part of a team that manages 8 fundraising events at Big Brothers Big Sisters of New York City, which generate more than $5MM in annual revenue. Reporting to the Special Events Director, the Manager of Special Events will serve as the lead for event planning, revenue generation, management, production and sponsorship opportunities. The ideal candidate will be creative and entrepreneurial, with the ability to execute high quality special events that meet or exceed annual goals. S/he will have exemplary relationship building skills and be excited by the responsibility of playing a critical role in securing funding for Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYCs revenue goals.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develop the overall planning and management of major fundraising events to include: budget management, acquisition, cultivation and retention of event participants, solicit corporate sponsorships, logistics, pre-and post-event follow up, committee recruitment and management of event committee/s, maintain timeline on all design/creative for event materials, etc.
Develop relationships and work closely with trustees, event chairs, committees, and honorees
Vendor management: oversee coordination of vendor production schedules (includes: venue contracts, collateral, save-the-dates, invitation design, media loops, printing and mailing, caterers, entertainment, photographers, videographers and consultants)
Track and manage ticket sales / sponsorships, draft correspondence and solicitation mailings, capture new donor information and execute sponsorship benefit elements
Develop and coordinate post-event analytics/evaluation to include return on investment analysis, to ensure continued success of events and sustainability
Provide proactive problem-solving while managing event logistics including auctions, signage, food/beverage, registration, volunteers, staffing, and talent. Also manage speakers remarks, transportation and hotel needs as necessary
Work with CMO to identify and implement ideas on effective marketing strategies and campaigns that appeal to the business community and beyond for events
Track event expenses and manage budget, produce event timelines and contact sheets
Responsible for researching and presenting potential new donor prospects and/or key industry stakeholders
Responsible for executing various administrative duties including preparations for meetings and events
Other development projects/events as assigned
JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
Belief in the power of mentoring
Bachelors Degree required
Minimum 4 years of event management experience with a proven track record of executing high profile fundraising events
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and superior attention to detail
Proven track record of ability to multi-task, stay organized when facing multiple priorities with competing time and resources needs
Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Raisers Edge, Convio/Luminate, Illustrator, Photoshop & graphic design experience a plus
Ability to work with key stakeholders including Trustees, Event Committee members and staff to meet budget goals with a strong focus on ROI. Extended hours and weekend work required as necessary
To Apply: Please apply with a cover letter and resume to Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYCs career center. Application without a cover letter will not be reviewed.

No search firms please.

Big Brothers Big Sisters of New York City is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Company Name: Big Brothers Big Sisters of NYC

Job Description:
OU Office of Admissions & Recruitment (OAR) works to bring in the next generation of Sooners. Our team operates from Norman as well as across the state, nation and world. We provide support to incoming domestic and international freshman and transfer students as they navigate the college application and decision process. Additionally, we partner with parents, counselors, and communities in providing resources to students interested in higher education. Our goal is to build a vibrant, inclusive community on campus by recruiting students with diverse backgrounds, educational experiences, and involvement.

We're currently looking for a new team member in our Norman office to serve as an Event Coordinator.

We need someone who can:

Integrity: Accountability for doing the right thing by exercising good judgment and honesty. Ability to create a safe environment for students and families and team members, including having emotional intelligence and self-awareness. Transparency and thoughtfulness in communication.

Care: Prioritization of creating the best experience possible for each person we encounter and at every step of the student experience. Providing service to others by being friendly, approachable and inclusive. Commitment to collaboration and to being a team player with a positive attitude. Inclusivity, which is the ability to work with a diverse group of people and having the ability to relate and be relatable to all those we serve.

Intentionality: Strong work ethic and contribution to the excellence of the Division of Enrollment Management, OAR and OU; self-motivation. Consistency in meeting deadlines and responding in a timely manner.

Innovation: Possession of a natural curiosity to learn and a continual pursuit of personal and professional growth in the field of college enrollment management. A focus on innovation, displaying an understanding of positive change and possessing a strong analytic ability. Efficiency by researching best practices, making creativity a priority.

Responsibilities for this position are to:

Assist the Events Team and Diversity Enrichment Programs with planning regional recruitment events.
Assist the Assistant Director with planning large scale recruitment/non-recruitment events.
Train Admissions & Recruitment staff on events and how to oversee/serve on event committees.
Create strategy, to ensure we are meeting the needs of the diverse population of prospective students OAR actively recruits.
Works with prospective students and their families throughout the admission, scholarship, housing, financial aid, and enrollment processes.
Also develops relationships with resident and non-resident high school counselors to inform them of opportunities at OU for their students.
Assists in the recruitment initiatives within a territory in Oklahoma.
Required Education: Bachelor Degree or equivalent combination of education/job related experience, AND:
0-24 months of student services experience, and event coordinating
Skills:
Ability to speak, read and write clear, concise English
Able to communicate well and build rapport quickly with students, faculty and staff
Highly organized and has a keen sense of details when it comes to projects and deadlines
Empathetic and strong initiative in leading others
Strong initiative to solve problems quickly
Keen sense of customer service and serving others
Creative ideation and ability to train others
Certifications:
Valid driver's license to travel to events
Advertised Physical Requirements:
Must be able to sit for extended periods of time doing work on a computer and via the telephone. Must be able to pull, push, lift, engage in repetitive motions, communication, including expressing oneself or exchanging information with others; see, including color, depth perception and clarity; and hear, including receiving detailed information orally.
Departmental Preferences:
Experience in higher education
Knowledge of OU
1 years' experience in event coordinating
Supervision: No Supervisory Duties

Special Instructions:
If you are selected as a final candidate for this position, you will be subject to The University of Oklahoma Norman Campus Tuberculosis Testing policy. To view the policy, visit https://hr.ou.edu/Policies-Handbooks/TB-Testing

Job Description
This is a full-time, in-house position. We are seeking an experienced Event Coordinator to manage our internal and external events both small and large. Our events include but are not limited to: corporate meetings, training programs, sales and marketing events and more. The Event Coordinator will have the responsibility of overseeing all aspects of event planning from venue selection to post-event evaluation. The successful candidate will be extremely organized, competent in vendor relations, possess strong interpersonal communication skills, attention to detail and be able to manage the logistics of multiple events simultaneously. Enthusiasm and passion to organize events that ensure the execution of business objectives is a must. The Event Coordinator will work closely with the Training Director and other internal business partners to deliver upon the strategic goals of the organization.

Specific Duties:
Work with Training Director and other internal business partners to develop and execute an annual business plan that includes a corporate events strategy that elevates the Crafco brand.
Strategize and prioritize events to support goals of the organization, including the development and maintenance of an annual events calendar.
Create and present comprehensive event ideas and plans to internal business partners that clarify how event objectives will be met and methods of measurement and evaluation.
Work closely with Training Director to assist with coordination of internal and external training programs and meetings including but not limited to Crafco University, Super Shot Service Schools, Equipment Schools, Crack Sealing Workshops, Pavement Preservation Schools, Technology Days, and product knowledge and soft skills workshops. Depending on format this can include site selection, audio/visual, F&B, coordinating supplies, materials and equipment, managing invitations and attendees and any other logistical needs pertaining to the event.
Work closely with Training Director and Senior Leadership Team to organize preparations for all corporate meetings including but not limited to Global Sales Meeting, Distributor Meeting, Customer Meeting, Owner Meeting and other similar events. Depending on format this can include site selection, negotiating room blocks, meeting space, choosing menus, entertainment, activities, décor, and all other related details.
Lead and manage Crafco’s nationwide annual charity fundraising campaign
Negotiate vendor contracts and adhere to all final agreements.
Develop and execute all pre-event and post-event communication plans. Communicate all details to necessary stakeholders and participants in timely and organized manner.
Attend local events as needed and ensure successful execution of all coordination and planning efforts. At times this may include being on-site contact to ensure each event is successful as it unfolds.
Liaise with event host at off site / remote events and maintain a close working relationship to ensure program needs are met.
Conduct post event evaluations for program effectiveness, report feedback and implement for continuous improvement.
Develop and maintain productive working relationships with internal business partners, customers, distributors, and vendors.
Attentive to the value of staying under budget while ensuring program specifications are effectively met or exceeded.
Study external environment and report regularly on best in class event examples both within and outside of the industry.
Organization of event inventory and supply items, ordering and maintaining supply levels as needed.
Support events at Crafco Supply Centers as needed.
Develop and maintain annual events calendar.
Manage online registration tool within Regfox.
Manage department contracts.
Administrative duties including printing, shipping, filing, reporting and more.
Frequent local travel (commuting by car) will be required for venue scouting and planning.
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality Management, Public Relations, Business or related discipline required
3+ years coordinating and planning corporate events with proven results
3+ years contract negotiation and budget compliance experience
Computer Proficiency:
Strong computer competency in MS Office applications such as Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Skill Requirements:
Proficient in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional time management and project management skills.
Highly organized thinker with deep attention to detail that can coordinate and manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills and listening skills
Display and encourage a positive attitude
Solutions Oriented team player – problem solving with a smile
Resourceful to find solutions to projects and problems
Strong negotiation skills
Reliable transportation for frequent local commuting required
Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Company Description
Crafco delivers confidence through innovation, quality, and value since 1976. Crafco is the world’s leading manufacturer in quantity and diversity of packaged pavement preservation products for asphalt and concrete such as hot-pour crack and joint sealants, hot-pour mastics, and cold-mix for pavement surface patching and repair. Crafco is the only company to manufacture these types of products and the equipment to apply them. The Crafco pavement preservation products have proven through long- and short-term independent studies, to extend the service life of pavement, and can help extend the life of other types of pavement surface treatments. Crafco also manufactures silicone, geocomposites and other pavement preservation materials and equipment. Crafco is proud to manufacture products in the USA with manufacturing locations nationwide and abroad.

Off the Grid’s Onsite Catering Event Producer (OCEP) is a contract position, which drives the on-site execution and event logistics of our mobile food catering events. This position partners closely with a team of Catering Event Producers, ensuring a smooth transition for clients moving from the planning, production, and post-production phase, and reports into the Catering Production Manager.
The ideal candidate is logistically minded and detailed oriented. With a charismatic approach, you emphasize and lead with hospitality in your communication, enabling you to build trusting client relationships and provide exceptional service. You handle pressure with efficiency and grace, are able to change gears quickly and resolve unexpected issues/circumstances, and view challenges as an opportunity to improve and exceed client expectations.
OCEP’s hours are dependent on the season but can range from 10-30 hours/week. A flexible schedule (including nights and weekends) is required to support the on-site execution of our Bay Area catering events.

This position will be responsible for, but not limited to the following:
Pre-Production
Participate in Pre-Production Handoff Meetings with Catering Event Producer to discuss event details including, but not limited to client and venue contacts, permitting and inspections, event layout and timelines, rentals, service staff, and potential oversages.
Onsite Execution
Attend and supervise events including, but not limited to:
Vendor management and parking
Rental management
Setup and breakdown
Onsite service staff
Interior buffets and passed service
Communication with client, venue managers, and inspectors
Post-Production
This position may be required to participate in post-event debriefs with Catering Event Producer, Catering Production Manager, and/or Catering Sales Manager.

Years of Related Professional Experience:
2+ years of full-time event planning and/or catering experience
Management Experience:
At least 1 year of experience supervising support or service staff is required
Educational/Position Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree is a plus
Travel (%):
20%
Other:
Must have a reliable source of transportation to and from home, office, and events.
Experience in Onsite Event Production and problem resolution
Availability Requirements:
This is an hourly, contracted position that requires a Monday through Friday schedule with nights and weekends as necessary to support catering events.
Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the job duties, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear; sit; stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls, reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required include visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned, close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: viewing a computer terminal. In addition, the employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Off the Grid is committed to creating an inclusive environment that welcomes and values differences among our associates, customers, vendors, and the communities in which we live and conduct business. Our continued success and growth is enhanced through initiatives that promote diversity throughout the company and our communities. Off the Grid is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
We hope you will consider joining our team!

Job Title:
Event Manager

Location:
Hawaii Convention Center

Employment Type:
Full-time

Regular/Temporary:
Regular

Job Description:
The Hawaii Convention Center

Just steps from Waikiki, the Hawaii Convention Center is an event destination like none other -- a stunning marriage of form and function, open to sky and sun between the shade of terraces and lanais, graced with courtyards, waterfalls and fishponds to create a meetings and convention backdrop that is at once tranquil and invigorating.

Designed by world-renowned architects Wimberly Allison Tong & Goo and LMN, this luminous structure shines like a gem tucked into its tropical setting, blending state-of-the-art technology with authentic island ambiance as a monument to the cultural diversity and legendary spirit of aloha that inspires attendees to see the world in a new light.

Position Summary:

Manages various types of events booked at the Hawai'i Convention Center.

Essential Functions:

EVENT MANAGEMENT:
Manages various types of events.
Manages all logistics for events booked at HCC. Determines event strategies and plans how to accomplish event success.
Primary contact and principle liaison during an event.
Determines needs and resolve problems by making strategic, business oriented and client-serving decisions required to ensure a successful event.
Builds and maintains successful business relationships with clients in effort to provide exceptional customer service and increase probability of future bookings/return.
Provide paperwork for the planning of a successful event (resumes, work orders, floor plans, event report and final invoicing).
SAFETY:
Monitors events to ensure all building rules, policies and safety procedures are being adhered to and enforced during events.
SITE TOURS:
Conducts site tours of facility to prospective and/or booked clients.
Shows the variety of usage, operations and functions the facility can provide.
Required Qualifications:
A minimum education level of: BA/BS Degree (4-year) Area of Study: Business, Event Planning, Tourism or related field.
A minimum of 3-5 years of related work experience.
Fluent in Japanese language strongly preferred (read, write and speak professionally)
Experience effectively managing and/or planning events.
Excellent customer service skills working with diverse backgrounds
Excellent knowledge of computer operations (Microsoft Office 365)
Effective oral communication and listening skills; able to speak clearly to give instructions and explanations and listen/understand when communicating with staff, vendors, and clients
Effective written communication skills; able to write and compose correspondence, contracts, memos and reports
Experience establishing and maintaining cooperative and productive work relationships
Excellent organizational and time management skills; strong attention to detail
Experience managing multiple priorities and working independently; able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment while meeting deadlines and remaining productive and professional.
Demonstrated independent thinking and problem-solving skills; able to work with confidential information
Must possess and exude a positive, team-oriented attitude
Self-starter with a willingness and enthusiasm for taking on additional responsibility
Due to the cyclical nature of the entertainment industry, employees may be required to work varying schedules to reflect the business needs of the company.
Ability to walk or otherwise move about frequently for several hours
Must have the ability to work harmoniously in a team setting exhibiting the "Aloha Spirit" to fellow workers, guests, clients and the community so as to provide exceptional customer service while demonstrating behaviors that reflect ASM Global and the Hawai'i Convention Center's vision, mission statement and values.

Job Description
***Looking for candidates with experinece in event planning logistics, data entry and Word/Excel, candidates without this experience will not be considered***

Company Description
Since our inception in 1967, Augmentation, Inc. has garnered a large and diversified base of clientele whose need for qualified personnel encompasses a wide field of temporary and permanent technical expertise. This being the case, assignment at an Augmentation, Inc. client places you at some of the top corporations in the nation, from industry leaders to potentially lucrative start-ups in Telecommunications, Information Technology, Manufacturing and Engineering.

Who We Are

SPEVCO designs, builds, and operates Special Event Vehicles for product marketing tours, incident command & control, disaster relief, mobile medical needs, military training, and more.

Our clients are cool. Our culture is awesome. Our products are rocking. Our people are pure gold.

Who We Want

SPEVCO is seeking a seasoned Experiential Marketing and Event Strategy professional that can translate their expertise into a strategic growth plan for our road tour/event business unit. A successful candidate will have prior success in the experiential marketing world. We want a person with the expertise, passion, and leadership to drive our vision for this business unit.

What You’ll Really Be Doing

Use your experience and expertise to create and execute a strategic plan, growing our event services business through the lens of Specialty Vehicles. Collaborate with every department and every level of leadership at SPEVCO. Collaborate with our clients to better understand their event/experiential needs. Collaborate directly with our operations, sales, and design team to ensure our proposals are aligned with our client's dreams.

What You Get Paid

We'll offer a competitive salary with commission, and our offer will be determined by your level of experience and expertise.

In addition, SPEVCO offers a great host of a la carte benefits from Health, Teladoc, Rx, Dental, and Vision, to voluntary Disability and Life insurances, Traditional and Roth 401k with company match, PTO plan, and 9 paid company holidays.

What Success Looks Like
Leadership, Fortitude, Integrity, and Positive Energy
Experiential marketing and/or event strategy development successes
Lead and support certain client proposals through insight, experience, and creativity
Clearly reason to our clients, and prospective clients, why Spevco's approach to experiential marketing is an important part of the marketing mix
Collaborate with our President, Sales Director, Operations Director, and Sales and Design Team
Create and contribute to meaningful and thoughtful proposals
Grow our event and experiential services and resulting revenue/profitability
Ensure that our equipment and event service offerings are both aligned with our client's experiential marketing goals
Recognize and act on new business opportunities
Build a world-class team, and be a world-class teammate, offering world-class special vehicles and experiential services
Physical & Mental Requirements

Must have the physical and mental strength and endurance to be able to perform duties, as well as the ability to handle stressors of the position in operational and administrative situations. Expected to stand, sit, walk, climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, bend, talk, hear, smell, see, and operate objects, tools, and controls.

How To Apply

If you would like to be part of our team and learn more about Spevco, please fill out this brief application and attach a current resume.

By submitting this application, I certify that all answers and information provided are true and complete. I also authorize Spevco to investigate all statements and information contained in this application for the purposes of arriving at employment decisions.

Spevco is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

You can also find this job posting at https://spevco.bamboohr.com/jobs/

Company Description
Since our inception in 1967, Augmentation, Inc. has garnered a large and diversified base of clientele whose need for qualified personnel encompasses a wide field of temporary and permanent technical expertise. Senior Field Marketing Manager

Field Marketing | US Austin, TX Remote

About the company:

In today's highly connected digital world, understanding, managing and securing the identity of individuals and things is essential to safety and success of both businesses and their customers. Billions of people connect from anywhere, use a wide variety of devices and expect a seamless yet secure experience.

The ForgeRock mission is to provide the most simple and comprehensive Identity and Access Management Platform to help our customers deepen their relationships with their consumers and improve the productivity and connectivity of their employees and partners. Our identity solution enables great digital experiences and is embedded with a rich set of security, privacy and consent features. We deliver our platform through both cloud services and on-premises software.

Our customers are some of the biggest companies, organizations, and even countries in the world. On any given day, it's likely that the ForgeRock Identity Platform helped keep your data safe, gave you access to stuff, and supported trusted relationships between you, companies and the devices you were using. ForgeRock is headquartered in San Francisco, but we are a global company with offices in the following cities: Vancouver, WA; Austin, TX; Munich, Germany; London & Bristol, UK; Grenoble & Paris, FR; Oslo, NO; Singapore and Sydney, Australia. Please read more about us at forgerock.com or follow ForgeRock on Twitter at http://www.twitter.com/forgerock.

The Role:

The America's South Field Marketing Manager will drive integrated marketing strategy and implementation across the South region. As the marketing lead and primary liaison to the sales team, this territory-based position is a crucial role requiring experience in campaign planning and execution managing the core lead generation development activities. The America's Field Marketing Manager is also responsible for: planning, execution and tracking of an integrated regional marketing plan focused on increasing revenue and market share; identifying, developing & exploiting best practices between sales & marketing. This role requires expertise in traditional marketing with a strong focus on physical events and account-based marketing, but also familiarity with social marketing tools and how they can help sales teams develop stronger relationships with customers and prospects.

Responsibilities:
Drive marketing strategy and implementation to deliver pipeline coverage for sales organization, in collaboration with Other marketing teams such as product marketing and online demand gen.
Collaborate with divisional sales stakeholders to build an integrated marketing and communications plan to support the sales goals/priorities, and leverage corporate marketing strategy/ initiatives.
Develop and implement a marketing plan to support revenue goals, including regional integration, alliances and directly-managed tactics, campaigns, events and activities to executive, management and technical audiences.
Create and manage a regional marketing dashboard that tracks effectiveness & impact of marketing spend on pipeline, using defined tools and resources. Monitor progress and measure results of all key marketing campaigns through regular pipeline inspection & deal tracking.
Develop consistent and regular reviews and ongoing communication with sales stakeholders.
Manage marketing calendar to ensure alignment with corporate and partner programs as appropriate.
Support the brand, leverage local and social media to drive awareness, demand gen and audience acquisition.


Required Skills & Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree.
Minimum 6-10 years of directly relevant, hands-on marketing experience with a demonstrated ability to drive and execute successful integrated marketing programs.
Minimum of 4+ years experience in leading field marketing campaigns for a high-tech company
Familiar with Security or related IT Markets, Products, Software and Services.
Understanding of Identity & Access Management target markets, competitive industry, strategy and product lines a plus.
Proven ability to work with sales teams and multiple levels of management, while being highly responsive.
Marketo experience a plus
Able to clearly articulate and deliver on program goals, strategy and execution elements to multiple audiences.
Ability to manage, collaborate, leverage and thrive in a fast paced matrix environment.
Experience in all facets of marketing including account-based marketing, online, social media and events.
Ability to develop integrated marketing plan
High energy, enthusiasm, initiative, and flexible.


Life at ForgeRock:

We believe in and facilitate a flexible, collaborative work environment. We've grown enormously, but remain true to the innovative, can-do startup values that got us here. Most important of all, we keep hiring talented, smart, fun, and genuinely nice people because that's who we want to succeed with every day. Below are just a few of the great things we have to offer at ForgeRock:
A great team of smart, fun and genuinely nice individuals.
Awesome company culture focused around providing a flexible and collaborative work environment
Regular office bonding events, from lunches and happy hours to group offsites and hack-days
Well-stocked fridges, whether you're hungry or thirsty
Competitive benefits and perks
We're Mac-friendly!
Generous employee referral bonus program
Amazing offices across the globe San Francisco HQ; Vancouver, WA; Austin, TX; Munich, Germany; London & Bristol, UK; Grenoble & Paris, FR; Oslo, NO; Singapore, Australia & counting!
ForgeRock is the collective sum of all our individual experiences, backgrounds and influences and we pride ourselves in growing and learning together. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone's individuality is respected and everyone has an Identity. In recruiting for new colleagues, we welcome the unique contributions you can bring and encourage you to be your best self.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Company Description
Morgan Manufacturing is a 32,000+Sq Ft event venue loaded with industrial elegance. The facility hosts nearly 200 events a year in a mix of corporate and social business.

WHO WE ARE:
Tealium is the trusted leader in the customer data industry. We believe unified customer data is an organization’s most valuable asset and greatest competitive advantage. We help brands seamlessly unify their siloed customer data and applications in real time, and drive more profitable interactions across all touchpoints. Tealium’s Customer Data Hub (CDH) enables you to connect your data so you can connect with your customers.

Founded in 2008, Tealium’s patented and award-winning solutions are used by over 1,000 of the world's most innovative brands, including Sony, Providence St. Joseph Health, Cambria Health, T-Mobile, Hulu, Uber, Facebook, Expedia, Hyatt, Barcelo Hotel Group, Sportsbet, Utah Jazz, American Airlines, The Gap, Orange, and many others.

Job Description Summary:
Detail-oriented logistics guru to support Marketing Events Team in developing and executing Tealium field marketing events and ABM campaign strategy, driving new pipeline creation, increasing brand awareness locally and regionally, and achieving overall marketing team goals.

Location:
Either in San Diego (Tealium HQ) or living in Western half of the US in a city with a major airport (remote)
About You
7+ years of event planning and regional field marketing experience required
Salesforce proficiency required
SaaS experience strongly preferred
Experience running successful ABM and direct mailer campaigns
Ability to travel up to 40% of the time
Experience managing numerous ROI-positive field events simultaneously
Proven problem-solver with ability to independently identify resolution and define recommendations to fulfill and exceed event and campaign objectives
Detail-oriented logistics master
Strong communications skills
Roles and Responsibilities
Develop and drive North America (West) field marketing strategy based on regional objectives and target accounts to drive new pipeline
Execute account-based marketing campaigns in an effort to penetrate and expand in our ideal customer profile, to include: collaborating with regional teams to identify target accounts, brainstorming creative sends / direct mailers, ensuring data accuracy, and building detailed plan for follow up
Develop event value proposition and messaging to target regional accounts and drive new prospect accounts
Define clear success metrics, and report post-event. To include: SFDC reporting, evaluation of event and campaign ROI, as well as a presentation of key learnings for recommendations on improvement
Identify and source thought leaders and speakers
Confirm executive and local team member staffing to support event objectives and key accounts registered
Define, build and execute event communication campaigns, internally and externally. To include: calls, emails, landing pages, presentations, collateral, social, etc.
Build strong relationships with sales to gain market insights and ensure alignment of marketing investments to top sales priorities.
Manage pre-event and on-site logistics, including securing venue, negotiating contracts, processing payments, branding, setup / breakdown, A/V, food and beverage, giveaways and attendees
Maintain and oversee event- or campaign-specific, and high-level field marketing and regional support budget
Collaborate cross-functionally with Executive Leadership, Regional Leadership, Sales, Business Development, Demand Gen, Product Management, Partner Marketing, Legal and Accounting teams
WHY YOU WANT TO WORK HERE:
The highly relevant and differentiated positioning of Tealium and our Customer Data Hub (CDH) makes this a unique and rewarding career opportunity. Organizations from start-ups to large global enterprises are utilizing Tealium to unify their customer data in real time and drive improvements in their overall data strategy. Over 1,000 global brands trust Tealium, and in an increasingly noisy market we are proud to maintain best-in-class renewal rates of >90%. When our customers are happy, we’re happy.

Our corporate HQ is located in sunny San Diego, just minutes from the beach and surrounded by beautiful hiking trails and the renowned Torrey Pines golf course. Our location is just one of the many perks we enjoy; At Tealium we dress casually (but professional), enjoy a flexible paid time off policy, rich benefit plans, company holidays, 401(K) match, and employee Stock Options - just to name a few. Not to mention we get to surround ourselves with some of the brightest minds in San Diego. If you are interested in being a part of Team Teal, we’d love to hear from you!

TEAL celebrates diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. It is our continuing policy to recruit and employ the best qualified individuals without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, and/or any other protected characteristic. TEAL does not tolerate unlawful discrimination of any kind and strives to be an inclusive and respectful workplace.

About Leap:

Leap develops and operates stores for premium emerging brands. On the Leap platform, brands can connect with customers by rapidly deploying efficient and modern experiential retail stores that work in concert with ecomm. Brand stores *powered by Leap* deliver impactful customer experiences and incremental growth enabling premium brands to capture more share, and powerful insights that accelerate product innovation and overall growth.

Mission for the position:

The Growth Marketing Manager will work in partnership with the VP of Brand Management, Store Managers and our Founders in creating marketing plans to lift performance/productivity of brands on the Leap platform and tackling key initiatives to help establish the Leap brand as the authority & leader in Retail-as-a-Service. To do so, the Growth Marketing Manager will build and manage local, national and regional marketing campaigns to help drive traffic (to stores & online) for our brand partners as well as assist in the development and management of programming pertaining to Leap B2B brand building, including local & national PR, events, digital and other strategies.

Key responsibilities:
Build, deploy and manage integrated/multi-channel marketing programs to drive traffic and conversion/sales for brand stores on the Leap platform and within/for our brand partners' owned online channels (i.e. ecomm storefronts), including collaborating directly with brand owners to execute in OOH, Email, CRM / customer outreach, Digital, Social, Print, Radio, etc.
Partner with Store Managers to oversee execution of field marketing programming pre- and post- openings, including but not limited to cross-channel local advertising campaign planning execution, event activations and other community development initiatives, store-level CRM programs, and building connections with local community partners such as non-competitive retail brands and other local merchants
Support the development of brand-centric components of overall retail execution for / on behalf of Leap brands across categories e.g. integrated and experiential marketing program development, sales/training knowledge system inputs (LMS data), etc.
Perform store and footprint level mix analysis and other analytics to deliver actionable insights for improving store performance/productivity based on brand, product and customer data.
Support cross-functional workflows between internal and outside/contracted Store Design team members, Store Development Project Managers, and Retail Operations team members to implement visual merchandising and other store design optimizations for store on the Leap Platform.
Partner with Retail Operations leaders/managers and Store Managers to help compile, synthesize and analyze marketing program performance and store performance reports for internal and external stakeholders and brand partners
Lead content creation & day-to-day management of social presence for the Leap brand (e.g. Linkedin, Instagram, FB, Twitter) and website to better establish Leap as a thought leader in the space of retail, technology & innovation.
Help build and manage Leap's CRM system and workflows, including programming to inform various stakeholders on Leap news
Assist with planning and development of B2C and B2B marketing & event activations & PR including editorial outreach, brand summits, panels, new store openings and more
Assist in the refinement of the brand positioning, voice and overall strategy for the Leap brand.
Key competencies & attributes for success:
4+ years experience in marketing, PR, brand management and/or management consulting
Experience working within a high growth emerging brand and/or platform/technology startups is a plus
Experience in digital first marketing & brand building
Proficient in designing & creating digital content & printed collateral
Success in driving brand partnerships and local marketing activations
Well versed in direct (non agency) social media management
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Creative problem solving skills
Working knowledge of the retail, DTC, luxury and fashion brands landscape
Strong cross-functional teamwork and project management skills
Self starter, humble, quick learner, with high aptitude for self-improvement
Exceptional attention to detail; ability to operate in the weeds while keeping sight of "the big picture"
Comfortable working in a dynamic and evolving environment
Self-starting, thoughtful and highly accountable taskmaster and creative problem solver
Outcomes & measures of success:
Successful marketing program deployment and ongoing management including ownership of reporting and analysis, and program optimization, as measured against program performance targets for contribution to store traffic, sales and customer experience ratings and feedback
Successful implementation of Leap Brand owned asset strategy as measured by audience growth and engagement
Consistent, timely execution/delivery of programming (execution) and reporting against agreed upon roadmap and OKRs
Consistent, successful collaboration with direct report manager, Store Managers and other Retail Operations team members, brand partner stakeholders (Leap brand customers) and other administrative/corporate functional leaders (e.g. Finance, HR, et al)
Tangible contributions to the development of a team-oriented high performance culture within the firm

Natera is looking for a Corporate Event Manager to join our corporate marketing team. We are looking for an experienced professional who is well versed in all aspects of event strategy, planning and execution. OUR OPPORTUNITY

Driven by the passion for elevating the science and utility of genetic testing, Natera is committed to helping families identify and manage genetic diseases. Natera is a rapidly-growing diagnostics company with proprietary bioinformatics and molecular technology for analyzing DNA. Our complex technology has been proven clinically and commercially in the prenatal testing space and we are actively researching its applications in the liquid biopsy space for developing products with oncology applications.

The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. When you join Natera, youll work hard and grow quickly. Working alongside the elite of the industry, youll be stretched and challenged, and take pride in being part of a company that is changing the landscape of genetic disease management.

Job Description:
Are you looking to help a non-profit grow in the community while also increasing resources for the people served? Life Treatment Centers may be the place for you. Life Treatment Centers is a non-profit, community-based organization that has served the needs of St. Joseph County/North Central Indiana since 1972. We provide a wide variety of services assisting people with alcohol, drugs, and gambling addictions. We have a comprehensive list of treatment services through programs including Residential Living, Continuing Care, Outpatient Therapy, Substance Use Prevention/Education, and Special Populations. In addition, we have a Veteran specific program that, working with the VA, helps Veterans gain access to stable housing, medical, and other needed resources.
We are currently looking for an experienced energetic and a self-starter to join our team. Job Description:
Job Title: Senior Digital Interactive Producer (Freelance)
Department: Experiential
Reports to: VP, Experiential Production & Operations
Overview: Giant Spoon is looking for a Senior Digital Interactive Producer to lead and manage virtual and digitally focused Experiential Event activations. We are looking for individuals with multi-disciplinary production experience with a focus on digital activations and the technical aspects of event production. This person brings a wealth of knowledge, experience, and excitement around emerging technologies and trends, as well as established vendor relationships to help execute never-been-done-before ideas. Ideal candidates should have a knack for seeing the big picture, yet the ability to execute down to the smallest of details. Traits and expertise such as strong leadership, project management, communication skills, and attention to detail are critical to the success of this position.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Lead and execute virtual, live, and integrated experiential activations across the country.
Build and manage budgets of all sizes ($50K - $2MM), ensuring projects come in on budget and on spec. Vet ideas throughout the process to ensure they are feasible and within budget. Creative problem solving ways to solve and engineer ideas.
Source and manage partners to aid in execution ranging from software developers, virtual event platforms, AR and VR developers, custom fabrication shops, audio/visual vendors, venues, staffing agencies, etc.
Collaborate closely in a team environment throughout the process. Work with the account team to manage client expectations, helping to educate and present production and technical elements as needed.
Lead with clear and consistent communication internally as well as with vendors and clients
Play a role in the conceptual, creative and strategic development of projects
Manage all permitting and production logistics

The ideal candidate:

Has a wealth of knowledge in the digital events and experiential event production space. While the focus of this role is on digital activations, a strong understanding of live event production is also critical. Must have experience leading productions such as digital experiential campaigns, live streams and webinars, interactive, AR/VR, mixed reality, artificial intelligence/robotics, digital content development across a variety of platforms, and website dev (site development, responsive web, etc). **Specialists in certain areas are welcome to apply. We do not expect each individual to have vast experience across all categories.
Is decisive, assertive, strategic and politically aware in their decision making
Has excellent project management, organizational, delegation and prioritization skills
Is efficient and always striving to streamline the process and best utilize every member of the team
Has a wealth of knowledge in budgeting and in finding custom solutions to creative, complex experiential and digital event experiences
Is adept at ensuring a project stays on strategy and hits the client’s KPIs
Has significant experience working with technology vendors, software developers, fabricators, specialists, and artists throughout the country
Is adept at pro-actively anticipating problems and creating solutions
Has the ability to interface with all levels of management, clients, and colleagues with ease and confidence
Is highly organized, solution-oriented and always one step ahead
Is passionate, positive, and solution-oriented

Requirements:

8 or more years of combined experience in digital experience production and/or technical production of live events. Agency experience preferred. Experiential marketing event production preferred.
Willingness to work extended hours and travel for events (eventually!)
Positive, can-do attitude!

Company Description
Who is Opus?

We are a collective of innovative minds who are always looking to be on top of market changes. Our Vision:

Job Title: Academic Events Coordinator and Academic Affairs Assistant
Job Description:
Job Description:

The University Academic Events Coordinator and Academic Affairs Administrative Assistant is responsible for oversight, planning, and implementation of University and College Academic Events in keeping with quality institutional images/standards.

The Coordinator provides leadership and professional expertise on matters relating to events, including budget oversight, research/site inspection, purchasing and/or recommendation of event venues, goods and services, negotiating food and beverage (f/b) contracts with external vendors, etc. The Coordinator reports to the Vice President for Academic Affairs (VPAA) and works with the Colleges, Academic Affairs, Admissions, other internal offices within the University as well as external vendors to ensure high quality, fiscally responsible events that support and promote the University’s strategic objectives and reputation as a leader in higher education.

This position will require a unique combination of analytic ability, systems thinking, and interpersonal skills. The ideal candidate will be both detail- and process-oriented, and will possess the skills necessary to manage and analyze a range of quantitative and qualitative information. This position is a member of the Academic Affairs team. Discretion and confidentiality for all university business and related matters are considered requirements for the individual to serve in this role.

Primary position responsibilities and expectations (but are not limited to) (60% - 70% time):
Oversee all aspects of specified institutional events, manage multiple deadlines, and strategic and logistical arrangements to produce tangible deliverables of quality, creative, events on time and under budget
Recruit and train student workers, staff volunteers, event contractors, and related personnel as needed
Develop, oversee, and monitor food/beverage (f/b) budget (in addition to all event costs) as well as budgets for events for identified departments.
Act as an advisor-consultant to departments and units throughout the University on matters related to f/b budgeting and cost effectiveness, venue research, site selection, and purchase of event goods and services.
Create, implement, and evaluates policies and procedures for events and operation of the academic events office
Negotiate and secure f/b and event contracts and serves as main purchasing agent for events related goods and services in concert with the VPAA and University Finance. Oversight of purchase order and invoice entry process, ensuring timely turn-around of event vendor payments, contract deposits, etc. Ensure event-related paperwork is filed with the appropriate offices.
Build strong, productive relationships with appropriate constituencies, including highest level of the organization’s administration, faculty, staff, and suppliers to ensure customer satisfaction
Prepare and monitor cost estimates, budgets, work plans, timelines, schedules, status reports, etc.
Attend professional development association events when possible to keep the institution up-to-date with the current trends in the events management field
Develop project timelines, ensure engagement from key stakeholders, and provide guidance regarding duties.
Lead the process of building the registration site for residential conferences and Academic events.
During each residential conference, tasks include, yet are not limited to Meeting with faculty and staff to plan event details, collaborate and plan with the conference contractors, create the conference schedule of events and program for each conference, complete and submit a VIP list, establish and fill AV needs, construct the master schedule, engage in suite assignments, badges and payments. Additional aspects include managing and overseeing events on the days of, including problem-solving, welcoming guests, directing event set-up and closure, along with communicating with University, Event, and External staff.
Manage faculty/Staff appointment system for residential conferences.
Research, schedule and manage packing and shipment of conference supplies and equipment to and from events with an approved vendor.
Ensure the completion of program printing and binding.
Organize and manage faculty handouts and flyers.
Other duties as assigned.
Administrative support (5% - 15%) Academic Affairs
Provide daily administrative support
Take minutes at meetings for the Office of Academic Affairs.
Monitor and administer calendar
Update website and gateways
Support Concur administration with faculty and staff trainings and ghost card reconciliation
Maintain confidential information and documents
Other duties as assigned
Administrative Support (25%) to Director of Clinical Training
Maintain all files related to the PhD clinical practicum and pre-doc internships and MA Counseling practicum/internships
Receive mailed, faxed and emailed practicum/internship contracts and supporting documents
Check received paperwork for accuracy and signatures
Check packets for completion of supporting documents vis-à-vis Saybrook requirements and student licensure state requirements
Track and follow through on missing documents
Send supervisor and student evaluation forms when due
Monitor and triage Director of Clinical Training inbox as appropriate
Maintain confidential information and documents
Other duties as assigned
Essential Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Ease with technology and a desire for more training and responsibility. (Microsoft Office, web editing, social media, student information, Concur)
Strong food and beverage knowledge and previous banquet, catering, and related event experience
Exceptional customer service capabilities: above average verbal and written communication skills, creative, strategic, analytical thinking and problem solving skills
Effective negotiation skills with service providers, such as caterers, hotels, and transportation suppliers
Demonstrated ability as a good team leader in matters relating to staff, training, and motivating volunteers, and student workers
Knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel
Position Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent (5-7 years) experience in the event planning field and high school diploma or GED
Minimum of 3 years of clerical or administrative assistant work experience
Strong written and verbal interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to multi-task and work with multiple members of the team.
Ability to manage immediate requests and regular job duties with a sense of urgency.
Detail-orientation and strong critical thinking skills are a must.
Candidates must function with a high level of confidentiality, ethics, and discretion.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Must possess a positive and professional demeanor as a first point of contact and build collegial relationships with all visitors, staff and faculty.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment with attention to detail.
Willingness and flexibility to work outside regular business hours including some nights and weekends.
Must be able to travel
Must be able to lift up to 35 pounds.

About Saybrook University:

Saybrook University was founded over 40 years ago by some of the greatest minds of the 20th century and continues to inspire a new generation of innovators. A non-profit regionally accredited university known for its commitment to humanistic studies and rigorous research, Saybrook University’s academic model puts the student at the center of everything we do to provide a unique, transformational, learning experience. Saybrook offers advanced degrees in organizational systems, psychology, mind-body medicine, and human science, all in flexible learning formats to help students continue to be active contributors to the fields they work in while they advance their education. Saybrook University is proud to be a community of creative, compassionate innovators dedicated to pursing new ways of thinking and doing for our professions, organizations, and communities.

Are you seeking an impactful role in an innovative company that is growing in a rapidly expanding market category? Intermedia can offer just the challenge you are looking for. We are an 900+ employee strong Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) and business cloud company that serves over a million customers with communication and data applications. What’s more, our product roadmap offers even more game-changing innovations than what got us to our strong position today. We serve the SMB marketplace with full featured products that are backed by a 99.999% uptime service level agreement and J.D. Power certified technical support.

Intermedia is a channel-first company. 6,500 active partners across the US rely on us for greater reliability and productivity to grow their businesses. As we help our extensive partner network to reap success, Intermedia’s business grows, too. That’s the opportunity Intermedia presents today. We’re taking on the world’s biggest tech companies in a battle for the multi-billion-dollar business communication and productivity industry.

Are you ready to make your mark?

Position Summary

We’re looking for a Channel Marketing Manager to join our dynamic, high performing team with a focus on growing our business by co-marketing with the partners in our vast partner channel ecosystem. As a channel first company, our base of 6,500+ active channel partners accounts for a large proportion of Intermedia’s revenue, and our co-marketing efforts are critical to driving this business and equipping our partners to grow. You would use your strong strategic thinking ability, creative problem-solving skills, channel marketing knowledge and tactical execution ability to develop new tools, programs and campaigns for Intermedia to go to market with our channel partners. We want someone who is smart, motivated, and with the entrepreneurial spirit to roll up sleeves to get things done.

You’ll have the opportunity to craft compelling corporate strategies and then bring those narratives to life. And because we’re an integrated marketing team, you’ll work closely with colleagues across the marketing organization as well as the stakeholders we engage with daily. This is a critical role for the company, and you’ll quickly find yourself immersed in the most exciting projects. You’ll get exposure to key leaders and senior executives as well as the leadership of our partner companies. If you’re a creative self-starter with channel marketing chops looking to contribute, take responsibility, and be recognized, this is the role for you.

Responsibilities:
Create, execute and optimize a portfolio of integrated marketing programs and campaigns to drive Intermedia’s growing Channel Partner business
Develop scalable, integrated go-to-market (GTM) strategies for assigned channels with established marketing and sales objectives
Build custom co-marketing campaigns with high value, strategic partners, including large scale distribution partners
Identify areas for partner marketing process improvement and Partner Relationship Management (PRM) improvement
Play an essential role in product launches and market entry campaigns
Ensure that GTM programs have clear and measurable success metrics, partnering with Marketing Operations teams to ensure the measurement plan and infrastructure is in place, and championing a “test and learn” optimization approach
Track and analyze channel marketing program performance to understand ROI and partner engagement against goals
Analyze evolving market trends and partner data to bring innovative ideas to market, including partner insights through research and regular live partner interaction
Requirements:
3+ years Channel and/or Product Marketing experience, specifically in a B2B setting
You will have a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or similar, MBA is a plus
Knowledge of channel partners and their business models
Knowledge of cloud services, hosted services, or software as a service
Experience with PRM and marketing automation platforms
Ability to manage Market Development Funds (MDF)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with innate story telling ability
Detail oriented and extremely organized
Strong planner with a strategic mindset
Self-starter with a can-do attitude
Desired skills:
Channel partner co-marketing marketing experience
Experience with cloud IT, specifically in the Unified Communications space
Client-facing consulting experience
Digital marketing expertise

“ Roll up sleeves and do what it takes” attitude
Strong team player not afraid to present new, creative ideas

Due to increased client demand, we will be launching multiple new campaigns & clients this year! As a result, our Assistant Event Coordinator Trainee position is available immediately.

Here at MELA Group, our company holds four key values:
Humbleness: “Humility will open more doors than arrogance ever will” - Zig Zagler

That’s why our management and business training program is so focused. Our people learn the most cutting-edge techniques for being successful in this industry from experts who have achieved their own successes.

Job Description:

***Contractor will support a variety of different events (ex. table top events, 10x10 booth events) for different solutions within Oracle Cloud Infrastructure - around 100 events per year***
***Responsible for project management/maintaining calendars, opening purchase requests, managing contract process for new events, event execution, ordering and shipping of marketing materials, sending out internal logistics to staff, managing budget and reporting for shows, etc.***

The Events Specialist contractor will support the day-to-day development and execution of 3rd party sponsored events. This role requires interaction and communication with vendors, partners, senior leaders and employees across the organization.

Job Description:
Summary

ASM Global, the leader in privately managed public assembly facilities, has an excellent and immediate opening for an Event Coordinator for ASM Global/Greater Columbus Convention Center. Responsible for providing support to the Event Management Department and assisting with servicing and monitoring clients. Interacts with clients, facility staff, in-house concessionaires and related personnel.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

* Assists Event Managers with in house clients, acting as the "eyes and ears" when servicing the client on site during busy periods.
Maintains rapport with clients, their associates, service suppliers, and building staff insuring the highest level of customer service.
Required to work irregular schedule including nights, weekends, and holidays to accommodate business and client needs in the facility.
Required to work both indoors and outdoors, including inclement weather, in various temperatures.
Must have the ability to interact with guests in a friendly, courteous and polite manner. This will include initiating contact with guests within 10 feet -- i.e. smiling, saying "Good Day" or offering assistance when needed.
Must feel comfortable when around large groups or speaking to a guest, as needed.
Understands the importance of providing customer service and in understanding of " The Magic is in the Details"
Ability to work on multiple projects at a time while meeting specific deadlines.
Ability to make quick, decisive decisions in high pressure situations.
Must obtain and maintain employer sponsored Certified Tourism Ambassador (CTA) certification, if applicable.
Other duties may be assigned.
Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience
A good knowledge of the principles of administration as they relate to provision of facilities, services and equipment in a convention, exhibition, conference, or entertainment center. A general knowledge of the services, vendors, or other organizations involved in producing events. A minimum of two years college level course work in a hospitality or marketing related program preferred.
Skills and Abilities

Sound organizational, planning, and interpersonal skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Sound computer skills. Ability to prioritize multiple projects. Ability to demonstrate problem solving skills. Professional appearance and strong work ethic. Ability to interact with all types of people in a polite and courteous manner. Ability to work well as a team player.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to move around the facility; to stand for long hours during events; talk and hear. This position may require work inside or outside of the building, as needed by events.

Note

The essential responsibilities of this position are described under the headings above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Also, this document in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position.

Job Description

The Supervisor, Event Production will be part of the agencys senior production team, managing and overseeing production elements and resources within the agencys client accounts. This leader will partner with the client services Account Director(s) to steer strategic direction of the account through best-in-class production services, and will propel client growth by identifying profitability opportunities. S/he will also manage, mentor, coach, and advise other full-time employees within the group, guiding their professional development and always leading by example.

Key Responsibilities

· Manage all production-related elements within a client account

· Serve as expert in all-things production-related for the client, always available for internal team meetings, client calls, client meetings and pitches, and on-site execution

· Assure seamless collaboration between production team members and other departments to deliver the agencys best-in-class services and exceed client expectations

· Keep fingers squarely on the pulse of all projects and immediately address vendor, internal or other challenges that could hinder project success

· Work with producers within assigned projects to assess the short-term and full-time resources required

· Serve as a trusted resource for the business development and Account Management teams, reviewing and recommending budgetary elements during the RFP/pitch stage

· Coordinate production assistance (sourcing, brainstorming, etc.) with the business development/Account Management teams for RFP/pitch work

· Work closely with the client services Account Director(s) to identify opportunities for growth within the assigned client portfolio

· Foster teamwork, collaboration, mutual respect, communication and a positive, productive work environment within her/his team of production professionals; allocate time for formally assessing and evaluating performance of team members against annual, department and agency goals

· Manage production team members to maximize efficiencies; maintain a smooth workflow by monitoring project timelines, deliverables, challenges and achievements

· Set (team and individual) expectations and standards that drive exceptional results

· Maintain open communication with the Managing Director of Production regarding opportunities and challenges facing the department

Job Requirements

· Bachelors degree and five-plus years of event production management experience, preferably within a full-service experiential marketing agency

· Extensive on-site production experience (and knowledge) with such production line elements as digital registration, digital photo/video technology, signage/branding, mobile/trade show/other fabrication, union labor, transportation, talent management, trade show management, A/V, activations, staffing, etc.

· Strong existing vendor relationships with fabrication, technology, venues, vehicle lease, premium, staffing and tour/event management contractors, etc.

· Critical understanding of budgeting, budget tracking, P&L, agency processes, general creative guidelines, vendor negotiation, production/vendor timelines, build details/ materials, contractor agreements, labor/DOT laws, client KPIs, ROI and ROX, etc.

· Experience leading teams and especially the management of multiple, various personality types and career levels

· Strong experience developing growth plans, annual reviews, goal-setting, etc.

· Confident, professional presence; strong, innate leadership/team-building skills; natural facility for fostering a nurturing work culture rooted in open communication, inclusiveness and transparency

· Ability to travel frequently to support projects on-site

OVERVIEW:


The Guidepoint Insights Operations team turns questions into answers. The team strategizes topics that our clients need to know about and delivers events that answer questions before our clients think to ask them. The team hosts teleconferences, in-person meetings, and custom events, featuring Advisors in our network that best fit featured topics.

The Event Coordinator will be responsible for assisting the team in the organization and coordination of company sponsored teleconferences and New York based breakfast/lunch meetings.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Supports operations associates in hosting teleconferences across sectors
Contact clients to determine event interest, confirm predetermined advisors, send invitations to clients, oversee client RSVPs and compliance, manage all correspondence with advisors prior to meeting, assist in maximizing attendance at events, ensure event runs successfully, conduct post event cost analysis and review client charges
Assist in managing internal documents
Work closely with other team members to ensure successful execution of meetings via the scheduling of advisors for breakfast/lunch meetings agendas and teleconferences
Provide team with all relevant materials for the events including PowerPoint slides, event signage and brochures
Oversee New York based events logistics including food and beverage services, client RSVPs and compliance
WHAT YOU HAVE:


Previous project management experience
Exceptional organizational skills with meticulous attention to detail
Ability to prioritize and multi-task and to work under tight deadlines
Flexibility to work long and unpredictable hours
Proficiency in MS-Office, Outlook, and Google Suite
Proficient in the use of the internet for research
Availability to attend New York based meetings
Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively and persuasively, both verbally and textually
Demonstrated ability to work both in a team atmosphere and autonomously
A desire to work in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment
WHAT WE HAVE:


Competitive compensation
Free snacks and beverages
Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents
401(k) match, life insurance, commuter benefits, corporate gym rates, paid time-off and parental leave plans
Friday happy hour and "Summer Fridays"
Year-round corporate athletic league
Casual work environment

ABOUT GUIDEPOINT:


Guidepoint, a leading expert network firm, connects clients with vetted subject matter expertsAdvisorsfrom their global professional network. Guidepoint clients leverage the insights and perspectives shared by Advisors to stay informed and make better business decisions. Its slate of services, including phone consultations, surveys, events and proprietary data insights products, help professionals gain comprehensive understanding of a topic before making strategic or investment decisions. Guidepoint's multinational client list includes 9 of the top 10 consulting firms and some of the largest hedge funds, private equity firms and Fortune-ranked public companies. For more information, visit www.guidepoint.com.
