Job Title: Customer Service Event Manager - Immediate Hire
Job Description:
Job Description
The role of the Customer Service Manager is to execute tactical objectives fulfilling our commitment to superior customer care and positive customer experience. The role will directly lead local personnel for improving customer service, managing service requests, cycle time, and ensuring effective communication within the market on results and performance. Please note that this is an entry-level position- you must learn all ends of our business operations before overseeing a team.

Here at MELA Group, our company's mission is to foster and encourage innovation for individuals and for our community that surrounds us so it can be easily emulated. In a world full of reactivity, MELA Group breeds toughness and perspective to keep a great balance to the environment around us. MELA Group carries a lot of meaning in the name, it stands for Measurable Excellence (and) Lasting Accomplishments. Our leadership team has demonstrated these characteristics on a daily basis.

Responsibilities:
• Build client relationships by providing exceptional customer service
• Have a thorough understanding of all clients products and services and be able to educate clients on how our products and services would be beneficial to them
• Acts as a Point of Contact for new and existing clients
• Troubleshoot and problem solve client or member accounts and issues
• Perform customer account maintenance requests from clients
• Provide sound business advice and suggestions to clients
• Retain business by identifying and addressing client issues (red flags)
• Suggest ideas and improvements.
• Other duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
• Minimum of 2 years supervisory experience preferred
• Minimum 3 years of customer service experience preferred
• Excellent training and customer services skills
• Strong organizational skills
• The ability to effectively communicate with various levels of management and demonstrate a professional demeanor at all times.
• Able to be flexible in a rapidly changing work environment
• Ability to work independently -- self-starter
Company Description
Our focus is singular: We’re always working on creating the next wave of business managers who can extend the reach of the Fortune 500 companies we represent. In their hands, our campaign planning, sales strategies, and organic approach to customer acquisitions really gets results.

MELA Group represents a wide variety of clients, and that means we need to fill our ranks with business-minded people who can adapt to any terrain. That’s why our management and business training program is so focused. Our people learn the most cutting-edge techniques for being successful in this industry from experts who have achieved their own successes.

Job Title: Integrated Channel Marketing Manager, Carillon Tower Advisers
Job Description:
Job Summary:

Under limited supervision, applies broad product management knowledge and skills obtained through education and experience, to lead channel marketing strategy development, market analysis, product development and product management. Leads large or multiple projects with significant scope or impact and serves as an advisor on larger, external products. Works independently on assignments that are broad in nature requiring originality and ingenuity with appreciable latitude for unreviewed actions or decisions. Provides comprehensive solutions to complex problems. Extensive contact with internal and external customers and information sources is required to identify, research, and resolve complex problems to effectively develop and manage various marketing products.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Takes the initiative to develop and incorporate product requirements into the marketing planning process.
Interprets and analyzes data related to assigned and related products, analyzes and evaluates ideas and suggestions and makes new recommendations, and identifies best practices to be shared with others.
Coordinates the implementation of strategies across marketing and sales functions to support others in building and expanding financial services business.
May lead others in implementing tactical plans to support marketing campaigns.
Ensures that channel marketing and product communications are disseminated, including but not limited to product-oriented positioning documents, product profiles, competitive analyses and other content.
Independently identifies, monitors, prepares and disseminates information and analyses on complex products, sales strategies, capabilities, vulnerabilities and intentions of existing and potential competitors.
Independently analyzes sales factors, including pricing, distribution and product performance; develops recommendations for new sales strategies and changes to existing strategies.
Independently identifies need, monitors, prepares and disseminates internal communications.
Assists to develop broad marketing campaigns, inclusive of public relation efforts, that are aligned with the organizational vision and strategies for growth, developing a clear, compelling and differentiated message and position for assigned products.
Identifies broad market segments and ensures that communication programs and media/channels are customized by segment profile.
Performs market and product mix research to track trends and identify potential product needs, develop product specifications, and make recommendations for optimal product mix profiles.
May participate in planning, strategy, and production meetings.
Makes presentations on products and services and represents assigned functional area at conferences and meetings, as required.
Works closely with sales teams and management to understand needs and assist in executing marketing strategies.
Performs human resource management activities, including approving initial salaries and salary changes; approving additions/reductions in staff; and assisting with the development of goals, monitoring of results, and coaching.
May plan, assign, monitor and manage the work of others.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of:
Financial services.
Fundamental investment concepts, practices and procedures used in the securities industry.
Principles, methods and techniques used in product research and analysis.
Concepts, practices and procedures of marketing and product management.
Business technologies associated with the product planning process.
Technical knowledge sufficient to manage assigned products.
Internet resources for data and information.
Advanced data collection and classification techniques.
Principles, techniques, methods and procedures associated with moderately complex statistical and financial analyses.
Ethical standards of the American Marketing Association (AMA), the Council of American Survey Research Organizations (CASRO), and the Society of Competitive Intelligence Professionals (SCIP) for conducting professional competitive intelligence data collection activities.
Skill in:
Performing market research, identifying market segments, developing product specifications and incorporating requirements into planning processes.
Business writing, including drafting, editing and proofreading internal and external communications.
Product analysis concepts, practices and procedures.
Preparing technical reports, correspondence and presentations.
Synthesizing and summarizing data research findings and data from conventional libraries, databases, reports and internet resources to draw logical conclusions and report results.
Identifying and analyzing trends and patterns in statistical information.
Interpreting and applying practical meaning to research results and presenting the information at an appropriate level to broad audiences at all levels of the organization.
Identifying and selecting sources of competitive intelligence information and conducting competitive intelligence studies.
Developing marketing campaigns.
Implementing strategies and tactical plans across organizational lines.
Managing the dissemination of marketing and product communications.
Delivering presentations to various size audiences and groups.
Operating standard office equipment and using required software applications to produce documents such as reports, graphics, electronic communications, spreadsheets, and databases.
Ability to:
Independently prioritize and work concurrently on multiple assignments to meet conflicting deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.
Employ critical thinking and analysis to develop strategies to overcome client objections and assist others in doing the same.
Ensure a high level of customer service for assigned products.
Partner with other functional areas to accomplish objectives.
Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, to internal and external stakeholders at all organizational levels.
Perform human resource management activities.
Plan, assign, monitor, review, evaluate and lead the work of others.
Coach and mentor others.
Identify training needs and develop subordinates.
Mentor others in performing moderately complex product research and analysis projects and studies.
Educational/Previous Experience Recommendations:
Bachelor's Degree in Communications, Marketing or a business-related field and a minimum of six (6) years of progressively responsible marketing or product management experience in the financial services industry.
Prior leadership experience preferred.
~or~
An equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training approved by Human Resources.
Licenses/Certifications:

None required.
Competitors: Merrill Lynch, Edward Jones, LPL Financial

Job Title: Event Coordinator

Location: New York City

About inMarket

inMarket is the leader in digital advertising and predictive location solutions that help brands sense and respond to consumer needs in real-time. Since 2010, inMarket has helped thousands of brands leverage SDK-derived, opt-in consumer data to better understand who consumers are, why they make decisions and how best to reach them.

With inMarket's suite of solutions, brands can better understand consumers, activate real-time digital advertising in the moments that matter and generate better campaign attribution.

inMarket's Moments solution drives an average of 5x the performance of traditional digital media and was a key factor in winning Best Mobile Marketing Platform at the 2019 Digiday Awards. inMarket, headquartered in Los Angeles, has offices in Atlanta, Bentonville, Chicago, New York and San Francisco. For more information, visit www.inmarket.com.

InMarket is looking for an experienced and creative Event Coordinator to join our team. As an Event Coordinator at our company, you will be responsible for organizing and coordinating our tradeshow and local event efforts.

We are expecting you to be very well-organized and competent in vendor management. Communication skills, good time management and attention to detail are a must!

Manage event requirements and operational details of each event including booth, show logistics, meals, staffing and attendance and budgets
Manage and oversee event budget and planning process
Negotiate with vendors to achieve the most favorable terms
Evaluate event's success including leads, sales qualified leads and conversions
Event Management requirements and qualifications

1 - 2 years of experience as an event coordinator or similar role
Portfolio of successful events
Proficient in MS Office
Excellent vendor management skills
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on company's success
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Team player

Job Description
HqO is a fast-growing company that is revolutionizing the commercial real estate industry by better connecting landlords to their building tenants. Along with managing our brand presence at events this person its comfortable developing content and outreach that highlights HqO’s value proposition, a critical component of partnering with sales development teams to aid their pre-event and post-event outreach, The right candidate will possess the ability to prioritize workload, be decisive, pragmatic, and thoughtful with every task. They’ll work closely with the customer team to find and create exceptional and memorable event experiences that also generate pipeline for HqO.

Lincoln Military Housing – A company for Growth and Opportunity!
Lincoln Military Housing was formed in 2001 through a Department of Defense (DoD) contract with parent company Lincoln Property Company. Our mission has always been to increase the quality of military housing for our nation's service men and women. Lincoln Military Housing now provides more than 36,000 family homes for military members across the US. Our Team Members are passionate about the work they do and take pride in our mission of providing our military families with exemplary service in a quality home environment.
When you join the LMH team, you will be working amongst a team of talented and passionate individuals while being provided with unparalleled opportunities for personal and professional development and career growth. Every day with LMH, you have the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of our service members and their families by demonstrating our core values of INTEGRITY, COMMUNICATION, EMPOWERMENT, RESPECT, BALANCE, and COMMITMENT.

A Day in the Life of an Event Coordinator:
As a Lincoln Military Housing Event Coordinator, you will plan, create, coordinate and host events and programs for residents that build connections within their community, create memories for the family, and provides rewarding experiences and opportunities Your position is responsible for effectively producing high quality and well planned events and managing all aspects of the event planning process. Your role requires strong organizational skills, self-starter with high energy, ability to travel to various locations within the region and deliver on our mission of providing exemplary service in accordance with Lincoln Military Housing’s customer satisfaction standards.
Your Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Event Planning- develop and coordinate all phases of the event planning process (research, design, planning, coordination, and evaluation) with delivering quality and creative.
Event Management – ability to manage and execute multiple events simultaneously. This includes but not limited to timelines, production schedules, risk assessment, creative design, vendor/venue management, event team coordination, and logistics management.
Event Production Coordination – responsible for executing on and off site events including but not limited to event team coordination, event set-up, day of hosting, event and risk brief, managing logistics throughout the event, and event tear down.
Budgets and Contracts - oversee, review, and process assigned accounting and financial matters based on assigned event budgets. (i.e. processing invoices in Payscan, MEC’s/IEC’s, PAF’s, PO’s, requesting quotes from vendors).
District Support- support District Teams within the event planning process to ensure the success of the event experience and entire planning process.
Marketing Coordination- develop, design, and create effective and comprehensive marketing plans and materials to market events and programs (i.e. flyers, website content, social media content, newsletters, banners, posters, email, event photography, event registration management).
Partnership Coordination- collaborate with like-minded military organizations, agencies and businesses on partnership and/or sponsorship opportunities to meet the needs of the residents through programing, events and other resident events.
Record Keeping- maintaining accurate event folders and records both online and in paper form and submit required items by deadlines (i.e. event recaps, attendance stats, evaluations, event photos).
Department Support – support through special projects, team members, and collateral duties as assigned.
Complies with all OSHA safety regulations, local applicable laws regarding health, safety or environmental, Fair Housing and LMH Standard Operating Procedures and Policies.

What You Need for Success:
Position requires event planning experience; experience with recreation, hospitality, marketing, communication or related field with a minimum of 1-2 years’ experience preferred.
Solid computer skills required. Proficiency in using Microsoft Office, a website Content Management System (preferred), Google applications including GMAIL, social media platforms, and graphic software (Adobe, Publisher, Photoshop, and InDesign preferred).
Effective written and verbal communication and interaction skills with internal/external customers to sufficiently exchange or convey information and to give and receive work direction.
Excellent project planning organization and strategic planning skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, effective time management, ability to balance multiple tasks and projects, prioritize and complete assigned duties to ensure operational and event objectives and goals are achieved.
Ability to operate a motor vehicle (valid license required).
Must be available to work a varied and flexible schedule, including evenings and weekends, holidays and overtime as required.
Ability to lift up to a maximum of 50lbs.
Ability to travel to other regional locations for work, training, meetings and other work-related activities.
What We Provide You:
Lincoln offers a wide range of insurance options and benefit programs. Our benefits take into consideration everything from career development to family matters, health and wellness, and we are committed to doing everything we can to offer you quality benefits and healthcare coverage. In addition, we offer competitive compensation and generous paid time off.

Job Title: Project Manager, Social & Influencer Marketing, Ole Henriksen
Job Description:
ABOUT KENDO

Kendo Holdings, Inc. is a San Francisco-based beauty brand developer and wholesaler owned by LVMH Moët Hennessy - Louis Vuitton, the world's largest luxury group. A play on the words can do, Kendo has become the hub of creativity and next generation beauty product development for global Sephora channels and selective retailers outside of Sephora.

Through original development, collaborations and acquisitions the Kendo stable of brands will always be creative, inspiring and innovative. A dynamic engine of speed, expertise and market-savvy, the Kendo team continues to redefine the beauty industry through great product, great storytelling, great retail and direct-to-consumer partnerships. This shows up in everything we do and in what we stand for:
ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT: We seek creative ways to get things done
PERSEVERANCE: We are moved by Winston Churchill's words, never, never, never give up'
GENEROSITY: The power of giving
STORYTELLING: Creating authentic stories to inspire
QUALITY OBSESSION: Our product quality is a reflection of ourselves
FUN: Work, life, and fun are woven of a single fabric
The Kendo house of brands currently includes: Bite, KVD Vegan Beauty, Marc Jacobs Beauty, Ole Henriksen and Fenty Beauty.

POSITION SUMMARY

Project Manager, Social and Influencer Marketing will lead the development and execution of social and influencer marketing campaigns for OLEHENRIKSEN. They will supervise all aspects of influencer and artistry outreach activities including personalized gifting, event planning, partnerships and networking. The incumbent is outgoing with exceptional interpersonal skills and has demonstrated success identifying industry trends and building strong relationships. They will be a strong communicator, as they will need to communicate and balance priorities on multiple projects. The dynamic person will have some experience in the beauty industry (or passion for beauty/skincare) and be well-versed in social marketing. Requires travel.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and oversee the execution of end-to-end influencer campaigns including framing the campaign strategy, curating talent, negotiating rates, managing contract development, influencer relations and reporting
Oversee relationship building strategy and execution by working with influencer marketing associate manager.
Coordinate and manage video production with talent including briefing, talent sourcing, concepts, strategy, and overseeing execution with cross functioning teams.
Co-produce content shoots (both still and video production)
Oversee ongoing gifting efforts for influencers and makeup artists
Recommend social content marketing plans to be executed in partnership with influencers
Assist social media team in other areas as needed
Work with cross functioning teams to oversee social media initiatives and international influencer marketing strategies/execution
Manage content calendar for influencer sponsored content and owned social calendar
Manage influencer marketing budget
Manage relevant filing of key Ole Henriksen content for both internal and international teams.
REQUIREMENTS
4-5 years of experience in principles and practices of social media, event planning, and influencer marketing
College degree or equivalent experience related to Marketing/PR/Events
Passion for beauty/cosmetics; experience in the industry is a plus
Organized, detail-oriented and proactive
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple programs in a deadline-intensive environment
Must be a leader and know how to manage a team efficiently and effectively

About CyberArk:

CyberArk is the global leader in privileged access security, a critical layer of IT security to protect data, infrastructure and assets across the enterprise, in the cloud and throughout the DevOps pipeline. CyberArk delivers the industry’s most complete solution to reduce risk created by privileged credentials and secrets. The company is trusted by the world’s leading organizations, including more than 50 percent of the Fortune 500, to protect against external attackers and malicious insiders.

Job Description:

CyberArk is seeking a Regional Field Marketing Manager to join our growing Americas team! In this role, you will be responsible for partnering with the Northeast sales teams to develop, execute and measure high volume, cost effective lead generation and nurture programs. You will also work closely with the Global Demand Center to align marketing campaigns and messaging to ensure continued success in new business development and customer expansion. This position reports to the Sr. Manager, Americas Field Marketing, East.

Success in this role will require an analytical mindset, creative demand generation skills, and project management expertise. It also necessitates a proven ability to work with sales, partners and marketing peers across the organization.

Responsibilities:
Develop a regional plan that builds pipeline for enterprise prospects, customers and target accounts.
Build strong relationships with sales to gain market insights and ensure alignment of marketing investments to top sales priorities.
Identify, manage, coordinate resources and measure effectiveness of regional events (CyberArk and industry).
Work with counterparts in Inside Sales to optimize quantity/quality targets for nurtured leads and ensure effective, timely follow up.
Support the development and expansion of our indirect sales channels with effective channel-ready lead programs and strong relationships with counterparts at top tier partners. Identify ways for partners to add to the sales pipeline.
Work efficiently with contracted marketing fulfillment house to ensure timely shipments of event collateral to all field sales events.
Identify digital marketing programs for region and work collaboratively with Digital Marketing Team to implement prioritized opportunities – this could include emails, webcasts, content syndication, digital ads, and 3rd party programs.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required, marketing or business-related degree a plus.
3+ years of combined marketing experience, primarily focused on lead generation and event management.
2+ years of experience managing demand generation, campaign development and execution.
2+ years of experience marketing with channel partners.
Professional B2B marketing experience leading demand generation programs preferably in the information security space.
Proficiency with marketing automation and CRM tools like Marketo and Salesforce.com.
Strong attention to detail.
Data driven and familiar with marketing metrics.
Excellent oral and written communication a must.
Willingness to travel, averaging 20% of time.
CyberArk is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Job title: Event Coordinator

Department: Sales

FLSA status: Exempt

Reports to: Director of Sales

Job Summary:

Inspired by our commitment to excellence, the sales and operations teams at our Company* create unforgettable memories for our guests. The successful Event Coordinator will successfully act as the customer's primary contact after the Sales Manager/Team Manager has closed the sale ensuring continuous customer satisfaction.

Essential Functions:

Event Coordination & Customer Service:
Coordinate the cruise event with the Sales, Food & Beverage, Operations, and Administrative Departments once the sale has been finalized
Act as the liaison between the Company and special order vendors
Develop comprehensive knowledge of product offerings, product extras, pricing and scripting for all standard products
Obtain all information related to a cruises from the sales team and individual call center
Coordinate all components of a cruise including tickets, bar packages, photo packages, and other special event orders
Place special event orders with appropriate, approved outside vendors
Perform pre-cruise calls to confirm final group counts and to finalize any last minute event details including menu, bar packages, entertainment and other special requests
Upsell to customer who already have cruises booked
Ensure complete and accurate product details are communicated to the F&B and Operations Departments to ensure proper execution of the product promised
Ensure communication is done in a timely, efficient manner
Solicit input and works with Director of Sales and other appropriate sales team members to finalize product offer details as necessary
Meet and board large groups when they arrive for their cruises. On occasion, may be required ride the cruise with the larger groups, especially full deck and full ship charters, to help ensure outstanding product delivery
Provide prompt responses to customer inquiries
Service/detail all brides 60 days out and be onsite coordinator the day of the wedding
Facilitate wedding ceremony, rehearsal and reception set up on the ship
Administrative:
Document customer interaction in EBMS and Salesforce, the Company's sales databases
Coordinate & run the weekly "two-week" meeting-this includes red alerts, reviewing function sheets and producing the final two-week report
Attend and participate in the calendar management meeting
Attend other pertinent meetings as requested
Ensure customers are billed correctly for all extra services provided according to the signed contract
Print weekly reports
Maintain good organizational skills through time management, setting priorities, and accurate paperwork
Accountabilities:

The successful Event Coordinator will attain personal selling goals, will personally contribute to the unforgettable guest experience, will be favorably viewed by supervisors and peers, and will be swift and efficient in the execution of their assigned duties. Performance will be measured by internal and external customer satisfaction, departmental tests, management evaluation, and feedback from peers on the city's team.

Job Specifications / qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a discipline related to the work of the position OR equivalent experience
Minimum of one (1) year of previous customer service experience
Minimum of one (1) year related industry experience
Communicate effectively in oral and written form
Maintain high level of organization
Be detail oriented
Handle multiple tasks/projects at one time
Focus on customer needs
Meet deadlines
Establish and maintain effective working relationships as required by job responsibility
Listen effectively, assesses the situation, determine relevant issues, & suggest solutions
Work with Microsoft Office applications (especially Word)
For purposes of this job description only, references to the 'Company' are to the following subsidiaries of Entertainment Cruises Inc.: Premier Yachts, Inc., Mystic Blue Cruises, Inc., Seadog Ventures, Inc., and Spirit Cruises, LLC. You are employed by one of these subsidiaries, not by Entertainment Cruises Inc.
Competitors: Hornblower Cruises and Events, World Yacht

Job Description:
Job Description
Dauntless Marketing is actively seeking a motivated Entry Level Marketing Assistant to work on ground breaking campaigns with an advertising and marketing firm in the local region. This innovative firm was founded by dedicated people looking to push the envelope by using cost-effective marketing campaigns and advertising strategies. Their goal is to provide the same advertising as the standard firm but at a fraction of the price. As a progressive company in the sales and marketing industry, this firm continues to set the standard for excellence in customer acquisition and establishing a repeat customer base for clients. By providing personalized sales and marketing services to some of the largest Clients in the world, this firm continues to increase the market shares of clients through proven sales and marketing strategies.

The Entry Level Marketing Assistant position is a valued team member in the marketing and advertising department. The position is considered entry level to start during training which includes a comprehensive overview of basic marketing strategy, direct advertising, promotional techniques, visual merchandising and consumer market research. After successful completion of the program, an individual would be considered a team lead in the marketing department. The entry level Marketing Assistant reports directly to the Executive Marketing Manager.

Responsibilities:
Assisting in the daily growth and development of assigned campaigns
Assisting with efforts of customer acquisition and retention
Expertly managing the needs of external customers
Developing strong leadership and interpersonal skills
Driving sales through retail promotional campaigns
Build brand recognition through local events and experiential marketing
Strategize, execute and manage along side the Brand Ambassador teams
Interact and communicate with customers
Problem solve and make professional judgment on whether customers qualify for the in-store services that the firm’s clients offer (candidate will be trained in this area)
Conduct lead generation and maintain and develop a client base for our clients who offer the in-store services
Aid marketing and advertising associates and senior staff with specific projects related to each client
Qualifications

The personalized focus of the campaigns is not only a refreshing alternative to more general mass sales and marketing strategies, but it is also responsible for the unprecedented growth and stability of the company. The management team prides themselves on recognizing top performance, integrity, and a winning mindset for continual internal promotions. If you possess a passion for marketing, sales or retail and would enjoy learning how to manage the varying dimensions of a business, this position could be an excellent fit for the right candidate.
Must be able to work full time hours
Ability to excel in unsupervised solo assignments as well as team projects.
Desire to travel at least 1 or 2 weeks a year for further training.
Great communication skills
Must be able to work in an energetic, fast paced environment.
2 or 4 year college degree in related field or relevant experience
Self-starter, creative thinker, problem solver
Why work here?
Paid Training
Company Paid Travel
Market Competitive Pay Structure: Base, Weekly Bonuses, and Incentives
Rapid upward mobility
Community involvement and Charitable opportunities
A fun, high energy work environment! No cubicles here, we work closely together as a team!

ENGINE SHOP IS NOT YOUR TYPICAL AGENCY.

We are looking for great people who are passionate about what they do. People who understand the value of hard work, are willing to get their hands dirty and enjoy the process as much as the result. People who love working on a team. People with a make it happen and get it done attitude. People who, no matter what the level, are leaders. No two gears are the same but they all fit together to make an unstoppable machine here at Engine Shop.

Our people are why Engine Shop has been consistently named a "Best Place To Work" by Ad Age and Event Marketer.

WHAT'S OUR STORY

We are an engagement marketing agency with deep roots across sports, entertainment and lifestyle. We integrate live experiences, digital engagement and content to help our clients connect with their consumers. To best serve these clients, all our people are expected to meet Engine Shop's standard of excellence.

But that's not our only focus. Our culture is a part of everything we do from our casual work environments to our creative benefits and our acclaimed annual retreat. It's a part of how we treat one another, how we have each other's backs and how we welcome people who are different.

Engine Shop needs an Account Supervisor who can activate a program/event from start to finish, while being proactive in handling any challenges that they may experience. This person should be an excellent communicator and effective leader who can supervise multiple programs and team members. We are looking for someone who serves high quality service to our clients and ensures that events and programs will run with very little oversight.

FUNCTIONS + RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead day-to-day oversight of multiple programs and team members through proactive planning, program structure development and implementation, effective delegation and coordination of company resources
Facilitate seamless executions by acting as the program lead, working directly with your team to coordinate the show organizer, exhibit company, vendors and any other pertinent parties
Oversee all program communication, including website and collateral materials related to events details, registration, post event surveys, etc.
Contribute ideas and tactics to new business proposals, decks and brainstorms
Can communicate effectively to executive management to provide feedback and results from your programs/events
Provide feedback and guide team members to grow and enhance their roles and responsibilities.


REQUIREMENTS
A talented and seasoned experiential marketing professional with 6+ years of experience developing creative concepts and bring them to life for mobile tours, live events, stage production and guerilla marketing campaigns for brands
Proven experience ideating around creative assignments to develop executable campaigns that drive meaningful consumer engagement with brands
A history of building successful consumer engagements from concept through budgeting, planning, execution and reconciliation
Experience of securing and implementing integrated experiential marketing programs including: permitting, staffing, security, logistics, fabrication, and buildout
Strong writing, presenting, and Excel skills
Additional consideration for candidates with 3+ years of experience in the alcoholic beverage, automotive and/or luxury consumer sectors
Additional consideration for candidates with AutoCAD and Photoshop skill sets
COMPENSATION/BENEFITS
Competitive compensation package including base salary and company bonus plan
Medical and dental benefits
401K + company match
Flex vacation policy


PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORK ENVIRONMENT

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand; walk; sit for extended periods of time; turn the head and torso, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; taste or smell; and have full power of speech.
Occasionally may have to exert up to 10-15 pounds of force to lift, carry, pull or otherwise move objects.
Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Responsibilities
• Be the on-site leader for Rock Your Profile event activations to ensure we are creating meaningful and memorable experiences for event attendees and representing our brand successfully.
• Manage professional photographers at event activations including briefing, coordinating, scheduling and managing the photography team at RYP events.
• Schedule event ambassadors to attend Rock Your Profile event activations this includes identifying ambassadors, creating a unique booth staff schedule for the event, building and sending event ambassador communications and managing logistics and ambassadors onsite at events.
• Lead the booth setup and takedown onsite at owned and operated and sponsored event RYP activations. This includes designing + creating the booth and coordinating all logistics of building, shipping and receiving the booth onsite.
• Select and order all RYP specific swag and collateral for event activations and be responsible for the shipping, receiving and coordination of swag onsite at event.
• Lead select Tier 2 and 3 events by leading all event logistics, placing speakers, managing event collateral/shipping and partnering with various vendors to ensure each event is a success.
• Proactively keep track of the events calendar and ensure we stay on top of competing deadlines and manage budget and continually track RYP event related expenses.
• Work collaboratively within the Global Event Marketing Team to build and manage relationships with event leaders. In addition, successfully build and manage key stakeholder relationships across the greater Marketing and Communications organization.

Basic Qualifications
BA/BS degree in Marketing, Communications or a related field
4+ years of business-to-business content and marketing experience, preferably in the brand, marketing technology, or agency marketing.
Successful track record of working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Experience managing events and large tradeshows and managing multiple projects at once
Advanced skills in Microsoft Suite, Google Docs, Excel and PowerPoint
30-40% travel required onsite to events
Preferred Qualifications
• Ability to work across various levels of the organization while building trust and fostering collaboration
• Strong skills in meeting management and leading meeting presentations
• Strong communication skills - verbal and written
• Ability to work well under pressure, with tight deadlines
• Proactive and able to easily take the lead on several events simultaneously
• Always striving for excellence by bringing new ideas to the table (both strategic and executional) as well as calling our inefficiencies to improve processes, programs and event experiences.
• Detail oriented and quick to jump in and solve problems

About us:

AV Concepts is a respected leader with a 30+ year track record of excellence in the convergence of technology and creativity in the live events industry. We recognize, respect and promote the power of our employees.

You will be joining a top team of industry professionals that bring unique technology and creative expertise together to offer the most innovative solutions to our clients that are limited only by your imagination!

About the role:

The Business Development role will support Sales, Marketing and Business Development efforts through direct client outreach. This position will be responsible for engaging directly with new client contacts to generate interest, evaluate needs, identify and qualify potential sales opportunities and lay a foundation for new, successful relationships with clients at the earliest stages of the sales process.

The scope of responsibilities will include cold calling, opportunity qualifying, needs assessment, opportunity identification, CRM data system entry, interaction with Account Managers, and nurturing of client relationships in the early stages.

This position requires a highly organized individual with previous sales experience, some knowledge of technology products and/or services and an outgoing personality with an exceptional capability to multi-task while delivering results. The ideal candidate will have worked in a sales culture that values customer services, personal accountability, teamwork and a positive “can-do” attitude.

What you need:
Exceptional at multi-tasking and organizing to deliver results
Confident and engaging phone skills that build trust immediately
Familiarity with web-based CRM systems
Experience with experiential marketing, PR campaigns and conferences a plus
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Power Point, Excel and Outlook)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Friendly, helpful and positive personality with a can-do attitude
Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced, ever-changing team environment
Knowledge of audio-visual industry a must
Ability to work independently and exercise good time management
Quality work and attention to detail are critical
Ability to preserve confidentiality of information
What you'll do:
Actively working assigned vertical markets and key client contact lists
Developing, managing and reporting a strategic sales plan for all assigned verticals
Direct communication with leads to evaluate needs, identify sales opportunities, and build confidence in AVC’s service quality and innovation.
Build relationships with potential clients in the early-stage and nurture the relationship until it is ready for transition to Account Manager, SME’s or sale leadership.
Enter and maintain accurate new lead information in company’s CRM system (Dynamics).
Outreach to identified Prospects to foster new relationships.
Collaborates with sales team to understand best practices and continually update ideal candidate profiles to maximize capability to identify and pursue high quality leads and Prospects.

Why you'll like working here:
Top salary and commission
Medical, dental, and 401k retirement plan

Cell phone reimbursement

***This role is for a contractor position and will be processed through a third-party Managed Service Provider. This is not a full time employment position at GoPro.***

Channel Marketing Manager (Contract)

About GoPro

GoPro makes it easy for people to celebrate and share experiences. We believe life is more meaningful when shared. We build cameras, software, and accessories that help the world share itself in immersive and exciting ways.

GoPro is a global movement whose business is driven by shared experiences. We celebrate diversity. We practice inclusion. We foster belonging. We demand equality. And we share the experiences of individuals and communities who also hold these values as core to who they are. From São Paulo to Munich, Silicon Valley to Shenzhen, we are dedicated to building a company that reflects and honors the diverse global communities where we live, work, and play.

GoPro is seeking a candidate for the Americas Channel Marketing team. This position will define, execute and deliver on various marketing plans with a defined set of strategic partners for the GoPro product portfolio. This role will work with cross-functional teams that includes Sales, Sales Ops, Training, and Marketing teams to help manage and create innovative strategies and tactics for Retail Big Box and Mid-Market accounts, specifically Amazon. This person is detail oriented, hungry to learn and understand best practices of how those strategies will impact the channel as a whole.

The ideal candidate has a passion for technology and proven experience in successfully bringing to market innovative products, developing memos and presentations, as well as managing multiple projects. Within this role, to gain more mind share and results for accounts this candidate should be able to influence and lead others both internally and externally.

This position will be based in San Mateo, California.

Responsibilities
Own and drive retailer marketing and merchandising strategies to achieve sell-through and revenue goals for assigned
Define process and standard on Big Box and Mid-Market accounts through merchandising asset requirements to drive awareness, consideration and conversion tactics (i.e. Amazon Advertising, A+ Content, etc.)
Manage and understand the requirements for online merchandising execution by creating trackers and work-back schedules for projects
Develop, manage, and execute channel marketing strategy and plans for physical retail and online sales channels including:
Drive best in class in-store merchandising, end-user demand generation (e.g. retail circulars, digital inserts, displays, retail promotions etc.)
Participate in the development of the strategy and vision for how our devices are merchandised and demonstrated within a retail store environment
Create and manage MDF / Coop Programs and a strong understanding of the financial impact of these programs.
Provide insights and strategy based on the GoPro customer, industry and retailer trends to evolve the business in an ever-changing marketing landscape
Skills We're Stoked About
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
5+ years of channel marketing experience with a consumer electronics company
Experience with Amazon is a big plus
Experience working at a start-up or rapidly-growing company preferred and stong understanding of the GoPro brand
Quick on your feet and able to problem solve on the fly
Personable and conversational – no wall flowers, please!
Organized and ability to multi-task and take initiative
GoPro Highlights
Fully-stocked kitchen with snacks galore
Employee commuter shuttles
GoPro is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

From our founding until now, our mission has remained the same: to remove the engineering burden from data teams by standardizing and fully automating data connectors. With Fivetran, your data just arrives in your warehouse, canonical and ready to query, no engineering or maintenance required. As we watch more and more companies leverage our technology to become truly data-driven, we’re proud not only of our growth but also of the fact that we’ve grown without compromising our core values.

Integrity.
We do the right thing, even when it's harder in the short run. We challenge the status quo by reasoning from first principles.

Initiative.
Fivetran belongs to all of us. We take ownership and are accountable for getting things done. Through curiosity, learning, and coaching, we grow as individuals and teams.

One team, one dream.
We share the pains and successes of our customers, partners and colleagues. We seek, gather, and trust a diverse group of teammates with different perspectives to guide Fivetran's progress.

If these values resonate with you, we’d love to hear from you.



Fivetran is in a hyper-growth stage and excited to be looking for a Field Marketer to help with our marketing goal! As part of the Demand Generation team, you’ll be at the heart of our growing field marketing strategy, connecting Fivetran to customers and prospects in a number of regions and working with our Alliance team to develop partner-focused marketing campaigns. These campaigns will allow us to increase brand awareness and help our sales teams achieve aggressive revenue goals. You’ll define a region-specific marketing plan that supports our sales strategy and meticulously plan, promote, and execute dozens of events as well as account-based marketing tactics throughout the US. The Field Marketing Manager manages the activities and performance of regional marketing budgets and programs to support the field in achieving monthly bookings targets. You can multitask, efficiently communicate, & work cross-functionally with sales, communications, & other sub-teams within Marketing. You are patient with an obsession for organization and a knack for juggling multiple projects at once in a (really) fast-paced environment.

This position is based out of our Oakland, CA or Denver, CO offices
As a Field Marketer at Fivetran, you will:
Execute marketing programs to drive pipeline growth for North America
Collaborate closely with other members of demand gen, product marketing, sales. partnerships and many others included in the process of development, execution, and measurement of field marketing campaigns.
Align the regional field events to support the sales goals for leads and opportunities.
Collaborate with alliances/partnerships team to align programming goals
Leverage analytics in Looker, Salesforce, and Pardot to understand the impact of your efforts
Research, Plan, promote, and host an array field marketing events (tradeshows, conferences, roadshows, executive dinners, webinars, etc.) across the region that capture prospects and help transition them into customers.
Provide onsite event staff/support when needed.
Build out landing pages, emails sequences, and social media plans for Fivetran events
Socialize and get buy-in from SDRs and account executives to promote and drive successful field events and programming
Manage budgets for campaigns, communicate ROI against program objectives
Work closely with sales and marketing leadership to craft Account-Based Marketing strategies for Field Events.
Your Superpowers:
Exposure to B2B SaaS or tech industry, data analytics a huge plus
Familiarity with SalesForce, Pardot, and Looker
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to coordinate across multiple departments.
You have strong stakeholder management skills and are comfortable managing expectations and keeping teams on track
You have an understanding of the foundations of marketing and how events can play a critical part in moving the business forward
Strong project management/organizational skills and the ability to successfully manage multiple initiatives at once.
Self-motivated, able to work autonomously and communicate effectively
Ability to grasp the Fivetran product and personas we are targeting to help shape event strategy and drive content/collateral for each event
Ability to travel (35% per quarter)
Perks of working with us:
100% paid Medical, Dental, Vision and Basic Life Insurance
Flexible PTO
401k match program
Pet Insurance -- and yes, you can bring your well-behaved fur babies to work
Commuter Benefits to help with transit and parking costs
Professional development and training opportunities
Unlimited coffee, office snacks and frequent catered lunches
Company happy hours and fun team building activities

We are located at 2881 Peach Avenue in Clovis, CA. This part-time, hourly sales assistant will help the Sales and Marketing Department. Your product will be field trips, group outings, daytime and evening private parties for kids and adults, and our groundbreaking STEM outings for these groups. You will help sell these programs by contacting schools, churches, scouts, groups, and organizations to help sell these established products in roller skating, education, and family entertainment.

Requirements and additional preferences:
Experience with inbound and outbound sales calls (experience a MUST)
Marketing/sales/promotions experience and enjoy working with youth
Reliable transportation for making outside sales calls
Flexible daytime schedule, Monday - Friday (25 hrs/wk) MUST have Daytime Availability
Excellent organization and great communication skills (both written and verbal),
Creativity and self-motivation
Perform well in a fast-paced, ever-changing, sales environment.
Establish, service and maintain existing and potential clients.
Multi-task various marketing projects, administrative and sales responsibilities.
Friendly and assertive.
Strong command of internet marketing tools. Your ability to use major search engines, Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube is critical. Your goals would include keeping these sites updated about what's happening at our location. Must be proficient in Word and Excel.

Job Description
You will be working within an extremely dynamic and successful new business team developing existing and attracting new business.

The Role:

To provide the primary external business interface for customers and the external sales force. Providing a full range of customer service support services including pricing information, lead time inquiries, and pro-active management of sales. Sales reporting and tracking day to day progress

Have good organizational skills.

Position: Marketing Manager

Location: Madison, WI

Full-time/Part-time/Temporary: Full-time

Travel (%): 10%

International: No

Job Summary

Duties and responsibilities of the Marketing Manager – Kid Trax, include managing the brand’s strategic growth through developing and maintaining a consistent positive image for the brand both online and offline. Supporting and assisting the Director of Marketing in all activities related to the brand.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Brand Marketing Responsibilities (30%)
Assists Director of Marketing in building a 1-3 year marketing strategy that connects the passion points of our consumers with our brand, product, and corporate strategies and objectives.
Defines, plans, and launches annual and seasonal campaigns and priorities for the business.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of the brand, category, competitors, and consumers to ensure relevant insights to fuel all marketing elements.
Manages internal and external partners to support the activation of integrated marketing plans. Establishing strong partnerships and processes with our internal teams (Creative services, PR, Sales, Retail, Product, Legal, Customer Service, and Finance) to effectively execute marketing campaigns.
Tracks and manages brand business performance. Analyzes and reports key marketing metrics with a view to strengthening marketing plan / activities for the future.
Manages the Kid Trax marketing budget, spending efficiently to achieve our marketing goals.
Strategically assesses current activation of assets across media, experiential marketing, spokespeople, festivals, and event properties to identify strategic white spaces where our brand should be.
Kid Trax Ecommerce Merchant (30%)
Define and execute our direct to consumer sales strategies for KidTraxToys.com.
Work collaboratively with sales and product management to establish and manage the online assortment including establishing pricing.
Build and execute digital marketing programs and campaigns to drive traffic and profitable sales on KidTraxtoys.com.
Collaborate with the digital marketing team on enhancing SEO and UX.
Manages and executes the Email Marketing program delivering growth in email database and growth in sales conversion.
Content Marketing Duties (20%)
Leads the creation and execution of consumer programs, campaigns, and annual high-profile product launches.
Evaluates creative ideas and thinking with a critical eye and understanding of the brand equity, vision and strategic priorities.
Manages the influencer program, seeking out, vetting, and selecting appropriate individuals to represent the Kid Trax brand.
Develop content for the brand website; keeping in mind brand voice and consumer journey optimization.
Maintain awareness of brand standards and guidelines, and make sure they are implemented for all assets before they are deployed to digital channels.
Measures/analyzes performance of all web activity; including traffic, content views, and demographics, and provide insights and key learnings to affiliated teams.
Social Media & Digital Marketing (10%)
Drives a holistic social media channel strategy that considers brand & product representation.
Build and manage all aspects of multiple social media accounts, including community development and content creation.
Create sharp, enticing content (including, but not limited to Facebook posts, Tweets, Instagram Posts, Instagram stories, and short format videos) which engage the brand’s audience across social channels.
Manage and implement a paid digital and social paid media advertising plan, using data, driven decision making.
Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.
Other Duties Assigned (10%)
Assist in presenting at key customer meetings on key Kid Trax initiatives.
Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
Follows internal controls and company policies set by Pacific Cycle Inc. and Dorel Sports.
Contributes to the success of Pacific Cycle Inc. by leading or assisting with other projects and tasks as assigned.
Minimum Requirements
College education ideally with degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications.
Masters study or degree a benefit.
At least five years experience in marketing role with social media responsibilities.
Experience in selling directly online
Enthusiasm and energy for the position
Passionate about marketing
Outstanding communicator and writer
Exhibit Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) computer skills
Must have own transportation
Will work on site during regular business hours
Team player who enjoys working with others
Dependable
Outgoing and friendly
Self-motivated and creative idea generator
Key Competencies
Innovative
Proactive and takes action without being prompted
Creativity
Generates original ideas, encourages new ways of thinking, explores options, and develops innovative solutions
Functional/Technical Expertise
Remains current in their area of expertise and serves as a resource in that area of the organization
Change Agility
Adaptable
Embraces needed change and modifies their behavior when appropriate to achieve organizational objectives
Effective in the face of ambiguity
Results Orientation
Maintains an appropriate focus on outcomes and accomplishments
Motivated by achievement, and persist until the goal is reached
Conveys a sense of urgency to make things happen
Respects the need to balance short- and long-term goals
Influence
Skilled at directing, persuading, and motivating others
Ability to flex their style to direct, collaborate, or empower, as the situation requires
Ability to establish a personal power base built on mutual trust, fairness, and honesty
Environmental Factors

A large percentage of work time is spent sitting. During events you may be on your feet for 5 or more hours. The noise level in the work area can be moderate.

Essential Physical Demands and Frequency
Standing: Occasionally
Driving: Yes
Sitting: Frequently
Bending: Occasionally
Lifting: Occasionally up to 50 lbs. unassisted
Other: Traveling
Twisting: Occasionally
Other: Making Phone calls

Competitors: Graco Children's Products, Summer Infant, Evenflo

Job Title: Account Manager - Full Time | Part Time
Job Description:
Job Description
Opus Inc IS HIRING- FULL TIME & PART TIME

We have a specific need for Management immediately.

THE POSITIONS INCLUDE:
Maintain Customer Service and Enhance Productivity Level.
Assist Customers daily with their Purchases, Sign Ups, and Billing Issues.
Supervise and Schedule Store Personnel.
Communicate daily about Sales and Customer Issues.
Motivate Customers to Enhance Sales and Profits by Advertising and Marketing Products.
HAVE PRIOR EXPERIENCE IN CUSTOMER SERVICE, RETAIL, OR AS A KEY HOLDER / MANAGER?

We want you! Our firm provides Full Paid Training and offers Full Time, Part Time, and Seasonal Positions. Any experience in the fields of Retail, Sales, and Customer Service is a huge plus and we are ready to meet you and go over our potential Career Opportunities.

OUR FIRM IS LOOKING FOR APPLICANTS THAT POSSESS THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA:
Enthusiastic and Exceptional Communication
Demonstrates the ability to Multi-Task and Prioritization
Organizational Skills
Time Management
A desire for Growth and Advancement
The Positions Does Not Include any of the following:
-Telemarketing
Canvassing (Door to Door)
Business to Business
Company Description
Who is Opus? We are a collective of innovative minds who are always looking to be on top of market changes. We use research-based, experiential marketing to create brand-awareness, consumer loyalty, as well as produce customized campaigns that boost acquisitions, while our clients focus on their core expertise.

Our Vision:

Our goal and vision is to elicit return business for our clients, growth for our company, and professional advancement for our team by embracing the creativity and teamwork necessary to help clients branch out into new markets.

All of this is possible with Opus due to the development of expert marketing managers who are efficient with clients and consumer acquisitions, and who build long-lasting relationships, which result in growth for our clients.

Opus is an in-store marketing company that represents leaders in home entertainment, inside some of the largest retailers in the world.

Likewise, we are passionate about delivering quality and results, for both our customers and clients.

We value teamwork within our agency and strive for great partnerships across all platforms.

Job Title: Regional Marketing Manager - State and Local Government
Job Description:
Position Description: Okta is looking for a strong Marketing Manager to strategically plan and manage field/regional programs and campaigns specifically targeting US State & Local Government. In partnership with the Sr. Manager of Public Sector Marketing, Education Marketing Manager, sales, alliances and the cross functional marketing team, this person will be responsible for quarterbacking and executing strategies to meet/exceed quarterly and annual pipeline goals.

The State and Local Government Marketing Manager role is an opportunity to make a key contribution, working across business units to develop unique customer and prospect experiences that drive business impact. The ideal candidate must be a results-oriented marketer that gets things done- a roll up your sleeves type of person. The role will require proven ability to effectively work and collaborate with cross-functional internal teams, including sales, marketing and operations, as well as external partners and vendors.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Build strategic marketing plans that incorporate various field / regional events, programs and campaigns designed to contribute to annual pipeline goals and support sales achievement of revenue objectives.
Execute on public sector marketing strategy- define, project manage and execute to event program goals, messaging, tactics, audience generation/email campaigns, speaker plan, collateral, on-site execution, post-show leads processing & follow-up, and other logistics.
Monitor and facilitate lead funnel management across all activities, and report program results to all stakeholders.
Oversee inventory, maintenance and distribution of regional event properties, promotional items and collateral for sales & field events.
Work closely with strategic field alliance and technology partners to build joint marketing programs and execute co-branded tactics that support public sector strategy and annual revenue goals.
Effectively work cross-functionally with teams across Okta to include field and inside sales, marketing, operations, alliances, PR, legal, and procurement to efficiently and effectively execute plans and achieve goals.
Clearly communicate public sector marketing strategy, activities, goals and outcomes to all stakeholders, as well as other internal cross-functional teams.
Minimum REQUIRED Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Demonstrated experience in program, event creation and campaign management to include measuring and reporting of success metrics/business impact.
Ability to plan strategically while also executing tactically
4-6 years of experience marketing to State & Local Government IT audience.
Experience planning and co-marketing with strategic reseller, distribution and or technology partners.
Budget Management to include all aspects of pre-event procurement and post-event reconciliation.
A proven track record of complex event programs with varied stakeholders, multiple product lines, and representing various cross teams within the organization.
Project management including budgets, venue selection, vendor sourcing and management, project plan, event show flow, promotion and registration, content development, on-site management.
Master of multi-tasking, prioritization, and timelines
Experience with sales and marketing automation systems – Salesforce and Marketo, preferred Clari, Demandbase, a bonus
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Thrives in rapid growth, fast paced environment and adapts well to change
Ability to work independently with minimal direction
Team player with a positive attitude.
Some travel will be required
Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Assistant Manager Trainee / Entry Level / Full Time / Paid Training
Job Description:
Job Description
Professionals with customer service experience are wanted to fill our Management Trainee position.

We are currently accepting applications from individuals with experience working in customer service, customer relations, and customer support to work as part of our team.

Management Trainee will receive training to ensure they have all the skills and knowledge that they require to be successful in this high energy industry. We are seeking candidates that are outgoing, personable & comfortable working in a team environment with a focus on customer satisfaction and professional development.

Team-based training sessions ensure that each person in our company has the opportunity to learn from our top representatives. We promote growth from within and encourage our team to work together to reach client & customer goals and improve skills.

Specialized training will prepare individuals to work with customers to provide a unique and pleasant sales experience, which fosters acquisition of quality customers and long term customer loyalty.

Job Description/Responsibilities:
Contribute to a positive & energetic environment
Maintain professional standards in marketing, sales & customer service
Customer interaction to promote products & services
Participate in daily training sessions & campaign meetings
New account acquisition & customer retention
Interact with customers daily to review current promotions, provide service quotes and sign on new accounts
Conduct credit checks for potential customers
Work strategically on a lead-based sale campaign
Paperwork & lead disposition as needed
Qualifications
Desire to participate in professional development and take on new responsibilities
Self-motivated and comfortable working both independently and as part of a team
Customer service or customer relationship experience
Ability to perform at a high level in a fast paced environment
Reliable transportation is required!
In the previous years we have been able to provide exceptional training for customer service, marketing, and sales management and we have expanded to multiple locations nationally. We continue to train within our company to maintain the values and integrity that have allowed us to become one of the fastest growing outsourced providers for consultative customer sales in our market. We are currently hiring representatives to work and expand our client's campaign in the Charlottesville market.

Position Benefits
Competitive Compensation- Weekly Pay
Merit Based Advancement
Exciting Bonuses & Incentive Plan
Company Events
Fun Work Environment
For immediate Consideration, Submit Your Resume Today!!
Company Description
Who is Opus?

We are a collective of innovative minds who are always looking to be on top of market changes. We use research-based, experiential marketing to create brand-awareness, consumer loyalty, as well as produce customized campaigns that boost acquisitions, while our clients focus on their core expertise.

Our Vision:

Our goal and vision is to elicit return business for our clients, growth for our company, and professional advancement for our team by embracing the creativity and teamwork necessary to help clients branch out into new markets.

All of this is possible with Opus due to the development of expert marketing managers who are efficient with clients and consumer acquisitions, and who build long-lasting relationships, which result in growth for our clients.

Opus is an in-store marketing company that represents leaders in home entertainment, inside some of the largest retailers in the world.

Likewise, we are passionate about delivering quality and results, for both our customers and clients.

We value teamwork within our agency and strive for great partnerships across all platforms.

Aspen Aerogels is the global leader in aerogel technology. The companys mission is to enable its customers and partners to shape their own strategies around the global megatrends of resource efficiency and sustainability. The companys Cryogel® and Pyrogel® products are valued by the worlds largest energy infrastructure companies. The companys Spaceloft® products provide building owners with industry-leading energy efficiency including options for a safe, non-combustible fire rating. The companys strategy is to partner with world-class industry leaders to leverage its aerogel technology platform into additional markets. Headquartered in Northborough, Mass., Aspen Aerogels manufactures its products at its East Providence, R.I. facility.

SUMMARY: The Regional Marketing Manager will support the regional sales team by closely coordinating collection of, contribution to, assembly of, and training of regionally focused marketing activities. The position is located in Northborough, MA and will primarily ensure best practices are implemented in prospecting, meeting preparation, lead capture, and lead follow up with the sales team. The regional marketing associate will also support regional customer facing events in coordination with the marketing team.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coordinate ongoing support of the regional sales team to ensure best practices in sales effectiveness are practiced, monitored, and optimized in pursuit of company targets.
Host regular calls / meetings to ensure best practices including prospecting, pre-call planning, contact building, meeting preparation and post meeting follow up are adhered to.
Coordinate with Sales & Marketing team to identify, coordinate and analyze goal driven campaigns for a range of segments.
Manage lead flows and interact with prospects and leads across a range of technology platforms.
Identify, qualify, and capture new leads in existing and emerging markets for the regional sales team.
Support identification, capture and validation of value propositions, collaborate internally to maximize impact of benefits through training and value reinforcement with the regional sales team.
Ensure that sales support tools are implemented and feedback captured and reported to maximize utilization and effectiveness.
Support identification and publication of regional social media contributions.
Identify & support execution of regional events including, training workshops, customer roadshow events, conferences, exhibitions, customer days.
Support the company brand / presence at customer, contractor, partner, and distributer sites.
Complete research projects to support regional strategy and goals. Contribute to planning, reporting, and budgeting cycles.
Work with Field Sales team to support their meetings and opportunities by researching new and existing opportunities and customers as needed.
Provide day to day support for forecasting, pipeline management, and report generation for the regional sales team as required.
Participate in sales visits with field sales (two trips per quarter minimum).
Performs other related duties as assigned by management.
Adopt and follow Aspens core values of Safety, Quality, Integrity, Teamwork, Customer and Innovation on both a personal and professional level.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
This job has no supervisory responsibilities.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong listening skills, ability capture situational information, develop needs and implication through a variety of interactions.
Strong verbal/written communication skills.
Ability to speak articulately about technical matters.
Ability to multi task and work under tight deadlines.
Sound worth ethic and positive attitude towards customer service.
Energetic self-starter, ability to anticipate key needs.
BS or BA or equivalent experience.
2-5 years experience.
Travel 10-15%
Experience with CRM such as Salesforce.com essential.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and related products.
Technical knowledge of Oil and Gas and/or Power Generation Markets a plus.
Aspen Aerogels is taking every measure to protect our employees and visitors during the Covid-19 situation.

Aspen Aerogels, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

Aspen Aerogels, Inc. is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to jlosordo@aerogel.com or call (508) 466-3111 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Requisition ID: 4838

Built on talent, technology, and trust, Grace is a leading global supplier of catalysts and engineered materials. The company’s two industry-leading business segments—Catalysts Technologies and Materials Technologies—provide innovative products, technologies, and services that enhance the products and processes of our customers around the world. Grace employs approximately 3,900 people in over 30 countries.
Job Description
This role will support growth and profitability of key regional market segments, in line with the business objectives. This person will manage regional marketing efforts and coordinate the regional lead generation and management activities. The individual will assist the Senior Manager, Regional Marketing in connecting with regional sales, technical teams and product managers to implement global business segment programs. This role will report into the Senior Manager, Regional Marketing.
Assist in the development and implementation of regional marketing programs to drive further demand in alignment with the overall global segment goals.
Manage customer facing events, including tradeshows, seminars and lunch and learns, along with the marcom team
Execute regional campaigns, programs, and specific content in support of the global marketing strategy
Run digital marketing campaigns and reporting analytics
Deploy programs to close pipeline gaps in targeted segments and accounts
Collect and report on regional industry market intelligence
Develop and execute a proactive feedback loop between global marketing and commercial teams
Assists in sales enablement - To provide sales promotional tools; ensure efficient and timely information flow
Manage the regional marketing budget
Travel Requirements: Up to 25% travel (majority domestic)
Required Skills
