Job Title: Event Coordinator

Location: New York City

About inMarket

inMarket is the leader in digital advertising and predictive location solutions that help brands sense and respond to consumer needs in real-time. Since 2010, inMarket has helped thousands of brands leverage SDK-derived, opt-in consumer data to better understand who consumers are, why they make decisions and how best to reach them.

With inMarket's suite of solutions, brands can better understand consumers, activate real-time digital advertising in the moments that matter and generate better campaign attribution.

inMarket's Moments solution drives an average of 5x the performance of traditional digital media and was a key factor in winning Best Mobile Marketing Platform at the 2019 Digiday Awards. inMarket, headquartered in Los Angeles, has offices in Atlanta, Bentonville, Chicago, New York and San Francisco. For more information, visit www.inmarket.com.

Job Description

InMarket is looking for an experienced and creative Event Coordinator to join our team. As an Event Coordinator at our company, you will be responsible for organizing and coordinating our tradeshow and local event efforts.

We are expecting you to be very well-organized and competent in vendor management. Communication skills, good time management and attention to detail are a must!

Duties
Lead industry sponsorships, partnerships and events presence
Plan and organize local events including sales dinners, training and meetings
Manage event requirements and operational details of each event including booth, show logistics, meals, staffing and attendance and budgets
Manage and oversee event budget and planning process
Negotiate with vendors to achieve the most favorable terms
Evaluate event's success including leads, sales qualified leads and conversions
Event Management requirements and qualifications
Requirements
1 - 2 years of experience as an event coordinator or similar role
Portfolio of successful events
Proficient in MS Office
Excellent vendor management skills
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on company's success
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Team player
Good time-management skills
Great interpersonal and communication skills
Degree in hospitality management, public relations or relevant field is preferred
Benefits Summary
Competitive salary, stock options, flexible vacation
Medical, dental and Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Company Matched 401(k)
Unlimited PTO (Within reason)
Talented co-workers and management
Agile Development Program (For continued learning/professional development)
Paid Paternity & Maternity Leave
inMarket is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

DAYBREAKER IS CREATING AN ENTIRELY NEW GENRE OF EXPERIENCE. We are dancers, artists, producers, musicians, poets, community builders and curators who produce events that bring local and global communities together in ways they never have before. Our experiences allow guests to express themselves through movement and dance, connect authentically, get sweaty, be creative, get inspired, and start their day off with energy and intention.

Need to experience it for yourself? Check this out: https://vimeo.com/146402615

This one too: https://vimeo.com/149991243

And if you're feeling lucky: https://vimeo.com/154125428

THE ROLE //

As a member of the Daybreaker team, you will be welcomed into our global family of epic humans, dedicated to spreading love and mischief around the world. We like to think of each Daybreaker event as a "love bomb" that explodes onto the city as the sun rises, and inspiring people to live with positivity, opens,shift their perspective.

As a Daybreaker Event Producer & Community Catalyst (we'll call you a "Producer" for short), you are the face of Daybreaker in your city! That means you will be the face of Daybreaker in your city, responsible for building an engaged and passionate community, producing mind-blowing experiences, and promoting the events to relevant audiences. You will be supported by the hardworking Daybreaker HQ team, who will coach and train you to be the best Producer you can be. We’ll provide you with the skeleton of what you need to produce Daybreaker events, grow your community, and uphold the global brand. It’s up to you to bring the hustle, passion, and creative zeal to create unique and refreshing events that participants will love. You'll be in charge of finding venues, sourcing talent and performers, cultivating a volunteer production team, coordinating with vendors and sponsors, creating local partnerships, and producing monthly events. We’ll provide marketing, communications, operations, branding, sponsorship, financing, and PR support so that you can concentrate on creating experiences that participants will never forget.

This is a paid part-time role, approximately 10 hours per week.

Requirements

The ideal Producer should live a healthy, conscious lifestyle. You should have a big heart and love dance music. You should be detailed and hard-working — a savvy and competent professional. You should be active in the startup/tech industry, the health & wellness world, and/or local arts & culture community. You should have a big network of millennials you can tap into, already be leader in your community, and know how to produce a great event start-to-finish that immerses people and transcends the commonplace. Ideally (but not required), you are a Burning Man participant. :)

YOU'LL NEED //

+ An entrepreneurial mindset and independent approach to your work — you should be an organized self-starter

+ Several years of large-scale event production experience

+ A strong network of influencers, creatives, doers and people who say YES to amazing experiences

+ Phenomenal community-building background — you should be a natural organizer of people

+ Cultural savvy in your city — you should be plugged into the local arts + music scene in your city to know what's cool and who's talented

+ A flexible schedule

+ A big heart, a clear mind, and a voracious appetite for all things that surprise and delight

Benefits

+ Insights and hands-on coaching on experience design, event production, brand management, and community development -- all best practices that have grown Daybreaker into a global movement

+ Access to a global network of artists, DJs, and musicians who are excited to participate and add to the experience

+ Collaborate with an international community of amazing Producers committed to the Daybreaker movement and creating unique experiences around the world — you can consider these folks your new global family

+ Monthly strategy sessions with Daybreaker co-founders and serial social entrepreneurs Radha Agrawal and Matthew Brimer

+ Invitations to exclusive events such as art exhibitions, underground dance parties, startup mixers, family dinners, and mindful experiences

+ Local and global support from our PR team, who has landed Daybreaker major features in leading publications like The New York Times, GQ, and The Washington Post.

+ A portion of proceeds from tickets sales at each event

If this sounds like your dream job, and you're serious about the role, then we would love to receive your application. We're excited to chat with you!

Reliable

Attentive

Service with the smile

Passion

Always Have Fun

Summary:

The Event coordinator will be responsible for selling catering, coordinate sales force required and selling events for all restaurant venues part of Graspa Group.

Our events occur both on and off site, and the Event Coordinator will have the responsibility of managing all events for the organization. The Event Coordinator oversees all aspects of event planning and management, including internal and external events.

A successful candidate will be extremely organized and be able to manage the logistics of multiple events simultaneously. Responsibilities for the Event Coordinator include meeting with clients to work outeventdetails, plan with the client, scout and book locations, food, entertainment, staff and cleanup. The Event Coordinator also creates event proposals and presenting proposals to prospective clients.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Coordinate, plan, and facilitate all details for catering and group parties booked at our restaurants.
Prepare signage and menu items for all banquet events function.
Processes all business correspondence within acceptable time limits. Creates proposals, contracts and other business- related documentation as required. Manages and maintains account files.
Promptly respond to all inquiries.
Attend and supervise events.
Correspond with potential customers providing any requested information or collateral concerning menus, special requests, billing details.
Conduct efficient and professional site inspections.
Up-sell all aspects of catering and restaurant events to include: specialty menus, receptions, breaks, breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
Competencies:
Excellent computer skillswith experience in Word, Excel, Power Point & Outlook.
Possess strong skills in multi-tasking to successfully handle multiple assignments.
Excellent listening skills.
Exceptional detail in follow-up.
Enjoy a team sales approach and able to work with diverse group of team members
Prior experience working in a hospitality environment.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Strong customer service and problem solving skills
Professional demeanor
Enjoy asking for business
Strong qualifying and closing skills
Supervisory Responsibility

This position is responsible for the performance management and hiring of the employees for catering events.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position, schedule may vary depending on business needs. Some holidays, weekends and night shifts may be required.

Required experience:
Catering Sales: 3 years experience preferred.
Required languages:
English
Spanish

Job Description
HqO is a fast-growing company that is revolutionizing the commercial real estate industry by better connecting landlords to their building tenants. We help landlords enable tenant experiences that surprise and delight through software, provide them with data to drive decisions, and ultimately increase the value of their assets. At HqO, each and every person plays an important role in shaping the future of our company and the industry itself. Join us as we empower the real estate companies to provide incredible experiences and build a stronger community for their tenants.

We’re excited to grow our team and have lots of opportunities for career development, so if you’re passionate about what you do and want to work in a fun and growing industry, join us!

The Event and Field Marketing Manager a fast-growing and fast-moving marketing team and take become the face of the company at marketing events. This person will be tasked with creating impactful, memorable event and trade show activations that drive response and enable our organization to grow. Along with managing our brand presence at events this person its comfortable developing content and outreach that highlights HqO’s value proposition, a critical component of partnering with sales development teams to aid their pre-event and post-event outreach, The right candidate will possess the ability to prioritize workload, be decisive, pragmatic, and thoughtful with every task. They’ll work closely with the customer team to find and create exceptional and memorable event experiences that also generate pipeline for HqO.

Key Responsibilities:
Own existing regional and national field marketing plans and develop them over time by adding events that speak to our target buyers
Research and build a targeted event marketing plan composed of regional events, partner event opportunities, as well as industry events and trade shows organized by media partners and trade organizations in our space
Coordinate and support all aspects of event management and production.
Develop multi-channel plan for event promotion, including partnering with social team to develop pre event social strategy and sales to provide in-depth attendee data.
Ideate inventive brand activations to encourage conversations and demos at booths.
Develop speaking and panel opportunities for leaders to speak at industry events and trade shows.
Forecast, monitor and analyze event campaign effectiveness, and ability to pivot strategy based on performance.
Coordinate pre event logistics planning and communication.
Management of promotional materials, including branding inventory, pop-up signs, and miscellaneous sales and marketing collateral.
Support on-site event execution, including booth set up, and expectations for team roles.
Ensure lead data is clean for sales team follow up.
Budget management.
Cultivate relationships across teams and vendors.
Qualifications:
5 years of Field Marketing or B2B events planning experience.
Excellent communication skills, including writing and proof-reading skills.
Fantastic customer service ethic and high expectations for quality.
Enthusiasm for data-driven marketing strategies.
Experience supporting an enterprise sales organization
Be a great team player, willing to roll up their sleeves.
Project management skills with meticulous attention to detail.
Desire to develop new skills, grow professional network, and contribute to company goals.
Flexible and adaptable, self-starter, able to execute with minimal guidance in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment.
Role involves travel to events throughout the year, roughly one trip a month.
Embody HqO’s values:
Learning

Excellence

Toughness

Speed

Goodness

Ownership

Understand objectives, communicate effectively, and are machines when it comes to owning budgets, developing timelines, and maintaining expectations
Manage budgets, schedules, deliverables, and overall project organization

Job Description

The Special Events Planner position entails a variety of outreach to the community, diverse organizations and trade groups in order to book, plan and execute events for both the restaurants as well as the sports and entertainment venues in Compass Arena. This individual will work closely with the Sports Director and the Restaurant Operations Director by communicating clearly the customer’s needs/requests. The ideal candidate for the Event Planner is a dynamic, assertive and creative-minded person that is responsible for overseeing the event planning process. Qualified candidate must possess outstanding customer service skills, a high level of professionalism and a desire to handle all booking, planning and administrative details for the event.

Responsibilities

Required, but not limited to:
Booking large conventions and corporate events such as concerts and sporting events as well as smaller, personal events such as birthdays, weddings and christenings
Communicate and correspond with clients in a timely fashion
Work with clients to select food & beverage catering options
Coordinate and monitor event timelines and ensure deadlines are met and with no overlapping
Work within company software for attendee registration and management
Manage e-mail correspondence both internally and externally
Create and manage inventory of marketing materials (brochures, giveaways, banners, etc.)
Support team members on the execution of all event initiatives
Take control of resolving problems and continuously improve development and efficiency processes
Build long-term relationships with new clients and continue to maintain relationships with current and prior clients
Create and monitor required materials and services for events; confirm shipping and delivery arrangements for all materials with training and marketing.
Assist the business partners in implementing project ideas and reservations
Candidate Skills
Experience with planning and executing successful events, while managing event teams, deadlines and budget goals.
Outstanding project management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects with tight time schedules
Proactive in building and managing leads for new events
Innovative and creative problem-solving skills
Anticipate customer’s needs by being proactive with all communication
Ability to create order from chaos; must be organized
Resourceful with a drive to innovate, create and exceed expectations
Adventurous, high-energy personality and positive attitude
Proficient with technology, especially Microsoft Office Suites
Compass Arena is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.

Commission

Are you ready to get out there and make your mark? Turn your drive and ambition into a lucrative and rewarding career with a global organization. Join our team at marcus evans!

We are a worldwide leader in the Business Information field, presenting over 1,000 strategic conferences and summits around the world each year. We are currently seeking intensely motivated and passionate individuals to serve as Event Producers with our Chicago-based conference division.
You will research, interview experts, learn industry, write copy, invite speakers and author marketing and sales strategy within the Capital Markets, Financial, Pharmaceutical, Medical Device, Healthcare, Legal, Government, Technology, Oil and Gas, and Energy sectors.
We will provide you with comprehensive ongoing training to familiarize you with our products and event production process as well as with all aspects of the sales, marketing and event management process. From there, your success will be driven by your personal motivation, persistence, and ability to connect with industry experts and clients.
If you want to build a career in learning new industries, making industry connections that will last a life-time, interviewing senior executives for a living, pitching ideas or stories, writing, project management, leading marketing and sales strategy and bettering the industries we serve, then producing prestigious events for an elite global brand like Marcus Evans is the place to launch you career.
We offer one of the highest compensation models in the industry, and your initial annual earnings should average $40,000 to $45,000. You will also find ample opportunity to advance within our company and even to relocate to various global locations. If you thrive on fast-paced, results and deadline-driven challenges and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you. Apply today!

Job Description:
Job Description
No Experience Necessary.

The first step on the career ladder?

Climb all the way to the top when you join our busy successful sales team based in Savannah. We are looking for people for our Customer Service/Sales openings in our Sales & Marketing Company due to recent expansion and new client campaigns.

About Us:

We are a leading Sales & Marketing Company based in the Savannah and we work on developing promotional campaigns for some of the Country’s most recognizable names in our field. This is a unique opportunity for self-motivated individuals who have the affinity for working with people and working to high standards.

Successful candidates have the opportunity to be involved with:
Customer Service
Business Development
High Brand Clients
Trainee Management Program
What we offer:
Full product training
One on One Mentoring
Career Progression and Development
Travel Opportunities
What we are looking for in our new team members:
Great people skills
The ability to work as part of a team
Good communication skills
Good time management
A professional image and attitude towards customers and clients
Whatever your background, no matter what experience you do or do not have, we will consider any applicants who can prove they can work as part of a dynamic team, contributing to a fast expanding sales/customer service environment.

Send your resume via the online system, remembering to attach name number or email or else your application will not be reviewed.
Company Description
Sparks Worldwide is an outsourced experiential marketing firm. Sparks Worldwide started with five highly motivated individuals that understand the clients goals and more importantly the opportunity provided likeminded individuals work together to achieve a common goal. Since expanding here to Savannah, GA in April 2019 we’ve grown to 30+ and people and are looking to continue expanding into multiple markets through our enthusiastic ideas.

Lincoln Military Housing – A company for Growth and Opportunity!
Lincoln Military Housing was formed in 2001 through a Department of Defense (DoD) contract with parent company Lincoln Property Company. Our mission has always been to increase the quality of military housing for our nation's service men and women. Lincoln Military Housing now provides more than 36,000 family homes for military members across the US. Our Team Members are passionate about the work they do and take pride in our mission of providing our military families with exemplary service in a quality home environment.
When you join the LMH team, you will be working amongst a team of talented and passionate individuals while being provided with unparalleled opportunities for personal and professional development and career growth. Every day with LMH, you have the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of our service members and their families by demonstrating our core values of INTEGRITY, COMMUNICATION, EMPOWERMENT, RESPECT, BALANCE, and COMMITMENT.

A Day in the Life of an Event Coordinator:
As a Lincoln Military Housing Event Coordinator, you will plan, create, coordinate and host events and programs for residents that build connections within their community, create memories for the family, and provides rewarding experiences and opportunities Your position is responsible for effectively producing high quality and well planned events and managing all aspects of the event planning process. Your role requires strong organizational skills, self-starter with high energy, ability to travel to various locations within the region and deliver on our mission of providing exemplary service in accordance with Lincoln Military Housing’s customer satisfaction standards.
Your Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
Event Planning- develop and coordinate all phases of the event planning process (research, design, planning, coordination, and evaluation) with delivering quality and creative.
Event Management – ability to manage and execute multiple events simultaneously. This includes but not limited to timelines, production schedules, risk assessment, creative design, vendor/venue management, event team coordination, and logistics management.
Event Production Coordination – responsible for executing on and off site events including but not limited to event team coordination, event set-up, day of hosting, event and risk brief, managing logistics throughout the event, and event tear down.
Budgets and Contracts - oversee, review, and process assigned accounting and financial matters based on assigned event budgets. (i.e. processing invoices in Payscan, MEC’s/IEC’s, PAF’s, PO’s, requesting quotes from vendors).
District Support- support District Teams within the event planning process to ensure the success of the event experience and entire planning process.
Marketing Coordination- develop, design, and create effective and comprehensive marketing plans and materials to market events and programs (i.e. flyers, website content, social media content, newsletters, banners, posters, email, event photography, event registration management).

Job Description:
This is an AmeriCorps position. After acceptance, you will also be required to complete an AmeriCorps application.

Objective/Summary:
The focus of the Operation and Event Coordinator is Camp DREAM's land, facilities and operation (which includes events). The member will develop and attend to all of the functions and operations of the property, a 50+acres rustic camp located in Fletcher, VT on the shore of Metcalf Pond and including a 4000+ square foot lodge .

Essential Functions:
Live onsite at Camp DREAM in Fletcher, VT to provide daily stewardship and neighborhood presence (at least 70% of term including at least one night per week and full time residence from May-August).
Maintain and improve trails and facilities at Camp DREAM (garden, trails, landscapes, and buildings).
Complete ongoing building projects and facility upgrades (requires moderate building competency).
Secure new supplies and equipment for camp programs and facility offerings, while maintaining current inventory.
Organize, support and lead volunteer days and work projects.
Organize, support and lead neighborhood and community events.
Develop and assist in executing programming for Camp DREAM's roll-out of year-round offerings, including summer residential sessions.
Ability to find comfort and enjoyment serving in the outdoors and in an independent fashion for multiple days in a row.
Other essential activities: complete and submit AmeriCorps paperwork, participate in VYT orientation, complete state of Vermont mandated reporter web-training, attend all mandatory training sessions, meeting and events, participate in community service events and projects, create a community profile, interact with youth and serve as a role model, keep a service journal, participate in supervision, submit weekly time sheets, submit event cover sheets, submit pre/post surveys from interviews with youth participants, compile and submit quarterly progress report, complete VYT evaluations, write newsletter articles, lead a team meeting, plan and implement an AmeriShare presentation, assist with community emergency response, create a legacy manual, prepare end-of-service presentation, and follow all rules.
Have fun, build friendships, and embark on an adventure of a lifetime!
AmeriCorps Program Type: State/National
Classification/Position Type: AmeriCorps Member
Term Type/Length: Full Time, minimum of 1700 hours
Hours Commitment: ~ 40/week, varied schedule
Start date: August 24, 2020

End Date: August 20, 2021

Position type/expected hours of work: This is an AmeriCorps position with a term length designated full time. A minimum of 1700 hours is required by AmeriCorps to receive the end-of-term education award. For successful completion of the service term, DREAM expects an average of 35-45 hours per week of service, through the end-of-term date indicated on the member agreement, with regular evenings and occasional weekend events over the course of the academic year (including quarterly overnight member retreats). During the summer season, regardless of hours completed to date, this position transitions to being onsite at Camp DREAM full time. While there is no maximum hours – DREAM expects members to continue serving 35-45 hours a week until the end-of-term date of their service commitment – DREAM encourages a healthy work/life balance, including taking vacation, lunch time and other time off.

Supervisory Responsibility: This position supports and supervises a network of volunteers.

Work environment/physical demands: This position operates in a professional office environment as well as an indoor/outdoor environment with active children and students. This role uses tools, machinery and other equipment required to maintain our Camp DREAM facilities and property.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee/member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

This position requires comfort working in outdoor environments, regardless of the weather. This position can be very active and frequently requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing. While performing the duties of this job, the employee/member is regularly required to communicate with individuals who talk and hear. The employee/member must occasionally lift and/or move items over 50 pounds. While performing the duties of this job, the employee/member is regularly required to observe and comprehend using vision abilities that include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Travel:
Travel will vary, including picking up needed materials for Camp DREAM and participating in transportation of participants and others for Camp DREAM use.

Required qualifications/experience:
Must be a citizen, national, or lawful permanent resident alien of the U.S.A. due to AmeriCorps requirements.
Be at least 17 years of age at the commencement of service OR be an out-of-school youth 16 years of age at the commencement of service participating in a program
Have a high school diploma or its equivalent OR not have dropped out of elementary or secondary school to enroll as an AmeriCorps participant (and must agree to obtain a high school diploma or its equivalent prior to using the education award) OR obtain a waiver from the Corporation OR be enrolled in an institution of higher education on an ability to benefit basis
Members must agree to the following Criminal History Checks to be performed in order to serve as an AmeriCorps Member: NSOPW (Public Sex Offender) Check, Statewide Criminal Repository Checks (for State of Service and State of Residence), and FBI fingerprint-based Criminal History Check. The member is aware that that their identity must be verified with a government-issued photo ID. The results of these checks will be kept confidential, but could affect eligibility to serve in AmeriCorps.
First aid and CPR certification by the time term begins.
Helpful experience:
Creativity, energy, and an entrepreneurial spirit.
A contagious energy for DREAM’s work.
Experience working in an outdoor environment in all seasons.
A Bachelor's degree or experience on a college campus.
Exceptional communication and facilitation skills with a focus on direct communication.
Current driver’s license, proof of insurance, and clean driving record.
Computer proficiency: comfort with Microsoft Office apps, Google's GSuite and email communication; Salesforce CRM experience a plus.
AAP/EEO Statement: The DREAM Program is an equal opportunity employer and an incorporated 501(c)3 charitable organization. The DREAM Program prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

At will employment: The DREAM Program is an at will employer. Employment with The DREAM Program is voluntary and is subject to termination by you or The DREAM Program at will, with or without cause, and with or without notice, at any time. The policy of employment-at-will may not be modified by any officer or employee.

Terms and benefits:
Living stipend of $14,279.
End of term of service education award of $ 6,195.00 (upon successful completion and exit of term)
Student loan forbearance and interest payments forbearance, if qualified.
Child care assistance, if eligible.
Access to support programs with regard to health care assistance, food assistance, rent assistance, energy assistance, public transportation assistance.
Reimbursements for work-related travel.
Opportunity for professional development.
DREAM gear/uniform provided and required.
Incredible, life-changing experiences!
WHY WE DREAM...
[Visit our website (dreamprogram.org) or see us social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram)]

Our Beliefs
We believe that the opportunity gap is unfair and unjust.
We believe that childhood is a precious part of the human experience and worthy of great investment.
We believe that all children have immense potential to contribute to our society and that lost potential for one is lost potential for all.
We believe that change is possible.
Our Vision
We seek a world in which all children have the opportunities, resources, and relationships necessary to achieve their dreams.

Our Mission
Our mission is to close the opportunity gap for children living in low-income housing.

Cultural Values
We live in the grassroots. We see ourselves as more of a movement than an organization. We value bottom-up development and look to our volunteers for leadership.
We are relationship-oriented. When relationships are done well, they can change the world and build bridges across differences. Relationships are at the center of all we do and are our greatest source of impact, influence, and learning.
We value transparency. We are an open organization and invite all to participate in decision-making. We see honest communication as the foundation for creating trust and understanding.
We like to play. We sing, surprise, act spontaneously, play games, and imagine. We see potential for something magical in every interaction. We think play is the ultimate vehicle or delivering our services.
We think the high dive is fun! Positive risk-taking plays a crucial role in development. By pushing our comfort zones, we broaden our world views and expand our options.
We think anything is possible. Call us naïve...wait a minute, don’t do that! Just join us!

Position: Donor Relations & Events Manager

Salary Grade: 5

Position Class: Learned Professional

Supervises: N/A

Reports to: Chief Development Officer

FLSA: Exempt

JVS is a non-profit, non-sectarian agency. Our mission is to empower individuals from diverse communities to find employment and build careers and to partner with employers to hire, develop and retain productive workforces. JVS provides a broad range of services including adult education, skills training, job readiness training, job placement and support, and access to post-secondary education. JVS assists employers in their search for well-qualified job applicants and their initiatives to upgrade the skills of their incumbent workforce.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Donor Relations & Events Manager will have a critical role in supporting the growth and strength of JVS Bostons donor base. Responsibilities include donor cultivation and stewardship as well as event strategy and implementation. The Donor Relations & Events Manager will be responsible for supporting the growth of relationships with donors, current and new, by managing a portfolio of current mid-level donors and creating custom cultivation and solicitation plans for each. Will also manage JVS Giving Society leveraging it to move pipeline donors and prospects toward increased support. The Donor Relations & Events Manager will also be responsible for processing all contributions, including coordinating with accounting, issuing gift receipts, preparing acknowledgements, maintaining and managing data and donor records, and preparing various reports for the CDO and Board.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Donor Relations

· Lead the vision and implementation of a robust, year-round stewardship and cultivation plan and calendar that meaningfully engages donors at all giving levels. This includes working with the CDO and Communications Manager to envision highly-customized engagement materials and experiences for top donors, as well as customizing messaging for the broader donor base.

· Manage a portfolio of at least 25 mid-level donors and 25 major gift pipeline prospects.

· Collaborate with Development Team members on deepening specific funder relationships in order to elevate giving, including individuals, foundations and corporations.

· Manage JVS Bostons donor database, and possess an aptitude for data analysis that helps to leverage the information we track to effectively engage our donors and prospects in a timely fashion.

Events Strategy

· Develop event vision and strategy for engaging new audiences and current donors more deeply. Define priorities and work closely with the CDO to create an events strategy as a critical component to annual planning.

· Set ambitious goals for each event cultivation event with clearly defined qualitative objectives and quantitative goals.

· Create an annual events calendar. This includes the Annual Elevate Gala as well as multiple donor cultivation events or unique donor opportunities throughout the year.

· Develop and share processes and systems for executing high-quality donor cultivation events. Adopt best practices for event planning and execution, such that we build upon our successes and continue to refine execution.

Event Management

· Lead vision for and manage a successful engagement plan at events for new audiences and current donors, to inspire them to begin, continue or elevate their support for JVS Boston. Recognize that the purpose of these events is to cultivate new relationships and more deeply engage current donors to develop lifelong relationships with JVS Boston.

· Create a robust pre-event, day/night-of, and post-event follow up plan that maximizes our opportunity to request and receive funding from participants, ideally within three-months of the events conclusion.

· Serve as the lead for all donor cultivation event logistics in order to produce high-quality and engaging events for prospective donors and critical audiences.

· Serve as lead JVS Staff member to our event consultants, working in partnership to manage the preparation and execution of the Annual Elevate Gala.

· Collaborate with Gala and host committee members. Facilitate, support and lead host committee member towards creating impactful and successful events.

MINIMUM SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS (REQUIRED):

· 3+ years of development and/or events work experience in a fast-paced, high-capacity work environment with demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to changing priorities.

· Proven track-record of closing gifts of $1,000 - $9,999.

· Demonstrated, strong ability to build strong, long-term partnerships and trust, with internal and external stakeholders.

· Exemplary verbal, written and oral communication skills.

· Able to seek creative solutions to challenging situations. Open to considering different perspectives, being flexible to absorb information and adjust plans quickly when appropriate.

· Exceptional organizational and project management skills. Able to self-direct and prioritize among competing goals to create manageable work plans and initiate process improvements. Strong achievement orientation with exceptional time management skills.

· Proficient in Excel and Office, experience with Raisers Edge and Salesforce preferred.

· A passion for workforce development.

EDUCATION: Bachelors degree required

KEY COMPETENCIES:

Accountability and Results focused

Adapting to Change

Building Relationships, Collaboration and Teamwork

Cultural Competency and Respect

Communication

Initiative

Planning/Organizing

Promotes Agency

JOB COMPETENCIES

Project Management

Relationship Building

Event Planning

Problem Solving

SPECIAL WORK CONDITIONS

Occasional early morning, evening and weekend hours may be required

Occasional local travel required

JVS CULTURE: JVS is strongly committed to diversity and a workplace environment that respects, appreciates and values employee differences and similarities. By providing and supporting a work culture that fosters and builds upon diversity and its strengths, JVS will better serve our local communities and continue to provide quality services.

JVS is an employment at-will organization and an equal opportunity employer committed to maintaining a work and learning environment free from discrimination on the basis of sex, race, color, religion, national origin, pregnancy, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital/civil union status, ancestry, place of birth, age, citizenship status, veteran status, political affiliation, genetic information or disability, as defined and required by state and federal laws. Additionally, JVS prohibits retaliation against an applicant or employee because he or she has engaged in protected activity under the statutes prohibiting discrimination in the workplace.

About Leap:

At Leap were building a world-class platform to drive growth for emerging brands by developing and operating branded retail stores. On the Leap platform, brands can easily open stores to connect with more customers and drive profitable growth - both offline and online. Branded stores *powered by Leap* deliver impactful and memorable customer experiences while helping brands to capture more customers, data and powerful insights that accelerate product innovation and overall growth. In our first year we've grown to 12 stores for 8 brands across New York City, San Francisco, Chicago and Miami and are set to grow even more rapidly in 2020 and beyond.

Mission for the position:

As a key member of our Brand Management team, the Retail Marketing Manager will work with internal stakeholders such as Leap corporate Retail Ops team members, and field sales / store leaders, and external stakeholders such as brand customer/client leaders, to plan and execute marketing programs which increase visits to brand stores powered by Leap. By strategically deploying structured marketing programs in support of our brands and stores, the Retail Marketing Manager helps to ensure brand stores powered by Leap achieve sales and profitability goals, and build highly engaged local communities around stores and brands on our platform.

Key responsibilities:

Brand Partner & Store Marketing
Build local, national and regional marketing activations, events and partnerships while tracking and ensuring KPIs are met and activations are repeatable and scalable.
Partner with Brand Managers and Store Managers to lead field & event marketing programming pre/post to store openings, including but not limited to event activations, partnerships and community development initiatives.
Lead tracking and analyzing KPIs of marketing program performance and store performance reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Drive communications with the store GMs and associates to ensure promotions, sales and customer loyalty
Implement & drive clienteling & loyalty tools and best practices with the stores team to drive loyalty and lifetime value.
Support the development of brand-centric components of overall retail strategy (i.e. experiential marketing, sales process / content for staff trainings, etc.)
Collaborate directly with Brand Managers and partner brands for regional test & learns that drive traffic to stores (OOH, Email CRM, Digital, Social, Print, Radio, etc)
Competencies & attributes for success:
3+ years experience in retail marketing, field marketing, partnerships, or brand management.
Familiarity with DTC brand space / categories e.g. apparel/fashion and accessories, home goods, etc.
Proficient in managing local activations e.g. promotional event marketing, cross-brand partnerships, etc. including budget and ROI reporting
Basic understanding of DTC space e.g. brand strategy, ecommerce vs. retail, etc.
Working knowledge of digital, social and programmatic CRM marketing channels
Proficient in leading partners in designing & creating digital content & printed collateral
Experience working in a high growth startup (brand or DTC-brand focused platform / SaaS business) is a plus

Ability to remain calm and effectively manage multiple simultaneous tasks in a fast-pace and high-pressure environment.

ABOUT KENDO

Kendo Holdings, Inc. is a San Francisco-based beauty brand developer and wholesaler owned by LVMH Moët Hennessy - Louis Vuitton, the world's largest luxury group. A play on the words can do, Kendo has become the hub of creativity and next generation beauty product development for global Sephora channels and selective retailers outside of Sephora.

A dynamic engine of speed, expertise and market-savvy, the Kendo team continues to redefine the beauty industry through great product, great storytelling, great retail and direct-to-consumer partnerships. Work with cross functioning teams to oversee social media initiatives and international influencer marketing strategies/execution
Manage content calendar for influencer sponsored content and owned social calendar
Manage influencer marketing budget

REQUIREMENTS
4-5 years of experience in principles and practices of social media, event planning, and influencer marketing
College degree or equivalent experience related to Marketing/PR/Events
Passion for beauty/cosmetics; experience in the industry is a plus
Organized, detail-oriented and proactive
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple programs in a deadline-intensive environment
Must be a leader and know how to manage a team efficiently and effectively

Successful Account Managers at ISL are eager to soak up knowledge by working with a variety of teams. They are able to juggle several tasks at once and are detail oriented, proactive problem solvers.

Job Overview


Wargaming is currently seeking a talented, highly motivated, passionate and experienced Regional Marketing Manager to join our team. The Regional Marketing Manager will drive marketing strategy in the Americas and lead execution of integrated marketing efforts to launch & sustain an unannounced F2P GaaS. The role will work with the global brand and the global publishing organization to develop go to market plans for each market in the region and manage cross-functional teams to ensure those plans are executed effectively.

As Regional Marketing Manager, you are the owner of the America's GTM through collaboration with the global brand and publishing teams. This Manager position will be responsible for executing long lead integrated territory specific marketing strategies while maintaining a cohesive campaign in the Americas. Success in this role requires creativity, a deep understanding of audience, media buying and analysis, direct and indirect leadership within marketing and other cross-functional teams, and a focus on ROI for integrated marketing plans. All of this should support engaging audiences while displaying the best our game has to offer.

Reports To


The Regional Marketing Director for North America

What will you do?
Territory Marketing: Create the long lead strategic territory specific go to market plans. The territory specific plans will identify marketing opportunities, challenges and solutions that match the overall strategic vision established by global brand while guiding cross-functional teams in their planning and filling out the complete integrated marketing campaign. The Regional Marketing Manager will collaborate with the Brand Manager in the review of cross-functional team plans to ensure that they stay true to the brand, are appropriate for the audience, and that the brand image remains consistent across all channels of communication across the globe.
Territory Strategy: Define the GTM strategy for the game and its community of players within the confines of what makes sense by territory and region. Utilize the global brand and strategy to create the territory level marketing plans as well as the development of regularly timed and specific campaigns that are data informed and territory centric. This will also support and guide the rest of the territory marketing teams with their specific campaign planning as well as external media, partners, creative, and other agencies where appropriate.
Media Planning: Take a lead role in development of paid media plans. Write media strategy, brief and manage agency through creation of full cycle media plan, in partnership with brand and cross functional marketing. Manage day to day relationship with media agency, providing timely updates, assets & direction, and managing timelines to ensure all milestones are achieved throughout planning and execution phases
Ongoing Business Management: Analyze performance data, including revenue and in-game data, to identify opportunities and challenges, then create strategies to improve results. Conduct ongoing product and competitive marketing analysis within managed territory to ensure consumer and market trends are informing key GTM strategies.
Coaching and Team Development: The Regional Marketing Manager is the Americas lead, coordinating with Brand Marketing and the cross functional marketing teams to ensure a cohesive long lead integrated territory specific strategy & GTM. The Regional Marketing Manager should provide leadership and guidance to the Marketing Team at large related to their game as well as mentor those reporting into them.
What are we looking for?
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, or Business-related field, MBA preferred
Minimum of 5 years of experience in games or entertainment industry Marketing. Preferably, with experience managing GaaS working on live/service based F2P titles for the Americas.
Media planning experience, either on the client or agency side
Demonstrated success in territory specific long lead GTM, creative and media strategies, customer acquisition, performance marketing, analysis and trends, and a broad understanding of related marketing fields
Ability to influence, inspire, and motivate people within the team as well as across the global organization
Hands-on approach to implementation of and strong ownership for the success of campaigns.
Results oriented with high standards for work products
Strong analytical mindset and critical thinking ability
Good creative and aesthetic judgement
Thinks big and is ok challenging the norm
Excellent written and verbal communication
In-depth knowledge of the games and entertainment industries
About Wargaming:


Wargaming is an award-winning online game developer and publisher headquartered in Nicosia, Cyprus. Delivering legendary games since 1998, Wargaming has grown to become one of the leaders in the free-to-play MMO gaming industry with 4500+ employees and more than 20 offices globally. Over 200 million players enjoy Wargaming's titles across all major gaming platforms, including the massively popular World of Tanks and World of Warships.

Working in our company means always having interesting challenges and gaining valuable experience while working with top-class experts.

Take your place among our passionate and experienced team and bring out the best in yourself at Wargaming!

Please see Wargaming Candidate Privacy Policy for details on how Wargaming uses your personal data.

Job Title: Senior Project Lead - Brand Experience, Programming, Apple Music
Job Description:
Posted: Feb 6, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:
200147668
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. You bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.

The Programming team is responsible for Creative Strategy and Project Management of all pitches and live projects delivered by the Brand Experience division for Apple Services. As a Senior Project Lead you will work alongside a group of Producers, Creatives and cross-functional teams to deliver experiential activations, live events, broadcast events and other artist-led projects that form part of broader Apple Music marketing campaigns.

We are seeking a hardworking person who can lead a team environment and wants to be part of a growing organization. This position requires a deep level of knowledge and passion for music and a self-motivated, highly collaborative approach with strong communication and leadership skills.
Key Qualifications
Minimum 10+ years of experience in a Senior Project Management role. International experience preferred.
Proven experience in the delivery of music based experiential campaigns, live events and broadcast events.
Demonstrable experience of working with talent of all levels to program unique events, experiences and shows.
Able to respond and adapt to the needs of a highly matrixed organization and ensure deliverables meet high standard and adhere to business and marketing objectives at all times.
Exceptional attention to detail, while still working under tight deadlines.
Proficient in Keynote, Microsoft Office, Pages and Numbers.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Description
Senior Project Lead across multiple live projects, responsible for the delivery of live events and experiential marketing activations to support the business objectives set with, and by, the Apple Music marketing teams.

A passion for new technologies, innovations and audience trends including immersive experiences, theatre, set build and VR/AR.

Ensure we deliver a consistent pipeline of Industry-leading experiences and activations.

Help to define and lead experiential programming strategy for Apple Music.

Receive, identify and write briefs ensuring all work is part of a clear plan and roadmap, with clearly defined return on investment and project deliverables before work begins.

Partner, engage and collaborate with the Creative and Production teams, other cross-functional teams across the business and external third parties and partners to deliver complex International projects.

Serve as a lead contact for our internal clients and ensure we deliver a high standard of client service and project management at all times. Be an on-site client facing lead at events.

Ensure the whole team follows consistent project management systems which you will set up at the start of each project, including timelines, status / contact reports and other project management documentation.

Set up and lead meetings, ensuring all meetings have a clear agenda, purpose and follow up.

Manage all project deliverables and ensure they are signed off in writing by all clients and partners.

Guarantee that contingency plans and responses are in place to ensure that the team delivers against the objectives set out in the original brief, even when working in changing circumstances.

Take ownership of pitch presentations and decks, working with other team members as the need arises. Regularly update the decks, share and save in a consistent way.

Help to prepare for and run creative review sessions with cross functional teams, pulling together all assets required for an effective project kick off.

Collaborate with teams to integrate the Apple Services ecosystem into event programming plans and campaigns.

This role reports into the Head of Programming.
Education & Experience
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience preferred.

About CyberArk:

CyberArk is the global leader in privileged access security, a critical layer of IT security to protect data, infrastructure and assets across the enterprise, in the cloud and throughout the DevOps pipeline. CyberArk delivers the industry’s most complete solution to reduce risk created by privileged credentials and secrets. The company is trusted by the world’s leading organizations, including more than 50 percent of the Fortune 500, to protect against external attackers and malicious insiders.

Job Description:

CyberArk is seeking a Regional Field Marketing Manager to join our growing Americas team! In this role, you will be responsible for partnering with the Northeast sales teams to develop, execute and measure high volume, cost effective lead generation and nurture programs. You will also work closely with the Global Demand Center to align marketing campaigns and messaging to ensure continued success in new business development and customer expansion. This position reports to the Sr. Manager, Americas Field Marketing, East.

Success in this role will require an analytical mindset, creative demand generation skills, and project management expertise. It also necessitates a proven ability to work with sales, partners and marketing peers across the organization.

Responsibilities:
Develop a regional plan that builds pipeline for enterprise prospects, customers and target accounts.
Build strong relationships with sales to gain market insights and ensure alignment of marketing investments to top sales priorities.
Identify, manage, coordinate resources and measure effectiveness of regional events (CyberArk and industry).
Work with counterparts in Inside Sales to optimize quantity/quality targets for nurtured leads and ensure effective, timely follow up.
Support the development and expansion of our indirect sales channels with effective channel-ready lead programs and strong relationships with counterparts at top tier partners. Identify ways for partners to add to the sales pipeline.
Work efficiently with contracted marketing fulfillment house to ensure timely shipments of event collateral to all field sales events.
Identify digital marketing programs for region and work collaboratively with Digital Marketing Team to implement prioritized opportunities – this could include emails, webcasts, content syndication, digital ads, and 3rd party programs.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required, marketing or business-related degree a plus.
3+ years of combined marketing experience, primarily focused on lead generation and event management.
2+ years of experience managing demand generation, campaign development and execution.
2+ years of experience marketing with channel partners.
Professional B2B marketing experience leading demand generation programs preferably in the information security space.
Proficiency with marketing automation and CRM tools like Marketo and Salesforce.com.
Strong attention to detail.
Data driven and familiar with marketing metrics.
Excellent oral and written communication a must.
Willingness to travel, averaging 20% of time.
CyberArk is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Job Description
High Volume Events Space Now Hiring Restaurant Event and Private Dining Sales/Marketing Manager

Aggressive Commission Based Position

POSITION SUMMARY

The Event Sales and Marketing is the main point of contact for group and private dining sales and events. They are responsible for promoting and marketing the restaurant by building business relationships, booking group and private dining events, and manage a referral program following the marketing plan which maximizes revenues. The Events Sales and Marketing Manager will also be responsible for the execution of private dining events from start to finish.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Delegate Responsible for all functions from organization to execution.
Manage private dining events and ensure excellence in guest satisfaction through effective training and supervision of co-workers assigned to the event.
Driving and increasing sales including generating new business and maintaining contact with present accounts.
Work pipeline of inquiries and Manage business on the books successfully, prospects, tentative and definite bookings.
Identify qualifying business potential, closing business, overcoming objections, negotiating, upselling and understanding the client’s needs.
Handle contracts, negotiations, deposits and final payment of events including account reconciliations as needed.
Create floor plans, custom menus, and general event outlines to present to clients.
Coordinate and complete Banquet Event Orders (BEOs) and update BEOs as needed.
Communicate BEOs on a regular basis with FOH and BOH management teams.
Work with management team to ensure proper scheduling of co-workers for events.
Review menu and wine/beverage selections with GM, Executive Chef to ensure food and beverage are ordered.
Communicate effectively with team to ensure, equipment (such as Audio Visual, power cords, etc.), dinnerware, stemware and glassware, are available for the event and that the setup of rooms (BEOs) are disseminated and executed accordingly.
With the General Manager, review Event Sales budget, along with weekly/monthly/quarterly goals to achieve financial goals.
ADMINISTRATIVE
As needed, assist with taking restaurant phone calls and reservations
Keep detailed, current calendar of events (event name, location, # people, time) in Tripleseat
Phones – make calls to contacts, take lead calls, work to solicit new group business, work with clients on menus, event details
As needed – assist with restaurant duties such as deliveries, phone calls, and attending to guests on the floor
Open Table – familiarization with reservation book, restaurant floor plan, and past history to maximize business opportunities * Develop and use a Customer Relationship Management system including follow up procedures and database management
Maintain goal of creating positive guest experiences every day in the restaurant
Maintain or exceed budgeted sales and profits in restaurant
Act as event sales team leader and primary contact/liaison for event sales with FOH/Operations/Marketing Teams to coordinate/resolve any issues or other projects
HOURS

Position will be required to work a varied schedule that reflects the events’ schedules and may include days, nights and weekends. It is expected that a sales person will be present to greet every client/event – once the event is up and running (approx 30-60 min), if everything is running well, the event can be turned over to event captain. If it is not possible to greet an event, the client and management team will be informed prior to the event, so there is no confusion on point of contact. All salaried employees strive to complete their work in 55 -60 hours per week; a minimum of 50 hours is required. Due to varied events’ schedules and offsite events, some long days or “double shifts” may be required. This position is based in the restaurant. A minimum of 65% of your time should be spent in the venue, with the other 35% of your time spent actively selling at outside sales events – such as networking events, offsite sales meetings, tradeshows, etc. If no outside sales events are scheduled, additional time will be required in the venue to be available for tours, tastings, answering questions about group events, and assisting with onsite sales and marketing duties and restaurant floor time. Event Sales Manager should maintain a presence in the venue as the face of the restaurants, and should be a recognizable person to guests, staff, and clients. Responding to emails and voicemails at home is also expected to ensure quick response time, and high quality of service for all potential clients.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS
Strong interpersonal skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to communicate effectively within all levels of the organization.
Excellent time management skills and ability to handle multiple projects.
Exceptional people skills, must be able to interact with a diverse array of clients and guests.
Demonstrate positive supervision and leadership abilities to motivate co-workers to meet and exceed guest service standards.
Passion for hospitality and guest service excellence.
Ability to work independently and in team settings.
Shows confidence, energy, and enthusiasm with a professional, clean appearance, and a friendly, helpful, approachable demeanor.
Well versed in all processes and positions (FOH and BOH).
Satisfactory physical and mental health to perform the requirements of the job, and to work with the public in compliance with applicable foodservice health and safety regulations.
Able to perform the essential functions of the assigned position with or without reasonable accommodation, and within company policy.
High degree of flexibility and the ability to manage multiple projects with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients and guests.
Knowledge of the sales process.
Capable of multi-tasking, leading and communicating with others, able to express and exchange ideas in spoken and written English in an above average manner.
Working knowledge of basic computer operations and associated software applications required to accomplish job responsibilities.
Strong math skills.
Demonstrate outstanding organizational and time management skills.
Must exhibit the highest level of professionalism in dealing with sensitive and confidential information.
Must be able to work weekdays, weekends and holidays.
Willingness to work an 11-12-hour day.
Possession of food certifications as required by local, state and federal law.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Must be able to operate or use the following: computer, printer, copier, calculator, telephone and writing utensils. Requires good vision and hearing (with corrections is okay). Position requires sitting, handling, eye-hand coordination, walking, standing, stooping, and kneeling. This position will be required to assist with conference set up and exhibiting and/or event execution, which may require the lifting, carrying, pulling or pushing of approximately 21—50 pounds – including, but not limited to tables, chairs, chafers, plates, catering equipment, boxes of menus, collateral, signage, etc. – as well as being on feet for extended periods of time, possibly up to 12+ hours. Office days may also require sitting in an office environment for 8-10 hours to accomplish sales and administrative tasks.

EXPERIENCE
5+ years of current Restaurant Catering/Event Sales Management experience in an Upscale or Fine Dining environment
High volume experience; must have Catering/Event Sales Management experience in restaurants doing over $1-2 million in sales annually
Strong connection of contacts in the [CITY] market is necessary for this position
Outside sales experience required
Computer Skills: Basic familiarity with computers, POS systems (Micros) scheduling software, Tripleseat and any department specific systems in use.

Education: Some college or culinary education beneficial.

Salary: Aggressive Commission and Commensurate Pay Scale

Job title: Event Coordinator

Department: Sales

FLSA status: Exempt

Reports to: Director of Sales

Job Summary:

Inspired by our commitment to excellence, the sales and operations teams at our Company* create unforgettable memories for our guests. The successful Event Coordinator will successfully act as the customer's primary contact after the Sales Manager/Team Manager has closed the sale ensuring continuous customer satisfaction.

Essential Functions:

Event Coordination & Customer Service:
Coordinate the cruise event with the Sales, Food & Beverage, Operations, and Administrative Departments once the sale has been finalized
Act as the liaison between the Company and special order vendors
Develop comprehensive knowledge of product offerings, product extras, pricing and scripting for all standard products

Ensure communication is done in a timely, efficient manner

Service/detail all brides 60 days out and be onsite coordinator the day of the wedding

Administrative:

Coordinate & run the weekly "two-week" meeting-this includes red alerts, reviewing function sheets and producing the final two-week report

Maintain good organizational skills through time management, setting priorities, and accurate paperwork
Accountabilities:

Performance will be measured by internal and external customer satisfaction, departmental tests, management evaluation, and feedback from peers on the city's team.

Job Specifications / qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a discipline related to the work of the position OR equivalent experience
Minimum of one (1) year of previous customer service experience
Minimum of one (1) year related industry experience
Communicate effectively in oral and written form
Maintain high level of organization
Be detail oriented
Handle multiple tasks/projects at one time
Focus on customer needs
Meet deadlines
Establish and maintain effective working relationships as required by job responsibility
Listen effectively, assesses the situation, determine relevant issues, & suggest solutions
Work with Microsoft Office applications (especially Word)
For purposes of this job description only, references to the 'Company' are to the following subsidiaries of Entertainment Cruises Inc.: Premier Yachts, Inc., Mystic Blue Cruises, Inc., Seadog Ventures, Inc., and Spirit Cruises, LLC. You are employed by one of these subsidiaries, not by Entertainment Cruises Inc.
Competitors: Hornblower Cruises and Events, World Yacht

Job Description:
Job Description
Dauntless Marketing is actively seeking a motivated Entry Level Marketing Assistant to work on ground breaking campaigns with an advertising and marketing firm in the local region. This innovative firm was founded by dedicated people looking to push the envelope by using cost-effective marketing campaigns and advertising strategies. Their goal is to provide the same advertising as the standard firm but at a fraction of the price. As a progressive company in the sales and marketing industry, this firm continues to set the standard for excellence in customer acquisition and establishing a repeat customer base for clients. By providing personalized sales and marketing services to some of the largest Clients in the world, this firm continues to increase the market shares of clients through proven sales and marketing strategies.

The Entry Level Marketing Assistant position is a valued team member in the marketing and advertising department. The position is considered entry level to start during training which includes a comprehensive overview of basic marketing strategy, direct advertising, promotional techniques, visual merchandising and consumer market research. After successful completion of the program, an individual would be considered a team lead in the marketing department. The entry level Marketing Assistant reports directly to the Executive Marketing Manager.

Responsibilities:
Assisting in the daily growth and development of assigned campaigns
Assisting with efforts of customer acquisition and retention
Expertly managing the needs of external customers
Developing strong leadership and interpersonal skills
Driving sales through retail promotional campaigns
Build brand recognition through local events and experiential marketing
Strategize, execute and manage along side the Brand Ambassador teams
Interact and communicate with customers
Problem solve and make professional judgment on whether customers qualify for the in-store services that the firm’s clients offer (candidate will be trained in this area)
Conduct lead generation and maintain and develop a client base for our clients who offer the in-store services
Aid marketing and advertising associates and senior staff with specific projects related to each client
Qualifications

The personalized focus of the campaigns is not only a refreshing alternative to more general mass sales and marketing strategies, but it is also responsible for the unprecedented growth and stability of the company. The management team prides themselves on recognizing top performance, integrity, and a winning mindset for continual internal promotions. If you possess a passion for marketing, sales or retail and would enjoy learning how to manage the varying dimensions of a business, this position could be an excellent fit for the right candidate.
Must be able to work full time hours
Ability to excel in unsupervised solo assignments as well as team projects.
Desire to travel at least 1 or 2 weeks a year for further training.
Great communication skills

Self-starter, creative thinker, problem solver

Responsibilities
• Be the on-site leader for Rock Your Profile event activations to ensure we are creating meaningful and memorable experiences for event attendees and representing our brand successfully.
• Manage professional photographers at event activations including briefing, coordinating, scheduling and managing the photography team at RYP events.
• Schedule event ambassadors to attend Rock Your Profile event activations this includes identifying ambassadors, creating a unique booth staff schedule for the event, building and sending event ambassador communications and managing logistics and ambassadors onsite at events.

• Lead select Tier 2 and 3 events by leading all event logistics, placing speakers, managing event collateral/shipping and partnering with various vendors to ensure each event is a success.

• Ability to work across various levels of the organization while building trust and fostering collaboration

• Ability to work well under pressure, with tight deadlines

ENGINE SHOP IS NOT YOUR TYPICAL AGENCY.

We are looking for great people who are passionate about what they do. People who understand the value of hard work, are willing to get their hands dirty and enjoy the process as much as the result. People who love working on a team. People with a make it happen and get it done attitude. People who, no matter what the level, are leaders. No two gears are the same but they all fit together to make an unstoppable machine here at Engine Shop.

Our people are why Engine Shop has been consistently named a "Best Place To Work" by Ad Age and Event Marketer.

WHAT'S OUR STORY

We are an engagement marketing agency with deep roots across sports, entertainment and lifestyle. We integrate live experiences, digital engagement and content to help our clients connect with their consumers. To best serve these clients, all our people are expected to meet Engine Shop's standard of excellence.

But that's not our only focus. Our culture is a part of everything we do from our casual work environments to our creative benefits and our acclaimed annual retreat. It's a part of how we treat one another, how we have each other's backs and how we welcome people who are different.

Engine Shop needs an Account Supervisor who can activate a program/event from start to finish, while being proactive in handling any challenges that they may experience. This person should be an excellent communicator and effective leader who can supervise multiple programs and team members. We are looking for someone who serves high quality service to our clients and ensures that events and programs will run with very little oversight.

FUNCTIONS + RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead day-to-day oversight of multiple programs and team members through proactive planning, program structure development and implementation, effective delegation and coordination of company resources
Facilitate seamless executions by acting as the program lead, working directly with your team to coordinate the show organizer, exhibit company, vendors and any other pertinent parties
Oversee all program communication, including website and collateral materials related to events details, registration, post event surveys, etc.
Contribute ideas and tactics to new business proposals, decks and brainstorms
Can communicate effectively to executive management to provide feedback and results from your programs/events
Provide feedback and guide team members to grow and enhance their roles and responsibilities.


REQUIREMENTS
A talented and seasoned experiential marketing professional with 6+ years of experience developing creative concepts and bring them to life for mobile tours, live events, stage production and guerilla marketing campaigns for brands
Proven experience ideating around creative assignments to develop executable campaigns that drive meaningful consumer engagement with brands
A history of building successful consumer engagements from concept through budgeting, planning, execution and reconciliation
Experience of securing and implementing integrated experiential marketing programs including: permitting, staffing, security, logistics, fabrication, and buildout
Strong writing, presenting, and Excel skills
Additional consideration for candidates with 3+ years of experience in the alcoholic beverage, automotive and/or luxury consumer sectors
Additional consideration for candidates with AutoCAD and Photoshop skill sets
COMPENSATION/BENEFITS
Competitive compensation package including base salary and company bonus plan
Medical and dental benefits
401K + company match
Flex vacation policy


PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORK ENVIRONMENT

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand; walk; sit for extended periods of time; turn the head and torso, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; taste or smell; and have full power of speech.
Occasionally may have to exert up to 10-15 pounds of force to lift, carry, pull or otherwise move objects.
Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

The mission of the United States Air Force Academy (USAFA) is to educate, train, and inspire men and women to become leaders of character, motivated to lead the United States Air Force in service to our nation.

The Center for Character & Leadership Development (CCLD) plays a pivotal role in the USAFA mission by developing, administering, and assessing programs designed to promote leadership and character scholarship. CCLD sponsors the annual National Character and Leadership Symposium (NCLS), USAFAs flagship character and leadership event, each year to bring together distinguished scholars, government officials, military and corporate leaders, and world class athletes to teach and inspire.

Aleut Aerospace Engineering is a certified 8(a) Alaska Native Corporation that manages the Advisory and Assistance Services Contract at USAFA to provide professional technical support to a wide variety of activities. Aleut’s mission mirrors that of USAFA, with an integrity-centric team focused on delivery of exceptional solutions, service, and value.

Position responsibilities may include, but are not limited to the following:
Assist in the planning, management, and execution of the National Character and Leadership Symposium (NCLS)
Assist CCLD personnel in identifying potential speakers, arranging speakers’ travel, transportation, and event registration
Support development, testing, and operation of the Fonteva event registration system
Establish and test all participant registration paths, and obtain approval
Ensure event registration system provides clear information and guidance for participants
Assist with event registration activities, including the processing/welcoming of participants and guests prior to the event
Monitor participant registration, speaker session selections, and venue capacity levels and submit recommendations for adjustments for approval
Review participant data to ensure participation criteria has been met prior to confirming registration
Assist in oversight of the automated event reporting system, and customize reports for specific event teams
Assist in reviewing, updating, and coordinating official invitation list for approval
Upload approved invitation list to the event registration system for automated dissemination
Prepare speaker name badges, welcome folders, itineraries, and disseminate to designated representatives
Assist the program director by updating existing team plans and checklists
