You can use www.workgrades.com to collect and manage your references for free and share them with us or anyone else you choose. Candidates with references are always preferred by our clients. Now is the most important time to stand out from the crowd. We suggest that you ensure you have updated your LinkedIn profile and that you start collecting your references early.
Company Description
Innovation, vision, expertise—all words that perfectly describe the creative talent, marketing and sales professionals, and industry leaders we partner with at Syndicatebleu. No matter your industry or discipline, let us design your perfect match.

Taoti Creative is looking for a mid- to senior level, strategy-oriented PROJECT MANAGER who knows how to get things done (especially when it comes to developing web sites.)

(Sorry in advance for the long read. But this is your career we’re talking about here! It’s worth the extra detail, right? The right fit is critical for both of our sakes, so please forgive us in advance for the verbosity.)

First, a quick blurb about Taoti…

Established in 1996, Taoti Creative is a boutique, full-service creative agency located on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC. We are privately owned and have no corporate overloads (nothing personal, WPP.) We do stuff like web development, social media management, branding, experiential marketing, video, AR/VR, etc. Our mission is to ‘move the needle’ for our clients. We compete (and cooperate) with companies like Huge, Ogilvy, ISL, Chief, ForumOne, etc. We leverage technology, creativity, and innovation to generate meaningful and measurable results for our clients—that’s what drives us. Speaking of clients, they’re about 60% non-profits, 20% commercial, and 20% federal government. Some of our customers include World Bank, USAID, DC Water, Discovery Education, American Chemical Society, Jane Goodall Foundation, and dozens of ‘National Association of _____________,’ etc. Our full time team of about 50 employees is about 65% in-house and 35% remote. We hail from over 12 countries. And for the last three years in a row, we’ve made the Inc5000 list of fastest growing companies in the United States. There’s of course plenty of additional information on our website. If you’ve not done so already, be sure to check out our culture video: https://vimeo.com/289302105. Or if you’re feeling virtual, here’s guided tour of the office in 360 video! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7KkzdmSGTM (Warning: not suitable for printers.)

Now, about the job…

Your job, fundamentally, is to be the project leader and use your wits, brains, creativity, innovation, and any resources available to you to produce great projects and happy clients. You’re the project’s champion who makes it happen. Granted, every project has issues. Maybe that new sales guy undersold it. Maybe the dev team spent all their time watching webinars on how to code instead of actually coding. Maybe the client is simply impossible. Whatever the challenges, it’s your job to deal with the curveballs. (Which is not to say that you have to be responsible for fixing all of them. Some things are beyond your control. But as they say: you need the serenity to accept the things you cannot change, the courage to change the things you can, and the wisdom to know the difference.) There is of course all the typical PM stuff… scopes, schedules, budgets, client communications, etc. These are underappreciated, but important parts of the job. But the PM role at Taoti is far more strategic than at most agencies. Our PMs are the project heroes—the people who dig in, call the plays, and then oversee execution. You have a lot of control of the destiny of the project. You have a lot (some would argue too much) autonomy to just figure things out as you see best using our three core principles as your guiding light: Quality, Innovation, Service and Teamwork. You have access to a “QIST Fund” to do stuff that is ‘out of scope’ but helps move the needle for our clients. That is to say, while you do have dedicated designers and strategists on your team, there’s still the smaller, every day decisions that govern how the project go. Those calls are yours to make. And those are critical… like raising a kid, success doesn’t come in big milestone moments with a lot of fanfare. But constant attention, slight corrective actions, and ongoing encouragement—that’s how you succeed.

Please note: we have gotten a LOT of applications from people wanting to 'switch careers' and trying their hand at managing projects. While we understand and respect that, for this particular role, we are looking for with extensive experience managing web development projects.

The challenges of this role…

Taoti puts out creative work that can go head to head with the biggest and best creative agencies in the world. But we’re doing so with a ~50 person team. So we need to be lean, efficient, and leverage our inner scrappiness to get the job done with fewer resources than what some of the big boys would throw at a project. So that often means wearing multiple hats and pitching in with production resources like UX, creative, IA, devs, etc. We’re not saying you have to be creating designs or banging out code. But you will have a lot of direct exposure to a lot of that stuff, and you’ll learn a lot about those trades—to the point where you can start thinking like some of them. And that’s a good thing.

As with any creative company in the business of doing transformative work, another big challenge is balancing our desire to do the best work in the world with the pragmatic realities of project budgets, scope limitations, client deadlines, etc. We actually have something we call a “QIST Fund” to account for it. QIST (Quality, Innovation, Service, and Teamwork) or our four primary guiding lights that we let try to steer our tough decisions. We allocate $250K/year for anyone in the company to utilize to go above and beyond on a project that otherwise doesn’t have the budget to realize some of the more progressive ideas that we have. So we actually encourage getting creative beyond what a budget allow. That being said, it takes an experienced creative to know the difference between ‘cool for the sake of cool’ and strategic risks which have the potential for big client impact. Keeping our heads in the clouds while keeping our feet on the ground is an art form, and it’s how we move the needle as creative professionals.

Is there room for career growth?

That’s one of the best parts about this role, specifically at Taoti. In a larger shop, the project management hierarchy is usually large, layered, and not-so-flexible. Or at a smaller shop, you may have lots of flexibility, but not enough of a team to really benefit from true collaboration. Taoti is the Goldilocks of creative agencies. We have enough structure so that you understand what the team looks like and where you fit in. But we’re small and agile enough to let employees carve out new roles and niches where it makes sense to do so. Our teams and roles are constantly evolving as the team grows, so if you want to grow into a role that doesn’t exist, you can help create it! Our growth rate alone (targeted at 50% this year) means that the team will keep growing, which means we’ll be hiring additional people across all departments. And our hiring philosophy is all about hiring the next wave of employees that best supports the existing team. In other words, we grow the team around what we already have—not according to some org chart or spreadsheet. So career paths are not rigid and finite. We have a history of shaking things up, making rather bold HR moves, and adapting our hiring processes (as well as the roles of our existing employees) in a way that makes strategic sense for the employee and the company. For example, our VP of sales is now in charge of delivery. A previous creative director ended up mostly in sales. And we’ve created all sorts of new roles for new hires for positions that didn’t exist before, in some cases, creating whole new realms within our team structure. The point is that we’re committed to doing whatever makes the most sense and are agile enough to get away with it. So your career trajectory has far more to do with your own aptitude and initiative than it does with an org chart or who’s above you.

Tips for getting onto the short list…
Stand out. When you apply, make an impression.
Even though we’re a full service agency, we do more than our fair share of web development. So experience with Drupal and/or Wordpress is a HUGE plus. If you’ve got it, tell us about it!
Show—don’t tell—us how great you are.
We can tell a lot by the documents someone creates. Doesn’t matter what it is, but we’d love to see some documents you’ve put together.
Talk to us about your favorite tools.
Give us some insight into your general PM philosophies.
Tell us why you want to work at Taoti, specifically. And what was wrong with your last gig that makes you want to leave?
Show us your passion and energy. We like passion and energy.
What’s the corporate culture like?

Taoti is a pretty casual shop. You can generally wear whatever you want. Lots of telework flexibility. You’ll have access to anyone/everyone in the company, including the CEO. Not only is it okay to question decisions and policy, but it’s part of your job to do so when you see a better way. The team is fun and social. We do a lot in and outside of the office together—from boat trips to happy hours to yoga. There are all sorts of perks and benefits, but culture isn’t about perks and benefits—it’s about a way of thinking. And our way of thinking goes back to the mission: to move the needle. We’re all about doing great work that gets results for our clients. And everything else that we do here, be it fun or work, in some way drives towards that objective. (As one employee puts it, “We’re fun, but focused.” That sums it up pretty well. There are some pictures of the office on the website and our Instagram account: https://www.instagram.com/taoticreative/?hl=en. Always feel free to drop in and see for yourself.

What about benefits?
3 weeks PTO for starters. You gain more with tenure. And if you’re really big in to PTO, you can even trade back some salary for more.
Telework options (which work like PTO… you accrue days with each paycheck. TELE days increase with tenure as well. By your fourth year, we don’t even count them any more.)
100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance. (50% for qualifying dependents.) And we have good insurance.
Paid family leave for men and women (including PTO plus short and long term disability options.)
3% retirement plan matching (plus access to a financial adviser).
Home buyer help (including a $1200 closing credit)
Mobile phone reimbursement
You can opt for a company-supplied PC or Mac laptop. Or if you want to use your own, we’ll reimburse you for it.
Charitable contribution matching
Guaranteed annual raises
Tax-free metro benefits
A legit 40-hour work week (not 60 hours like some shops essentially require)
Money and time off allocated for professional development (also increases with tenure)
A diverse team hailing from over 15 countries last time we checked
A very hip/cool/funky/quirky office space on Barracks Row, in the heart of Capitol Hill. Just 2 blocks from the metro! (With the office space doubling in size next year as we build a new building in the parking lot next door to our building.)
Fun perks like a roof deck, wine/beer always on tap, regular company boat outings (boat is walking distance from the office), chill work environment, etc.
No real dress code (within reason, as long as you can be an adult about getting dressed for work)
Annual global retreat (where we bring the whole team together for fun, games, and teamwork)
Of course, the above is a quick list. Our handbook covers all the gory details.

Next steps…

If you’re qualified and interested, please apply on our website (www.taoti.com/careers.) Please note that these job ads often get placed onto other websites with their own application systems (we’re looking at you Jooble!) And some sites (looking at you Indeed!) have made up random salary ranges. While we do not have a fixed salary in mind, we're shopping somewhere in the $70-100K range based on experience, seniority, and lots of other factors. That's just a range--not a hard limit. But if you're looking for something well into the 6 figures, we're may not be the right fit and don't want to waste your time. Also, please know that once the corona virus stuff dies down, this will be an in-house (most of the time) job. If you don't live in the DC area now but plan to relocate, please make sure you indicate as such somewhere in your application. Otherwise, we're likely to reject because we assume you aren't in our area. We aren't able to respond to applications that don’t come through our own website (Because we use software to manage our hiring process, and without it, it would be the wild west here. So please be sure you’re applying on our website.)

Equal Opportunity Employer

Taoti is an equal opportunity employer and actively embraces building a diverse and inclusive team!

From our founding until now, our mission has remained the same: to remove the engineering burden from data teams by standardizing and fully automating data connectors. With Fivetran, your data just arrives in your warehouse, canonical and ready to query, no engineering or maintenance required. As we watch more and more companies leverage our technology to become truly data-driven, we’re proud not only of our growth but also of the fact that we’ve grown without compromising our core values.

Integrity.
We do the right thing, even when it's harder in the short run. We challenge the status quo by reasoning from first principles.

Initiative.
Fivetran belongs to all of us. We take ownership and are accountable for getting things done. Through curiosity, learning, and coaching, we grow as individuals and teams.

One team, one dream.
We share the pains and successes of our customers, partners and colleagues. We seek, gather, and trust a diverse group of teammates with different perspectives to guide Fivetran's progress.

If these values resonate with you, we’d love to hear from you.



Fivetran is in a hyper-growth stage and excited to be looking for a Field Marketer to help with our marketing goal! As part of the Demand Generation team, you’ll be at the heart of our growing field marketing strategy, connecting Fivetran to customers and prospects in a number of regions and working with our Alliance team to develop partner-focused marketing campaigns. These campaigns will allow us to increase brand awareness and help our sales teams achieve aggressive revenue goals. You’ll define a region-specific marketing plan that supports our sales strategy and meticulously plan, promote, and execute dozens of events as well as account-based marketing tactics throughout the US. The Field Marketing Manager manages the activities and performance of regional marketing budgets and programs to support the field in achieving monthly bookings targets. You can multitask, efficiently communicate, & work cross-functionally with sales, communications, & other sub-teams within Marketing. You are patient with an obsession for organization and a knack for juggling multiple projects at once in a (really) fast-paced environment.

This position is based out of our Oakland, CA or Denver, CO offices
As a Field Marketer at Fivetran, you will:
Execute marketing programs to drive pipeline growth for North America
Collaborate closely with other members of demand gen, product marketing, sales. partnerships and many others included in the process of development, execution, and measurement of field marketing campaigns.
Align the regional field events to support the sales goals for leads and opportunities.
Collaborate with alliances/partnerships team to align programming goals
Leverage analytics in Looker, Salesforce, and Pardot to understand the impact of your efforts
Research, Plan, promote, and host an array field marketing events (tradeshows, conferences, roadshows, executive dinners, webinars, etc.) across the region that capture prospects and help transition them into customers.
Provide onsite event staff/support when needed.
Build out landing pages, emails sequences, and social media plans for Fivetran events
Socialize and get buy-in from SDRs and account executives to promote and drive successful field events and programming
Manage budgets for campaigns, communicate ROI against program objectives
Work closely with sales and marketing leadership to craft Account-Based Marketing strategies for Field Events.
Your Superpowers:
Exposure to B2B SaaS or tech industry, data analytics a huge plus
Familiarity with SalesForce, Pardot, and Looker
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to coordinate across multiple departments.
You have strong stakeholder management skills and are comfortable managing expectations and keeping teams on track
You have an understanding of the foundations of marketing and how events can play a critical part in moving the business forward
Strong project management/organizational skills and the ability to successfully manage multiple initiatives at once.
Self-motivated, able to work autonomously and communicate effectively
Ability to grasp the Fivetran product and personas we are targeting to help shape event strategy and drive content/collateral for each event
Ability to travel (35% per quarter)
Perks of working with us:
100% paid Medical, Dental, Vision and Basic Life Insurance
Flexible PTO
401k match program
Pet Insurance -- and yes, you can bring your well-behaved fur babies to work
Commuter Benefits to help with transit and parking costs
Professional development and training opportunities
Unlimited coffee, office snacks and frequent catered lunches
Company happy hours and fun team building activities

Job Title: Activities and Events Coordinator - College of Education, Early Intervention Training Program
Job Description:
Description:
ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS COORDINATOR
Early Intervention Training Program (EITP)
Department of Special Education, College of Education
University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

The Activities & Events Coordinator will assist with visualizing, planning, coordinating and executing activities and events hosted by the Early Intervention Training Program (EITP) and provide technical assistance related to early intervention professional development opportunities and requirements. This individual works closely with all EITP team members and collaborates effectively with internal and external departments, committees, consultants, vendors, and early intervention stakeholders.

The University of Illinois is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. For more information, visit http://go.illinois.edu/EEO.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

EVENT PLANNING AND COORDINATION
Assist with planning EITP events and activities aligned with EITP contract deliverables, across the regions of the state and throughout the fiscal year.
Anticipate professional development and training needs based upon participation in team meetings, and formal and informal needs assessment data.
Assist with coordinating event dates, speakers, and sites, including audiovisual and catering needs, communicating details and plans to all necessary team members.
Coordinate contract and payment for events with the university business office, consultants and vendors.
Coordinate arrangements and maintain open lines of communication with EITP personnel, partner programs, university personnel as well as external consultants, vendors, suppliers to ensure event success.
Develop and maintain registration websites for all events, and ensure accurate record keeping through event software and registration tools. Participates in regularly scheduled team meetings as requested.
Serve as an integral part of the decision-making process within activities of the Early Intervention Training Program.
Recommend and implement changes based on continual event/activity evaluation and seeks resolution to existing program problems.
Coordinate EITP events and operate within budget guidelines.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND CUSTOMER SERVICE
Serve as a resource person, creates links and acts as a liaison to other EITP personnel, early intervention partners, and community programs.
Serve in the role of customer service to assist stakeholders with questions on early intervention requirements, training needs, and technical assistance issues.
Assist with responding to EITP inquiries and customer service needs via telephone and email in a timely manner.
Assist with supporting stakeholders in accessing and troubleshooting EITPs learning management system, registration system, and virtual learning systems.
Maintain appropriate records and documentation.
Communicates and follows-up on pertinent matters.
QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:

Required: High School graduation or equivalent.

Experience:

Required: Any combination totaling two (2) years (24 months) from the following categories:
Professional work experience in event coordination.
College course work in any discipline, as measured by the following conversion table or its proportional equivalent:
60 semester hours equals one (1) year (12 months)
90 semester hours equals two (2) years (24 months)
Preferred: Illinois Early intervention (EI) experience. Three years of professional work experience in Event Planning, Conference Management, Public Relations, Communications, Marketing, or related field. Demonstrated project management experience and experience with purchasing contracts. Demonstrated experience with University purchasing and contract procedures, and with Banner. Experience with standard office technology and event planning tools.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of the early intervention system policies and continuing education requirements. Working knowledge of the university system for contracts. Demonstrated ability in decision-making, strong written and oral communication skills, strong interpersonal relationship skills, including the ability to interact effectively with team members, university staff, external stakeholders, attention to detail, adaptability, and dependability.

SALARY AND APPOINTMENT INFORMATION: This is a full-time Civil Service Events Coordinator position appointed on a 12-month service basis. The expected start date is July 1, 2020. Salary is commensurate with experience.

TO APPLY:

Applications must be received by June 5, 2020. Apply for this position using the “Apply for Position” button below. If you have not applied before, you must create your candidate profile at http://jobs.illinois.edu. If you already have a profile, you will be redirected to that existing profile via email notification. To complete the application process:

Step 1) Submit the Staff Vacancy Application.

Step 2) Submit the Voluntary Self-Identification of Disability forms.

Step 3) Upload ALL of the following documents:
cover letter
resume (months and years of employment must be included)
academic credentials (unofficial transcripts or diploma may be acceptable)
three references (names/contact information)
In order to be considered as a transfer candidate, you must apply for this position using the “Apply for Position” button below. Applications not submitted through this website will not be considered. For further information about this specific position, contact Susan Connor suec@illinois.edu. For questions about the application process, please contact 217-333-2137.

The University of Illinois conducts criminal background checks on all job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent offer.

As a qualifying federal contractor, the University of Illinois System uses E-Verify to verify employment eligibility.

Job Title: Events Manager | Institute for Nonprofit News
Job Description: The Texas Tribune is seeking an events manager to help plan, manage and execute the Tribune's year-round event portfolio.Since our launch, the Tribune has hosted nearly 500 on-the-record, open-to-the-public live events - on college campuses, in community centers and everywhere in between - at which public officials, policy wonks and newsmakers answer for the work they're doing and how they're spending Texans' tax dollars.The Events Manager will work closely with the Director of Events & Programming and Assistant Director of Events to plan and execute the Tribune's suite of events around the state, including conversations with legislators, panel discussions, social and co-sponsored events, day-long symposia and the annual Texas Tribune Festival, which attracts thousands of attendees to downtown Austin to learn about Texas' biggest challenges and to engage in thoughtful discussions about their respective solutions.We're looking for a confident and detail-oriented events professional with experience planning and promoting events of varying sizes and managing projects at all stages - from conception and pre-event planning to on-site execution and post-event analysis.Responsibilities will include:Event production including venue planning and site visitsManaging speaker scheduling and communications relating to their appearanceCopywriting and editing of event-related materials, including promotional materialsCoordinating with the Tribune art team on the development and design of event promotional materials, programs, signage, etc.Creating event promotional materials, including social media, and executing event outreachManaging event RSVPs and contactsAssisting with various aspects of Texas Tribune Festival productionManaging expenses to budget and submit invoicesRunning post-event evaluation, including data entry and analysis, and producing reports for stakeholdersAnticipating needs and troubleshooting to ensure that all events run smoothlyAn ideal candidate will have:1-3 years of event production or event-related experienceStrong writing and communication skills with a good copy-editing eyeAbility to juggle and prioritize many projects simultaneously with an eye on the big pictureA detail-oriented approach with a commitment to getting the job done well and on-scheduleStrong discretion and courtesy when dealing with all Tribune contacts and relationshipsThe ability to remain cool under pressure and work well both independently and on teamsFacility with EventBrite, MailChimp and SalesforceThis position requires some travel around the state to assist with events, as well as occasional evening and weekend events.We know there are great candidates who won't fit everything we've described above, or who have important skills we haven't thought of. If that's you, don't hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself.The Texas Tribune is committed to diversity and building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and ages. And we are taking steps to meet that commitment. We especially encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including women, people of color, LGBTQ people and people with disabilities.

Job Title: Account Trainee – Home Improvement, College Football
Job Description:
THE JOB / Account Trainee –
Home Improvement, College Football

EXPERIENCES / Responsible for planning and executing event and experiential
marketing programs.

The Octagon team is preparing for what we hope will soon be the
start of College Football season. Our client, a well-known home improvement
retailer has long been at the heart of College GameDay, helping to drive fan
engagement for the love of the sport, and they plan to continue to fuel that
passion

If you have a personal passion
for College Football, then this is where you come in!

travel, communicating with and managing store promotions in each market,
creation of weekly VIP communication pieces, weekly recaps and reporting,
weekly on-site activation and hospitality, and assisting with program overview
at conclusion of the season. This position will also require onsite event
management of other client-related events in the Atlanta market.

While there may be questions
surrounding what sports, and specifically, College Football will look like this
fall; we are making our best efforts to be prepared with great experiences.
Regardless of fans being in stadiums or not, Octagon will be at the forefront
of bringing sports and the world’s best-known brands to consumers and fans in
unique and safe ways.

Please also know that the well-being of our employees,
partners, fans and consumers are top of mind to our agency, and we are taking

place for our events and activations.

Assist
in administration and event operations of weekly on-site broadcasts,

(shipping and tracking of promotional items, signage, collateral, etc.)

to broadcast locations on a weekly basis to assist in the activation and

and report program data including participant information, post-event
surveys, store manager and customer comments, etc.

in day-to-day general office administration such as answering phones,
managing incoming and outgoing mail/packages and shipments, etc.
Other
related duties/projects as reasonably assigned
Weekend/holiday
work and travel are required – approximately 75
THE BIGGER TEAM YOU’LL JOIN

Where
others see complexity, we see possibility.

Octagon is the global sports,
entertainment and experiential marketing arm of the Interpublic Group. But if
that classification doesn’t do it for you, and it shouldn’t, let’s take it a
step further.

We are what we believe. And we believe
that while the world of sports and entertainment is full of opportunities and
possibilities, sometimes the amount of choice can seem a little overwhelming.
Even daunting.
That’s where we come into play.

At Octagon we inspire brands, talent, and
our people to see the world for all its potential. We then help break down the
complexity and push forward so you can make your next right move.
WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR
You
have a passion for and expertise in the sports and entertainment world
Bachelor’s
Degree in a related field
1
year’s work or internship experience in the marketing or advertising
industries
Capacity
to become knowledgeable on our clients’ industry, brand and product
offering
Ability
to prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously and produce quality work
within a timely manner
Proven
track record to work as part of a team and to solve problems effectively
and independently
Outstanding
organization, interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and
written)
Proficiency
with Microsoft Office Software particularly Excel and PowerPoint
Comfortable
working non-traditional hours, including weekends

to lift up to 40 lbs.

***This role is for a contractor position and will be processed through a third-party Managed Service Provider. This is not a full time employment position at GoPro.***

Channel Marketing Manager (Contract)

About GoPro

GoPro makes it easy for people to celebrate and share experiences. We believe life is more meaningful when shared. We build cameras, software, and accessories that help the world share itself in immersive and exciting ways.

GoPro is a global movement whose business is driven by shared experiences. We celebrate diversity. We practice inclusion. We foster belonging. We demand equality. And we share the experiences of individuals and communities who also hold these values as core to who they are. From São Paulo to Munich, Silicon Valley to Shenzhen, we are dedicated to building a company that reflects and honors the diverse global communities where we live, work, and play.

GoPro is seeking a candidate for the Americas Channel Marketing team. This position will define, execute and deliver on various marketing plans with a defined set of strategic partners for the GoPro product portfolio. This role will work with cross-functional teams that includes Sales, Sales Ops, Training, and Marketing teams to help manage and create innovative strategies and tactics for Retail Big Box and Mid-Market accounts, specifically Amazon. This person is detail oriented, hungry to learn and understand best practices of how those strategies will impact the channel as a whole.

The ideal candidate has a passion for technology and proven experience in successfully bringing to market innovative products, developing memos and presentations, as well as managing multiple projects. Within this role, to gain more mind share and results for accounts this candidate should be able to influence and lead others both internally and externally.

This position will be based in San Mateo, California.

Responsibilities
Own and drive retailer marketing and merchandising strategies to achieve sell-through and revenue goals for assigned
Define process and standard on Big Box and Mid-Market accounts through merchandising asset requirements to drive awareness, consideration and conversion tactics (i.e. Amazon Advertising, A+ Content, etc.)
Manage and understand the requirements for online merchandising execution by creating trackers and work-back schedules for projects
Develop, manage, and execute channel marketing strategy and plans for physical retail and online sales channels including:
Drive best in class in-store merchandising, end-user demand generation (e.g. retail circulars, digital inserts, displays, retail promotions etc.)
Participate in the development of the strategy and vision for how our devices are merchandised and demonstrated within a retail store environment
Create and manage MDF / Coop Programs and a strong understanding of the financial impact of these programs.
Provide insights and strategy based on the GoPro customer, industry and retailer trends to evolve the business in an ever-changing marketing landscape
Skills We're Stoked About
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
5+ years of channel marketing experience with a consumer electronics company
Experience with Amazon is a big plus
Experience working at a start-up or rapidly-growing company preferred and stong understanding of the GoPro brand
Quick on your feet and able to problem solve on the fly
Personable and conversational – no wall flowers, please!
Organized and ability to multi-task and take initiative
GoPro Highlights
Fully-stocked kitchen with snacks galore
Employee commuter shuttles
GoPro is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: FUTURE INQUIRIES: Creative Strategist – TV and Media
Job Description:
CSM exists to create impact by challenging convention. We do this because it produces work for our clients that is more meaningful, memorable and measurable.

Our diversity of experience, expertise and opinions is our greatest asset, which is why we celebrate our differences. We are looking for individuals who want to put their hand up and challenge convention to create something exciting, bigger and better each and every time.

CSM Media and Entertainment is the division of CSM dedicated to working with best-in-breed media companies to promote their biggest consumer-facing content, activate ground-breaking B2B initiatives and strategize around new revenue-generating opportunities. We primarily work with the country’s largest TV networks and film studios on experiential campaigns, partnerships, activations at festivals and other campaigns that are designed to drive press and social buzz.

Do you have a passion for TV, film and marketing? Do you love it when entertainment franchises build experiences for fans and people can’t stop talking about it? Do you have a background in driving the creative development of memorable, kick-ass brand experiences?

We seek a Creative Strategist with impressive pedigree and a willingness to go with the flow in our energetic, quirky NYC-based office. This is an amazing opportunity for someone who requires a fast-paced environment, loves to get their hands dirty, and is a natural at leading the creative process. We want someone who has their finger on the pulse of the next “big thing,”

has a history of developing break-through ideas and is comfortable working on multiple pitches at once.

This role is responsible for leading all ideation and presentations to support our sales efforts in the TV/film space. This typically includes 3-5 simultaneous pitches at any one time where the ideas are rooted in the show content. One pitch will be about crime-solving detectives and the next will be about Viking Warriors. The ideal candidate will be able to quickly become an “expert” in those worlds and translate them to fan-forward concepts that utilize experiential, PR, social media, partnerships, influencers, and digital promotions to deliver on our client’s brief and win the pitch.

Overview of Responsibilities

• Lead the development of insights and ideas for new business pitches – including facilitating brainstorming sessions, selecting the best concepts and ultimately overseeing copywriting and deck design

• Serve as Creative Strategy lead in internal meetings, client meetings, brainstorm/strategy sessions, and pitch presentations

• Drive the ideas forward during rounds of creative development and iteration, making sure deliverables are advancing forward while staying on brief

• Coordinate deliverables, timelines, and creative development for all business opportunities

• Contribute to cultural and industry trend reports through industry, vendor and competitive research

• Develop relationships with cultural partners that will help us win pitches and generate new business opportunities

• Identify innovation opportunities for our agency and work closely with members of senior management to make them happen

Desired Skills and Experience

• 4-6+ years agency experience (or a similar work environment)

• Experience developing creative ideas and platforms featuring experiential marketing, as well as the supporting elements that amplify any campaign: partnerships, digital, social, influencers, strategic partners and brand promotions

• Strong knowledge of current industry, tech and cultural trends

• Well-rounded strategic and creative mindset – you don’t have to be an expert in anything, but should be knowledgeable about many things

• Strong leadership, organization, & time management skills – we are looking for you to own the process, but you’d be working closely with someone who will oversee the final selection of ideas and write-ups

• Able to juggle multiple tasks with overlapping deadlines

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

• Ability to understand client goals, expectations and mindset

• Quick thinker, able problem-solver

• Collaborative teammate

• Self-starter, entrepreneurial, willing to try things you haven’t done before

Patient Care Coordinator & Events Manager – Full Time (San Francisco/Bay Area)

Compensation: Salary and bonus structure, based on key performance indices and experience

Busy Dermatology practice with a subspecialty in the ARTAS robotic hair transplant surgery is seeking a highly motivated person with great interpersonal skills, reliable, organized, and dependable and a team player. As the world's most experienced specialist in the ARTAS robotic hair transplant surgery procedure, conducting the research and development for this procedure since 2006, Berman Skin Institute is looking for a well-groomed, responsible, and positive individual to educate our patients about the benefits of this life-changing surgical procedure.

We require a minimum of five years’ experience in sales and direct selling positions preferably in the medical environment. As a Patient Care Coordinator, you will be informing patients who are interested in ARTAS hair transplant procedure and scheduling their surgeries. The counselor prepares the surgery schedules, maintains electronic medical files, and ensures effective communication with team members to keep a consistent flow throughout the department.

Auxiliary duties may also include obtaining necessary patient history and payment information for procedures, providing a comfortable environment for patients as well as prior authorizations, pre, and post-op instruction. Candidates will preferably have a background in surgery/clinical consultations and have great communication skills that ensure effective education and be willing to answer patient questions. You may cross-train as Events Manager with various responsibilities and must be able to work flexible schedule working between 8-5 pm Monday to Saturdays.

We’re looking for an individual with past Dermatology and Cosmetic Surgery / Plastic Surgery experience. Willing to travel to 11 Northern California locations. Must be detail-oriented, with the ability to multi-task. The position requires a bright and resourceful individual with strong written and communication skills.

Job duties include but are not limited to:
Achieve monthly revenue goals
Prepares all paperwork and explain each document to the patient and discuss financing/payment options to patients. Excellent communication, presentation, and listening skills are a must. Need to have good computer skills.
Counsels all patients explaining the benefits of ARTAS robotic hair transplant surgery
Schedule all surgeries, pre-op and post-op visits
Coordinate the surgery schedule with satellite offices and should know how to manage busy situations and stay organized.
Bring a positive attitude every day to share with staff and patients and work well in teams and have a team player attitude. Willing to adapt to an ever-changing environment and be will to learn.
Develop relationships with potential patients
Work closely with Patient Services team to coordinate daily schedules and confirmations
Maintain primary relationship with patients and provide accurate information
Prefer previous background in health facility, medical, dermatology, plastic surgery/cosmetic surgery is a plus.
Develop recommendations to improve the exams completion and conversion processes
Utilize all different databases to help patients get approval for financing their surgeries
Requirements:
Excellent communicator, professional appearance, solid work history.
Some background in medical counseling/education/public relations or marketing. Strong organization skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Detail orientated, reliable, and motivated Patient Care Coordinator and Events Manager who is able to multi-task in a fast-paced, high volume work environment.
Training will be provided for this position.
Berman Skin Institute is recognized as the world's leader in the ARTAS robotic hair transplant procedure. Besides a competitive salary plus a bonus structure based on certain key performance indices, we do offer our full-time staff a comprehensive benefits package. We look forward to finding an individual with a positive attitude with a can-do work ethic. We have 11 locations providing a wide range of services including dermatology and cosmetic surgery procedures.

Job Description
BROOKFIELD PROPERTIES

Brookfield Properties is a leading owner, operator and developer of office and multifamily assets. Our signature office properties define the skyline of dynamic cities around the world, including gateway cities such as New York, London, Berlin, Toronto, and Sydney. Our multifamily business owns, develops, renovates and manages approximately 40,000 high quality rental apartment buildings in supply constrained markets of major cities such as New York and London, as well as high growth markets in the suburban U.S.

POSITION SUMMARY
Brookfield Properties is seeking an experienced full-time associate who will serve as the primary Property Assistant and Events Coordinator for the Eager Park recreational area “The Park” which is in East Baltimore’s Eager Park Community. The Park is a privately funded 5.5-acre park that is the focal point of the 88-acre Eager Park community.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Facility Management and Operations – Contract, coordinate and maintain vendor relationships for facility management. Manages equipment inventory of park assets and implements “hands-on” preventative maintenance programs to ensure the park features meet safety standards. Ensures the park maintenance and security teams deployment are synchronized with park activities. Develops and implements park use agreement documentation, emergency action plan and standard operating procedures.
Park Ambassador – The associate produces, facilitates and/or coordinates events and programs in the park; ensures event reservations are scheduled in a timely manner.
Community Relations – Acts as the liaison with community and business partners by participating or leading group discussions and meetings regarding park activities. The associate will be expected to develop and maintain strong working relationships with community and business partners to ensure The Park continues to serve the neighbors, tenants and visitors.
Marketing – Develops, utilizes and maintains appropriate social media feeds/networks and print media to publicize The Park and events. Establish revenue generating programs and or sponsors to offset operational expenses.
Fiscal Administration – Report and document revenues and expenses from event and/or facility rentals including invoicing, contracts, and reports. Controls operational expenses. Provide periodical budget reports on all reservations/event budgets to manager and stakeholders.
Related Duties – Work under the direction of the General Manager performing administrative duties including, but not limited to: answering phones, filing, generating/executing work orders and purchase orders, customer service, participate/lead meetings, generate meeting minutes and agenda, etc.
EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s Degree and at least one year of professional work experience related to facility and/or event operations in campus recreation, parks and recreation, preferred.
Candidates with an Associate’s degree and three or more years of professional work experience related to facility and/or event operations in campus recreation, parks and recreation will also be considered.
REQUIREMENTS
Strong communication and organizational skills.
Flexible schedule - Evening, weekend and holiday shifts will be required during peak season.
Able to work outside during all seasons.
Experience with creating and maintaining social media networks including, but not limited to Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.
Advanced in with Microsoft Office software and Google Drive.
Current CPR/AED and First Aid Certification or ability to complete within first three months of employment.
Experience with contracting and supervising event staff.
Must be able to lift and move 50 lbs.; physical ability to move and survey facilities when and where necessary.

Senior Account Executive – Las Vegas


Imagine an environment where the world is your playground. Where you will have the full support of global agency behind you to help you provide solutions to the most recognized brands in the world. To be part of a team, a global community of passionate artists, thinkers, makers, and industry experts who have won countless awards designing, building and executing live marketing events throughout the world. If you are looking for a home where you can utilize your sales and business development skills to create relationships and solutions for global brands then MC² is that workplace. We have an exciting opening for an Account Executive to join our amazing group.

About MC²

MC², an award-winning brand experience solutions agency, is currently seeking a highly motivated and forward-thinking Senior Account Executives to join the Las Vegas Sales Team to be a key contributor to our organization’s global sales initiatives. With strategic thinking, inspiring designs, and seamless execution, MC² delivers growth solutions for our clients by creating immersive experiences that foster emotional relationships between brands and their audiences. Our solutions include experiential activations, trade show exhibits, pop-up stores, message-based experiences, events & conferences.

About the position

This role will be a key member of the west coast sales and customer engagement team. The selected individual will be responsible for generating new opportunities with potential clients. Maintaining and expanding relationships with existing clients as a means of identifying, developing and securing profitable business opportunities for the company. Utilize internal network and resources to develop and deliver sales presentations designed to demonstrate the organization’s capabilities and capacity to offer solutions for new potential clients.

Most importantly, this candidate will perform all tasks with an emphasis on enhancing the customer experience.

What you will do
Identify prospective clients, develop sales strategy and goals and execute plan to generate new business/revenue
Work with prospective clients to determine needs, match capabilities to develop offerings and services
Build on existing client relationships by developing a need for additional, broader scope of services and new concepts
Work with marketing team to craft and deliver presentations to prospects and potential clients
Participates in RFP process
Secure production and service contracts
Produces requests for estimates by means of established procedures and guidelines
Functions as liaison with client and internal team, managing clients expectations and communicating requirements and details to appropriate resources within the company i.e. design, graphics, project management, production, account management and the division management team
Utilize the internal tools and partner with internal team to deliver comprehensive marketing solutions to the client
Ensures proper invoicing and payment procedures are executed
Attend regular project team meetings
Skills and Qualifications
Marketing or Advertising degree and/or related experience required
A minimum of 5 years sales experience in advertising, marketing or the Live Marketing Industry (Trade Shows, Events, Conferences, activations, Branded Environments or related experiential marketing field)
A proven track record of successful sales development
Strong interpersonal skills with emphasis on relationship building
Excellent communication, time management and organizational skills
Ability to interface with diverse audiences
Active and proficient with business social media platforms (LinkedIn & Twitter)
Proven ability to identify and persuade decision makers
PC proficient with particular emphasis on Microsoft Office Suite as well as internet search tools
Financial acumen as it relates to cost margins and profit and loss
Requirements
Frequent domestic and international travel necessary


MC² offers a robust benefits package including: Medical (4 choices of plans), Dental (2 choices of plans) , 401K, Vision, company paid Life Insurance, company paid Long Term Disability, Short Term Disability, Accident and Critical Illness Insurance–plus more. Our culture fosters team work, individual strength, and innovation, all in a dynamic environment!

MC² is an equal opportunity employer. M/F/D/V.

Are you an…
Ambassador of Awesomeness?
or perhaps an…
Engineer of Experiences?

Then maybe you have what it takes to be an Angelic Bakehouse Brand Ambassador!
You get the picture…we’re looking for that health-conscious person with moxie. That person who will thrive in the fast paced and ever-changing world of in-store sampling, farmer’s markets, and experiential marketing at local events. Your ability and desire to engage, educate, and excite consumers is how we measure success. Do you have what it takes?

Your typical workday will look something like this:
The Brand Ambassador must be available both Saturdays and Sundays.
The Brand Ambassador will exchange bread for money, talk about the product with market-goers, create samples for market-goers to try, handle cash and credit card transactions, count the bread, lift about 30 pounds, work well with people, be friendly and outgoing, and have a good time outdoors rain or shine!
The Brand Ambassador also works in grocery store demos, various community events, health fairs, and more as the face of the company, educating consumers on Angelic Bakehouse sprouted grain bread products and encouraging sales of the brand.
Occasionally, it may include some of this:
Overnight travel.
A longer work day at trade shows or other special events.

Your qualifications
Detail Oriented – Attention to detail, ability to focus on the project or task at hand and consistently deliver error free results.
Change Management – Adaptable to a fast paced, shifting work environment; willing to remain flexible to accommodate changing business conditions, work requirements and scheduling needs.
Integrity, personal responsibility, and a genuine passion for healthy, delicious foods.
Ability to lift 30 pounds and stand for 4 hours or more at a time.
Reliable transportation. Personal vehicle is preferred.
Excellent communication to communicate via text, and send in reports after demo events.
Ability to follow food safety guidelines.

Education and Related Experience, Qualifications and/or Certifications:
One (1) to three (3) years of sales/marketing experience preferred, but not required.
Customer service and/or sales experience desired.
Excellent written and oral communications skills
Driver’s License with clean driving record is required to occasionally drive company vehicles for farmer’s markets and other events.

Job Description
Yellowstone Club’s Food & Beverage department is currently seeking candidates for a Special Events Coordinator.

The Special Events Coordinator assists in organizing the details of special events such as conferences, weddings, birthdays, anniversaries, charity events, surprise parties, sales meetings, business meetings, employee appreciation events, and all other events as assigned events to the standards of Yellowstone Club.

Responsibilities Include:
• Assist with editing and design of event materials
• Work with suppliers, contractors, employees, vendors, managers, and many other parties at the same time to coordinate the event timelines
• Assist with negotiations for clients and vendors including, but not limited to: food and beverage, supplies, equipment and signage, décor, flowers, props, staging, transportation and more to meet quality standards and Yellowstone Club expectations
• Conduct research, make site visits, plan layout of seating, entertainment, decorations, food and beverage stations to suggest event possibilities
• Assist in the creation and revision of room layouts for each event
• Propose new ideas to improve the event planning and implementation process or to refresh future events.
• Serve as liaison with vendors on event-related matters
• Assist with managing on-site production and clean up for events as necessary
• Prepare packages, gift bags, registration lists, seating cards, RSVP’s, etc. as required for each event
• Assist in maintaining budget and providing periodic progress reports to employees, clients and managers/directors for each event project. Prepare Member billing as required
• Keep track of event finances including check requests, invoicing, and reporting
• Coordinate appointments and scheduling of events on the calendar
• Act as the point of contact for events as needed. Assist with complaints, orders, errors, questions, billing, cancellations and other queries
• Help to document activities prior to and during the events for internal and external communications
• Coordinate event logistics, including registration and attendee tracking, presentation and materials support and pre- and post-event evaluations. Close out all events as required
• Manage inventory of all Yellowstone Club event supplies
• Possess strong customer service focus striving for high Member and guest satisfaction, going out of the way to be helpful and pleasant, and making it as easy as possible for the Members and guests to do business with the Club for special events, parties or other social activities
• Take ownership of the event, do what is needed without being asked, have strong follow through and communication skills throughout the event from inception to completion
• Be organized and detail oriented, utilizing checklists or other systems to ensure no task is left undone; anticipate events and plan ahead; prepare for the unexpected; remain focused on the end result

Position Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree
• Previous work experience as an Event Coordinator or Event Planner
• Excellent communication skills, including writing, proof reading skills, and speaking
• Excellent organization skills and experience with project management
• Excellent interpersonal skills both in person and by phone, with high professionalism
• Ability to accomplish projects with little supervision; Excellent organization skills and experience with project management
• Strong Microsoft Office skills including Work, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook to, plan, budget, and organize events
• Proficient use of the Web to conduct research, procurement and suggest event ideas
• Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office systems
• Valid State Driver’s License
• Ability to lift 50 lbs

The position offered is a seasonal, full-time position located in Big Sky, MT.

Sparks Worldwide is an outsourced experiential marketing firm. Sparks Worldwide started with five highly motivated individuals that understand the clients goals and more importantly the opportunity provided likeminded individuals work together to achieve a common goal. Since expanding here to Savannah, GA in April 2019 we’ve grown to 30+ and people and are looking to continue expanding into multiple markets through our enthusiastic ideas.

United Skates of America, an industry leader for over 45 years in recreation and entertainment facility management, is seeking to hire a Part-Time Event Coordinator (Sales Assistant). We are located at 2881 Peach Avenue in Clovis, CA. This part-time, hourly sales assistant will help the Sales and Marketing Department. Your product will be field trips, group outings, daytime and evening private parties for kids and adults, and our groundbreaking STEM outings for these groups. You will help sell these programs by contacting schools, churches, scouts, groups, and organizations to help sell these established products in roller skating, education, and family entertainment.

Requirements and additional preferences:
Experience with inbound and outbound sales calls (experience a MUST)
Marketing/sales/promotions experience and enjoy working with youth
Reliable transportation for making outside sales calls
Flexible daytime schedule, Monday - Friday (25 hrs/wk) MUST have Daytime Availability
Excellent organization and great communication skills (both written and verbal),
Creativity and self-motivation
Perform well in a fast-paced, ever-changing, sales environment.
Establish, service and maintain existing and potential clients.
Multi-task various marketing projects, administrative and sales responsibilities.
Friendly and assertive.
Strong command of internet marketing tools. Your ability to use major search engines, Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube is critical. Your goals would include keeping these sites updated about what's happening at our location. Must be proficient in Word and Excel.
Perform general office duties as assigned
Basic desktop publishing experience is a PLUS!
$14 - $17/hour

About us:

AV Concepts is a respected leader with a 30+ year track record of excellence in the convergence of technology and creativity in the live events industry. We recognize, respect and promote the power of our employees.

You will be joining a top team of industry professionals that bring unique technology and creative expertise together to offer the most innovative solutions to our clients that are limited only by your imagination!

About the role:

The Business Development role will support Sales, Marketing and Business Development efforts through direct client outreach. This position will be responsible for engaging directly with new client contacts to generate interest, evaluate needs, identify and qualify potential sales opportunities and lay a foundation for new, successful relationships with clients at the earliest stages of the sales process.

The scope of responsibilities will include cold calling, opportunity qualifying, needs assessment, opportunity identification, CRM data system entry, interaction with Account Managers, and nurturing of client relationships in the early stages.

This position requires a highly organized individual with previous sales experience, some knowledge of technology products and/or services and an outgoing personality with an exceptional capability to multi-task while delivering results. The ideal candidate will have worked in a sales culture that values customer services, personal accountability, teamwork and a positive can-do attitude.

What you need:
Exceptional at multi-tasking and organizing to deliver results
Confident and engaging phone skills that build trust immediately
Familiarity with web-based CRM systems
Experience with experiential marketing, PR campaigns and conferences a plus
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Power Point, Excel and Outlook)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Friendly, helpful and positive personality with a can-do attitude
Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced, ever-changing team environment
Knowledge of audio-visual industry a must
Ability to work independently and exercise good time management
Quality work and attention to detail are critical
Ability to preserve confidentiality of information
What you'll do:
Actively working assigned vertical markets and key client contact lists
Developing, managing and reporting a strategic sales plan for all assigned verticals
Direct communication with leads to evaluate needs, identify sales opportunities, and build confidence in AVCs service quality and innovation.
Build relationships with potential clients in the early-stage and nurture the relationship until it is ready for transition to Account Manager, SMEs or sale leadership.
Enter and maintain accurate new lead information in companys CRM system (Dynamics).
Outreach to identified Prospects to foster new relationships.
Collaborates with sales team to understand best practices and continually update ideal candidate profiles to maximize capability to identify and pursue high quality leads and Prospects.
Engaging in-person with leads in corporate meeting and conference environments when needed (occasionally).
Why you'll like working here:
Top salary and commission
Medical, dental, and 401k retirement plan
Opportunity for career advancement
Collaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and fresh thinking
Casual dress code
Cell phone reimbursement

Samaritans Purse is seeking to hire a full time Hospitality / Event Coordinator to oversee the full cycle execution of all Samaritans Purse catered events and hospitality requests under the supervision of the Hospitality Manager. This hands on food services event role requires a detail oriented person who is conscientious, flexible and has a desire to provide outstanding customer service! The position requires a minimum of 3 years of full time event experience with the planning, preparation, and execution of all things event related, including preparation of certain food items.

If hospitality is your gift, you feel a call to our ministry and have the experience we are seeking, we would love the opportunity to connect with you! Please submit your application, including your resume and cover letter.

Job Duties:
Maintain a personal, active relationship with Jesus Christ and is a consistent witness for Jesus Christ.
Oversee the preparation and service of food according to approved menus and standardized recipes, while keeping waste to a minimum.
Oversee the execution of all approved Event/Hospitality forms in all Samaritans Purse locations, as directed by Hospitality Manager. This includes all aspects from set-up to clean-up. Follow approved forms, and ensure accuracy and professional appearance.
Keep all break rooms on Samaritans Purse campuses stocked with supplies. Alert Hospitality Manager when quantities are low.
Serve "Watermelon Friday" events during the summer (Friday following Memorial Day thru the last Friday in August).
Travel between main kitchens and training centers. Some evening and weekend travel required.
Foster and maintain positive relationships with event hosts.
Monitor all catering related supplies and alert Hospitality Manager when quantities are low. Keep accurate pars based on events calendar and calculated needs while minimizing waste and maintaining clean workspace.
Monitor food quality using Food Safe methods as directed.
Help maintain orderly, clean kitchen, eating and service area, storage, and cooler/freezer facilities.
Oversee serving meals and in appropriate portions, as necessary.
Clean up all facilities used for events. This includes breakroom, kitchen, and dining room. Wash all catering dishes and equipment. Know and execute all policies concerning table tops, approved foods, and event space.
Coordinate van usage with Hospitality Manager and Assistant Director, Food Services. Maintain fuel levels and vehicle cleanliness.
Additional Duties and Responsibilities
Oversee transportation of food dishes, utensils, and service ware to event destinations. Assist in set-up as directed.
Help sanitize and store all equipment at the end of each shift.
Keep manager apprised of problems or situations that may arise, such as product shortages, special order needs, or repair and maintenance needs.
Wash dishes, glassware, silverware, pots, and pans after meals. Collect and return dirty dishes to washing area.
Qualifications:
Knowledge of the methods, principles, processes, materials, techniques and equipment used in quantity food preparation and customer service
Knowledge of proper food storage and handling techniques as well as the quality, safety and sanitary standards involved in food preparation
Knowledge of production and processing including cost controls and other techniques for effective operations
Knowledge and experience in assessing, coordinating and preparing food prep levels
Knowledge of principles and processes of providing customer satisfaction
Social Perceptiveness, understanding of others
Service orientation actively looking for ways to help other people and develop constructive and cooperative working relationships
Valid Drivers License and safe driving record
Education and Experience:

High School Diploma or equivalent; three (3) to five (5) years experience in the Hospitality industry. Food Safe Handler certification required. Banquet/catering and customer service experience preferred.

Physical Demands:
Walk and stand for extended periods of time. Must meet speed demands of a fast paced cooking environment. Long hours/double shifts are required.
Active listening, oral comprehension and communication.
Bend, stretch, and lift moderate amounts of weight (35 lbs.).
Perform repetitive hand and arm motions.
Comfortable driving, parking, and backing up catering van. Up to 4 hours of driving required on some days.
Work under a range of temperature conditions.
Benefits:
Medical, prescription, dental & vision insurance
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Long term and short term disability insurance
Term Life insurance
401(k) retirement savings plan
Ten paid holidays
Ten or more days of vacation depending on years of service
Ten sick days
Staff discounts at retail stores and service providers in the Boone area and nationwide
Daily staff devotions and prayer time
Samaritans Purse Distinct Objectives:

PROCLAIM THE GOSPEL - EXALT Christ and share the Gospel while working in His Name around the world

SERVE WITH EXCELLENCE - EXCEED the worlds standard while serving the purposes of Gods kingdom

RESPOND WITH COMPASSIONATE ACTION - EXPEDITE our response to needs as the Lord reveals opportunities to minister

DEMONSTRATE BIBLICAL INTEGRITY - EXHIBIT character and integrity personally, at home and work

WALK IN BOLD FAITH - EXPECT God to do the impossible
Samaritan's Purse Mission Statement:

Samaritan's Purse is a nondenominational evangelical Christian organization providing spiritual and physical aid to hurting people around the world. Since 1970, Samaritan's Purse has helped meet needs of people who are victims of war, poverty, natural disasters, disease, and famine with the purpose of sharing God's love through His Son, Jesus Christ. The organization serves the Church worldwide to promote the Gospel of the Lord Jesus Christ.

Samaritan's Purse Statement of Faith:

* We believe the Bible to be the inspired, the only infallible, authoritative Word of God. (1 Thessalonians 2:13; 2 Timothy 3:15-17)

* We believe that there is one God, eternally existent in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. (Matthew 28:19; John 10:30; Ephesians 4:4-6)

* We believe in the deity of the Lord Jesus Christ, in His virgin birth, in His sinless life, in His miracles, in His vicarious and atoning death through His shed blood on the cross, in His bodily resurrection, in His ascension to the right hand of the Father, and in His personal return in power and glory. (Matthew 1:23; John 1:1-4 and 1:29; Acts 1:11 and 2:22-24; Romans 8:34; 1 Corinthians 15:3-4; 2 Corinthians 5:21; Philippians 2:5-11; Hebrews 1:1-4 and 4:15)

* We believe that all men everywhere are lost and face the judgment of God, that Jesus Christ is the only way of salvation, and that for the salvation of lost and sinful man, repentance of sin and faith in Jesus Christ results in regeneration by the Holy Spirit. (Luke 24:46-47; John 14:6; Acts 4:12; Romans 3:23; 2 Corinthians 5:10-11; Ephesians 1:7 and 2:8-9; Titus 3:4-7)

* We believe in the present ministry of the Holy Spirit, whose indwelling enables the Christian to live a godly life. (John 3:5-8; Acts 1:8 and 4:31; Romans 8:9; 1 Corinthians 2:14; Galatians 5:16-18; Ephesians 6:12; Colossians 2:6-10)

* We believe in the resurrection of both the saved and the lost; the saved unto the resurrection of eternal life and the lost unto the resurrection of damnation and eternal punishment. (1 Corinthians 15:51-57; Revelation 20:11-15)

* We believe in the spiritual unity of believers in the Lord Jesus Christ and that all true believers are members of His body, the church. (1 Corinthians 12:12, 27; Ephesians 1:22-23)

* We believe that the ministry of evangelism and discipleship is a responsibility of all followers of Jesus Christ. (Matthew 28:18-20; Acts 1:8; Romans 10:9-15; 1 Peter 3:15)

* We believe Gods plan for human sexuality is to be expressed only within the context of marriage, that God created man and woman as unique biological persons made to complete each other. God instituted monogamous marriage between male and female as the foundation of the family and the basic structure of human society. For this reason, we believe that marriage is exclusively the union of one genetic male and one genetic female. (Genesis 2:24; Matthew 19:5-6; Mark 10:6-9; Romans 1:26-27; 1 Corinthians 6:9)

* We believe that we must dedicate ourselves to prayer, to the service of our Lord, to His authority over our lives, and to the ministry of evangelism. (Matthew 9:35-38; 22:37-39, and 28:18-20; Acts 1:8; Romans 10:9-15 and 12:20-21; Galatians 6:10; Colossians 2:6-10; 1 Peter 3:15)

* We believe that human life is sacred from conception to its natural end; and that we must have concern for the physical and spiritual needs of our fellowmen. (Psalm 139:13; Isaiah 49:1; Jeremiah 1:5; Matthew 22:37-39; Romans 12:20-21; Galatians 6:10)
