Job Title: Senior Digital & Physical Events Marketing Manager
Job Description:
Job Description

SendBird is looking for a Senior Events Manager to lead and execute our global events strategy for both physical and digital events

Events are a critical component for how SendBird engages with customers and partners within our industry. The Senior Events Manager position will be responsible for managing the execution of all events for SendBird and creating the measurement plan to demonstrate the impact to the business. As a core member of the Demand Generation team, this role will have a great deal of autonomy to develop a framework for repeatable execution of revenue-driving events.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
Manage our trade show and field event presence globally
Build and run our Webinar program
Manage event logistics ranging such as defining event goals, promotional strategy, site identification, contract negotiation, and on-day support.
Develop and execute an engagement plan for each event including reviewing attendee lists, working with other marketing members to develop outreach content, owning booth design, and identifying opportunities for SendBird to amplify it's presence
Responsible for developing and tracking key performance indicators for events, such as the number of attendees, content generated via events, and the number of new customers / revenue generated as a result of events.
WHO YOU ARE
Go-Getter. Motivated to learn and grow with a fast-growing company. Ability to multitask programs and projects in a fast-paced environment with short timeframes. Competing priorities and ambiguity do not slow you down.
Problem Solver. You anticipate problems, know when to escalate, understand what tradeoffs should be made, and balance the needs of the business with delivering an experience that is valuable to the attendees.
Customer Obsessed. You think of an event as a product and obsess over how to add value to attendees before, during, and after the experience.
You eat details for breakfast. No detail is too small or inconsequential for you to consider. You give new meaning to the term "detail oriented" with the ability to think on your feet to discover creative solutions.
EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
You've done it. 3+ years of experience in marketing, event/webinar management, or experiential marketing. B2B/SaaS experience preferred.
Systems. Experience with MarTech systems such as Marketo, gotowebinar, etc preferred
Relentlessly High Standards. Strong project management skills and ability to manage a timeline with many moving parts and stakeholders.
ADDITIONAL BENEFITS
Pick your new laptop!
4 weeks paid time off!
99.99% paid Benefits
12 US paid Holidays
Fun working environment
Flexible work schedule
Opportunity to work for the hottest startups on the planet!
ABOUT SENDBIRD

SendBird is the world's leading chat & messaging platform as a service. Our mission is to digitize human interactions for businesses. Our platform delivers billions of messages per month to help people connect through the products and apps they love.

We're a Y Combinator alumnus (W16) and have raised over $120M from leading investors including ICONIQ Capital, Tiger Global Management, Shasta Ventures, August Capital, and FundersClub. We are headquartered in San Mateo, CA (50+ employees) with an Asia-Pacific office in Seoul (100+ employees).

We have an immediate opening for a local driver in the Baltimore, MD area with experience operating straight trucks. This 1099 contract is an in-market program, so you will be home every night. Should there be any overnight travel needs, the company will pay for all accommodations. The position starts immediately and runs through the end of the year.

Aardvark Mobile Tours is the undisputed leader in the experiential marketing industry. We work with the largest brands in the world (and their agencies) and have a unique family culture you won’t find anywhere else. If you want to join a winning team with a growing organization, apply now!

Fooji is taking experiential marketing by storm and we need you help.

We are looking for a competent Logistics Coordinator to oversee and facilitate the supply chain operations of our company. You will be the one to coordinate personnel and processes to achieve the effective distribution of goods. A great asset for a Logistics Coordinator is their communication and negotiation skills. They are also well-versed in supply management principles and practices. The ideal candidate will have great record-keeping abilities and a customer-oriented approach. The goal is to ensure the smooth operations of a variety of channels aiming for maximum efficiency.

What you'll do:
Pick-up items from a storage facility
Occasionally pick up boxes from a local FedEx location
Occasionally transfer items from the storage facility office to Fooji's Storage Unit
Distribute those items to our couriers either from the storage facility or a pre-arranged distribution point
Coordinate delivery drivers on the ground, occasionally answering questions and directing them back to the proper channels at Fooji
Arrange shipping of un-delivered items back to Fooji via FedEx
Work autonomously without a manager overseeing your work
Serve as a liaison between our HQ and our distribution location
Works collaboratively with Fooji team with find on the ground distribution solutions as needed
Recruit and coordinate logistics staff (e.g. couriers) according to availabilities and requirements
Communicate with vendors, couriers, partners etc. to achieve profitable deals and mutual satisfaction
Prepare accurate stock reports & timely updates for management
Requirements
Impeccable punctuality
Ability to lift boxes sometimes up to 60 lbs.
Strong communication skills and is accessible via mobile phone
Can direct couriers where to get help if they have questions/concerns
Comfortable being the point-person in market for Fooji during campaigns
Works well in a small team environment and/or alone
Isn't afraid of a fast-paced and quickly changing environment
Benefits
This position would be a great resumé builder!
Play an active role in fun campaigns for major brands

Marketing Event Manager- San MateoaAs a world-class Event Manager you will impact hyper-growth trajectory for the company future.

In this Marketing role you will organize global events to raise awareness, motivating engagement, and creating new opportunities.

You have a charismatic, amiable persona with an endless supply of fresh ideas.

You also have proven organizational, project management, and people skills, negotiation tactics, self-starter attitude, and keen reporting, follow up skills to show success via metrics.

Responsibilities Are:

Interfacing with sales, marketing, and engineering teams when planning, recruiting and managing deliverables for events

Managing all event logistics, audience acquisition strategy, production, signage, budget tracking, and staffing matrix for trade shows, local events,

Handle small user groups and large-scale, complex trade shows

Interface directly with vendors, technology partners, and customers to manage demos, booth logistics, speaking opps, cocktail and party functions, etc to provide the highest-level event experience aligned with our go-to-market strategy

Research new event options and gather information to assess the relevance of the show for target audience, messaging.

Work as a cross-functional project manager with other corporate departments within the company as well as external vendors to drive the event deliverables and lifecycle

Qualifications:

5+ years’ experience managing all levels and types of industry events including sponsorship of large-scale, complex trade shows

Highly energetic, creative ability to get things done

Proven experience to plan, manage, and execute the full event lifecycle

Have exceptional negotiation skills

Ability to motivate and tactfully push others to ensure deliverables are completed on time and on budget

Aptitude for working in a fast-paced start up environment

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

3+ years high tech industry experience (preferably in the storage or backup space)

This position is located in San Mateo, CA. Travel to events will be required.

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

We are seeking an Event Manager to join our team! You will be responsible for organizing important events from conception through completion.

Responsibilities:
Coordinate all event activities and personnel

Company Name: LOW COUNTRY QUISINE BY JOLIE RAMIZE

Job Description:
Director of Content

Material Bank

Boca Raton, FL

Material Bank, a division of SANDOW, is a disruptive technology and logistics company that helps designers and trade professionals with sourcing materials and architectural products. The platform provides users the ability to search through thousands of products from leading manufacturers and request samples all within a single site. As members source and make selections through Material Bank’s sophisticated tools, the platform connects them directly with manufacturers—ultimately driving their purchasing decisions.
Our Director of Content will focus on developing and executing a strategic plan for content marketing that spurs inspiration and creativity for our audience of interior designers, architects, and other design professionals. If establishing content marketing best practices in a culture focused on experimentation, measurement, and optimization excites you, apply today!

What you'll do:
Lead the development of Material Bank’s content strategy to drive engagement with our core members of interior designers and architects
Define content roadmaps that focus on short-term wins and longer-term business objectives, such as increased personalization and highly targeted marketing segmentation
Track and monitor the competitive landscape of existing content providers within the interior design and architecture communities
Lead design thinking efforts to innovate content delivery to our members
Lead the creation of key messaging, copy and supporting content across channels including the core website, editorial/blog, in-box, organic social, experiential and event marketing
Own and grow our online social community, encourage user-generated content and oversee the day-to-day operations of social media channels including, but not limited to Instagram, Facebook and LinkedIn
Define the monthly and quarterly content calendar in partnership with Marketing, Product and Brand Service teams
Establish a formal content marketing team by sourcing and working with freelancers as well as hiring and developing strong performers
What you'll bring:
8+ years professional experience in integrated or content marketing, social media and/or communications
Demonstrated success crafting stories and publishing content in a variety of formats across a range of channels
Experience in brand management and/or brand building
Experience in establishing content quality standards and strategy
Experience driving efficiencies in content creation operational workflows
Startup experience a plus
About SANDOW

SANDOW was founded by visionary entrepreneur Adam Sandow in 2003 with the goal of building a truly innovative media company that would reinvent the traditional publishing model. Today, SANDOW is a fully integrated solutions platform powering innovation for the design and luxury industries. Its diverse portfolio of design media and technology companies include Interior Design, Luxe Interiors + Design, Metropolis, Galerie and NewBeauty. Materials Innovation brands include global materials consultancy Material ConneXion and game-changing material sampling, logistics and sustainability platform Material Bank. SANDOW brands also include research and strategy firm ThinkLab. In 2019, SANDOW was selected by the New York Economic Development Corp. to become the official operator of NYCxDESIGN, beginning in 2020.

Tradeshow, Event & Field Marketing

We're making healthcare better! Bright.md helps primary care providers deliver remarkably efficient, high-quality, delightful asynchronous virtual care, improving provider efficiency by as much as 90%, increasing care quality by 2x, and delighting patients and providers with a new experience of care. We're looking for a Tradeshow, Events, & Field Marketing Manager who’s excited to join our diverse, creative, high-performing team to help us transform healthcare by growing and innovating at an amazing pace.
Much more than “telehealth,” we build products that bridge the communication gap between patients and providers, automating the remote care-delivery process for clinicians at major health systems. This unique approach enables a 10x reduction in cost and provider time, markedly better clinical outcomes, and major improvements in both patient and provider satisfaction.

You'll work closely with a great, cross-functional team of passionate, engaged partners and stakeholders that include marketing, sales, customer success, agency partners, and more. Bright.md is an innovative healthcare technology company, providing a best-in-class, uniquely differentiated care automation product to major healthcare delivery systems. The mission for this role is to increase awareness and drive leads in collaboration with others on the marketing and sales teams. The tradeshow, event and field marketing manager will ensure that over the next year, we develop a playbook that is successful, repeatable, scalable for in-market events (ours or industry), promoting and elevating our brand, and setting us apart (in a good way) from the rest of the industry.

The ideal candidate: is self-motivated, a master multi-tasker, works cross-departmentally, and drives event and tradeshow related lead-generation activities to build pipeline for the sales organization and to grow our marketable database. We are looking for a hands-on strategist who will help us identify new venues to participate in and create new events from the ground up to engage our targeted prospects.
We'll provide a compassionate, innovative, happy place to work, and support you in your efforts to grow. Your ideas will be valued, your efforts recognized, your growth fostered, your contributions rewarded, and your successes celebrated.

To excel in this role, you'll need:
Creativity and curiosity. You’ll bring and find best practices and new techniques to a well-known discipline to help us differentiate, do things smarter and better than other companies to deliver better and faster results.
Previous experience with event and tradeshow planning and management
To be proactive and thorough in completing existing tasks and pursuing assignments above and beyond
Strong oral and written communication skills to both tell our story in our chosen venues and to, inevitably, herd kittens when necessary.
To be extremely detail-oriented with superior attention to detail; superior organizational skills
The ability to respond quickly and professionally to internal and external requests. As you know, things come up.
Professionalism in all project management
The ability to manage concurrent tasks effectively, without being overwhelmed. Ability to maintain multiple deadline-driven projects. It’s your secret superpower.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team. Sometimes it takes a village, and other times it’s more effective to do it on your own.

You’ll be accountable for:
Creating and maintaining a 12-month rolling calendar of industry events with a suggested strategy for each
Building a strong relationship, communication plan, meeting cadence, and feedback loops with the sales team in to ensure regional support needs are included in the BMD event strategy
Translation of show strategies into clear direction for vendors and service providers
Setting timelines for meeting design, production, and shipping schedules
Directing/performing on-site booth set-ups and teardowns; scheduling booth staffing and coordinating staff travel arrangements
Building a strong relationship, communication plan, and feedback loop with product and sales with the express purpose of ensuring appropriate demos and messaging for events
Design, construction, repair, storage, and shipping of all booths, signage and exhibit materials.
Negotiation of venue, food and beverage, and accommodations for company-hosted client events
Working with the marketing team to ensure all signage, materials, messaging, and other show deliverables follow Bright.md brand and quality standards and guidelines. And, within budget.
Facilitating timely lead processing and sales assignments; track and measure results.

Requirements
You’ll likely need a BA/BS with at least 5-7 years of prior experience in B2B tradeshow, event management and field marketing. We believe that talent is as important as specific training or industry knowledge. If you’ve got strong, demonstrated abilities, but have taken a different path, we’d love to hear from you.

Cultural fit is also critical. We’re looking for someone who is a compassionate team member, and who won’t accept mediocrity--someone who is open-minded, actively and candidly shares their ideas, works well on an innovative close-knit team. Someone who is passionate and driven to create something valuable, help people live better lives, and have fun along the way.

A bit more about us, and applying
Bright.md is passionately an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse backgrounds and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of millions of patients’ means that a criminal background check is required to join Bright.md.
To fast track your application, let us know in your cover letter why this job, product, and company is of particular interest to you.

Job Summary

Duties and responsibilities of the Marketing Manager – Kid Trax, include managing the brand’s strategic growth through developing and maintaining a consistent positive image for the brand both online and offline. Supporting and assisting the Director of Marketing in all activities related to the brand.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Brand Marketing Responsibilities (30%)
Assists Director of Marketing in building a 1-3 year marketing strategy that connects the passion points of our consumers with our brand, product, and corporate strategies and objectives.
Defines, plans, and launches annual and seasonal campaigns and priorities for the business.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of the brand, category, competitors, and consumers to ensure relevant insights to fuel all marketing elements.
Manages internal and external partners to support the activation of integrated marketing plans. Establishing strong partnerships and processes with our internal teams (Creative services, PR, Sales, Retail, Product, Legal, Customer Service, and Finance) to effectively execute marketing campaigns.
Tracks and manages brand business performance. Analyzes and reports key marketing metrics with a view to strengthening marketing plan / activities for the future.
Manages the Kid Trax marketing budget, spending efficiently to achieve our marketing goals.
Strategically assesses current activation of assets across media, experiential marketing, spokespeople, festivals, and event properties to identify strategic white spaces where our brand should be.
Kid Trax Ecommerce Merchant (30%)
Define and execute our direct to consumer sales strategies for KidTraxToys.com.
Work collaboratively with sales and product management to establish and manage the online assortment including establishing pricing.
Build and execute digital marketing programs and campaigns to drive traffic and profitable sales on KidTraxtoys.com.
Collaborate with the digital marketing team on enhancing SEO and UX.
Manages and executes the Email Marketing program delivering growth in email database and growth in sales conversion.
Content Marketing Duties (20%)
Leads the creation and execution of consumer programs, campaigns, and annual high-profile product launches.
Evaluates creative ideas and thinking with a critical eye and understanding of the brand equity, vision and strategic priorities.
Manages the influencer program, seeking out, vetting, and selecting appropriate individuals to represent the Kid Trax brand.
Develop content for the brand website; keeping in mind brand voice and consumer journey optimization.
Maintain awareness of brand standards and guidelines, and make sure they are implemented for all assets before they are deployed to digital channels.
Measures/analyzes performance of all web activity; including traffic, content views, and demographics, and provide insights and key learnings to affiliated teams.
Social Media & Digital Marketing (10%)
Drives a holistic social media channel strategy that considers brand & product representation.
Build and manage all aspects of multiple social media accounts, including community development and content creation.
Create sharp, enticing content (including, but not limited to Facebook posts, Tweets, Instagram Posts, Instagram stories, and short format videos) which engage the brand’s audience across social channels.
Manage and implement a paid digital and social paid media advertising plan, using data, driven decision making.
Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.
Other Duties Assigned (10%)
Assist in presenting at key customer meetings on key Kid Trax initiatives.
Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
Follows internal controls and company policies set by Pacific Cycle Inc. and Dorel Sports.
Contributes to the success of Pacific Cycle Inc. by leading or assisting with other projects and tasks as assigned.

College education ideally with degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications.
Masters study or degree a benefit.
At least five years experience in marketing role with social media responsibilities.
Experience in selling directly online

Passionate about marketing
Outstanding communicator and writer
Exhibit Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) computer skills

Will work on site during regular business hours
Team player who enjoys working with others
Dependable
Outgoing and friendly
Self-motivated and creative idea generator

Proactive and takes action without being prompted
Creativity
Generates original ideas, encourages new ways of thinking, explores options, and develops innovative solutions

Remains current in their area of expertise and serves as a resource in that area of the organization

Results Orientation

Motivated by achievement, and persist until the goal is reached

FIELD/CHANNEL MARKETING MANAGER

Description

The Field Marketing Manager will be responsible for leading the marketing strategy and execution of field and channel marketing programs to generate new business, drive cross sell/upsell opportunities and help advance existing opportunities for the sales team. Reporting to the Marketing Director, this individual will collaborate with theatre Sales leadership, channel partners, and Global Marketing to identify and understand target market needs; position Lancope's solutions; and develop, implement, track and measure marketing programs that help the theatre achieve its business/revenue plan.

In this role, you will also work closely with channel partners, the channel sales team, and the marketing team to support and accelerate channel activities. Responsible for joint marketing programs, partner launch activities, partner event management, partner portal management, partner communications, and the channel marketing budget.

The successful candidate must be a strong spokesperson and have a solid track record of; developing and executing go-to-market strategies, managing teams delivering field specific lead generation programs plans directly and with channel partners, and working cross-functionally with a track record of success. The right candidate will thrive on building relationships with sales team, must be an exceptional leader with strong partnering skills, possess a keen understanding of joint partner marketing, lead development and program execution and follow up, and be fluent in a metrics-driven organization.

Responsibilities
Act as the local point of contact on the development and execution of European programs; Understand local go-to-market and account strategies, segment the market and interlock with sales teams to create distinct regional marketing plans.
Develop and implement pipeline acceleration programs jointly with sales.
Research, choose, design and manage live events to be included as tactics in the overall marketing mix, and ensure there is a cohesive pre-event, at-event and post-event strategy to increase engagement and response rates.
Interface with sales to determine sales enablement needs, and work with product/solution marketing to develop tools, programs in a box, training and content.
Align local messages and tactical plans with the company's business goals.
Actively participate in regional/global interlock sessions and share best practices with colleagues.
Generate insights about, and proactively address, market trends and competitive activity to help ensure evolving corporate, product and marketing strategies meet theatre market needs.
Analyze historical results data (e.g. budget and tactic metrics). Monitor, review and report on marketing activities and results against key performance metrics during monthly and quarterly meetings; adjusts marketing mix based on performance to maximize ROI.

Job Title: Regional Marketing Manager - State and Local Government
Job Description:
Position Description: Okta is looking for a strong Marketing Manager to strategically plan and manage field/regional programs and campaigns specifically targeting US State & Local Government. In partnership with the Sr. Manager of Public Sector Marketing, Education Marketing Manager, sales, alliances and the cross functional marketing team, this person will be responsible for quarterbacking and executing strategies to meet/exceed quarterly and annual pipeline goals.

The State and Local Government Marketing Manager role is an opportunity to make a key contribution, working across business units to develop unique customer and prospect experiences that drive business impact. The ideal candidate must be a results-oriented marketer that gets things done- a roll up your sleeves type of person. The role will require proven ability to effectively work and collaborate with cross-functional internal teams, including sales, marketing and operations, as well as external partners and vendors.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Build strategic marketing plans that incorporate various field / regional events, programs and campaigns designed to contribute to annual pipeline goals and support sales achievement of revenue objectives.
Execute on public sector marketing strategy- define, project manage and execute to event program goals, messaging, tactics, audience generation/email campaigns, speaker plan, collateral, on-site execution, post-show leads processing & follow-up, and other logistics.
Monitor and facilitate lead funnel management across all activities, and report program results to all stakeholders.
Oversee inventory, maintenance and distribution of regional event properties, promotional items and collateral for sales & field events.
Work closely with strategic field alliance and technology partners to build joint marketing programs and execute co-branded tactics that support public sector strategy and annual revenue goals.
Effectively work cross-functionally with teams across Okta to include field and inside sales, marketing, operations, alliances, PR, legal, and procurement to efficiently and effectively execute plans and achieve goals.
Clearly communicate public sector marketing strategy, activities, goals and outcomes to all stakeholders, as well as other internal cross-functional teams.
Minimum REQUIRED Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Demonstrated experience in program, event creation and campaign management to include measuring and reporting of success metrics/business impact.
Ability to plan strategically while also executing tactically
4-6 years of experience marketing to State & Local Government IT audience.
Experience planning and co-marketing with strategic reseller, distribution and or technology partners.
Budget Management to include all aspects of pre-event procurement and post-event reconciliation.
A proven track record of complex event programs with varied stakeholders, multiple product lines, and representing various cross teams within the organization.
Project management including budgets, venue selection, vendor sourcing and management, project plan, event show flow, promotion and registration, content development, on-site management.
Master of multi-tasking, prioritization, and timelines
Experience with sales and marketing automation systems – Salesforce and Marketo, preferred Clari, Demandbase, a bonus
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Thrives in rapid growth, fast paced environment and adapts well to change
Ability to work independently with minimal direction
Team player with a positive attitude.
Some travel will be required
Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Company Description
Who is Opus?

Position Title: Senior Manager, Engagement - Absolut

Position Location: New York City, NY

Position Summary

PRUSA brand marketing is composed by 3 main teams: brand management in charge of long term strategy and innovation, brand engagement leading consumer facing translation of that strategy (incl., social, content, media, ATL, Digital, Experiential), and brand activation managing the relationship with the US regions and key customers.

The role is part of the brand engagement team. It aims at creating the most culturally relevant, talked about brands focusing on social, digital and experiential.

The Senior Manager will be responsible for translating brand programs into campaigns, experiences & conversations with the consumer for one of the most iconic brands of the Pernod Ricard USA (PR USA) portfolio: Absolut Vodka.

In close collaboration with the Brand Management and Activation teams, the Senior Manager will lead the definition, implementation and tracking of best-in-class digital activation and experiential programs driving brand salience, influencer advocacy, consumer engagement and/or conversion (depending on objectives).

This position requires an individual who able to directly manage a team of two, multiple stakeholders, from internal brand and activation partners, cross functional teams, agencies and senior leadership. She/he is a creative, high-energy team player who can think strategically as well as execute to create engaging brand content, shape 360 media plans with digital & social focus. She/he has a drive for analytics, passion for current digital and consumer trends, connections in the industry, and possesses strong business acumen.

Major Responsibilities / Accountabilities
Leverage brand insights and social listening to define most culturally relevant engagement tactics to increase relevance and equity
Develop programs, starting with bold, consumer centric, thumb stopping content and experiences to be amplified through digital and social to generate engagement
Drive paid media strategy leading our agencies, ensure relevant traditional and digital channels are prioritized and creative / targeting optimized.
Build complete media plans hitting brand / program goals and ultimately leading to convert / action, which could include in-store or via any digital channel
Develop best-in-class experiential marketing to ensure premium consumer experience and engagement, content creation, and amplify through digital platforms.
Nature & Scope: This position will work within the Absolut Vodka Brand Team at PRUSA. Work with multiple internal stakeholders, including internal PR USA colleagues, global Pernod Ricard Brand Companies and Digital counterparts outside of the US. In addition, manage relationships with third parties, such as agencies, and other service providers.

This position involves practical, hands-on delivery with a focus on tactical execution. Must be a skilled digital practitioner who can operate as a technical project manager and solve problems creatively – often for \"clients\" who are not well-versed in experiential and digital opportunities and solutions. Demonstrate a high degree of self-sufficiency and be able to work on individual projects, as well as those that require working with teams. Drawing on extensive practical experience, have a high level of technical knowledge in key digital disciplines, such as content development, creative design and web development – as well as good understanding of other areas, such as Data Management Platforms, APIs, CRM and database marketing.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree
8+ years’ experience working at a digital agency or within a digital / comms marketing team.
Experience managing social media platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, Pinterest, YouTube, as well as search (SEO-SEM), eCommerce.
Good understanding of CPG space and millennial consumers.
Preferred Skills
Master’s degree is a plus
Solid level of experience and technical understanding across digital marketing –including social, web, mobile, search, content, CRM, and data management. Comprehensive understanding of web design and development.
Experience managing third party digital/social/mobile agencies or content creators.
Excellent project management skills on large projects.
Experience managing multiple stakeholders -- collaborative, consensus-building approach.
Experience working on the digital publishing side or content development is a plus.
Experience with Photoshop, basic HTML/CSS skills, Adobe Creative Suite or other video and photo editing skills for content creation are a plus.
Understanding of how to take an idea and make it come to life on the right platforms, right formats and distribute to the right targets.
Understanding of how to leverage data in modern marketing. Strong working knowledge of how content and advertising can be amplified using paid media, as well as a working knowledge of traditional media channels.
Travel: Frequent travel up to 30% of the time.

Who are we?

Pernod Ricard USA is a leading premium spirits and wine company in the U.S. The company's leading spirits and wines include such prestigious brands as ABSOLUT® Vodka, Chivas Regal® Scotch Whisky, The Glenlivet® Single Malt Scotch Whisky, Jameson® Irish Whiskey, Malibu®, Kahlúa® Liqueur, Beefeater® Gin, and Avión™ Tequila; such superior wines as Jacob's Creek® and Brancott Estate®; and such exquisite champagnes and sparkling wines as Perrier-Jouët® Champagne, G.H. Mumm™ Champagne and Mumm Napa® sparkling wines. Learn more about our history, values, strategies and organization by visiting us at www.pernod-ricard-usa.com

Position: Marketing Manager

Location: Madison, WI

Full-time/Part-time/Temporary: Full-time

Travel (%): 10%

International: No

Job Summary

Duties and responsibilities of the Marketing Manager – Kid Trax, include managing the brand’s strategic growth through developing and maintaining a consistent positive image for the brand both online and offline. Supporting and assisting the Director of Marketing in all activities related to the brand.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Brand Marketing Responsibilities (30%)
Assists Director of Marketing in building a 1-3 year marketing strategy that connects the passion points of our consumers with our brand, product, and corporate strategies and objectives.
Defines, plans, and launches annual and seasonal campaigns and priorities for the business.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of the brand, category, competitors, and consumers to ensure relevant insights to fuel all marketing elements.
Manages internal and external partners to support the activation of integrated marketing plans. Establishing strong partnerships and processes with our internal teams (Creative services, PR, Sales, Retail, Product, Legal, Customer Service, and Finance) to effectively execute marketing campaigns.
Tracks and manages brand business performance. Analyzes and reports key marketing metrics with a view to strengthening marketing plan / activities for the future.
Manages the Kid Trax marketing budget, spending efficiently to achieve our marketing goals.
Strategically assesses current activation of assets across media, experiential marketing, spokespeople, festivals, and event properties to identify strategic white spaces where our brand should be.
Kid Trax Ecommerce Merchant (30%)
Define and execute our direct to consumer sales strategies for KidTraxToys.com.
Work collaboratively with sales and product management to establish and manage the online assortment including establishing pricing.
Build and execute digital marketing programs and campaigns to drive traffic and profitable sales on KidTraxtoys.com.
Collaborate with the digital marketing team on enhancing SEO and UX.
Manages and executes the Email Marketing program delivering growth in email database and growth in sales conversion.
Content Marketing Duties (20%)
Leads the creation and execution of consumer programs, campaigns, and annual high-profile product launches.
Evaluates creative ideas and thinking with a critical eye and understanding of the brand equity, vision and strategic priorities.
Manages the influencer program, seeking out, vetting, and selecting appropriate individuals to represent the Kid Trax brand.
Develop content for the brand website; keeping in mind brand voice and consumer journey optimization.
Maintain awareness of brand standards and guidelines, and make sure they are implemented for all assets before they are deployed to digital channels.
Measures/analyzes performance of all web activity; including traffic, content views, and demographics, and provide insights and key learnings to affiliated teams.
Social Media & Digital Marketing (10%)
Drives a holistic social media channel strategy that considers brand & product representation.
Build and manage all aspects of multiple social media accounts, including community development and content creation.
Create sharp, enticing content (including, but not limited to Facebook posts, Tweets, Instagram Posts, Instagram stories, and short format videos) which engage the brand’s audience across social channels.
Manage and implement a paid digital and social paid media advertising plan, using data, driven decision making.
Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.
Other Duties Assigned (10%)
Assist in presenting at key customer meetings on key Kid Trax initiatives.
Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
Follows internal controls and company policies set by Pacific Cycle Inc. and Dorel Sports.
Contributes to the success of Pacific Cycle Inc. by leading or assisting with other projects and tasks as assigned.
Minimum Requirements
College education ideally with degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications.
Masters study or degree a benefit.
At least five years experience in marketing role with social media responsibilities.
Experience in selling directly online
Enthusiasm and energy for the position
Passionate about marketing
Outstanding communicator and writer
Exhibit Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) computer skills
Must have own transportation
Will work on site during regular business hours
Team player who enjoys working with others
Dependable
Outgoing and friendly
Self-motivated and creative idea generator

Innovative
Proactive and takes action without being prompted
Creativity
Generates original ideas, encourages new ways of thinking, explores options, and develops innovative solutions
Functional/Technical Expertise
Remains current in their area of expertise and serves as a resource in that area of the organization
Change Agility
Adaptable
Embraces needed change and modifies their behavior when appropriate to achieve organizational objectives

Results Orientation
Maintains an appropriate focus on outcomes and accomplishments
Motivated by achievement, and persist until the goal is reached

Influence
Skilled at directing, persuading, and motivating others

Company Description
Indianapolis Singles has been helping Local Singles find love for nearly twenty years. If you are looking for a rewarding, fast-paced career, this might be the opportunity you have been waiting to come around.

Let's face it, who has time to keep up with the latest hot spot or sign up for the newest online dating app only to find more disingenuous, nameless, faceless matches? Sincere single people invest hours chatting with someone who piques their curiosity, only to discover the photo they posted was from several years ago and a whole different version from the person anticipated meeting on their date. If you have felt these frustrations or know someone who has, then you know one of the reasons our clients come to us seeking a better solution. Indianapolis Singles is a comprehensive service that helps our members meet positive, personable individuals who are interested in developing real, tangible relationships who live, work, and socialize here in the Indianapolis area.

We combine the best aspects of online dating with a host of personalized services to help our clients find that special someone and make their life more enjoyable and manageable. Our extensive screening process ensures that they each connect with people of integrity that they can trust. We will only qualify candidates for membership after they pass a screening process demonstrating they will not pose a threat to our members or their families. Also, we ensure they are functioning members of our community, which means they are employed, financially stable, and are single and serious about looking for a meaningful relationship or a quality social avenue. We also take the time to get to know each of them personally, such as their likes, dislikes, and the type of partner they are looking for and whom they find attractive. As a service-oriented company here in Indianapolis, we offer a range of options to suit their busy schedules and personality.

For us to do these things and so much more, we have to make sure we have a talented and dedicated team of compassionate professionals leading the way. This is where you come in. If you love people, love to work with energetic and passionate colleagues and clients, and are looking for a career rather than a job, please submit your interest immediately. We offer flexible schedules, excellent compensation and benefits, and a culture that values each of our team associates and encourages your suggestions and uniqueness. Contact us today, and let's see if we are 'a match.'

Job Title: GIS Lab, Outreach and Events Coordinator
Job Description:
Washington College is seeking qualified applicants for a GIS Lab, Outreach and Events Coordinator. This position is responsible for assisting the GIS Program Director, and senior GIS professional staff, in the coordination and execution of business and marketing operations for the GIS Program. This position requires the exercise of independent judgment and discretion over the operations of the GIS Program. Broad authority will be given to support the organization by maintaining office systems and enforcing procedures and policies amongst student interns and staff. This position will oversee the coordination of all outreach efforts, and take the lead in planning GIS Program events. Additionally, this position will coordinate GIS Program internships for student workers and manage procedural relationships with internal and external departments, organizations, and/or entities as required to support their success and the overall success of the GIS Program. Primary duties to include: program support by conducting independent and/or directed research, management of information requests, essential clerical functions as needed, assisting with grant management and reporting, collaborating with other campus offices in accounting for student work, creating and updating marketing materials, and coordinating all office related tasks as requested. Handling of sensitive financial and criminal justice information related to funded grants is also required. The successful applicant will report to the Washington College GIS Program Director, and work directly on site in the GIS Lab in Chestertown, Maryland.

Essential Functions:
Responsible for tracking of time spent recorded by project codes; processing student time sheets and time & effort documents; and developing student intern schedules.
Responsible for the preparation and processing of biweekly payroll for student interns; responsible for coordinating efforts between all Washington College departments to ensure proper flow of employee data.
Interface between the GIS Program and other offices on campus exercising independent judgment and discretion on confidential business matters including business transactions, employee hiring, employee reviews, and disciplinary issues.
Coordinates with the Washington College Office of Information Technologies, as well as the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to troubleshoot server, network, and other related IT issues with hardware or software.
Assists in the completion and processing of travel reimbursements and credit card expenses for GIS staff and student interns; maintains accurate records for employee time and leave; management of all consultants, independent contractors, and organizational expenses including property leases, utilities, contractual cleaning, etc.
Responsible for drafting and delivering invoices to customers, and maintaining invoicing tracker; as well as maintaining billing records and expenses for each grant and contract.
Assist in the preparation and management of grant account budgets and contractual project account budgets; monitors and administers program and project revenues and expenses; assists in the development of funded proposals for the GIS program.
Responsible for the purchasing of computers and any office materials needed.
Manage the wide range of Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) maintained between the GIS Program and external organizations; includes creation of new MOA documents for approval by internal and external organizations.
Establish written procedures for all business functions in the GIS Program.
Assists in the creation of marketing and advertisement materials for the program; assists in website updates and posts on social media sites; prepares letters and emails for correspondence with staff, student interns, external clients, and other departments on campus.
Assist the GIS Program Director on any and all projects and tasks as requested.

Education:

Bachelors degree in Business Administration/Management or Accounting, or Marketing/Communications with prior coordination and/or office management experience is preferred. Relevant work experience may be used to supplement degree in other academic fields.

Experience and Background:
Prior experience in a similar position required.
Must be self-directed and able to complete projects with limited supervision.
Windows computer experience with Access and Excel skills highly desired.
Accounting management software experience preferred.
Proven track record exercising independent judgment to find cost savings in utilities, leases, and other business costs.
Experience handling and prioritizing multiple tasks successfully, meeting all deadlines.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Interest in coordinating with multiple departments, across a range of academic, personal and professional backgrounds, to complete tasks.

Aspen Aerogels is the global leader in aerogel technology. The companys mission is to enable its customers and partners to shape their own strategies around the global megatrends of resource efficiency and sustainability. The companys Cryogel® and Pyrogel® products are valued by the worlds largest energy infrastructure companies. The companys Spaceloft® products provide building owners with industry-leading energy efficiency including options for a safe, non-combustible fire rating. The companys strategy is to partner with world-class industry leaders to leverage its aerogel technology platform into additional markets. Headquartered in Northborough, Mass., Aspen Aerogels manufactures its products at its East Providence, R.I. facility.

SUMMARY: The Regional Marketing Manager will support the regional sales team by closely coordinating collection of, contribution to, assembly of, and training of regionally focused marketing activities. The position is located in Northborough, MA and will primarily ensure best practices are implemented in prospecting, meeting preparation, lead capture, and lead follow up with the sales team. The regional marketing associate will also support regional customer facing events in coordination with the marketing team.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coordinate ongoing support of the regional sales team to ensure best practices in sales effectiveness are practiced, monitored, and optimized in pursuit of company targets.
Host regular calls / meetings to ensure best practices including prospecting, pre-call planning, contact building, meeting preparation and post meeting follow up are adhered to.
Coordinate with Sales & Marketing team to identify, coordinate and analyze goal driven campaigns for a range of segments.
Manage lead flows and interact with prospects and leads across a range of technology platforms.
Identify, qualify, and capture new leads in existing and emerging markets for the regional sales team.
Support identification, capture and validation of value propositions, collaborate internally to maximize impact of benefits through training and value reinforcement with the regional sales team.
Ensure that sales support tools are implemented and feedback captured and reported to maximize utilization and effectiveness.
Support identification and publication of regional social media contributions.
Identify & support execution of regional events including, training workshops, customer roadshow events, conferences, exhibitions, customer days.
Support the company brand / presence at customer, contractor, partner, and distributer sites.
Complete research projects to support regional strategy and goals. Contribute to planning, reporting, and budgeting cycles.
Work with Field Sales team to support their meetings and opportunities by researching new and existing opportunities and customers as needed.
Provide day to day support for forecasting, pipeline management, and report generation for the regional sales team as required.
Participate in sales visits with field sales (two trips per quarter minimum).
Performs other related duties as assigned by management.
Adopt and follow Aspens core values of Safety, Quality, Integrity, Teamwork, Customer and Innovation on both a personal and professional level.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
This job has no supervisory responsibilities.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong listening skills, ability capture situational information, develop needs and implication through a variety of interactions.
Strong verbal/written communication skills.
Ability to speak articulately about technical matters.
Ability to multi task and work under tight deadlines.
Sound worth ethic and positive attitude towards customer service.
Energetic self-starter, ability to anticipate key needs.
BS or BA or equivalent experience.
2-5 years experience.
Travel 10-15%
Experience with CRM such as Salesforce.com essential.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and related products.
Technical knowledge of Oil and Gas and/or Power Generation Markets a plus.

About Juniper Square


Our mission is to make the world's private capital markets more efficient, transparent, and accessible. Privately owned assets like commercial real estate make up half of our financial ecosystem yet remain inaccessible to most people. We are digitizing these markets and as a result bringing access to millions who don't currently benefit from one of the most productive corners of our financial ecosystem. If you care about making the world a better place by making markets work better through technology—all while contributing as a member of a values-driven organization—we want to hear from you. We've tripled our team in each of the past three years while maintaining an excellent culture and staying true to our values. We are well-funded and building for the long-term, and are on track to triple our headcount again this year. We need YOU to help us achieve our mission.

About your role


We are looking for someone who will generate awareness and create demand using a variety of marketing vehicles and tactics including regional and national trade shows, conferences, professional associations and targeted field events. The primary objective being to move accounts through the sales pipeline and accelerate the sales cycle for prospects and customers through the execution of marketing programs. The successful candidate will have the ability to build connections quickly with customers and industry stakeholders, be able to balance multiple competing priorities in a fast paced environment, and have very strong attention to detail.

What you'll do
You'll identify insights that inform our event strategy by becoming an expert on our industry, customers, prospects, and competition.
You'll develop processes to streamline and scale the execution of event campaigns
You'll attend and manage 25+ events annually, including implementation of a pre-event strategy and post-event follow up both internally and with prospects/customers
You'll build a regional field marketing plan that ties into pipeline and strategy
You'll manage the logistics of our current field events while helping us grow both nationally and internationally
You'll develop a social media strategy related to our events calendar and marketing outputs
You'll help execute on thought leadership opportunities for both executives at our firm and customers
You'll work cross-functionally with sales, business operations and customer success to align campaign goals and timelines
Qualifications
5-7 years years of experience in field marketing, business development and/or event marketing
Experience working at a B2B technology company, preferably SaaS
Must be able to travel 50% of the time
Ability to build strong partnerships and influence outcomes cross-functionally
Excellent communication skills both internally and externally
Crisis management skills with a solution oriented mindset
Detail oriented and the ability to adhere to tight deadlines
Experience with commercial real estate is a plus, but not required
Benefits
Competitive salary and meaningful equity
Health, dental, and vision care for you and your family
Unlimited vacation policy and paid holidays
Generous paid family leave, medical leave, and bereavement leave policies
401k retirement savings plan
Healthcare FSA and commuter benefits programs
Freedom to customize your work and technology setup as you see fit
Professional development stipend
Monthly work from home wellness stipend while we're all remote
Mental wellness coverage including live coaching and therapy sessions
At Juniper Square, we're building a company where all kinds of people from all walks of life are valued and respected. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. If you think this job sounds like you, come join us! We'd love to hear from you.

Overview

SMS is seeking a DCO Event Manager to join our team on our Air Force Project. This position will work closely to develop an overarching plan to incorporate and implement cyberspace defense capabilities, processes, and procedures on assigned Government IT systems throughout USSF

SMS has been serving the advanced information technology needs of the federal government since 1976, delivering talented teams and innovative, cost-effective solutions and services to support our customers' missions for more than 40 years. SMS is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with offices and on-site operations at customer locations throughout the United States. As a dynamic systems integrator, SMS offers proven solutions in engineering, operations, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. With expertise in modernizing and optimizing legacy infrastructure and systems, ensuring operational efficiency, and designing, implementing, and managing secure environments, SMS supports business and mission goals with proficiency, quality, and integrity. Join our team of top talent in supporting the federal government. Apply Today!

Responsibilities

DCO Event Manager prepares and or coordinates Request for Support (RFS) as needed or tasked based on operational and intelligence environment for space missions. Support routine requests to include, but not limited to, coordinating base/wing/installation support, de-conflicting schedules, coordinating IA approvals, and coordinating various customer groups. Support coordination between the receiving unit and the assessment team for cyberspace vulnerability assessments.
Provide Government leads with the necessary information so the Government leads can task applicable support teams for fix-actions identified via Government processes and procedures, track and report status of these fix-actions and POA&M that identifies units affected, timing, tempo and costs of fix-actions required.
Develop and execute processes to receive and submit nominations to implement cyberspace security measures, including, but not limited to, system/network updates, patches, software, hardware requirements, and cyberspace security tools, for mission systems.
Understand and analyze reports or other cyberspace security assessments of assigned Government IT systems and all space wings.
Coordinate with outside stakeholders or other applicable units to resolve findings and inform leadership of potential risks and recommendations for mitigation of risks.
Must have excellent communications skills.
Must have experience working with various trouble ticketing systems (Remedy, ServiceNow, etc.).
Qualifications

Clearance
Must have a current DoD TS/SCI Clearance
Certifications
ITIL Foundations preferred
Education
Bachelor's degree in a related field preferred
Experience
3-5 years of experience in within a Cyber security field.
SMS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

SMS is a veteran-owned network integrator established in 1976. With an employee retention rate averaging over 5 years, our ability to hire quality people and retain them in a rapidly evolving IT market proves why we are a world-class information technology company. At SMS, we place a high value on quality of service, customer satisfaction, and best-of-breed policies and practices. As a result, SMS is proud to be ISO 9001:2008 Registered and a CMMI Level 3 certified company, ensuring that we continue to meet and exceed the expectations of our customers, partners and employees.

This role is responsible for guiding and supporting the activation business, and overseeing a team of Regional Directors across on & off-premise retail sampling, as well as sponsorships & events. The VP of Activation has strategic understanding and tactical expertise of consumer facing brand experiences. The right individual possesses dynamic leadership skills, the ability develop and mentor a team of regional activation directors, and make sound business decisions. VP Activation leads a cross channel team, guides multiple departments, and functions as a strategic business partner to key client stakeholders, to ensure event activation exceeds high standards of excellence.

Provide long-term perspective for brand and business growth
Function as strategic business partner to key client stakeholders
Demonstrate a thorough understanding and a passion for client’s industry brands
Lead and manage team of Regional Directors across retail sampling and events & sponsorships to ensure flawless execution of 70K+ events
Develop; retain and motivate team Regional Directors and ensure actionable steps are taken in succession planning
Ensure activation teams and local staff are armed with market leading experiential strategies, and activation / production guides
Ensure activation team is adhering to standard operating procedures, and event protocols
Provide continuous and constructive feedback to direct reports; conduct performance reviews
Provide national oversight of sponsorship negotiation and event approvals including comprehensive knowledge of events that best match brand goals and investments
Lead weekly communications with regional, local, and central teams

Job Description
NYC Proctor Coordinator Job Description

Overview

The goal of the our team is to educate businesses of all sizes how to leverage Social Media to build and grow their businesses. The Blueprint team is entrepreneurial-minded and dedicated to delivering the ultimate learning experiences for partners across multiple channels. Our mission is to democratize scaled education for businesses big and small.

Blueprint consists of 3 pillars: Online (eLearning), In-Person (Blueprint Live and Blueprint Spotlight), and Blueprint Certification.

Blueprint Online provides a set of foundational online courses that serve as the one-stop place for agencies, clients, marketing partners and SMB’s to go for all things Facebook marketing.

Blueprint In-Person is the in-person training program taught in a workshop format that teaches how to take the foundational principles taught within the eLearning and apply them to client or business problems with the feedback/supervision of Facebook trainers.

Blueprint Certification is a rigorous, exam-based program that certifies advertising professionals in advanced-level Facebook marketing skills.

Project Description (Business Need and Deliverables):
Looking for a coordinator to serve in a supporting role for all three pillars of the Blueprint In-person program and those who execute them in the region. Primary focus on supporting the North American region with secondary responsibilities of supporting the other regions globally.

Responsibilities
Support regional events within the USA/Canada, working with vendor agencies to source venues, catering, AV and any other resources needed for the event.
Manage the scheduling, invitations, materials and logistics for all regional in-person programs.
Work with internal partners to execute events, from set-up to on-the-ground support, to data analysis of survey & attendance feedback.
Set up Certification events including testing software & internet bandwidth, setting up laptops and proctor audience.
Maintain, update and report on regional and global data tracking sheets for all regional in-person programs.
Manage purchase order requests and invoice submissions for all events.
Manage voucher tool for Certification program; from creation, organization to distribution and maintaining tracking. Act as a POC for internal and external partners on all things regarding vouchers for our region.
Minimum of 20% travel across US/Canada to support Certification events.
Skills, Competencies, and Tools Required (must haves):
1-3 years of work experience providing all round event management support and coordination
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously
Efficient and organized with excruciating attention to detail
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills essential / works well under pressure
Ability to deliver high-quality work within tight timelines
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and on multiple initiatives in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment
Strong customer service orientation while maintaining a high level of integrity and confidentiality
Coordinate course enrollment and scheduling on a long-term and short-term basis
Generate standard and ad-hoc reports
Proficient in Excel, Word, Outlook
Basic troubleshooting IT skills preferred, especially email, spreadsheets, and exam delivery software
A good sense of humor, a positive attitude and great teamwork skills
Other (nice to haves):
Bachelor's degree or similar work experience
Digital marketing experience

The JRT agency® is growing, so we’re looking for an accomplished Account Director to manage the entirety of marketing communications work for a Japanese-headquartered, global automotive products client that is expanding its brand work across a multitude of countries. The ideal candidate has taken a variety of programs and projects (varying in size and complexity) from inception through launch, including both digital and traditional communications. This job requires daily contact with clients in the U.S. and internationally; in fact, you will be the key individual representing the agency’s work, under the guidance of a client accounts SVP. You’ll have a support team alongside you representing other agency disciplines — strategy, creative, account support, production and digital design — but you will be asked to take a leadership role building, rallying and setting a team dynamic second to none.

There’s one more preferred qualification: Have you worked with Japanese clients or a Japanese-based company? While clients are proficient in both English and Japanese —and clients are based both in the U.S. and globally — experience working with a Japanese business culture is a big plus.

If you thrive in a multi-faceted environment where you drive team development, don’t shy from a challenge, and ultimately lead the collaboration and activity across departments, we’d love to hear from you.

Job Responsibilities
Serve as a primary contact for clients and internal stakeholders
Participate in strategic planning and proposal development based on client
business objectives
Develop and manage all aspects of PR, advertising, customer retention, digital and social programs and campaigns (100+ projects annually)
Supervise two direct account reports and coordinate activities across other teams
Oversee client budget/financial management, drafting quotes, securing purchase orders, forecasting agency revenue and tracking time on jobs to ensure the agency delivers within secured budgets
Ability to actively manage the priorities of each project and to work with other managers internally to reallocate resources as needed
Actively participate and ensure proper development across departments for correct messaging and quality
Become an expert on the client’s business and agency services
Lead and inspire all involved teams while maintaining visibility on project progress and identifying issues that could impede project development
Qualifications
10+ years of related professional experience in marketing/advertising, with experience working with automotive and/or tier 1 supplier clients
Experience working with international teams and customers, with strongly demonstrated team and client leadership ability
Demonstrated ability in marketing planning and execution
Extensive experience managing day-to-day client relationships
Bachelor’s degree (4-year college) or higher education required
Excellent communication, preparation, presentation skills; effectively able to communicate with and influence the customer and internal communities and stakeholders
Preferred Experience and Skills (not a requirement, but desired)
English and Japanese communication skills
Previous experience with Japanese automotive OEMs
Experience with and in Japanese business culture
If we are describing a role and place that you would like to know more about, please start a conversation with us by emailing your cover letter and resume, including “Account Director” in the subject line.

We look forward to hearing from you.

ABOUT THE JRT AGENCY®

The JRT agency® is a creative marketing communications agency made up of people with diverse skills and experiences. Along with our sister company, CG Detroit®, we are 100+ strong. We describe ourselves as a 45-year-old start-up, working with some of the biggest automotive brands and other great companies in a variety of industries. We excel in advertising, publishing, PR, experiential marketing, web development and digital media technologies, offering highly competitive salaries, paid time off, healthcare, dental, vision, 401(k) and more. We love, love, love and reward high achievers who show a passion for their work and naturally possess a high-performance, collaborative work ethic. Importantly, we reciprocate by working as a transparent culture with open dialogue and monthly agency meetings. We also give back to the community regularly and enjoy seasonal social activities, too.

See yourself here.

Job Title: Manager, North America Channel Marketing - AR/VR
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.AR/VR is looking for a highly talented Manager, North America Channel Marketing to take on this exciting new role in our Menlo Park, CA office focused on Facebook hardware. Reporting to the Head of NA Retail Sales, this role will lead all NA marketing operations, including retail/channel marketing, experiential programs, customer acquisition and retention while fully supporting the for all AR/VR products across brick and mortar & online retail accounts.

Responsibilities:

Lead, recruit, develop and manage team of channel marketing managers to support strategic account managers in accomplishing channel specific goals for Facebook hardware
Develop GTM marketing strategy for NA retail to optimize awareness, trial and conversion
Lead & execute marketing and merchandising initiatives with NA retail partners within agreed upon budgets and KPIs
Continuous measurement, optimization of marketing programs to drive efficiency
Management and distribution of co-marketing budget, focusing on performance metrics
Present key marketing materials in front of retailers, executives, business development teams
Manage content & campaign activities across retailers ensuring our content meets brand standards and is in service of overall team strategy
Identify new channel marketing opportunities and position for review to help in future decisions
Coordinate and manage marketing elements of QBRs including share regional context & performance across channels

10+ years experience in a marketing role, with a clear record of achievement and success in technology based consumer product marketing and/or product management
Experience and clear understanding of the North American retail landscape
Experience in go-to-market planning and execution across online and traditional retail channels
Proven communication and presentation skills with business acumen
Knowledge for innovation and the opportunities presented by disruptive technologies
Bachelors degree in business or related field with post-graduate business/marketing qualification

Job Description


We are seeking an Associate Manager, Event Production to support the planning and execution of experiential marketing programs. This position will consist of element transportation, event execution, in-office tasks, and other work at Fusion Marketing. This Associate Manager role requires extensive travel to and from event sites in support of all areas of the event execution including element transportation, set-up, event management, and break down. The candidate should be prepared for a minimum of 50-75% road travel during the first year, including weekends and some holidays.

In the office, the position will be responsible for supporting event preparations, recapping, maintaining personal expenses, and any other account related tasks that may arise. This position will be utilized in supporting additional key accounts as needed, as well as actively engaging in various company initiatives.

The Associate Manager is responsible for working effectively with both client and internal account teams to support event programs that achieve client results against established strategic & creative objectives, timelines and financial goals. The ideal candidate should have relevant experience in experiential marketing production and execution, be self-motivated, thrive under pressure, work well in a fast-paced competitive industry, and have a passion for event production, execution and logistics.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support all aspects of event activation
Responsible for maintaining and submitting timely expense reports and DOT log books
Travel as needed, ensuring availability for all required event dates
Understand event budgets ensuring that financial goals are always met
Collaborate with the Account Manager to support the activation plan, budgeting, event execution, recapping, and reconciliation
Take ownership of event and transportation elements
Collaborate with vendors to ensure quality and workability and that the various projects meet the core objectives of the program
Work closely with staffing agencies to support the hiring, training and managing the event staff needs for the programs
Manage the warehousing PO system and understand/execute the shipping process
Document and learn all aspects of the account elements to assist in creating manuals and/or physical training
Collaborate with peers in the department to foster innovation
QUALIFICATIONS:
1+ year experience in experiential marketing and/or event production
Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience
1+ Year Touring/Road experience
CDL not required but a plus
Pays close attention to detail
Demonstrates knowledge and desire to learn event production
Excellent customer focus, interpersonal and written communication skills
Ability to handle numerous account tasks simultaneously with excellent organizational skills, while self-managing priorities and commitments
Ability to pro-actively anticipate obstacles and create solutions
Must possess a strong work ethic, can-do attitude, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment
Willing and able to work nonstandard work hours and weekends as required (this is not a 9 to 5 job), and possess a good sense of humor!
Willing to travel at minimum 50 – 75% of the calendar year
Passion for new technology, sports and entertainment and live events
