Job Title: Vice President, Product Management & Marketing - Commercial Building Products
Job Description:
Req ID: 7806

Sloan is the world’s leading manufacturer of commercial plumbing systems and has been in operation since 1906. We are at the forefront of the green building movement and provide sustainable restroom solutions. We manufacture water-efficient products including flush valves, electronic faucets, soap dispensing and sink systems along with vitreous china fixtures for commercial, industrial and institutional markets worldwide.

We have an immediate need for a Vice President of Product Management & Marketing at our global Corporate Heaquarters in Franklin Park, IL. This position reports directly to the Chief Sales & Marketing Officer and will be responsible for leading, developing and executing a clearly defined marketing strategy in a manner that supports consistent and measurable business growth. The VP will "sit at the sales, customer experience and marketing management team table" to assist in the formulation and execution of the company's strategic direction. This position is responsible for planning, organizing, staffing, training and managing all global marketing functions (4Ps - Product, price, placement/channel and promotion) to achieve Sloan's objectives for sales, growth, profitability, and visibility in the marketplace; in alignment with the company's strategic direction. Key responsibility is leading and driving product development via product management function. Will also be responsible for leading the strategic planning process with VP/C-suite team.

Responsibilities:
Serve as a key and active member of the management operating team. Provide leadership for the development of global strategic marketing plans including objectives and strategy for targeted markets
Lead product management team to drive efforts with product and global business development to define an overall product portfolio strategy, multi-generation product plans (MGPP), that will drive the long term growth of the organization. Ensure the development of all strategic product roadmaps and corresponding marketing plans
Lead the process for the continuous evaluation of trends and adjust strategy to capitalize on shifts in the marketplace; including the process of obtaining and disseminating competitive intelligence across all markets and product lines
Develop marketing and sales promotion programs and direct marcom team in developing promotional material including managing website, social media, video, collaterals, etc.
Monitor business metrics in regard to revenues, profitability, market share and product portfolio mix. Provides on-going communication of these metrics to the senior management team
Collaborate with Sales, channel partners, and reps to define effective sales channels of all products and establish effective relationship with the sales force for leadership, training, pricing, and positioning expertise. Develop ecommerce and alternative channels to drive growth.
Develop and provide leadership for a data driven high performing product and vertical market management teams to drive the execution of strategic marketing plans for meeting Sloan's overall business objectives
Lead and develop pricing programs, quote management, and pricing analytics to drive profitable growth across global teams.
Establish metrics for the measurement of marketing program effectiveness. Develop and manage the marketing budget. Responsible (in collaboration with sales) for the development of the company's revenue forecast
Other duties and responsibilities as required.
Requirements:
3+ years in a senior marketing leadership position as VP or Director with durable goods experience, preferably with two step distribution process in building products/construction industry.
Must have Bachelor degree in Engineering or business or equivalent, preferably with MBA or masters in finance.
Background working in a middle market organization with increasing responsibility is a plus with strong financial acumen.
Must have experience as product manager in previous roles with strategic planning background
Experience in channel management, pricing and marcom, preferably with experienced in digital marketing and experiential marketing
Proven success and track record as an individual contributor and manager who has grown top and bottom line results
Demonstrated working experience with sales team and customer support organization, preferably some experience in sales position.
High level of personal and professional integrity and trustworthiness with strong work ethic and the ability to work independently with minimal direction
Excellent communications and presentation skills
Strategic, critical thinker, with an innovative spirit, strong business sense and excellent financial skills
Highly collaborative with the ability to lead, create and work within cross-functional team environments
Strong data driven, using best practices in market research and analysis to formulate and measure marketing programs
*If interested, please email careers@sloan.com to apply!

We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package, including:
Medical, dental, vision, Rx coverage for employee plus eligible dependents
Life and AD & D insurance, dependent life insurance, long term disability, and HSA, FSA
Employer matching 401K, PTO, holidays, EAP, wellness programs, on-site medical staff and fitness center
We Are Proud Partners With the Chicago Cubs:

We are a Legacy Partner of the Chicago Cubs and we are proud to be the organization’s official water efficiency partner! Through this relationship, which includes the naming rights to Sloan Park, the Cubs’ Spring Training facility in Mesa, Arizona, we have had the opportunity to promote our brand and continue our water conservation efforts in the city of Chicago and around the world

JOIN AN INDUSTRY LEADER!

About Leap:

At Leap were building a world-class platform to drive growth for emerging brands by developing and operating branded retail stores. On the Leap platform, brands can easily open stores to connect with more customers and drive profitable growth - both offline and online. Branded stores *powered by Leap* deliver impactful and memorable customer experiences while helping brands to capture more customers, data and powerful insights that accelerate product innovation and overall growth. In our first year we've grown to 12 stores for 9 brands across New York City, San Francisco, Chicago and Miami and are set to grow even more rapidly in 2020 and beyond.

Mission for the position:

The Growth Marketing Manager, will work in partnership with the VP of Brand Management and the Leap Leadership Team in developing scalable, programmatic approaches and marketing plans to drive local traffic to the branded stores (and Brand websites) on the Leap platform. To do so, the CRM & Growth Marketing Manager will leverage Leaps large customer file and build marketing programs and a always on approach through Leap and Brand owned assets (email, CRM, social) and paid media (social, web, OOH, radio, direct mail, etc) at both the local and regional level. Understanding the full cycle of strategy, creative, buying, implementation, tracking/optimization will be paramount for success in this role.

Key responsibilities:

Develop and execute a marketing strategy across owned and paid channels
Create and deploy store-level email CRM programing and flows setup inclusive of post visit NPS survey, product/store reviews, cross selling to other products and cross selling to other brands/stores
Create and deploy paid digital utilizing the audience & geo-targeting strategies to drive ramp new store openings and drive traffic to Leap powered stores (i.e. FB/IG paid media, google)
Partner with internal & external creative resources to create assets needed for owned assets and paid media activations
Explore and build offline marketing strategies that create synergies across brands to boost store performance (i.e multi-brand Direct mail, OOH)
Manage Leap owned assets (Instagram, Website, Twitter, Linkedin)
Collaborate directly with partner brands for regional test & learns that drive traffic to stores (Email CRM, Digital, Social, OOH, Print, Radio, etc)
Support the marketing and stores team in the development of brand-centric components of overall retail strategy (i.e. experiential marketing, sales process / content for staff trainings, etc.)
Manage budgets (by channel/brand), KPIs, optimizations and synthesis of results
Create and define benchmarks, recommendations and optimizations
Partner with the marketing, retail operations team and store managers synthesize and analyze marketing program performance and results
Create recommendations, case studies and guides to help brands understand marketing activations and investments that work to drive store performance
Drive new channels and cutting edge activations
Explore new technology, tools and platforms that can drive traffic & store performance both in marketing campaigns and in-store with test and learns.
Competencies & attributes for success:
+5 years experience in marketing with focus to email CRM, social & digital activations and brand building
Experience working at smaller, scrappy startup preferred with knowledge of retail, DTC, luxury and fashion brands landscape.
Well versed in direct (non agency) social media management (buying, deploying, measuring)
Experience in designing & creating digital content & printed collateral or working with external resources (i.e. freelancers)
Exceptional written and verbal communication ability
Strong creative and problem solving skills
Strong teamwork and leadership skills
Self starter, humble, quick learner, with high aptitude for self-improvement
Extreme attention to detail; ability to understand the big picture while operating in weeds
Outcomes & measures of success:
Successful email & digital program deployment and ongoing management including strategy, implementation, reporting, analysis and optimization, as measured against program performance targets for contribution to email performance, store traffic and sales.
Consistent timely delivery of marketing program performance reports
Development of new marketing programs for brands to opt into
Successful implementation of Leap Brand owned asset strategy by deploying engaging content and growing follower counts
Consistent successful collaboration with direct report management, store managers and staff and corporate administrative functional leaders (e.g. HR, etc.)
Contribution to the development of a team-oriented high performance culture within the firm

Job Title: Senior Back End Drupal Developer (Must be US Citizen)
Job Description:
Taoti Creative is looking a senior level, back-end, Drupal developer (US Citizens ONLY)

For this role, we are open to in-house, remote, full time, and contractor status. Basically, we're open to anything, SO LONG AS YOU ARE A US CITIZEN because we need you to work on some projects that have that requirement.

(Sorry in advance for the long read. But this is your career we’re talking about here! It’s worth the extra detail, right? The right fit is critical for both of our sakes, so please forgive us in advance for the verbosity.)

First, a quick blurb about Taoti…

Established in 1996, Taoti Creative is a boutique, full-service creative agency located on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC. We are privately owned and have no corporate overloads (nothing personal, WPP.) We do stuff like web development, social media management, branding, experiential marketing, video, AR/VR, etc. Our mission is to ‘move the needle’ for our clients. We compete (and cooperate) with companies like Huge, Ogilvy, ISL, Chief, ForumOne, etc. We leverage technology, creativity, and innovation to generate meaningful and measurable results for our clients—that’s what drives us. Speaking of clients, they’re about 60% non-profits, 20% commercial, and 20% federal government. Some of our customers include World Bank, USAID, DC Water, Discovery Education, American Chemical Society, Jane Goodall Foundation, and dozens of ‘National Association of _____________,’ etc. Our full time team of about 50 employees is about 65% in-house and 35% remote. We hail from over 12 countries. And for the last three years in a row, we’ve made the Inc5000 list of fastest growing companies in the United States. There’s of course plenty of additional information on our website. If you’ve not done so already, be sure to check out our culture video: https://vimeo.com/289302105. Or if you’re feeling virtual, here’s guided tour of the office in 360 video! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7KkzdmSGTM (Warning: not suitable for printers.)

Things you'll do on the job:
Lead the technical planning, user story and technical acceptance creation, and coding.
Guide and manage other developers that are contributing code to the project.
Estimate the level of development tasks within a project.
Identify and correct complex bugs and problems.
Plan technical architectures that minimize or eliminate performance problems, complexity, or solution fragility.
Work independently or with limited oversight to create high quality applications that meet specifications.
Serve as the technical lead in a client-facing capacity on medium and large-sized projects.
Write custom modules for Drupal..
Build web sites and applications by writing object-oriented PHP and configuring and extending content management software (Drupal).
Assess existing sites/systems for code quality and interactive appeal.
Evangelize for best practices for open source development.
The challenges of this role…

Like any dev role, balancing timelines, budgets, requirements, and customer happiness is always a challenge. Because this is a senior level role, we generally expect you to be able to get up to speed quickly and be self-sufficient for the most part. You’ll be working in a team of 3-6 other developers under a Technical Manager that helps your team deliver its work. At any given time, you may be working on several projects at the same day, so jumping back and forth between projects is always a challenge in an agency environment, but we try hard to let developers focus more time on fewer projects when we can, as we understand that’s how we become more efficient as a group.

What it’s like to be a remote developer at Taoti

Many companies hire remote developers and treat them like code monkeys that they pay to deliver code. Taoti is different. Taoti wants to hire you as part of our in-house team. And while you may not technically be under our office roof, you’re as much a part of the team as those who are. We’ll sing happy birthday to you over video chat, fly you to DC for company retreats, and communicate (usually via Slack) all day long with you. Better yet, you get many of the benefits that we offer the rest of our employees, like paid time off and holidays (and if you’re in the United States, health insurance, retirement account contributions, etc.) You’ll get a fixed monthly salary, regardless of how many hours you work, even if we have nothing for you to do (but that won’t be an issue—we always have work to do.) You may be technically be a subcontractor to us, but we’ll treat you like an in-house employee. And we want you to treat us the same way! (Note: Taoti has about 50 employees. About 20 of them are developers. And of those 20, more than half are spread throughout South, Central, and North America. Most of the non-developer staff is based out of our DC office, so we have a unique culture in that regard, but it works well.

Tips for getting onto the short list…

First, you have to be a senior level developer and have the experience and code to show us that you really know what you’re doing. There will be several interviews and code reviews. It’s important that you’re a good cultural fit in addition to being an excellent coder. We want to know that you will work well with in a team both technically and socially. It isn't just about the code for us. Your personality and contribution to our culture are important to us as well. Finally, because we value communication and collaboration so highly, great English is a must. It's the reason we are only considering the Americas and not India or Europe. There are great devs there too, but we want people who are awake when we are and can work with us in real time.

What’s the corporate culture like?

We have a great culture (in fact, we've won several awards for being so cool! ;-) We're a pretty casual shop. You can generally wear whatever you want. Lots of telework flexibility. You’ll have access to anyone/everyone in the company, including the CEO. Not only is it okay to question decisions and policy, but it’s part of your job to do so when you see a better way. The team is fun and social. We do a lot in and outside of the office together—from boat trips to happy hours to roof yoga. There are all sorts of perks and benefits, but culture isn’t about perks and benefits—it’s about a way of thinking. And our way of thinking goes back to the mission: to move the needle. We’re all about doing great work that gets meaningful and measurable results for our clients. And everything else that we do here, be it fun or work, in some way drives towards that objective. (As one employee puts it, “We’re fun, but focused.” That sums it up pretty well. There are some pictures of the office on the website and our Instagram account: https://www.instagram.com/taoticreative/?hl=en. Always feel free to drop in and see for yourself.

What about benefits?

(Note: the below are benefits for in-house, W2 employees. If you are remote, you generally get most of these benefits, but there are a few differences for logistic and legal reasons.)
3 weeks PTO for starters. You gain more with tenure. And if you’re really big in to PTO, you can even trade back some salary for more.
Telework options (which work like PTO… you accrue days with each paycheck. TELE days increase with tenure as well. By your fourth year, we don’t even count them any more.)
100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance. (50% for qualifying dependents.) And we have good insurance.
Paid family leave for men and women (including PTO plus short and long term disability options.)
3% retirement plan matching (plus access to a financial advisor).
Home buyer help (including a $1200 closing credit)
Mobile phone reimbursement
You can opt for a company-supplied PC or Mac laptop. Or if you want to use your own, we’ll reimburse you for it.
Charitable contribution matching
Guaranteed annual raises
Tax-free metro benefits
A legit 40-hour work week (not 60 hours like some shops essentially require)
Weekly, in-office Yoga and Meditation sessions
Money and time off allocated for professional development (also increases with tenure)
A diverse team hailing from over 15 countries last time we checked
A very hip/cool/funky/quirky office space on Barracks Row, in the heart of Capitol Hill. Just 2 blocks from the metro! (With the office space doubling in size next year as we build a new building in the parking lot next door to our building.)
Fun perks like a roof deck, wine/beer always on tap, regular company boat outings (boat is walking distance from the office), chill work environment, etc.
No real dress code (within reason, as long as you can be an adult about getting dressed for work)
Weekly yoga and meditation classes
Annual global retreat (where we bring the whole team together for fun, games, and teamwork)
Of course, the above is a quick list. See the handbook for all the gory details.

Next steps…

If you’re qualified and interested, please apply on our website (www.taoti.com/careers.) Please note that these job ads often get placed onto other websites with their own application systems (we’re looking at you Jooble!) We aren't able to respond to applications that don’t come through our own website (Because we use software to manage our hiring process, and without it, it would be the wild west here. So please be sure you’re applying on our website.)

Equal Opportunity Employer

Taoti embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Pretty please, no recruiters.

S.O.P.’s.

operation.

Event days or dictated by the event requirements.

Responsibilities

Share your passion for creating a warm and welcoming environment with your team
Deliver fast and accurate service

Plans and oversees on-site meetings and promotions for all partners of Dorney Park. This includes Burger King, Dunkin’ Donuts, Subway, Wendy’s, etc

DESCRIPTION
Coding Dojo is growing our digital marketing instructional team and are seeking a Digital Marketing instructor for classes at our Bellevue WA campus. The instructor will lead the delivery of the Digital Marketing programs through in-person and live-online instruction for entry level to pro cohorts. The Instructor will monitor student success and provide 1:1 guidance as needed.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Teach Coding Dojo’s Digital Marketing programs
Facilitate group discussions, demos, in-class activities and feedback & coaching sessions
Prepare students for success by providing coaching in all aspects of their journey towards becoming strategic thinkers and problem solvers
Provide actionable feedback on student’s soft and hard skills
Develop student’s storytelling and presentation skills
Follow industry trends related to Digital Marketing
Play a hands-on role in curriculum development, use what you learn from working with students to make our curriculum world class
Day to day instruction of students, following a well-curated curriculum, supplemented with your own professional experiences
Implement state law policies relating to career / vocational schools, such as enforcing student attendance, the grading of assignments, etc.
Gather and report on student metrics
Participate in occasional project and curriculum development, as well as curriculum refinement
Participate on and off campus activities, including but not limited to: orientation, open houses, student events, graduations, tech talks and workshops related to Digital Marketing
Participate in professional training, so you stay fresh!
EDUCATIONAL AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
You must have proficient Digital Marketing experience, preferably in a leadership role. Please ensure you meet or exceed the following:
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university
Fluency in customer segmentation, targeting, tracking, paid media, social media platforms, community management, paid search, Google Analytics & AdWords, Facebook Ads, email, experiential and events marketing
Experience developing marketing campaigns combining a variety of media
Design Thinking experience
Knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Teaching and leading teams experience a big plus
A combo of digital marketing, technology and education in your background is preferred
WE'D LOVE TO WORK WITH YOU IF...
You are passionate about learning, helping others, and making a positive impact in the world. Your energy will be an important driver for the success of our students and staff.
You are a highly motivated individual with leadership skills who can guide and lead our students.
You are willing to travel 15% of the time to other campuses.
Teaching, mentorship, and coaching experience is a big plus!
ABOUT CODING DOJO
Coding Dojo is an industry-leading coding bootcamp whose flagship program is unmatched: we teach 3 full stacks in 3 months—a mixture of which can include iOS, Python, MEAN, Rails, C#, Java, or LAMP. This position is a rare opportunity to join a rapidly growing start-up and make a positive impact in many people's lives.
Coding Dojo has campuses in Silicon Valley, Seattle, Los Angeles, Dallas, Arlington, Chicago, Tulsa, Boise, and online.
Coding Dojo offers a competitive salary and standard benefits.
We're looking for Digital Marketing innovators who are passionate about learning and helping others. Our instructors get to teach, work on projects, as well as develop curriculum and new courses for the Dojo.

Company Description
Sparks Worldwide is an outsourced experiential marketing firm. Sparks Worldwide started with five highly motivated individuals that understand the clients goals and more importantly the opportunity provided likeminded individuals work together to achieve a common goal. Since expanding here to Savannah, GA in April 2019 we’ve grown to 30+ and people and are looking to continue expanding into multiple markets through our enthusiastic ideas.

The Company

Rescue provides behavior change marketing services (or "social marketing") to government, non-profit and corporate organizations. Rescue's current work focuses on tobacco, obesity, violence and alcohol prevention; the promotion of exercise, fresh foods and after school programs; and other products and services that promote healthy living. Rescues behavior change campaigns focus on diverse populations within teen (13 - 17), young adult (18 - 26), and adult (18+) populations in both rural and urban areas, resulting in a vast array of campaign styles and strategies.

Rescue is a full-service agency, providing research, strategy, creative, production, web, traditional media, social media, policy change, youth engagement and experiential marketing services to clients in over a dozen states and provinces, as well as to federal government agencies.

We believe that marketing can do more than sell goods, it can create good.

The Job

We are looking for an ambitious and dynamic Proposal Writer with experience writing new business proposals for government contracts seeking marketing and advertising services. The ideal candidate has a passion for public health marketing, a history of taking initiative, and is capable of moving writing projects forward with a sense of urgency.

Day-To-Day Activities:
Author persuasive and clear proposal responses for marketing and advertising Requests For Proposals (RFPs) across a broad range of health behaviors (opioid use, tobacco prevention and cessation, marijuana education, nutrition education, obesity prevention, sexual health education, etc.)
Develop narrative responses that reconcile complex RFP requirements with proposed services to ensure proposals meet both internal and external expectations in a clear and logical manner
Clearly articulate the technical aspects of proposed services (paid media campaigns, outcome evaluations, influencers, youth volunteers, events, interactive websites, etc.)
Sell Rescue ideas and services in a way that shows compelling solutions, an ability to collaborate productively with clients, and a focus on health outcomes and contract results
Revise and tailor strategic, functional, technical, and company-related content from internal subject matter experts (research, media, social, analytics, strategy, youth engagement, and more)
Thoroughly understand and incorporate detailed RFP requirements and unique RFP terms and language nuances to ensure all requirements are met within proposals
Meet proposal deadlines, properly accounting for information gathering, writing, review, and revisions
Ensure quality results by maintaining a RFP reference library and following proposal-writing standards, such as readability, consistency, and tone
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree +4 years relevant experience OR 9 years relevant experience OR Master's Degree +2 years relevant experience
Experience in drafting proposal responses in the marketing and advertising field (RFPs, RFIs, etc.), government contracting experience preferred
Ability to work under pressure and tight timelines
Proven ability to develop strategic ideas into a compelling RFP response
Proven ability to work independently, prioritize workload, and meet deadlines
Experience writing to specifically outlined RFP requirements and point allocations
Exceptional attention to detail and analytical thinking skills
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Slides), and Keynote
Location: San Diego, CA

Status: Full-time

Benefits: Learn more about the benefits of working at Rescue here: http://rescueagency.com/careers/

Travel: Once per quarter, as needed

If youre ready to join our team of mission driven talent challenging the status quo, wed love to meet you! Check out our Careers page at rescueagency.com/careers for more information about what its like to work at Rescue, and the benefits that we offer to our team members.

The Fine Print

Environment:


All business-related environments are tobacco-free. Must have valid driver's license, reliable transportation, and computer and Internet access. Must be available to work non-traditional hours such as late nights and weekends.

Physical Requirements:


Able to remain in a sitting position for prolonged periods of time and stoop, bend, reach, climb stairs, and move freely throughout the building for the performance of duties. Able to read from a computer or laptop monitor for several hours at a time including fonts of various sizes from a variety of sources. Able to travel nationwide as needed to meet with clients, coworkers, or attend meetings and seminars.

The Application

All applications must be submitted through Rescues online careers system (unless you qualify to request a reasonable accommodation, as detailed at RescueAgency.com/careers). We do not accept applications via email, mail, fax or in-person delivery. Please send questions to careers@rescueagency.com. All applicants must upload or email at least one writing sample directly related to business development/securing new business, preferably for government contracts.

PLEASE NOTE: All email correspondence that you receive from Rescue Agency will be sent through an @rescueagency.com email address. We recommend that you disregard any emails posing as authentic Rescue Agency accounts (e.g. @rescueaggency.com or rescueagency.jobs@gmail.com). If you receive a message from a Rescue employee, you can verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us at careers@rescueagency.com.

Rescue | The Behavior Change Agency is an EEO/Minority/Female/Disability/Protected Veteran Employer

Company Description
Who is Opus?

We are a collective of innovative minds who are always looking to be on top of market changes. We use research-based, experiential marketing to create brand-awareness, consumer loyalty, as well as produce customized campaigns that boost acquisitions, while our clients focus on their core expertise.

Our Vision:

Our goal and vision is to elicit return business for our clients, growth for our company, and professional advancement for our team by embracing the creativity and teamwork necessary to help clients branch out into new markets.

All of this is possible with Opus due to the development of expert marketing managers who are efficient with clients and consumer acquisitions, and who build long-lasting relationships, which result in growth for our clients.

Job Description
About Leap:

At Leap we’re building a world-class platform to drive growth for emerging brands by developing and operating branded retail stores. On the Leap platform, brands can easily open stores to connect with more customers and drive profitable growth - both offline and online. Branded stores *powered by Leap* deliver impactful and memorable customer experiences while helping brands to capture more customers, data and powerful insights that accelerate product innovation and overall growth. In our first year we've grown to 12 stores for 8 brands across New York City, San Francisco, Chicago and Miami and are set to grow even more rapidly in 2020 and beyond.

Mission for the position:

As a key member of our Brand Management team, the Retail Marketing Manager will work with internal stakeholders such as Leap corporate Retail Ops team members, and field sales / store leaders, and external stakeholders such as brand customer/client leaders, to plan and execute marketing programs which increase visits to brand stores powered by Leap. By strategically deploying structured marketing programs in support of our brands and stores, the Retail Marketing Manager helps to ensure brand stores powered by Leap achieve sales and profitability goals, and build highly engaged local communities around stores and brands on our platform.

Key responsibilities:

Brand Partner & Store Marketing
Build local, national and regional marketing activations, events and partnerships while tracking and ensuring KPIs are met and activations are repeatable and scalable.
Partner with Brand Managers and Store Managers to lead field & event marketing programming pre/post to store openings, including but not limited to event activations, partnerships and community development initiatives.
Lead tracking and analyzing KPIs of marketing program performance and store performance reports for internal and external stakeholders.
Drive communications with the store GMs and associates to ensure promotions, sales and customer loyalty
Implement & drive clienteling & loyalty tools and best practices with the stores team to drive loyalty and lifetime value.
Support the development of brand-centric components of overall retail strategy (i.e. experiential marketing, sales process / content for staff trainings, etc.)
Collaborate directly with Brand Managers and partner brands for regional test & learns that drive traffic to stores (OOH, Email CRM, Digital, Social, Print, Radio, etc)
Competencies & attributes for success:
3+ years experience in retail marketing, field marketing, partnerships, or brand management.
Familiarity with DTC brand space / categories e.g. apparel/fashion and accessories, home goods, etc.
Proficient in managing local activations e.g. promotional event marketing, cross-brand partnerships, etc. including budget and ROI reporting
Basic understanding of DTC space e.g. brand strategy, ecommerce vs. retail, etc.
Working knowledge of digital, social and programmatic CRM marketing channels
Proficient in leading partners in designing & creating digital content & printed collateral
Experience working in a high growth startup (brand or DTC-brand focused platform / SaaS business) is a plus
Exceptional writing and verbal communication skills
Strong creative and problem solving skills
Strong teamwork and project management skills
Self starting, humble, quick learner who enjoys working with a team of A players
High attention to detail and ability to understand the big picture while operating in weeds
Outcomes & measures of success:
Successful deployment and management of varied marketing programs including reporting and analysis and regular program/playbook optimization, as measured against program performance targets for contribution to store traffic, sales, and customer experience ratings and feedback
Consistent timely delivery of marketing program performance reports
Consistent successful collaboration with fellow team members and other internal stakeholders, and external stakeholders e.g. brand leadership personnel, and Leap field sales / store leadership team members
Contribution to the development of a team-oriented high performance culture within the company

Job Description


Endeavor Global Marketing (EGM) is the cultural marketing agency within the Endeavor network, which includes preeminent talent agency WME, sports and fashion industry pioneer IMG, and other leading organizations from across the cultural landscape.

Its position within Endeavor provides EGM and its employees with unrivaled cultural insight, access, and understanding of the audiences the world’s leading brands need to reach.

Our approach to cultural marketing generates elevated ad campaigns, relevant PR strategies, humanized digital marketing platforms, and unparalleled experiences, with more than 9,000 experiential events around the world annually. In short, we build brand- and business-driving platforms and programs, rooted in human and cultural insights.

Being a part of the team that delivers these solutions means being a part of the agency that is defining the new frontier of marketing. For anyone with the drive to seek out new challenges and the commitment to craft effective solutions shaped by insight and defined by excellence, the opportunities for growth and exploration are endless.

Endeavor Global Marketing is now more than 700 employees strong globally, providing expertise in brand strategy and activation, advertising, digital and social marketing, public relations, sports and entertainment marketing, social impact marketing, influencer strategy, experiential marketing, original content and business intelligence. We work with major brand clients including Audi, AB InBev, Marriott, Visa, Coca-Cola, Papa John’s, Bumble, E. & J. Gallo Winery, and Microsoft, among more than 200 others.

Overview:

This position is for an Art Director role at Endeavor Global Marketing working with/on the Fusion Marketing Team. The Creative team/group within Endeavor Global Marketing is looking for a smart-working, passionate problem solver. The ideal candidate has experience in promotions, digital design and preferably someone who has worked on beverage accounts – adult and/or otherwise. He or she MUST be personable, thick-skinned, creative, flexible, resilient and eager to do great work.

Duties Include:
• Designing and producing visual communications for events, promotions, ads, packaging, web, mobile, broadcasts and presentations
• Understanding and coming up with solutions for on- and off-premise promotions
• Always, always meeting deadlines
• Being an active participant in brainstorms
• Directing and assisting photo shoots
• Working closely with and rarely pissing off fellow creatives, account executives, experiential marketing managers, and everyone else at the agency
• Bringing a positive attitude to your work and the office

Requirements:
• 2-5 years of experience
• A kick-ass portfolio
• Experience in both traditional and digital media
• Proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite
• Fluent in preparing artwork files for print and digital production
• Ability to own a project, from beginning to end
• An understanding of HTML and basic web publishing is a plus

What You Can Expect:
• A collaborative working environment where no one is afraid to speak his or her mind
• An opportunity to work on some of the biggest brands in the business
• A competitive salary
• Great benefits that include PTO, health, dental, and vision insurance, plus a 401k with company match

Company Overview
Catalyst is the world’s most intuitive Customer Success Platform (CSP), and was built by an experienced group of industry leaders. Our software integrates with all of the tools that CS teams are already using to provide one centralized view of customer data. Customer Success Managers can subsequently take the right actions to prevent churn, increase product adoption, and align the entire organization on a unified workflow to manage customers throughout their journey. Catalyst helps organizations turn Customer Success into a company-wide mission.

Position Overview
As Catalyst’s first dedicated Marketing hire, you will have the opportunity to build out the function from the ground up. You will be a key member of Catalyst’s leadership team and will work closely with our cofounders. Catalyst is a design-centric and user-experience focused company that puts the customer at the core of everything we do, and we’ll rely upon you to ensure that this reputation carries. Every message & touchpoint starting at the pre-sales funnel is evaluated and refined to ensure that we’re represented as a top tier brand for customer success. You will assume responsibility for demand gen, brand, content,/event marketing, & sales enablement.

What You’ll Do
Deliver qualified prospects/interest to achieve revenue targets, in partnership with Sales
Show and tell our story on driving customer success to the forefront and center of every company
Own our creative channels to build brand awareness for Catalyst as the #1 Customer Success Platform (eg. blog, podcasts, videos, community)
Build and own the processes across all demand-generation programs marketing channels (eg. ABM, paid social, events, webinars, SEO) )
Partner with our Product team to develop product launch plans for prospects and customers
Work with Revenue Ops to build our sales enablement playbooks and the foundation of our marketing tech stack
Build a community & customer advocacy program
Build and drive automation strategies across the customer lifecycle (new sales, customer communications, customer marketing)
Continuously brainstorm, test, and execute optimization experiments to improve channel performance and drive growth of qualified leads, opportunities, and revenue

What You’ll Need
Extensive hands-on marketing leadership experience within B2B SaaS companies, preferably for a product that sells into multiple different personas
Demonstrated passion for experiential marketing
Domain knowledge of the customer success, CRM, customer support, & product analytics space is a plus
Mastery of content - strong messaging/positioning skills and solid writing skills for use in messaging documents, presentations, and blogs
Detail and results-oriented; skilled at both strategy and hands-on execution; data-driven and intuitive and empathetic to the needs of our customers
Strong analytical skills, with a data-driven approach to managing projects
Strong people management, mentoring, coaching, and development experience

Why You’ll Love Working Here!
Highly competitive compensation package, including equity - everyone has a stake in our growth
Comprehensive benefits, including 100% paid medical insurance coverage for you, your partner, and your dependents
Unlimited vacation policy, encouraging you to take the time you need - we trust you to strike the right work/life balance
Personal Seamless account, to be used for free daily lunches; catered team lunches twice per week
Monthly team-building events (including game nights - Super Smash Brothers, Team Fortress 2, and Codenames, anyone?, trivia, and more!)

Catalyst is an equal opportunity employer, meaning that we do not discriminate based upon race, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, or any other protected class. We believe that diversity is more than just good intentions, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job Title: Major Donors Development and Events Manager
Job Description:
You may think "old" when you think of Institute on Aging (IOA) because we offer services for seniors and are a 40+ year institute. but you wouldn't be more wrong. While we do have a long-standing history in California, IOA is on the forefront of revolutionary healthcare models, reshaping the way people can age in place. Our innovative models transform lives, enhance communities, and save healthcare systems millions of dollars. Rather than focusing on archaic outdated design, we strive to consistently question the "status-quo" and create new and more innovative ways to help aging adults maintain their quality of life. With over 23 programs, we offer multiple ways to aid seniors maintain their health, well-being, independence and participation in the community, fulfilling our mission.

IOA's Development Department is seeking a skilled, organized, self-motivated and resourceful Development and Events Manager to join its San Francisco-based team. Under the direction of the Vice President of Philanthropy, in the Development Department. The Events Manager will provide valuable assistance to a goal-oriented team in all aspects of Development. S/he will focus on coordinating and managing fund-raising events, from galas to parlor meetings. Key duties and responsibilities may include, but not necessarily limited to:
Oversight of public affairs/development campaign to combat social isolation and loneliness of seniors.

Direct the launch of new initiatives (eg. Valentines for seniors)
Manage social media programs and activities
Manage direct mail, preparing letters and ensuring accurate and timely delivery

Other duties assigned and as the organization grows and changes

Research donors' passions and interests, with an eye to appropriate solicitation of donations
Use Move Management to schedule regular contact

Researching potential funders
Assist with outreach campaigns
Assist with mailing campaigns

Manage planning committees
Negotiate contracts
Work with marketing on invitations and other promotions
Oversee all logistics
Organize 6 private events (parlor meetings) a year:
Create program and agendas
Recruit hosts
Build attendance
Oversee all logistics
Required Qualifications
B.A./B.S. degree or higher

Demonstrated ability to quickly assess/address multiple situations simultaneously
Demonstrated ability to work independently and part of a team

Excellent MS Office Suite proficiency (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

MA/MS degree
Demonstrated passion for working with an organization that focuses on providing care to the elderly and adults with disabilities
Previous experience in social services, or mission-driven organizations
We encourage you to learn more about IOA by logging onto https://www.ioaging.org/about-ioa.

5 years of marketing, business, sales or related business experience.
Strong project management skills
Strong team leadership skills

Preferred Experience:
Ability to manage multiple projects.
Proficient utilizing Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, Google applications.
Regulatory and compliance awareness (e.g. USDA, ISO 9000, CLIA, FDA, GMP), ISO 9000, CLIA, FDA, GMP)

Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Sales & Marketing, Sales & Marketing > Marketing

SUMMARY OF POSITION

The Associate Creative Strategist is a key member of the Creative team, focusing on supporting the development of insightful, big ideas that exceed client expectations, achieve results and win business for the agency. Associate Creative Strategist demonstrate exceptional clarity around research and show an ability to generate strong insights from that research in order to drive creative thinking. This role also must show an affinity for creative ideation and actively contribute unique ideas to brainstorms and concept development.

Associate Creative Strategists assist senior Creative team members in organizing multiple contributors, helping to manage and copy write large scale RFP responses and project concepts. This position will also independently drive concept development for select projects and RFPs, working in collaboration with other Creative team members (Design & Digital) as well as cross-departmental teams in Account and Production.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

RESEARCH & INSIGHTS
Conducting research from a variety of sources, including primary research such as focus groups and interviews as well as secondary research from databases and industry sites, for projects & RFPs.
Developing insights from research that inform and fuel creative brainstorms.
Proactively researching client brands and industry trends to support Creative and Account teams in building organic and new business opportunities.
RFP RESPONSES & CONCEPT DEVELOPMENT
Developing measurable objectives and Key Performance Indicators to help ground and guide overall concept and proposal development.
Identifying key insights for creative concepting and brainstorms.
Contributing to the development of big, brave creative ideas as part of RFP responses and Concept Development phases of won business.
Crafting well-articulated plans and points of view, including comprehensive pitch decks for select opportunities and projects that include clear insights, strategies and creative concepts in a thoughtful, compelling and cohesive storyline. Support more senior Creative team members in this process for large opportunities and projects.
Managing multiple stakeholders as part of the proposal development process, supporting the organization and creation of concept decks, monitoring and collecting content deliverables across the cross-functional team.
Collaborating with Design team members to create cohesive and visually-inspiring presentations.
Participating in client pitch presentations as needed.
MEASUREMENT & ROI
Developing Measurement Plans for new and ongoing proposals and projects, discerning measurable objectives and Key Performance Indicators related to hose objectives, as well as identifying data collection methods for capturing data related to each KPI.
Supporting the Account team in collecting and analyzing KPI-related data in efforts to calculate ROI/ROE and provide insightful recommendations to improve and optimize our project executions.
OBE MARKETING SUPPORT
Monitoring industry trends for the agency (experiential and marketing trends) to share out internally as well as contributing to external agency thought leadership
Assisting Marketing Coordinator and New Business teams in creating targeted capabilities presentations for specific clients by leveraging case study library and capabilities overview.
Contributing to OBE Social Media presence in collaboration with Marketing Manager and Digital Content Marketing Manager.
Supporting internal brand marketing initiatives in collaboration with VP People & Operations as needed.
DAY TO DAY TASKS COULD INCLUDE:
Overall Strategy & Creative team support
Participating in client discovery calls
Architecting and presenting capabilities
Copywriting support for both internal and project-specific deliverables (i.e. email marketing copy, signage copy support, etc.)
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

EDUCATION

Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, Business Administration or related field.

EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 2 years agency experience.
Experience in event/experiential marketing to include generating ideas and concepts for innovative programs.
Advanced education degrees will be considered to supplement candidate's work experience.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Excellent research and insight development skills.
Strong creative and proposal writing skills.
Excellent client presentation skills.
Ability to understand client's business issues.
Deep knowledge in brand positioning, awareness and consideration.
Firm understanding and familiarity of working with Brand Guidelines and Style Guides.
BIG thinker, strategic in your approach.
Up-to-date on current media, industry and consumer trends that affect audiences.
Strong understanding of social media marketing.
Ability to travel.
OTHER QUALITIES AND SKILLS
Strong work ethic and ability to thrive and enjoy a fast-paces dynamic work environment.
Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.
High energy and flexibility in working non-traditional hours as needed (some nights and weekends).

Job Description:
NVE Experience Agency is a world-class experiential marketing agency and event production company, guided by the principle that the right moment will transform someone forever. NVE creates experiences that connect brands to the people, ideas, and trends that drive culture. Committed to delivering calculated impact, NVE builds multi-dimensional business solutions that convert consumer attention into action, sales, and brand loyalty.

We believe that an immersive experience is the most potent form of marketing in the world. And, properly executed, experiential marketing can convert more consumers into passionate fans than any other marketing vehicle.

Summary of Position

We are seeking an Account Director to counsel key clients and lead the development of experiential marketing strategies, campaigns and projects and events. Candidate should have exceptional interpersonal communication, prior team leadership experience, and project leadership skills with an aptitude towards strategic thinking, problem solving and the ability to facilitate multiple projects simultaneously.

The Account Director will lead an account services team to secure and grow key accounts in the agency while managing, mentoring, and coaching each team member. You will develop relationships with our key clients as a representative of the management team, tweak and manage the successful standardization of the overall client experience as provided by the agency, grow the existing account base through the current account staff in terms of revenue and services provided, and participate in both new business and client strategy development, presentation, and delivery.

This role will report directly to NVE's SVP of Client Services.

Role Priorities:
Client Counsel: Act as agency's lead contact for key accounts, streamlining internal and external client communication throughout the campaign/project management process, develop and deepen client relationships and grow key accounts
Brand Strategy: Guide and counsel leading brands within the NVE portfolio. Develop and deliver creative ideas that meet client objectives using a wide arsenal of experiential tactics including live events, social media, emerging technology, and strategic partnerships. Work with new business team and strategy teams to respond to RFPs and proactively identify ways to further engage and grow assigned accounts
Team Leadership: Supervise, train and lead assigned account teams to success, ensuring talents and resources are both maximized and nurtured. Act as a more senior liaison between Production, Creative Services, Brand Influence departments and the Client to ensure all contracted deliverables are executed and deadlines met, implementing and managing all necessary internal and external processes to ensure proper communication flow and manage expectations
Job Responsibilities:

Act as a senior point of contact for key clients, oversee assigned team's client communication and management of expectations during the campaign production and campaign execution process
Anticipate client needs and proactively offer solutions and experiential opportunities for the brand
Responsible for effectively translating, communicating, and prioritizing client requirements to teams
Provide education and direction on goals and objectives to team
Consistently motivate internal teams and actively promote innovation, new thinking and advancement of skills
Creative prowess, development of award-winning disruptive concepts
Supervise and monitor assigned account team's day-to-day activities internal/external weekly updates on project development and management, client meeting preparation, etc.
Establish cross-functional relationships with department counterparts and assist in overseeing the health of cross-department activities, relationships, processes and workflow
Attend and supervise critical internal/external meetings as needed
Ensure timely and quality delivery of all contracted event deliverables
Supervise development of post-event recaps for clients
Participate in RFP brainstorms, offering creative ideas and approaches towards client requests and needs
Assist SVP in assigning new accounts to appropriate account teams
Qualifications:
8+ years of experience in account leadership, campaign/event management/production, marketing, advertising, digital PR, and experiential
Familiarity with developing integrated campaigns that include paid, earned, social, and owned media for brands.
Proven track record of client leadership and account growth
Entrepreneurial mindset with demonstrated experience successfully leading and converting new business opportunities, understanding all stages of the new business process, and successfully scaling teams and business operations to support growth
Experience in an agency environment; must be process-oriented and highly organized
Excellent people manager with ability to recruit and retain high functioning employees; naturally driven to inspire, motivate, and mentor
Viewed as a strong, respected and inspiring leader by current leadership, peers, clients, and direct reports
Experience with management and oversight of complex client budgets
Ability to write effectively, persuasively and professionally
Confidence in verbal and written communication with excellent presentation skills
Flexibility and adaptability to a fast-paced work environment and ability to work under tight deadlines
Willingness to work extended hours and on weekends when necessary
Proven ability to weave brands into popular culture

Amazon Devices are among the best-selling products in the history of Amazon.com, and the device business is one of the most innovative and fastest growing businesses at Amazon. The Amazon Devices Marketing team is looking for a proven, customer obsessed channel marketer who will own retail execution of our in-store demo experiences across North America.
The Sr. Channel Marketing Manager will be an expert on the retail environment, with a specific focus on in-store demo fixture construction and execution. You will be responsible for creating scalable mechanisms to incorporate operational learnings into our fixture designs, while managing the installation, repair and maintenance of those fixtures across US, CA and MX.

This role requires deep collaboration with multiple teams, including channel marketing retailer leads, Amazon field sales teams, 3P fixture manufacturers, and 3P in-store merchandising labor suppliers. A successful candidate will combine their passion and experience with retail merchandising, with strong analytics, and the ability to work effectively in a matrixed organization.

Job Responsibilities
Manage demo device ordering and fulfillment for new product launches, retailer expansion and repair and maintenance needs, for all Amazon device fixtures in NA.
Plan and execute in-store installations across all Amazon device retailers in NA. The scope of work includes vendor and financial management, negotiating contracts for 3P installation, and producing regular reporting to track performance to launch and financial targets.
Develop efficient, scalable mechanisms for in-store repair and maintenance of demo devices and fixtures. Build an audit and reporting mechanism that allows channel marketers to report health of fixtures to their retailers on a regular cadence. Develop a spare parts process that supports retailers, Amazon field sales and 3P in-store teams.
Influence fixture design with learnings from in-store execution, and data from repair and maintenance audits, along with retailer and field feedback.
Ensure accurate execution of final fixture design for assigned projects. Including planning, engineering, compliance, documentation, reviews, budgets and status updates and establishing materials specifications in collaboration with Channel Marketing and Design.
On-board and manage external vendors including contract, budget, and expectation management.
Vendor and financial management, negotiating contracts for 3P installation, and producing regular reporting to track performance to launch and financial targets.
Manage weekly fixture vendor and 3P installer project management calls.
Own channel marketing's project tracking tool and publish weekly status reports to leadership.
Collaborate with channel managers to update launch workback schedules, incorporating process improvements and operational learnings.
Support logistics of ad-hoc merchandising opportunities, like pop-up stores, merchandising tests, and retailer meetings.
Attend first article fixture prototype reviews, and pre-launch training meetings at fixture vendor facilities when launching new fixtures or new devices.
Regularly schedule store visits with Amazon field sales and 3P fixture installers to see first-hand how fixtures are performing in-store.Basic Qualifications
8+ years of experience in Product Management, Retail Marketing, Channel Marketing, B2C Marketing or Retail Merchandising.
Experience managing retail go-to-market functions.
Experience defining project scope and managing to a timeline and/or budget.
Experience building and communicating project plans.
Experience using tools to manage projects, such as Microsoft Project or others.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. In this role, the Enterprise Channel Marketing Manager will partner with Product Marketing, the Partnerships team, Sales and Operations to deliver best-in-class enterprise programs that will educate and incentivize our channel partners through direct engagement and channel online marketing. This Channel Marketer will also operate as the point of contact for channel events that drive new customer awareness and acquisition.

Responsibilities:

In partnership with our Product Marketing team the Enterprise Channel Manager will deliver the go-to-market programs for assigned Enterprise partners to optimize for product awareness & education while delivering Hardware and Software pilots and large scale deployments and associated documentation including white papers and case studies.
Define, manage and communicate quarterly channel marketing plans.
Create compelling marketing programs to drive sales that include HW & SW bundles, promotions and content offers.
Develop business briefs that educate channel partners and online merchandising teams.
Manage the performance of channel marketing programs and iterate to drive efficiencies.
Review and approve brand execution of all assets in the channel to ensure on brand execution.
Manage online channel presence to create best in class enterprise storytelling and experiences.
Partner with Sales, Product Marketing and Operations to review and improve the customer purchasing experience.
Influence product positioning by providing monthly briefs with geographical and vertical insights and data to product marketing teams.
Develop a deep understanding of geographic and vertical product needs and usage and build programs that target those use cases.
Travel will be required ~30% of the time.
Mininum Qualifications:

10+ years experience in global enterprise channel marketing.
Experience selling and marketing enterprise hardware and software through enterprise channel partners like SHI, CDW, Synnex and Computacenter.
Proven presentation skills both in presentation and creation.
Proven track record of exceeding sell through goals with experience at a Global 2000 Hardware and Software company e.g. Microsoft, Cisco, VMware.
Proven data driven tools experience including Excel, Tableau, etc.
Demonstrated experience managing sales and marketing funnel.
Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working in start-up environment.
Strong SaaS experience, preferably DaaS experience.

Help us improve access to life-changing therapies that can transform human health

We are Cytiva, a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics. Formerly part of GE Healthcare, we have a rich heritage tracing back hundreds of years, and a fresh beginning since 2020.

Our customers undertake life-saving activities. These range from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, biologic drugs, and novel cell and gene therapies. Our job is to supply the tools and services - the pots, pans, soups and sauces - they need to work better, faster and safer, leading to better patient outcomes.

We are looking for a Cell & Gene Therapy Field Marketing Manager to work with our expert Marketing team of 250 employees across the world. Do you have a passion for data driven marketing and actionable customer insights? Then we would love to hear from you.

What youll do
Working with sales teams on both a segment and account by account basis to assist commercial opportunities and relationships, constantly review customer data to identify future marketing actions.
Develop and execute demand creation and funnel acceleration tactics supporting product and solution commercial launch plans and installed base marketing initiatives
Creation, testing and reiteration of an integrated quarter by quarter marketing plan: In partnership with Product and Sales teams, ensuring execution of impactful content and marketing campaigns. This includes accountability for ensuring that sales teams will be properly trained and equipped.
Develop and implement marketing strategies to support Account Managers and Sales Specialists in selling products and solutions, with an ultimate focus on the customers' needs and intended outcomes.
Who you are
Knowledge of the Cell & Gene Therapy or a related field, industry dynamics, developments and technology applications
Demonstrated experience in: customer segmentation, digital marketing, marketing data analysis - SalesForceDotCom, content marketing and utilization of social media in a business context
5+ years experience in a commercial environment. For example; sales, key account management, sales management, marketing, scientific support.
Earned a Bachelors degree; MBA or Masters degree a plus
Willingness and ability to travel within US & Canada
Who we are

Whatever your role, we bring purpose and challenge into our everyday work. If you are driven to make the world a better place thanks to science and medicine, youll feel right at home here. If youre flexible, curious and relentless, youll belong. If you are excited about a global culture, this can be the place to further your career.

Want to know more? Take a look at our Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn pages!

Cytiva is a 3.5 billion USD global life sciences leader with over 7000 associates across 40 countries who are dedicated to our mission to help us improve access to life-changing therapies that transform human health. As a trusted partner to customers that range in scale and scope, Cytiva brings efficiencies to research and manufacturing workflows, ensuring the development, manufacture and delivery of transformative medicines to patients.

As part of the Danaher family of companies, our work at Cytiva is supported by a global science and technology innovator. In addition to Danahers unrivaled leadership training and professional development programs, our relationship also provides expanded career opportunities across industries and brands. Together, we are united by a shared purpose: Helping Realize Lifes Potential.

Nexon, a world leader in online games, is building a workplace based on mutual respect, good humor, and the pursuit of excellence because we believe that great games can only be built by amazing people. Our vision is to create high quality, innovative online games that create unforgettable experiences for players around the world.

If you want to be part of building an exciting game company and help chart the course of online gaming, let's talk!

Job Description

In this role, you will act as the voice of Nexon by leading and launching social media campaigns that impact players globally, owning campaigns end-to-end. You will also build a more personal relationship with content creators and influencers to collaborate and promote our games.

[Social Media 60%]
Develop highly creative and trending content to increase brand awareness, drive follower growth, and engagement via social media campaigns.
Identify new opportunities and develop innovative social media campaigns.
Work closely with internal teams to create assets and execute social media campaigns.
Own social boosting campaigns and track budgets.
Work with social platforms to analyze and monitor campaigns regularly to understand the effectiveness of strategies and make improvements.
[Influencer 40%]
Build close relationships with influencers and maintain and update the influencer database.
Plan and create giveaways for social events and for influencers.
Develop influencer strategies as a creative way to drive, amplify a brand story, educate and inspire players, while improving social sentiment, recognition, and driving growth.
Create collaborative content with influencers to promote Nexon games.
Handle travel accommodations of influencers and be the main host for influencers at offline events.
Provide on-site support for the company's public events.
Skills & Requirements

Your qualifications include:
3 - 5 years' experience working in a Creative, Communications or Marketing role.
Mobile gaming experience required.
Demonstrates creativity and maintain excellent writing and language skills.
Understanding of and interest in gaming trends.
Confident communicator with an ability to manage and develop relationships with our players.
Strong reporting skills and data tracking experience.
Flexible, motivated self-starter who is highly organized and detail-oriented.
Must possess both critical thinking skills and creativity.
We also like to see:
Bachelor's degree with a Marketing or Communications focus.
Interest in gaming in general.
Experience managing influencers or a strong network of influencers is a plus.
Events experience including game shows and live stream experience.
Management has the right to add or change duties and job requirements at any time.

Nexon's benefits and perks:

We offer medical, dental and vision plans for you, your spouse or domestic partner and your children. Employees who enroll in the high deductible health plan receive an annual employer contribution to a health savings account and company paid hospital indemnity benefits. We also provide company paid life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability benefits as well as access to voluntary life and AD&D for yourself and your dependents, flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) savings plan with a company match, and pet insurance. Nexies are encouraged to take advantage of our monthly wellness credit, participate in lunchtime yoga, and enroll in language classes. We host bi-monthly catered lunches, monthly happy hours, and maintain a well-stocked snack bar. To help you maintain a good work life balance, we offer paid time off, sick days, company holidays, and a year-end break.

Nexon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Morrison Healthcare is a leading national food and nutrition services company exclusively dedicated to serving more than 600 hospitals and healthcare systems. Morrison's hospital kitchens, restaurants, and cafés feature socially responsible practices and exceptional guest experiences. The company's comprehensive Mindful Choices® wellness and sustainability platform includes the latest in healthful eating and an understanding of behavioral change in food consumption. Morrison's alignment with Partnership for a Healthier America's (PHA) Hospital Healthy Food Initiative positively impacts up to 41 million patients and 500 million hospital meals annually. Morrison has been named one of Modern Healthcare's "Top 100 Best Places to Work in Healthcare" for the past five years, and Training Magazine's Top 125 organizations for the past six consecutive years. Administrative

Morgan & Morgan, P.A. is the largest plaintiffs’ law firm in the country, with offices in more than 40 cities, 2,500 employees nationwide, and over 30 years in the industry. We are looking for a Strategy Director to lead our practice in identifying and managing opportunities to grow the organization's strategic and long-term profitability goals, and to extend the business into new markets.

Our Brooklyn office, situated inside a redesigned industrial loft, is the creative and operational backbone of the company. It looks like a startup (foosball, beanbags, unlimited snacks) but offers the strength and security of a leading 30-year enterprise.

We tackle complex marketing, media, and technology challenges in the legal sphere. We're fast learners, risk-takers, and experts in our fields. We have been doing this for a long time, together, and we put people first. With that mantra (“For The People”) in mind, we're redefining the law space.

This Role Will:
Serve as a leader for the Strategy Department, a team of nine which consists of marketing managers who develop, plan, and execute marketing initiatives for our core practice areas, including labor, employment, insurance, business, social security, and mass tort law
Report to the Senior Director of Marketing and work to execute the team’s strategic initiatives in collaboration with the leads of other departments, including Media, PR, Paid Marketing, and Insights
Work with managing partners and other attorneys to develop strategy in need and opportunity markets
Translate findings and opportunities into an achievable roadmap for the team and business
Analyze and recommend emerging industry or marketing trends, as well as drivers for growth, including key mergers and acquisitions, competitive threats, viability of our external partners, internal business performance, and business process improvement
What We Require:
5+ years of direct team management experience in mid-to-large organizations
A proven track record of successfully leading either clients or in-house teams into new strategic areas and campaigns
An innate curiosity and deep desire to drive the business forward
A broad understanding of key business-drivers and an ability to deliver solutions
Mastery of analytics and data analysis
Comfortable with quantitative and qualitative research methodologies, with working knowledge of when and how to apply them
Familiarity with cross-channel strategies, including television, radio, digital advertising, direct response, and other channels
Experience with Salesforce or other CRM solutions
Nice to Have:
MBA
Exposure and experience with the legal industry
Familiarity with lead generation, loyalty marketing, and experiential marketing
Morgan & Morgan offers a competitive salary with the opportunity to grow within the company and shape our growth strategy. Employees are eligible for full medical benefits (including dental and vision), Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions, commuter benefits, and much more.

Job Description
About Leap:

At Leap we’re building a world-class platform to drive growth for emerging brands by developing and operating branded retail stores. On the Leap platform, brands can easily open stores to connect with more customers and drive profitable growth - both offline and online. Branded stores *powered by Leap* deliver impactful and memorable customer experiences while helping brands to capture more customers, data and powerful insights that accelerate product innovation and overall growth. In our first year we've grown to 12 stores for 9 brands across New York City, San Francisco, Chicago and Miami and are set to grow even more rapidly in 2020 and beyond.

Mission for the position:

The Growth Marketing Manager, will work in partnership with the VP of Brand Management and the Leap Leadership Team in developing scalable, programmatic approaches and marketing plans to drive local traffic to the branded stores (and Brand websites) on the Leap platform. To do so, the CRM & Growth Marketing Manager will leverage Leap’s large customer file and build marketing programs and a ‘always on’ approach through Leap and Brand owned assets (email, CRM, social) and paid media (social, web, OOH, radio, direct mail, etc) at both the local and regional level. Understanding the full cycle of strategy, creative, buying, implementation, tracking/optimization will be paramount for success in this role.

Key responsibilities:

Develop and execute a marketing strategy across owned and paid channels
Create and deploy store-level email CRM programing and flows setup inclusive of post visit NPS survey, product/store reviews, cross selling to other products and cross selling to other brands/stores
Create and deploy paid digital utilizing the audience & geo-targeting strategies to drive ramp new store openings and drive traffic to Leap powered stores (i.e. FB/IG paid media, google)
Partner with internal & external creative resources to create assets needed for owned assets and paid media activations
Explore and build offline marketing strategies that create synergies across brands to boost store performance (i.e multi-brand Direct mail, OOH)
Manage Leap owned assets (Instagram, Website, Twitter, Linkedin)
Collaborate directly with partner brands for regional test & learns that drive traffic to stores (Email CRM, Digital, Social, OOH, Print, Radio, etc)
Support the marketing and stores team in the development of brand-centric components of overall retail strategy (i.e. experiential marketing, sales process / content for staff trainings, etc.)
Manage budgets (by channel/brand), KPIs, optimizations and synthesis of results
Create and define benchmarks, recommendations and optimizations
Partner with the marketing, retail operations team and store managers synthesize and analyze marketing program performance and results
Create recommendations, case studies and guides to help brands understand marketing activations and investments that work to drive store performance
Drive new channels and cutting edge activations
Explore new technology, tools and platforms that can drive traffic & store performance both in marketing campaigns and in-store with test and learns.
Competencies & attributes for success:
+5 years experience in marketing with focus to email CRM, social & digital activations and brand building
Experience working at smaller, scrappy startup preferred with knowledge of retail, DTC, luxury and fashion brands landscape.
Well versed in direct (non agency) social media management (buying, deploying, measuring)
Experience in designing & creating digital content & printed collateral or working with external resources (i.e. freelancers)
Exceptional written and verbal communication ability
Strong creative and problem solving skills
Strong teamwork and leadership skills
Self starter, humble, quick learner, with high aptitude for self-improvement
Extreme attention to detail; ability to understand the big picture while operating in weeds
Outcomes & measures of success:
Successful email & digital program deployment and ongoing management including strategy, implementation, reporting, analysis and optimization, as measured against program performance targets for contribution to email performance, store traffic and sales.
Consistent timely delivery of marketing program performance reports
Development of new marketing programs for brands to opt into
Successful implementation of Leap Brand owned asset strategy by deploying engaging content and growing follower counts
Consistent successful collaboration with direct report management, store managers and staff and corporate administrative functional leaders (e.g. HR, etc.)
Contribution to the development of a team-oriented high performance culture within the firm

Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.

Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
