DEPARTMENT: Marketing

POSITION: Field Marketing Manager (4 Field-Based Positions: Dallas, Orlando, Chicago, Phoenix)

REPORTS TO: National Field Marketing Manager

PGA TOUR Superstore is an exciting, fast-paced and high energy environment, and supports the operations of nearly 50 retail locations across the U.S. We are seeking a qualified candidate to fulfill the role of Field Marketing Manager.

Position Summary

The Field Marketing Manager, reports directly to the National Manager of Field Marketing. This role is responsible for overseeing and support consistency in marketing standards and execution throughout assigned territory. Responsible for evaluating and providing feedback to store leadership and reporting up to District and Regional Managers. This leadership role models the PGA TOUR Superstore core values of cultivating our customers and developing our associates. The position utilizes strong business acumen and retail knowledge to formulate goals, develop objectives, and improve merchandising processes. In addition, this leader will build strong relationship of support and collaboration with their assigned District Manager and the General Manager’s within their territory.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities:
Responsible for 8-10 retail locations minimum.
Communicates and implements the company's marketing brand and media strategy in assigned regions to assist in achieving sales, profitability and traffic goals.
Identify local store initiatives based on trade area data to supplement the system wide media plans and develop local store marketing calendars to support system wide media plans
Evaluate all Local Partnerships Media Value as applicable
Ensures marketing resources are applied effectively and efficiently to maximize individual store or district performance.
Takes a leadership role in the marketing planning for new store openings in assigned territory in partnership with Store Operations, Brand Marketing including Local Media and Event planning
Conduct regular in-market visits with store leadership to discuss recent and upcoming marketing initiatives; provide guidance and feedback as needed and to ensure quality and consistency with marketing calendar and plans. (requires approximately 50% travel)
Create Opportunity and Competitive store specific plans to improve performance of stores in assigned territory as needed
Responsible for developing and driving the local marketing strategy for assigned territory in addition to coordinating and executing various elements of national campaigns with Brand Media Lead
Weekly visits to stores within driving distance, quarterly to remote location. Travel schedule will be provided.
Communicates weekly with the National Field Marketing Manager and acts as a communication conduit by providing key marketing leadership with feedback received from operations partners.
Communicates regularly and conducts weekly reviews with Regional Managers/District Managers – highlighting performance areas of opportunity and needs of their assigned territories.
Communicate with brand marketing team on communication issues (bulletins), marketing opportunities and media planning.
Responds to request for feedback, information or other marketing needs within 24 hours or in a timely manner.
Ability to balance multiple projects across stores in territory.
Minimum Qualifications:
Education: The knowledge, skills, and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor’s degree from four-year college/university or equivalent.
Experience: Five (5) years of experience in multi-unit Field Marketing or Advertising Agency with local media planning and account services experience. Passion for Golf and Tennis is highly desired.
Communication: Candidates must possess strong listening and interpersonal skills. Must be able to influence and communicate in both written and verbal form with conviction and credibility, adapting message to suit level of audience. Must have ability to influence decision making using consumer and business insight to drive results
Analytical: Candidates must have strong strategic skills, forecast business needs, and develop comprehensive solutions to complex problems. Strong analytical abilities and understanding of business model and profitability issues. Experience in planning and managing budgets.
Flexibility: a positive attitude, enthusiasm and excellent collaboration skills
Computer: Candidates must have strong computer skills utilizing the internet, Outlook and Microsoft Office Suite including MS TEAMS
Organization: Candidates must be able to effectively multi-task and manage competing priorities across multiple store locations, as well as properly ensure resources are allocated to meet objectives.
Scheduling: Field Marketing Manager role must be able to accommodate a retail schedule (flexible, including nights, weekends, and holidays), and must be willing and able to travel for business including overnight travel. As well as possess the ability to work independently and with teams.
Physical Requirements:
Field Marketing Manager role must be able to stand for extended periods of time, climb up and down a ladder, move around the store, and lift a 30 lb. box overhead. Regular travel required within respective territory. Travel by plane is a requirement.

Marketing Mix & Attribution Modeling Lead


Job Description :

Marketing leads the development of integrated marketing strategies across 90 plus business lines and national geography. The group is responsible for brand strategy and advertising, database and experiential marketing including, integrated program and product development, market research and related customer analytics, and diverse segments strategy and business development.

The newly formed Marketing Insights & Analytics team will build a best-in class decision support organization that can provide insights to inform our business/customer marketing and product strategy, as well as our broader strategic initiatives. Marketing Measurement is a critical team within the Marketing Insights & Analytics team that is responsible for understanding the performance of marketing campaigns in online and offline channels. In addition, the team is responsible for analyzing and establishing the cumulative impact of all marketing in both the short-term and long-term.

The role of Marketing Mix & Attribution Modeling Lead is a highly quantitative role with responsibilities including:

•Build, maintain and evolve market level mix models to estimate causal impacts of marketing activities on financial outcomes in the short and long term

•Build, maintain and evolve customer level attribution models to explain longitudinal behavioral shifts associated with exposure to a varying combination of touch point exposures

•Measure the long-term impacts on customer behavior

•Automate input ETL, iterative solution search and operationalization of models

This person will have significant interactions with other analytics teams in Marketing Insights & Analytics and is expected to provide analytical thought leadership and bring cutting edge statistical knowledge to solve complex marketing problems. Deep technical skills, ability to continuously learn from industry and academic work, and strong communication skills will be determining factors in selection.

A successful applicant will demonstrate:

•Ability to deliver critical insights and analysis

•Collaborative partnership and strong influencing skills

•Ability to extract insights to identify growth opportunities and effectively communicate outcomes and recommendations

•Lead effective data analysis that may suggest risk or opportunities

•Partnership/collaboration with marketing business partners and other enterprise teams

Required Qualifications:

•8+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling or a Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling

Desired Qualifications:

•Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis

•Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy

•Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

Other Desired Qualifications:

•8+ years of experience in regression based modeling

•5+ hands-on experience programming marketing mix modeling solutions in SAS

•Expertise on hierarchical Bayesian and MCMC approaches

•Proven history of developing innovative, cutting-edge causal measurement capabilities across the range of marketing activities, including TV, print, radio, OOH, paid search, display, online video, owned media, sponsorships and promotions

•Significant experience coding and maintaining stand along SAS-based applications

•Deep knowledge of statistical areas such as ANOVA, Multiple Regression, Time-series Modeling, Principal Component Analyses, Decision Trees, Clustering, etc

•Experience programming in R, SQL, Python and GAMS

•Experience working in marketing/ customer analytics organizations

•Demonstrated ability to play a leadership role in large, complex analytical projects

•Strong sense of ownership, relentless curiosity, and self-driven approach to problem solving

•Consistent pattern of digging into the raw respondent data

•Exceptionally strong technical background

•Experience/ exposure to data and analytics in Banking and Financial Services industry

Salary : $ 120k- $160k

ABOUT THE JOB

We are looking for a Field Marketing Manager, Central to join our Marketing team. OneStream Software, a leading corporate performance management (CPM) platform for the office of finance. The candidate will be responsible for the design, implementation, and execution of field marketing and ABM campaigns and events. S/he will work closely with marketing and sales teams to create and execute on demand generation activities which drive the creation of pipeline.

Primary responsibilities:
Develop field marketing plan quarterly, utilizing tactics like email marketing, online marketing, direct mail, live events, etc.
Plan and complete field marketing campaigns after conducting preliminary research
Plan and manage relevant regional events, to meet or exceed projected lead targets
Maintain relationships with 3rd-party vendors and venues for event planning/logistics
Plan and manage ABM campaigns for region
Develop knowledge of all product lines/services and positioning
Manage messaging for social media activity surrounding field marketing campaigns
Track expenses and budget in an organized fashion
Report regularly on the status and performance of field marketing activities

This is an exciting opportunity to help build our fast-growing international company, your career, as well as the careers of others. The ideal candidate will be passionate about developing and helping others within our company and the community, and have a high interest in the OneStream mission and being an integral part of a collaborative, tight-knit firm. A passion for technology and learning, and the ability to grow others are vital for success in this role.

QUALITIES OF A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE
3-5 years experience in field marketing, B2B SaaS business a plus
Strong oral, written, and verbal communication skills
Experience with marketing automation tools, HubSpot a plus
Demonstrated track record in field and promotional marketing
Exceptional leadership and management skills
Strong organizational skills with emphasis on time management
Strong interpersonal skills and negotiation skills
Ability to work independently or in groups including account managers and sales mgt.
Self-motivated with demonstrated flexibility and adaptability
Strong analytical skills with focus towards details
Ability to handle pressure and work in a constantly changing atmosphere
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Formal Education and Certification
4 Year college degree in a field such as Marketing, Business, Sales or relevant field or related field experience.
Knowledge and Experience
Proven experience as Demand Generation or similar role.
Excellent organization and ability to work independently.
Outstanding communication abilities.

SAP Outlooksoft BPC.
SAP BOFC (Cartesis).
Hyperion HFM, FDM, Planning, Essbase, Enterprise.
IBM Cognos or other EPM solutions.
Personal Attributes
Organized.
Strong reasoning skills.
Self-motivated, self-starter.

Independent thinker, uses good judgement
Ability to think fast on their toes
Sound decision making skills
Ability to evaluate pros and cons
Ability to multitask a variety of projects.
Prioritization skills.
Comfortable communicating with all levels of management.
Experience with OneStream Software not required.
WHO WE ARE

OneStream Software is a privately held software company created by the same team that invented the leading financial solutions of the last decade. We provide a unified Corporate Performance Management (CPM) platform which enables the enterprise to simplify financial consolidation, reporting, budgeting and forecasting for complex organizations. Our powerful extensibility enables the enterprise to deliver additional analytic solutions without adding any technical complexity. By delivering multiple solutions in one application, we offer increased capabilities for financial reporting and analysis while reducing the risk, complexity and total cost of ownership for our customers. We are driven by our mission statement that every customer must be a reference and success.

We are equally fanatical about our OneStream family members (formally known as employees). We are a team in every sense of the word. Everyone here is approachable and excited to pitch in and help. We work hard and play hard. The right candidate is someone who is easy to get along with, always willing to lend a hand, excited about coming to work, and happy to contribute to the team. We have a casual dress environment and modern office with onsite gym!

WHY JOIN THE ONESTREAM TEAM
Transparency around corporate structure, salary, and benefits
Core value of customer success
Variety of project work (not industry specific)
Strong culture andcamaraderie
Multiple training opportunities


Benefits at OneStream Software OneStream employees are passionate, hardworking individuals who go above and beyond to keep our customers happy and follow through on our mission statement. They consistently deliver the best and in turn, we make every effort to keep them cared for and happy. A sample of the benefits we provide are:
Excellent Medical Plan

Life Insurance
Short & Long Term Disability
Vacation Time
Paid Holidays
Professional Development
Retirement Plan

Morrison Healthcare is a leading national food and nutrition services company exclusively dedicated to serving more than 600 hospitals and healthcare systems. Morrison's hospital kitchens, restaurants, and cafés feature socially responsible practices and exceptional guest experiences. The company's comprehensive Mindful Choices® wellness and sustainability platform includes the latest in healthful eating and an understanding of behavioral change in food consumption. Morrison's alignment with Partnership for a Healthier America's (PHA) Hospital Healthy Food Initiative positively impacts up to 41 million patients and 500 million hospital meals annually. Job Description
Alphalete is actively seeking a motivated Advertising Trainee to work on groundbreaking campaigns with an advertising and marketing firm in the DFW region. This innovative firm was founded by dedicated people looking to push the envelope by using cost-effective marketing campaigns and advertising strategies. As a progressive company in the sales and marketing industry, this firm continues to set the standard for excellence in customer acquisition and establishing a repeat customer base for clients. By providing personalized sales and marketing services to some of the largest retailers globally, this firm continues to increase the market shares of clients through proven sales and marketing strategies.

The Advertising Trainee position is a valued team member in the marketing and advertising department. The position is considered entry level to start during training which includes a comprehensive overview of basic marketing strategy, direct advertising, promotional techniques, visual merchandising, and consumer market research. After successful completion of the program, an individual would be considered a team leads in the marketing department. The Advertising Trainee reports directly to the Executive Marketing Manager.

Responsibilities:

Expertly manage the needs of external customers.
Developing strong leadership and interpersonal skills
Driving sales through retail promotional campaigns
Build brand recognition through local events and experiential marketing
Strategize, execute and manage with the Brand Ambassador teams

The personalized focus of the campaigns is a refreshing alternative to more general mass sales and marketing strategies, but it is also responsible for the company's unprecedented growth and stability. The management team prides itself on recognizing top performance, integrity, and a winning mindset for continual internal promotions. If you possess a passion for marketing, sales, or retail and would enjoy learning how to manage the varying dimensions of a business, this position could be an excellent fit for the right candidate.
Must be able to work full-time hours and some weekends for special events.
Ability to excel in unsupervised solo assignments as well as team projects
Great communication skills

Self-starter, creative thinker, problem solver

Full Training

Company Description
Sparks Worldwide is an outsourced experiential marketing firm. Sparks Worldwide started with five highly motivated individuals that understand the clients goals and more importantly the opportunity provided likeminded individuals work together to achieve a common goal. Since expanding here to Savannah, GA in April 2019 we’ve grown to 30+ and people and are looking to continue expanding into multiple markets through our enthusiastic ideas.

Do you have a passion for making a difference in people’s lives?

AHRC New York City is a family governed organization committed to finding ways for people with intellectual and other developmental disabilities to build full lives as defined by each person and supported by dedicated families, staff, and community partners.

The Regional Marketing Manager (RMM), under the supervision of the Assistant Director and Director of Business Development will be responsible for (a) geographic region; regions are assigned by Director of EBS and/or Vice President of Business and Program Development. The primary objective of the RMM is to create jobs for the people EBS provides services to, to identify and to build a team of Account Executives who will bring jobs, promote our programs and/or stablish partnerships throughout the City with the goal of promoting and creating jobs for people we support.

The RMM will have specific performance goals to be met periodically; such goals will be provided by the assigned supervisor, at the minimum, the RMM must meet the contractual placements’ levels as outlined in addendum #1 under this Job Description. Addendum #1 is part of this job description. Addendum #1 will be reviewed and modified as needed based on the assessment of existing and newly procured contracts.

The RMM will actively work in promoting and creating vast network of business relationships with the objective of creating new employment opportunities, person centered employment for each person we support, and develop new business opportunities for our Affirmative Enterprise businesses.

As per Region assignment, the RMM will actively work in identifying and create JOBS for Experienced Hudson River Services’ employees– a list of candidates will be provided to the respective RMM in order for each manager to plan and to place individuals in new jobs.

This professional will receive periodical feedback from her/is immediate supervisor, at minimum a comprehensive 6 month performance review will take place and followed by an annual performance review. This role will be subject to close performance monitoring in order to ensure all goals and objectives of role are met such as placements and points.

The RMM is a senior management and supervisory position responsible for coordinating job development activities in an assigned region and overseeing Account Executives.

The RMM will be required to work a flexible or extended schedule from time to time. The RMM may be asked to assist other regions in the city or assist other departments when needed for cross-departmental projects and other assignments.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Oversee and supervise Marketing and Sales Region assigned
Develop employment opportunities for people supported as outlined in the Addendum #1 attached
Promote widespread, positive image/knowledge of AHRC’s Employment& Business Services.
Hire and supervise of Account Executives (AE)
Assess performance of Account Executives under direct supervision, train new marketing staff, and coordinate placement activity
Ensure excellent customer service to all customers
Actively participate in internal and external networking events
Actively organize networking events to develop linkages with potential employers and to promote AHRC brand
Develop and maintain marketing strategy targeting successful creation of jobs for people supported
Create and complete action plans targeting a specific line of business, employers, type of job, etc.
Develop valued relationships with businesses/ employers. Maintain and expand customer base
Provide best job matching for job seekers and employers
Ensure customized employment is a priority for the marketing team
Coordinate the day to day responsibilities of Account Executives
Ensure program placement goals are met for each program in region
At a minimum, the RMM will be required to bring new business, in the form of a service contract that provides employment to two or more people supported on a quarterly basis
Develop employment opportunities for existing NYSID workers in experienced porter positions. At a minimum, six employees will need to transition from NYSID contracts
Required to travel throughout the 5 boroughs and in and out of state as needed
Prepare and deliver marketing presentations as needed
Conduct other responsibilities as assigned
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s in Arts or Bachelor’s in Science, plus 2 years marketing/sales/related experience or Associate’s Degree with 5 years of experience, required
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Great motivational skills
Experience with people with disabilities/youth a plus
Ability to work collaboratively with senior EBS operations and program managers and to develop and maintain sites, disseminate information, and provide top quality customer service to all EBS customers.
NYS driver’s license preferred. Must have clear driving record
Annual Salary: $70K-$80K depending on experience and education.

“Here’s a job where you’ll create the stuff you actually want to see in your own feed.”

MMC is next-gen comms agency that uses influence and culture to catapult business and get the world talking. The creative department is looking for an agile Senior Copywriter - steeped in pop culture (partnered with a Senior Art Director) - who can bring the conceptual heat to every assignment. From shareable content series to opportunistic social campaigns to engaging experiences that make eyes bulge and jaws drop. You’ll work across a range of CPG and consumer clients who are demanding ideas that earn people’s attention and engagement because they’re just that amazing.

WE SHOULD TALK IF:
You fight against mediocrity in idea and execution
You’re a collaborative and strategically responsible boundary pusher who works quickly - at the speed of culture
You have 5+ years of experience in integrated campaign development, shareable content and experiential marketing
You’re a firm believer that it’s no longer about :30 TV spots and print ads
It’s a brand-new marketing world out there with traditional advertising on life-support. You see the massive potential for comms agencies to lead the way
The future is highly-shareable content, immersive experiential marketing, social media campaigns and thought-provoking digital experiences
You search for and find connections others miss
You’re on top of pop culture, trends and bleeding-edge ways to use social platforms
You find it perfectly acceptable to experiment often and aren’t afraid to push the limit

Collaboration with a diverse group of people and functions is not only fun, it leads to the best work
ABOUT US:

MMC leverages its PR heritage and today is a data-driven, 3.0 modern communications company that delivers scaled influence, cultural relevance and brand talkability to our Fortune 200 consumer and healthcare brands. Our goal is to do innovative work and drive business results for our clients. Innovators at heart, we love to build and challenge the status quo. That’s why The Holmes Report awarded us both 2018 Global Consumer Agency of the Year AND Campaign of the Year. For the entrepreneurially minded, working at MMC is an amazing opportunity to get people talking, thinking and behaving differently.

Our team is a deeply committed and somewhat quirky bunch of content creators, brand builders, growth hackers, storytellers, experientialists, artists, mad data scientists, tech junkies and trend sensors. All armed with powerful ideas and a strong point of view and drive to win. We’re relentlessly curious, always creating, innovating often, agile and responsive.

MMC is moving fast and we have doubled our business in the last 5 years. Can you keep up? If you fit our qualifications, we have a spot for you.

When applying, please include your portfolio link along with a tweet-length description of why you're the one we should hire.

Data Scientist- Leader


Data Scientist-Leader

We are looking for an experienced data scientist to lead the development of this analytical effort for the enterprise and deliver value to our customers by understanding them in ways that our traditional approaches have not been able to achieve. Responsibilities include:

•Development of an offer success measurement plan to include non-sales outcomes like customer satisfaction and engagement

•Creation of next-generation models that use both traditional and un-/semi-structured data to better predict customer needs and outcomes

•Partnership with the technology and sales teams to ensure alignment on deliverables/timelines/implementation

•Analytical management of small, pilot programs to test new offer ideas in targeted markets

•Integration with enterprise modeling efforts in partner organizations (Enterprise Data & Analytics/Risk/Finance) to ensure that the lead & offer optimization engine is cross-compatible with existing modeling frameworks

•Leadership of the data strategy around collection, structure and syndication of lead & offer data

•Mentoring junior staff on modeling techniques and providing guidance on analytical approaches

•Leading cross-functional and cross-LOB project teams

The group is responsible for brand strategy and advertising, database and experiential marketing integrated program and product development, market research and related customer analytics, and diverse segments strategy and business development.

Required Qualifications:

•10+ years of experience in analytics, modeling or a combination of both or a PhD in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 7+ years of experience in analytics, modeling, or a combination of both

Desired Qualifications:

•Ability to translate and present complex technical data across technical and non-technical groups

•Ability to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple priorities.

Other Desired Qualifications:

•Experience modeling non-traditional data (e.g. free-form text)

•Experience coding in R/Python and/or experience in big data environments (e.g. Hadoop/Aster)

•Experience with traditional data science techniques including machine learning (e.g. random forest, gradient boosting, neural networks).

Job Expectations:

•Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.

THE COMPANY: OPENPATH SECURITY, INC. (www.openpath.com)

You know smart homes. Now think smart offices.

Founded in 2016 and launched onto the market in May 2018, Openpath combines sleek hardware with an app, enabling employees to enter the office using their smartphones and making office management easier than ever. This is a world-class team of proven startup veterans with multiple exits, top-notch technologists and NSA-level security experts leading the modernization of the workplace with a new industry-leading platform that streamline access while tightening security. Openpath allows employees to enter their work just by having their mobile device on hand providing a frictionless experience for the built environment.

We are always looking for smart and hard working people who are passionate about building and being part of a fast growing start-up.

Highlights…

Be part of a company “innovating the long-stagnant $6B access control industry.”
Led by proven serial entrepreneurs with a track record of scaling successful global enterprise technology companies.
Initial $7M round led by co-founders along with Sorenson Ventures, Bonfire Ventures, Pritzker Group Venture Capital, Fika Ventures and others.
Institutional round of $20M Series B led by Emergence Capital (the first institutional VC to fund Zoom).

THE OPPORTUNITY: Marketing Manager - Channel
We are seeking a creative and enthusiastic Marketing Manager - Channel to join our LA-based team. Reporting to the CMO this position will work cross-functionally to evangelize the Openpath brand within the channel partner ecosystem, which is largely made up of security system integrators, low voltage technicians, and access control installers. Openpath products are only sold via the Channel and you will be foundational in creating and executing Openpath’s Channel Marketing program. In conjunction with the Director of Channel Alliances & Partnerships this role will drive awareness leading to engagement and productivity reinforcing the highly disruptive nature of the Openpath frictionless access control solution.

What you’ll do & more...

Develop and execute a comprehensive channel marketing program in driving adoption and productivity to include (but not limited to) training, tool kits, educational materials, incentive plans.
Work on competitive and channel insights and related research
Account Management in segmenting and prioritizing accounts to drive long term success
Work within the Partner Portal to ensure it depicts Openpath clearly and effectively across training, sales collateral and other enablement tools
optimize user flow in partner portal, keep dashboard updated and dynamic
create separate dashboard, catering to various personas
increase utilization of co-marketing programs and materials
In partnership with the CRM team, create a comprehensive program for effective channel comms
Develop reports and insights for other key stakeholders demonstrating program efficacy
Create CRM campaigns and related channel communication programs
Collaborate with other marketing team members to take broad based programs into the channel utilizing paid, earned and owned media.

What skills and experience do you bring?

EDUCATION: Bachelor's Degree in either Marketing, Communications, or related discipline.
Experience + aptitude/attitude count more.
4 + years with channel and partner marketing preferably with the company/brand
A self starter who can own the program and build relationships across the channel spectrum for the greatest impact.
Ideally B2B experience combining software/hardware as a Cloud (SaaS) solution
Humility to admit mistakes, correct them, and move forward.
Experience in a fast-paced startup or brand highly preferred.
Experience with Salesforce/Hubspot is a plus
Solid communication skills that span writing, speaking, and presenting.
Versed across digital media platforms including email, website, social media, and more.
Ability to creatively problem solve, adapt to shifting projects and moving targets, and work highly collaboratively.
Time management skills and ability to juggle competing priorities with ease.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves, be additive when and where you can, and support team tasks to help out the company when necessary.

Job Summary

Duties and responsibilities of the Marketing Manager – Kid Trax, include managing the brand’s strategic growth through developing and maintaining a consistent positive image for the brand both online and offline. Brand Marketing Responsibilities (30%)
Assists Director of Marketing in building a 1-3 year marketing strategy that connects the passion points of our consumers with our brand, product, and corporate strategies and objectives.
Defines, plans, and launches annual and seasonal campaigns and priorities for the business.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of the brand, category, competitors, and consumers to ensure relevant insights to fuel all marketing elements.
Manages internal and external partners to support the activation of integrated marketing plans. Establishing strong partnerships and processes with our internal teams (Creative services, PR, Sales, Retail, Product, Legal, Customer Service, and Finance) to effectively execute marketing campaigns.
Tracks and manages brand business performance. Analyzes and reports key marketing metrics with a view to strengthening marketing plan / activities for the future.
Manages the Kid Trax marketing budget, spending efficiently to achieve our marketing goals.
Strategically assesses current activation of assets across media, experiential marketing, spokespeople, festivals, and event properties to identify strategic white spaces where our brand should be.
Kid Trax Ecommerce Merchant (30%)
Define and execute our direct to consumer sales strategies for KidTraxToys.com.
Work collaboratively with sales and product management to establish and manage the online assortment including establishing pricing.
Build and execute digital marketing programs and campaigns to drive traffic and profitable sales on KidTraxtoys.com.
Collaborate with the digital marketing team on enhancing SEO and UX.
Manages and executes the Email Marketing program delivering growth in email database and growth in sales conversion.
Content Marketing Duties (20%)
Leads the creation and execution of consumer programs, campaigns, and annual high-profile product launches.
Evaluates creative ideas and thinking with a critical eye and understanding of the brand equity, vision and strategic priorities.
Manages the influencer program, seeking out, vetting, and selecting appropriate individuals to represent the Kid Trax brand.
Develop content for the brand website; keeping in mind brand voice and consumer journey optimization.
Maintain awareness of brand standards and guidelines, and make sure they are implemented for all assets before they are deployed to digital channels.
Measures/analyzes performance of all web activity; including traffic, content views, and demographics, and provide insights and key learnings to affiliated teams.
Social Media & Digital Marketing (10%)
Drives a holistic social media channel strategy that considers brand & product representation.
Build and manage all aspects of multiple social media accounts, including community development and content creation.
Create sharp, enticing content (including, but not limited to Facebook posts, Tweets, Instagram Posts, Instagram stories, and short format videos) which engage the brand’s audience across social channels.
Manage and implement a paid digital and social paid media advertising plan, using data, driven decision making.
Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.
Other Duties Assigned (10%)
Assist in presenting at key customer meetings on key Kid Trax initiatives.
Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
Follows internal controls and company policies set by Pacific Cycle Inc. and Dorel Sports.
Contributes to the success of Pacific Cycle Inc. by leading or assisting with other projects and tasks as assigned.

College education ideally with degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications.

At least five years experience in marketing role with social media responsibilities.
Experience in selling directly online

Passionate about marketing
Outstanding communicator and writer
Exhibit Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) computer skills

Company Description
Sparks Worldwide is an outsourced experiential marketing firm. Sparks Worldwide started with five highly motivated individuals that understand the clients goals and more importantly the opportunity provided likeminded individuals work together to achieve a common goal. Job Description
Senior Activation Planner, Platform Activation Team

Sensory Interactive’s architects, designers, and project managers are combining technology and architecture to develop a new generation of dynamic and engaging places. We’re using our understanding of space, materials, and construction methods in new and totally innovative ways, creating immersive environments that emphasize communication, interaction, and community building.

The Sensory Interactive team works around the world on high-profile projects that include digital urban experiences, interactive educational exhibits, sports arena display programs, and Times Square LED spectaculars.

Sensory Interactive’s Platform Activation Team designs and delivers the experiences that draw crowds, entertain visitors, and build brands. This includes producing content for digital signs, static signs, event and activation spaces, web and mobile sites, social media feeds, and more. We are responsible for all non-revenue content that plays across all media assets in the Promotional Platforms that we construct for our clients.

As a team member at Sensory interactive, you'll let the world know about how we combine digital experiences with physical spaces to foster new kinds of user interactions. Our multidisciplinary approach and cross-industry project portfolio are putting our firm on the leading edge of technologies and business models that are changing built environments around the world.

The Position:

We are seeking a Senior Activation Planner in our Austin office. The Senior Associate will lead Sensory Interactive’s team to concept, plan, budget, schedule, and execute content. Interfacing with the Activation Strategist, Account Executive and Client, the Senior Associate oversees the overall activation from pre-production through successful execution, anticipating any issues along the way. The position requires a blend of creativity and strategy, excellent communication and time-management skills, and self-motivated leadership focused on team collaboration; all while carrying the responsibility of the project’s outcome.

The Planner works closely with an Activation Strategist who develops and maintains the brand and creative vision across all content and experiences.

Qualifications:

You must be a highly organized and self-motivated person comfortable engaging with a wide variety of people and organizations. Specific qualifications include:
A bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Public Relations, Marketing or related field.
Eight or more years of experience managing complex projects in an event production firm, experiential marketing firm, advertising agency, or similar firm.
Mature project management methodologies with a collaborative focus.
Knowledge of both B2B and B2C engagements.
A proactive outlook combined with the ability to manage change as project requirements evolve.
Ability to work with and manage groups with many stakeholders.
Experience establishing and maturing relationships with executives and senior clients.
Experience drafting, reviewing, negotiating, and executing RFPs.
Ability to travel as required.
Responsibilities:

As a Senior Activation Planner, you will be responsible for building positive, consultative relationships with high-level clients, and providing them the utmost in customer service.
Lead our internal team to define the experiences that we will deliver across project sites and the required scope, schedule, and budget.
Engage directly with senior clients and other stakeholders as necessary to ensure the smooth delivery of the desired experience.
Work closely with an Activation Strategist and Account Manager to plan, contract, execute, and operate experiences across project sites on a multi-year basis. Manage and “own” the timeline, day-to-day budget, and project operations from end to end.
Oversee the creation of detailed annual plans for visitor-facing experiences. This includes planning, creation, and refresh of static graphic, digital animation, video, and interactive content; web, mobile, and social media content; and events including fitness classes, sponsored health fairs, farmers markets, art installations, holiday festivals, and more.
Manage the execution of all visitor-facing experiences in coordination with the project’s Strategist and Account Executive.
Maintain and report on detailed schedules for each content category.
Manage, in coordination with the Account Executive, creation and execution of all RFPs or other contracting models for all content.
Manage, in coordination with the Account Executive and Strategist, development and delivery of all content (including graphic design, animation, and video production, interactive content, digital and mobile content, social media content, events, and other content) whether by internal or contracted resources.
Manage, in coordination with the Account Executive, onsite operational and logistics needs for all events (e.g. insurance requirements, load-in and load-out, signage and product deliverables, payment processing needs, electricity, wifi, security, storage cages, and other onsite operational needs to deliver the intended experiences).
Develop, maintain, reconcile, and report on annual budgets including both expenses and revenue.
Benefits:
Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
401K profit-sharing plan
Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) and Holidays
Employee cell phone plan reimbursement
Employee referral bonuses
Wellness incentives
Continuing education

Company Description
Sensory Interactive is a consulting firm that designs and implements digital media projects for the built environment. We provide owner representation services from initial concept through operations for large-format digital out-of-home projects, sponsored promotional platforms, and multi-user interactive walls.

We have learned from experience that owners unfamiliar with digital media are often challenged to efficiently steer a project from design and programming through construction and long-term operation. In response, we have built our business on guiding clients through the full development and implementation process for dynamic media environments.

The Role: Field Marketing Manager

Grade (relevant for internal applicants only): 9

The Location: Houston or Denver

The Team: Team is responsible for creating and implementing comprehensive marketing plans to achieve assigned objectives. These objectives can include regional demand generation programs, audience acquisition at live events/conferences, and other customer facing programs. You will partner closely with other functional teams to achieve your goals.

The Impact: We provide market driven insights to the energy and commodities industries. Through our campaigns, we connect, engage, educate, and drive to selection the portfolio of Platts products and services. Marketing contributes 25% of sales and over $6.0 million in direct revenue from conferences.

Whats in it for you:
Opportunity to shine as a strong individual contributor
Freedom to explore and test new tactics and strategies
Gain experience by working with a dynamic team in a role that is fast paced and fun
Professional and personal development from specific trainings and workshops
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the development of marketing plans consisting of multi-touch, multi-dimensional programs including both inbound and outbound tactics
Engage with in house creative team to create compelling collateral, web pages, online exposure, and more
Budget acumen and responsibility for delivering the targets within budget guidelines.
Research, choose, design and manage live events to be included as tactics in the overall marketing mix, and ensure there is a cohesive pre-event, at-event and post event strategy to increase engagement and response rates
Forecast, measure, analyze and report on impact of programs
What Were Looking For:

Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years of B-to-B sales cycle knowledge including demand creation and pipeline contribution/acceleration
Superior project management skills ability to organize new work efforts and establish metrics to track progress
Knowledge and experience using key business applications - MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Sharepoint as well as SalesForce, Marketo, and HTML
Well rounded marketing execution experience in both inbound and outbound, physical and virtual events, social and digital marketing and ability to match tactics with appropriate objectives and outcomes
Strong oral/written communications skills
Strong consultative marketing approach in order to effectively engage with sales and other functions (content, product, operations)
Preferred Qualifications:
Build and manage customer data (targeting, segmentation, campaign sizing, propensity modeling)
Industry knowledge energy & commodities markets.
Ability to demonstrate track record of success in all key areas of responsibility
At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. Were the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.

S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com.

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Fast Casual Restaurant

Our Fast Casual Restaurant company is searching for a high energy, marketing professional to act as a liaison between our Corporate team and our restaurants to aid in the development of market specific marketing plans and the local execution of the national marketing plan to profitably build sales, transactions, and cash flow for the company and Owner/Operator restaurants. Exciting & Rewarding Work Environment
Cutting-edge technology, designed to assist you in effectively performing your daily tasks

The National Field Marketing Manager must be able to plan, manage and administer local restaurant marketing budgets
The National Field Marketing Manager must understand local market conditions and their potential marketing value
The National Field Marketing Manager will identify, develop and implement local sales driving marketing programs
The National Field Marketing Manager must understand Brand strategies and incorporate into local plans

The National Field Marketing Manager must track Corporate and Franchise owned restaurant sales performance
The National Field Marketing Manager must work with Corporate and Franchise Partners to develop strong grand opening plans that drive sales by venue
The National Field Marketing Manager must gather and report competitive customer intelligence to cross functional teams
The National Field Marketing Manager will support all company initiatives, give actionable feedback, share best practices and serve as advocate and information source for company
Apply Now – National Field Marketing Manager located in North Palm Beach, FL.

Company information

Westamerica is among the largest commercial banks headquartered in California. We are looking for outstanding people to join our winning team. We reached our current strength because our employees, customers, and shareholders believe in the same fundamental goals: Delivering a wide variety of financial services with a superior customer service guarantee. Westamerica Bank is a 130-year-old community bank with $4.9 billion in assets and 88 branches throughout Northern and Central California. We have been profitable quarter in and quarter out for 23 years. Industry associations and rating agencies routinely rank Westamerica Bank among the top community banks for asset quality, capital ratios, safety and soundness, and overall financial performance.

Description of role

Recruit, manage, coach and motivate a team of Business Relationship Managers, Business Banking Officers, and Business Banking Managers, along with other employees within a defined geographical region of the bank. Oversee and maintain excellent service standards and promote growth in profitability with the use of Sales Culture. The development of direct reports in a sale driven environment is critics for this role. Solicit large prospects and assist direct reports with large customers and prospects with joint calling efforts.

Responsibilities
Understand the commercial real estate and C & I markets within your geographical location.
Ability to differentiate Westamerica Bank from the competition and use those differences as coaching tools to your direct reports.
Ability to read, understand and compare financial statements.
Develop calling plans with each officer to take advantage of competitive strengths within each market.
Establish and maintain relationships with key community leaders and achieves a significant presence in the community to promote the Bank.
Provide Senior Management with reports, feedback, and areas of opportunity with the region.
Offer weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting with forecasts and details about sales growth in lending. Deposits and Non-interest Income.
Ensure compliance with all Bank and Regulatory requirements.
Requirements
Bachelors degree in Business, Accounting, and Finance is required.
5+ years of sales management, outside sales and customer service experience in the financial services industry.
Adherence to policies, procedures and regulatory banking requirements.
Highly developed verbal and written communication skills including familiarity with basic word processing applications software.
Ability to analyze financial statements.
Ability to prepare and effectively deliver sales presentations using applicable support materials.
Strong sales and sales presentation skills.
Effectively solves problems, present solutions and resolve conflicts.
Ability to recruit, train and coach a sales team.
Demonstrate strong leadership skills, always projecting a positive attitude and provide an environment of professional excellence.
EOE Westamerica Bank's Privacy Policy may be found at: www.westamerica.com/about/privacy

Job Title: Manager, North America Channel Marketing - AR/VR
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.AR/VR is looking for a highly talented Manager, North America Channel Marketing to take on this exciting new role in our Menlo Park, CA office focused on Facebook hardware. Reporting to the Head of NA Retail Sales, this role will lead all NA marketing operations, including retail/channel marketing, experiential programs, customer acquisition and retention while fully supporting the for all AR/VR products across brick and mortar & online retail accounts.

Responsibilities:

Lead, recruit, develop and manage team of channel marketing managers to support strategic account managers in accomplishing channel specific goals for Facebook hardware
Develop GTM marketing strategy for NA retail to optimize awareness, trial and conversion
Lead & execute marketing and merchandising initiatives with NA retail partners within agreed upon budgets and KPIs
Continuous measurement, optimization of marketing programs to drive efficiency
Management and distribution of co-marketing budget, focusing on performance metrics
Present key marketing materials in front of retailers, executives, business development teams
Manage content & campaign activities across retailers ensuring our content meets brand standards and is in service of overall team strategy
Identify new channel marketing opportunities and position for review to help in future decisions
Coordinate and manage marketing elements of QBRs including share regional context & performance across channels
Mininum Qualifications:

10+ years experience in a marketing role, with a clear record of achievement and success in technology based consumer product marketing and/or product management
Experience and clear understanding of the North American retail landscape
Experience in go-to-market planning and execution across online and traditional retail channels
Proven communication and presentation skills with business acumen
Knowledge for innovation and the opportunities presented by disruptive technologies
Bachelors degree in business or related field with post-graduate business/marketing qualification

Job Description


We are seeking an Associate Manager, Event Production to support the planning and execution of experiential marketing programs. This position will consist of element transportation, event execution, in-office tasks, and other work at Fusion Marketing. This Associate Manager role requires extensive travel to and from event sites in support of all areas of the event execution including element transportation, set-up, event management, and break down. The candidate should be prepared for a minimum of 50-75% road travel during the first year, including weekends and some holidays.

In the office, the position will be responsible for supporting event preparations, recapping, maintaining personal expenses, and any other account related tasks that may arise. This position will be utilized in supporting additional key accounts as needed, as well as actively engaging in various company initiatives.

The Associate Manager is responsible for working effectively with both client and internal account teams to support event programs that achieve client results against established strategic & creative objectives, timelines and financial goals. The ideal candidate should have relevant experience in experiential marketing production and execution, be self-motivated, thrive under pressure, work well in a fast-paced competitive industry, and have a passion for event production, execution and logistics.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support all aspects of event activation
Responsible for maintaining and submitting timely expense reports and DOT log books
Travel as needed, ensuring availability for all required event dates
Understand event budgets ensuring that financial goals are always met
Collaborate with the Account Manager to support the activation plan, budgeting, event execution, recapping, and reconciliation
Take ownership of event and transportation elements
Collaborate with vendors to ensure quality and workability and that the various projects meet the core objectives of the program
Work closely with staffing agencies to support the hiring, training and managing the event staff needs for the programs
Manage the warehousing PO system and understand/execute the shipping process
Document and learn all aspects of the account elements to assist in creating manuals and/or physical training
Collaborate with peers in the department to foster innovation
QUALIFICATIONS:
1+ year experience in experiential marketing and/or event production
Bachelor’s degree and/or equivalent experience
1+ Year Touring/Road experience
CDL not required but a plus
Pays close attention to detail
Demonstrates knowledge and desire to learn event production
Excellent customer focus, interpersonal and written communication skills
Ability to handle numerous account tasks simultaneously with excellent organizational skills, while self-managing priorities and commitments
Ability to pro-actively anticipate obstacles and create solutions
Must possess a strong work ethic, can-do attitude, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment
Willing and able to work nonstandard work hours and weekends as required (this is not a 9 to 5 job), and possess a good sense of humor!
Willing to travel at minimum 50 – 75% of the calendar year
Passion for new technology, sports and entertainment and live events

Job Description
LOCATION: Rawhide Event Center/Wild Horse Pass Motorsport Park

COMPENSATION: $35,568 - $42,500 annualized

HOURS OF WORK: Varies

FLSA STATUS: EXEMPT

SUPERVISORY: Yes

REPORTS TO: AGM Operations

POSITION SUMMARY:

This team member works hand-in-hand with our event and sales teams, and other members of the operation to ensure event success. Coordinates arrangements for major events, sponsored events, and corporate group events and banquets, ensuring a seamless and flawless execution. Maintains a balance between delivery of hospitality and service and promotion of the revenue centers.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Consults with representatives of client group or internal organization to plan details such as number of persons expected, display space desire, site location, facilities and services schedule.
Coordinates arrangements with appropriate departments, such as safety, vendors and facilities and operations.
Notifies various department heads and managers of arrangements.
Prepares contracts and exhibits per Planning Notes from Sales and Operations.
Maintains event schedule for all parts of Venue and facilities.
Informs all internal specialists and marketing if there are any needs for publicity and or signage.
Quickly and effectively resolves complaints, and performs other duties to promote goodwill.
Establishes and maintains internal and external relationships by interacting and communicating effectively with diverse groups of individuals.
Maintains contact with group representatives to ensure any unforeseen event is handled seamlessly and flawlessly.
Confers with supervisor to review achievements and discuss needed changes in goals or objectives resulting from current or projected future status or conditions.
Assist in the development of, and employs appropriate measures to assess event effectiveness and success.
Maximizes cost effectiveness within the area by ensuring compliance with established budget, labor, and revenue benchmarks.
Recommends and implements techniques to improve productivity, reduce costs, and improve guest service.
Meets challenges with resourcefulness; develops innovative approaches and ideas.
Conveys feelings of warmth, caring, safety, and efficiency to each guest.
Ensures meetings adhere to fire and safety regulations.
KEY QUALIFICATIONS – EDUCATION & WORK EXPERIENCE:
High school diploma or equivalent (GED) preferred.
Three (3) years of demonstrated events or sales experience.
Knowledge of Motorsports highly preferred, and/or events or sales-operational knowledge of public events.
Must possess a valid AZ driver’s license, proved a 39-month violation-free MVR report.
Must be able to obtain a Tribal operator license driving permit at the time of hire.
A satisfactory result obtained through a test for illegal drugs is a requirement of employment.
Must acknowledge and agree to maintain a drug-free work place as a condition of employment.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Knowledge of events, Motorsports and banquet standards and client service practices is helpful.
Knowledge of modern filing and record keeping practices and procedures.
Strong administrative skills.
Strong organizational, planning, and time management skills.
Customer Service
Skill in working courteously with the public as well as developing and maintaining effective working relationships.
Effective ability to communicate and follow directions
Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Ability to establish effective work relationships with diverse groups of individuals.
Ability to coordinate a high level of activities under a variety of conditions and constraints.
Ability to effectively manage and organize multiple priorities.
Ability to adapt to changes in the work environment, manage competing demands, and deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Ability to remain calm under pressure.
Ability to convey a positive and professional image.
COMPUTER SKILLS:

Microsoft Suite, Microsoft Outlook, Sketch-up and hospitality database software.

LANGUAGE SKILLS:

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write and speak effectively, provide verbal and written reports as needed.

MATH SKILLS:

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent, and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

REASONING ABILITY:

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret variety of instructions in all formats and deal with both abstract and concrete variables. Ability to act calmly and responsibly in an emergency situation; stay in control.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be outside for an entire shift/extended period of time in most all types of weather, including hot weather. During their shift, an employee will be required to walk; use hands and fingers to handle, or feel; execute repetitive motions of the wrists, hands and fingers; reach with hands and arms; and talk and hear. The employee is regularly required to sit; and climb, balance, bend, stoop, lift, carry, push, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move 25 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Work is performed both outside and inside; primarily outside. Outside work is performed in most kinds of weather with exposure to extreme heat, fumes and direct sunlight and extreme heat. Work is performed primarily in an amusement park / race track setting/ public events setting. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.

Evening, night, weekend, and holiday work is required. Extended hours and irregular shifts may be required.
Company Description
Wild Horse Pass is conveniently located in Phoenix’s East Valley with a current population of nearly 1. 2 million, projected to grow to 1.4 million by 2020. There is a labor force of more than 750,000 in the East Valley comprising 42% of the total workforce in the metro-Phoenix area, making it a daytime employment hub. The communities of the East Valley boast one of the highest educational attainment levels in the nation. More than 40 percent of the population has a college degree, with more than 25 percent holding a bachelor’s degree and 15 percent holding a graduate degree. Additionally, the average cost of living in the East Valley is well below the national average and comparative business markets; 9 percent lower than Salt Lake City, 13 percent lower than in Denver, and 46 percent lower than Los Angeles.

We are a boutique firm located near BWI Airport. Our clients are located throughout the U.S. and represent many different industries.

The ideal candidate to join us will have the following experience and abilities:

 Initiative to drive organizational processes

 Ability to lift up to 40 lbs. Professional demeanor and appearance

 Strong background in customer service

 Prepare PowerPoint presentations

 Maintain customer confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential

 Attend local events in support of TargetGov

 Maintain event project tracking with project management software

 Production and distribution of documents for events

 Make and track travel arrangements for speakers

 Prepare and answer calls for papers to national and local contracting events

We are looking for a conscientious person who is willing to bring their best – this position can evolve from contract to a full-time position. This is rewarding work that can lead to other opportunities within a growing firm that helps companies be more successful selling their services and products to the U.S. federal government.

Company Description
Seattle Singles has been the leading Dating Service/Matchmaker in the greater Seattle area for over twenty years.

We are an exclusive Dating Service for individuals who want to meet real and progressive individuals that are looking for a stable relationship.

Seatle Singles combines the best characteristics of online dating in one platform - our services are personalized and professional. Our goal is to help our members find the partner of their liking. To provide the best service to our members, we get to know all of them by finding out about their likes, dislikes, and the type of person they would find attractive.

We are responsible for countless amounts of introductions, marriages, and happy couples; Seattle Singles provides a comprehensive dating experience unprecedented in the dating industry. With our relationship specialists, our professional, friendly staff, and our in-house photographer we can offer a top-notch authentic, successful dating experience.

Seattle Singles is matchmaking with a "twist," ultimately giving our members full control over their complete dating experience. We provide comprehensive background checks, meet face-to-face with all potential members, provide ongoing personalized service, coordinate and facilitate member events, and so much more!

With thousands of dating companies that have sprung up over the years, we know it can be challenging to cut through the clutter. Seattle Singles is a company that combines the best features of online dating, with the safety and added benefits of having a full-service company help to verify profile content. We want everyone to have an excellent working and dating experience, and for us, that starts with the people we hire. We want motivated and compassionate individuals who love working with others towards a common goal: Our Members Success! We invite you to join our team and begin a career that could span decades like so many of our other Seattle Singles have enjoyed. Contact us and let's see if we are 'a match.'

Job Description:
At Academy Mortgage, we measure success not only in financial terms but also in human terms. We view our customers as people, not as loans. Our core purpose is to help individuals and families achieve successful homeownership through responsible lending. Academy’s outstanding people fuel the growth of our organization. We hire and retain the industry’s brightest and most capable mortgage professionals.

As the Field Marketing Manager, you will be responsible to support the Academy Production Team in various marketing activities for the assigned region(s). This role collaborates across the region(s) to foster and enable a coordinated, consistent customer experience to our production teams.
Key responsibilities include:
Support implementation of key initiatives to enable business and production strategies, collaborate with production team to develop and execute marketing strategies, and provide customer marketing support.
What you’ll Do:
• Meet regularly (travel may be required), with local branches to promote and train on monthly and quarterly corporate marketing initiatives and promotions
• Support Loan Officers with CRM set-up/deployments, social media marketing, and business development initiatives
• Assist new loan officers and branch locations with initial onboarding marketing efforts • Assist in creation of marketing materials by creating project analysis briefs, consulting with creative team and managing the compliance approval process o Establish KPIs for marketing projects and perform follow up to determine ROI
• Filter and manage incoming requests for branch and/or individual marketing needs, this includes regular updates and on-going communications
• Assist (as determined by the manager) in coordinating marketing events at the local level • Work with local Branch Marketing Coordinators and/or appointed marketing to train, educate, and support key initiatives, as well as general marketing activities in local markets
• Train and sustain adoption locally on key marketing initiatives and tools
• Monitor, review, and report on marketing activity and results at the local level
Job Requirements and Preferred Education:
• High School Diploma or equivalent required. BA/BS in Marketing or related field a plus
• Mortgage Origination industry preferred
• Peer collaboration and professional development
• Implementing, enhancing and supporting existing marketing programs with measurable, positive results
• Understanding and serving the unique needs of diverse employee groups
• Quickly build collaborative partnerships with others
• Managing multiple, sometimes overlapping, deliverables and timelines
• Seek and apply feedback from diverse sources to understand needs from your core consumer base
Academy Mortgage Corporation is an EEO Employer, who participates in E-Verify. Reference checks are a pre-requisite of employment. All offers are contingent on successful completion of a criminal background check and credit checks, as required by state regulation. All successful candidates must provide original documents that will establish their identity and eligibility to work in the United States as required by the Immigration Reform and Control Act.

The Point Loma Nazarene University community is, and intends to be, a decidedly Christian community, as exhibited by our shared beliefs, corporate practices, and Christlike character.

JOB SUMMARY

Participates as an active member of the PLNU Admissions team and is responsible for admissions events.

JOB STATUS

Time:

Full time

***

RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as a contact for CRM event management, travel tracking, form building, online payment, submitting tickets, and troubleshooting as needed.
Partner with Assistant Director for Marketing/Communication on promotion of events in CRM.
Oversee Admissions Preview Day and Sunset Tour program, including, but not limited to
Marketing each event
Managing event registration
Scheduling staff, students and campus partners for each event
Various components of event planning, including scheduling facilities, catering, media, etc.
Compiling and evaluating event feedback and data
Oversee Admissions In Your Area events, including, but not limited to
Finding locations for PLNU Info Nights and area Admitted Student Receptions
Scheduling staff, students, alum for each event
Training staff, students, alum for each event
Marketing each event
Programming events, including providing materials for event hosts
Traveling to events as needed
Working with Marketing Team on scheduling Admissions Counselor Fall Recruiting Events, including, but not limited to
Serving as a PLNU liaison for fall travel college fairs and transfer days
Managing PLNU Admissions Counselor fall travel schedules by scheduling events, planning what weeks they’ll be on the road, and more
Work with other Admissions staff in planning, execution of Admissions outreach events (such as Encuentro, Latino Summer Camp, etc).
Travel to events as needed
Demonstrate knowledge of and compliance with all PacWest Conference and NCAA rules and regulations as they pertain to student-athlete admission requirements.
Other duties and committee participation as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum of three years of admissions experience (can include student worker experience). Bachelor’s degree required. Must be an enthusiastic supporter of PLNU and its programs. Knowledge of PLNU admission standards and procedures is a plus. Basic knowledge of Microsoft Word and Outlook.
Understanding of and commitment to the spiritual mission of the university.
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, including public speaking skills. Commitment to a customer-oriented provision of service.
Ability to motivate and challenge student employees to enthusiastically and effectively represent Point Loma Nazarene University.
Must possess strong detail and time management skills. Ability to work independently and accomplish tasks under deadline stresses.
Ability to exercise interpersonal skills in establishing and maintaining effective working relations with prospective students and their parents, faculty, staff, and other external contacts.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
The work is primarily sedentary and may require sitting for extended periods of time. Use of computer equipment: computer keyboard, mouse, and monitor. Ability to read documents, email and other correspondence, and reports on paper and computer monitor. Hearing and speaking to communicate effectively with others in person and by phone. Ability to stand, stoop, push, pull, and lift up to 20 lbs throughout the day.

BENEFITS
Benefits include health, dental, tuition benefits for employee and dependents, competitive retirement matching, vacation and sick time, and 15 paid holidays per year.
In addition, we have many opportunities to engage with our community including staff chapel, monthly lunches and a robust wellness program.
