As an employee of the Washington State Patrol, you will be part of a team of dedicated professionals responsible for providing safety and security to the citizens of the State of Washington.

Troopers patrolling the highways are the most visible part of this agency. However, there are over 1,200 civilian employees who serve behind the scenes supporting the agency mission. To name just a few, we have:
911 dispatchers who are the critical vital link between calls for assistance and emergency response;
Commercial Vehicle Enforcement Officers that work to inspect commercial vehicles to ensure safe and efficient travel on public highways;
Deputy State Fire Marshals who help prevent fires in homes and workplaces;
Forensic Scientists who process evidence that assists in prosecuting criminal cases;
Records staff that process criminal information to ensure crimes are reported accurately so that offenders do not end up working with vulnerable people.
Administrative staff who provide exceptional customer service and respond to information requests while ensuring the agency runs smoothly and efficiently.
Apply today and join us in providing "Service with Humility"!

The individual hired for this position may also be qualified for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program. For information on this program click on Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program.

This position will remain open until filled. The initial screening date will be April 30, 2020. In order to be considered for the initial screening, please submit an application on or before April 29, 2020. The agency reserves the right to make an appointment any time after the initial screening date. If you have already applied, you do not need to reapply.

NOTE: Upon completion of training, the incumbent will be able to telework during the COVID-19 shelter-in-place order.

The Fire Training Academy (FTA) Division has responsibility for providing training opportunities and facilities for the fire service. The division operates a 51 acre live fire training facility. The FTA provides classroom and live fire training to the fire service, airport fire fighters, the military and law enforcement. The FTA also coordinates and administers the Regional Direct Delivery Program which provides basic firefighter training to volunteers throughout the state in the communities they serve.

This position is responsible for providing a high degree of customer service and administrative support to the Fire Training Academy staff to ensure compliance with agency administrative requirements including, tracking and scheduling of all facilities use, administrative procedure development, event coordination, student registrations, records management and data analysis.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Request, review and maintain registration documentation.
Coordinate training needs for facility use, scheduled training, and facility maintenance.
Schedule training and dormitory for FTA students and user groups.
Maintain facility use calendar and training schedule.
Arrange tours and special event as needed.
Tracking, analyze and maintain data from scheduled training, registrations, Recruit Academies, and develop reports for management as needed.
Respond to and distribute correspondence and documentation for students, departments, website, and general course announcements.
Plan, coordinate, and provide logistics for FTA meetings and other events.
Maintain and respond to emails submitted to the FTA general email accounts.
Conduct research and collect data, perform data analysis, and assist with the development of operational procedures, guidelines and reports.
Assist with drafting, formatting and posting division procedures.
Assist with completion of bureau level projects and assignments.
Maintain files and records in accordance with retention schedules.
Support recruit academy graduation ceremony to include: set-up, correspondence, execution, and break-down.
Resolve customer issues within established agency policy and program guidelines.
Assist with maintaining FTA website with current information.
Respond to written, email, and telephone inquiries from other WSP sections, divisions, bureaus, partner agencies, internal and external customers, other stakeholders, and either directs inquiries to the appropriate personnel or provides proper resolution to inquiries.
Assist in the development and maintenance of standardized desk manuals related to FTA business practices.
Required Qualifications:
High School Graduate or GED equivalent.
At least 3 years' of working knowledge at an expert level of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, etc.).
Knowledge of basic office procedures and practices; business management practices; research methods and data collection.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Strong customer service skills.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Ability to resolve complex problems; think critically using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Ability to manage multiple priorities with competing deadlines.
Familiarity in creating forms and developing procedures.
Desired Qualifications:

Associates degree in business administration or allied field.

OR

Three (3) years of progressively responsible experience in accounting, general office, event coordinating, business management, administrative analysis, or closely related field.

The act of submitting application materials electronically is considered affirmation that the information is complete and truthful. The agency will verify this information and any untruthful or misleading answers will be cause for rejection of potential employment.

How to Apply:

Please complete the on-line application process at www.careers.wa.gov. Applicants are required to attach unofficial college transcripts as attachments to their application.

If you have questions regarding this announcement, please contact Tracy Moore at (360) 704-2315 or tracy.moore@wsp.wa.gov.

Union Notice:

This position is in a collective bargaining unit.

Polygraph & Background Investigation:

Prior to a hire, a polygraph examination and background check including criminal record history will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position.

Applicants are required to sign release of information forms and will not have access to any investigative materials, files, or results. The Washington State Patrol has strict guidelines relating, but not limited to, personal and employment characteristics, arrests, convictions, and illegal drug usage, etc.

During the polygraph examination, candidates are required to sign an assessment sheet and participate in an oral interview process to verify responses to the Personal Background Evaluation, the Personal History and Background Questionnaire, and a Pre-Employment Interview. Untruthful or misleading answers or omissions will be treated as a falsification which will be cause for rejection of potential employment.

Transcripts:

Education verification is part of the selection process. If selected as a top candidate, all education, to include high school and equivalent, indicated in your application materials, will be verified. If you are selected as a top candidate you will be contacted by the Human Resource Division and asked to provide official transcripts at the appropriate time.

Other Information:

Persons with a disability, who need assistance in the application or assessment process, or those needing this announcement in an alternative format, may call (360) 704-2317. Applicants that are deaf or hard of hearing may call through the Washington Relay Service 7-1-1 or 1-800-833-6384.

The Washington State Patrol actively supports Diversity, Equity, Inclusion in the workplace, and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Events and Shows Manager (Irvine, California, US) in Irvine, CA at Kia Motors America
Job Description:
Job Description
At Kia, we’re creating award-winning products and redefining what value means in the automotive industry. It takes a special group of individuals to do what we do, and we do it together. Our culture is fast-paced, collaborative, and innovative. Our people thrive on thinking differently and challenging the status quo. We are creating something special here, a culture of learning and opportunity, where you can help Kia achieve big things and most importantly, feel passionate and connected to your work every day.
Kia provides team members with competitive benefits including 100% premium paid medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) plan matching of 100% up to 6% of the salary deferral, and time off starting at 14 days per year. Kia also offers company lease and purchase programs, company-wide holiday shutdown, paid volunteer hours, and premium lifestyle amenities at our corporate campus in Irvine, California.
Status
Exempt
Summary
Manage and develop National Dealer facing events, manages the daily operations of Kia’s Auto Show and Point-of-Sale Merchandising Programs and Experiential programs. These operations include, but is not limited to, show site supervision, concept development, and show site event/promotion coordination and all around experience of event development, management and marketing.
Major Responsibilities

With support of the National Manager of Partnerships and Experiential; Administer experiential marketing activities and Collaborate with KMA Market Research / other internal departments, and partner agencies to develop and execute consumer/fan surveys. Ensure that surveys are the voice of the customer and that methodology / questions / results meet the business needs. Assist Partnerships Mgr with day to day operations of experiential marketing events and partnerships.

4th Priority - 10%
Assist Regions/DMGs with any local Ride and Drive or display activations
Education/Certification
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Business, or equivalent directly related experience.
Overall Experience

Minimum seven to ten years in a marketing environment. Preferably within the Automotive Industry.
Other Requirements:
Travel will be required domestically and/or internationally.
May need to work additional hours outside of normal business hours as required by the job, including weekends or holidays.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Directly Related Experience
Four to six years’ experience working within an auto show environment.v

Written & Verbal Communication

Detail-oriented and proactive

Job Description
A UK based Marketing Agency is seeking an experienced Event Coordinator to organize excellent events. You will be responsible for every aspect of an event, from choosing venues to evaluating success afterwards.

An event coordinator must be well-organized and competent in vendor management. Communication skills and attention to detail will set apart the best among the candidates. Add a shot of enthusiasm and passion for the job and you’ll be our ideal candidate.

These events will occur online (through tools such as Zoom, GoToWebinar and WebEx) as well as in-person after the ease of COVID-19 related restrictions.

The goal is to organize unforgettable events that will ensure the participation of all attendees and facilitate the completion of business objectives.

Responsibilities:
Understand requirements for each event
Coordinate all event activities and personnel
Recruit sponsors for each event
Maintain stock of event supplies
Research and identify successful event opportunities
Plan event with attention to financial and time constraints
Distribute all meeting information and supplies to attending personnel
Book venues and schedule speakers
Research vendors (catering, decorators, musicians etc.) and choose the best combination of quality and cost
Negotiate with vendors to achieve the most favorable terms
Manage all event operations (preparing venue, invitations etc.)
Do final checks at the day of the event (e.g. tables, technology) to ensure everything meets standards
Oversee event happenings and act quickly to resolve problems
Evaluate event’s success and submit reports
Qualifications:
Previous experience in event planning or other related fields
Strong project managing skills
Deadline and detail-oriented
Ability to work well in teams

Job Description
MetroNet has an immediate opening for an energetic; Marketing Coordinator in Ames, IA!

At MetroNet, we pride ourselves on providing cutting-edge technology combined with outstanding customer care. We are a fast-growing telecommunication company, offering 100% fiber-optic technology. MetroNet specializes in fiber to the premise TV, voice and internet services that provide our customers with some of the fastest internet speeds in the world. Recognized for being one of the Best Places to Work in 2020 by Glassdoor. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry by enhancing the overall customer experience and optimizing the talent of our valued associates.

We’re looking for tech-savvy, innovative thinkers to join our team and help us create what’s next!

What is in it for you?
Competitive salary
80% of Medical premiums paid for by company
Company paid Disability and Life insurance
401(k) company match and 100% vested on day 1
Discounted MetroNet service in our serviceable area
Locally owned, friendly, fun atmosphere
Job Summary:

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for developing and executing local marketing campaigns in assigned markets to gain and retain new and existing customers. Collaborates with key cross functional teams and outside vendors to support campaigns. Monitors market trends, competitive intelligence, and analyzes campaign results to recommend enhancements of local marketing strategies.

What you will be doing:
Identifies, coordinates and executes strategic market level campaigns including but not limited to events, sponsorships, partnerships, community involvement, experiential marketing, and guerilla marketing
Creates and executes go-to market campaigns for multi-dwelling unit properties and homeowner associations
Identifies and negotiates MDU/HOA Referral and Community Affiliate program partnerships
Manages campaign logistics including but not limited to deadlines, payments, assets, staffing, and results tracking
Provides ongoing market monitoring and feedback: market insights, customer contact, and associate engagement
Researches and compiles competitive intelligence to identify key concerns and opportunities
Manages on-going compliance with assigned expense budgets and adheres to purchase request and expense reporting guidelines
Provides tracking, analysis, reporting, and commentary on local marketing campaigns.
Communicates daily, weekly, monthly on local marketing campaigns and initiatives through reports and scorecards
Collaborates with cross functional teams in aligning efforts, resources and budget allocations.
Identifies and coordinates PR opportunities to support local campaign initiatives
Provides excellent internal customer service and maintains open communication with all associates, management and contractors
Maintains inventory of all local marketing assets
Performs other duties as assigned
What You Need For This Position:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, or Sales
2+ years Marketing or equivalent experience required
Previous Cable TV, Internet, or Telecommunications industry experience preferred
Event Planning/Management, Fundraising, Experiential Marketing, Guerilla Marketing, or Sales experience a plus
Highly organized, self-motivated and strong attention to detail
Demonstrated project management and organizational skills; proven ability to manage multiple projects and priorities with excellent follow-through
Strategic thinker who can articulate objectives into actionable campaigns that produce results
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving, collaborative environment
Solid interpersonal skills with a high level of professionalism; in-person, phone and email
Proficient using the latest versions of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet software, email and database software
If you have a strong desire to impact, the success of our organization by ensuring we continue to attract and retain committed professionals, please apply today!

MetroNet is an EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Company Description
Headquartered in Evansville, Indiana, MetroNet is a customer-focused company providing cutting-edge fiber optic telecommunication services, including high-speed Fiber Internet, full-featured Fiber Phone, Fiber IPTV with a wide variety of programming, and a home security product called MetroNet SmartHome.

We got our start in 2005, with our first fiber optic network in Greencastle, Indiana, and have since expanded into 50+ communities throughout Indiana, Illinois, and Kentucky. All MetroNet services are delivered across our 100% fiber-optic network made up of thousands of miles of fiber optic cables connected directly to homes and businesses.

At MetroNet, we are committed to bringing state-of-the-art telecommunication services to the communities we serve by delivering services comparable or superior to those offered in large metropolitan areas. This commitment not only means better internet, television and telephone options for our customers today but also the capacity to continually provide additional products and services in the future as new uses for 100% fiber are developed.

Our commitment to our communities doesn’t stop at bringing exciting new technology. We’re also proud to have local retail stores, staffed with friendly associates and technicians who actually live in the communities we serve. We find it is always reassuring to see a familiar face when your services are installed or when you stop by our store. Our innovative store design allows customers to test drive MetroNet products at interactive kiosks, sign up for services, pay their bills, and much more.

Job Title: PR Account Supervisor - Digital, Gaming & Entertainment
Job Description:
Metro Public Relations is seeking an Account Supervisor for its Entertainment, Digital and Corporate clients.

*
We are an award-winning entertainment PR, experiential and creative marketing agency with teams in Los Angeles and NYC. We represent top traditional/digital talent, brands, film studios and networks, events, production and gaming companies, podcasts, and some of the world’s leading platforms.
*
The ideal candidate can manage multiple client work streams and has strong experience in strategic planning and client communication at all stages of campaign. They will bring a passion for digital media, gaming, and entertainment tech with a deep bench of media contacts across digital, entertainment industry, and B2B trade press. Candidate should have strong relationships with key contacts at outlets such as Adweek, Bloomberg, LAT, Forbes, Hollywood Reporter, NYT, TechCrunch, Variety, WSJ, among others. Additionally, candidates will have thought leadership experience drafting abstracts and tradeshow submissions for executives.
*
Job Responsibilities:
*
Lead client communication with no oversight, making strategic recommendations that align with client goals

- Create and lead reputation-building earned media, partnership and event strategies

- Identify and pitch stories that ladder back to the client’s larger business goals

- Develop PR plans, brand decks, and new business presentations (with little to no oversight)

- Draft press releases and other materials for clients

- Secure speaking opportunities to elevate executive and talent profiles

- Secure op eds for client spokespeople*
- Campaign development: demonstrate creativity and proactively develop strategic plans for each project, seeing it through to its successful completion. Can go outside the box to exceed client expectations.

*
- Media outreach. Lead pitching initiatives and maintain strong relationships with media contacts across B2B, entertainment industry and digital press. Ability to strategically pivot tactics when hitting roadblocks.

- Lead the execution of client events (post COVID-19) / client’s virtual events.

- Manage and delegate to team members across accounts. This role will also serve as a mentor for junior staff to help them grow, help with time management, oversee assignments, provide pitch edits, etc.

- Participate in new business process, including proactive outreach, joining meetings, preparing decks and proposals, and helping close
*
Requirements:
5+ years of media relations experience; large agency/client experience is a plus
Strong track record of creating successful media and brand strategies - the ability to showcase examples from your past work
Strong media contacts
Thrives in a very fast paced environment passion for digital media, B2B work and entertainment.
Strong leadership and team management skills
A positive attitude that upholds our culture
*
We offer a team-oriented, creative environment and expect all employees to maintain our positive office culture. While our office is currently closed during COVID-19 Stay at Home orders, our business is fully operational and we are all working remotely.
Job Type: Full-time

Experience:
Public Relations: 4 years (Required)
Benefits:
Health insurance
Retirement plan
Paid time off
Parental leave
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekends required
Company's website:
metropublicrelations.com
Company's Facebook page:
https://www.instagram.com/metropublicrelations/?hl=en
Benefit Conditions:
Waiting period may apply
Work Remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Sonic Automotive is a Fortune 500 company that is transforming the way people shop for, buy and service their vehicles. Our talented team work together to ensure we provide an experience unmatched by our competitors.

Job Description

Our Field Marketing Manager will act as the first point of contact with our General Managers to support marketing strategies and optimization plans.
Position require about 75% travel to the Sonic-owned stores and to our company headquarters in Charlotte, NC.
Primary focus is to provide support to General Managers at Sonic’s stores/retail environments with social media, digital, CRM, local-marketing, SEO/SEM, public relations and project-management – as Sonic leads these stores into a new era of auto retail experience, marked by industry-leading technology, infrastructure and marketing. You will develop store-level marketing plans. They will utilize the expertise and strategies set by our channel marketing experts to create and execute on store-level, full 360 degree channel marketing plans.
This role works collaboratively with the marketing channel leaders and agency partners to optimize store-level marketing performance, and reports to the Field Marketing Director.

Required Skills & Responsibilities
Devising plans for optimized performance across channels in real-time, working closely with Sonic channel managers and in support of store GMs
Understands multi-channel marketing and the points of integration between social and digital touch points.
Coordinates with the Sonic Digital Team members to ensure integration of stores’ social and digital media programming with the respective store digital properties
Knowledge of web and mobile functionality, user experience, ecommerce and web analytics
Collaborates with other internal teams (SEO, web, events), contributes leadership to promote best-in-class in class thinking and delivery of plans
Helps ensure cohesive information as it relates to store-level marketing across all marketing channels (i.e….are we communicating the same “offers”, using aligned creative assets, across all marketing channels to help support the strategy?
Creates, guides, delivers strategic social planning and programming (social content, strategy/communication plans, social marketing/experiences, programming plans, competition and category research, social consumer insights/trend audits)
Responsible for ensuring agency and supporting team delivers on agreed social KPIs and goals for each store
First point of contact for the GMs in answering questions about our social media, CRM, and digital strategy and approach and plans as they are executed at the store level, collaborating and communicating closely with Sonic channel managers
Ensure content/messaging across all channel platforms is on brand, optimized for best creative approach and that the brand voice and content addresses the ethos of each social platform
Tracks delivery of social-content publishing schedule; collaborates with local-marketing team to ensure social is integrated with on-site dealership marketing activities
Activate local marketing events, by ensuring social assets are captures and published on time and to right platforms
Help ensure that local marketing social/digital/CRM efforts are pitched to the local media to drive incremental visibility for store marketing
Creates, operationalizes and manages campaigns and content plans
Displays excellent project management, problem solving, interpersonal skills presentation skills
Reviews and Reports on total campaign effectiveness to internal channel owners to help support optimizing of best practice strategies across all channels. Works with channel marketers and agencies to obtain performance data to support this process.
Qualifications

Education
BA/BS in Liberal Arts, Journalism, Communications, Marketing, Advertising, Digital, Public Relations; advanced degree preferred

Required Primary Experience

The winning candidate will possess a combination of skills and experiences in social media, digital, mobile, local-community event & sponsorship marketing, SEO/SEM, CRM, public relations and project management.
3-5 years of experience dedicated to social media and/or digital media focused on top-tier consumer brand marketing or retail brand
Experience in customer communications role (i.e…email marketing, direct mail marketing, or live call marketing)
Experience within the retail automotive industry required
Demonstrated experience in building relationships with regional retail marketing leaders, General Managers and/or store personnel
Experience evaluating marketing performance and consulting on optimization plans
Demonstrated experience building marketing plans and executing marketing plans.
Additional Skills
Knowledge of functionality of social platforms (paid products, targeting capabilities, insights tools, PowerEditor, Google Analytics, etc.).
Knowledge of functionality of digital content strategy and website conversion tracking tools.
Experience planning and executing digital programming that supports key areas of brand outreach – ranging from influencer programs, to paid media programming, to CRM and support of offline retail & sponsorship marketing activities.
Has functioned in a project management of digital marketing – ensuring delivery of activations on time and within budget, managing the agency partners and other internal/store-level teams.
Has demonstrated advanced knowledge of social platforms, web platforms, specific rules of engagement for brand/advertisers, general platform policies.
Has exhibited thorough understanding of digital marketing practices (e.g. mobile, social platforms/APIs, third party listening, publishing and vendor-specific toolsets).
Has come to understand web-build processes and has familiarity with SEO, advanced knowledge of social CMS tools, social listening, social APIs, social vendors, mobile technologies
Has demonstrated fluency with research/organic search techniques/methodologies and application supporting development execution/optimization of brand campaigns.
Has functioned in a project management role, managing deliverables against social strategies.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Description
This position will remain open until filled. The start date for this position is uncertain at this time.
The college utilizes an electronic eReference feature which emails your references a secure link upon submission of your application.*
About the College:
Olympic College is a public two-year community college accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities that educates more than 11,000 students a year. The College is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and encourages applications from women, people of color, individuals with disabilities and veterans. Olympic College is located on the scenic Kitsap Peninsula across the Puget Sound from the city of Seattle. Kitsap is surrounded by 236 miles of saltwater shoreline and centrally located between the Olympic and Cascade Mountain ranges, affording spectacular views of mountains and water from every vantage point.

About the Position:
Olympic College is recruiting to fill a full-time temporary Events Coordinator position. This position will work closely with the OC Foundation, Communications Department, Facilities Services, Campus Safety, Instruction and Instructional Divisions, the Theatre Technical Director, and program faculty. The Events Coordinator will be responsible for scheduling and managing all programs and events on the Bremerton campus. They will also be responsible for developing related policies and procedures regarding community use of Olympic College facilities. The Events Coordinator will be responsible for a diverse range of activities such as musical productions, art gallery functions, special events, speakers, etc. The Events Coordinator will ensure respectful and appropriate use of Olympic College facilities as well as smooth and efficient organization, preparation, and guidance for events held on campus. Essential Functions
Collaborate with Communications Department when booking events or programs in the William Harvey Theater and/or other campus spaces.
Coordinate rental/usage agreements in addition to managing contracts for use of theater/specified college building spaces with community members and the college.
Act as a liaison for technical needs of groups using the space.
Develop and implement a comprehensive outreach and recruitment plan for theater.
Maintain current information on the theater and program websites.
Collaborate with college, division faculty, OC Foundation, and others in the planning and preparation for events.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, contractors, volunteers, sponsors, media, and the public.
May supervise hourly or student personnel.
Perform other related duties as required and/or assigned.
Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree from a regionally accredited college or university.
Intermediate computer skills including use of Microsoft Office applications.
Experience in event coordination and/or project management.
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of venue management practices and techniques.
Equivalent combinations of education & experience that demonstrate the ability to perform the essential functions of the position may be considered.

Successful applicants will be able to:
Demonstrate success working with individuals and groups representing a diverse cultural, geographic, and socioeconomic backgrounds.
Collaborate with colleagues and staff to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Demonstrate project management skills necessary for the position.
Demonstrate planning and organizational skills.
Be flexible and adaptable.
Have excellent time management skills.
Be a good listener and problem solver.
Exhibit initiative and possess excellent negotiation skills.
Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrate tact and civility in professional communications.
Demonstrate an understanding of and commitment to the Olympic College mission and values.
Experience working with internal and external constituents.
Ability to maintain a flexible working schedule to accommodate programing at different times, including evenings and weekends.
Additional Information

Terms of Employment:
This is a temporary, benefits eligible, full-time position with a flexible weekly schedule to accommodate the need for some evening and/or weekend hours in support of events.
Olympic College provides an excellent benefits package which includes vacation, holiday & sick leave, medical/dental/vision/life insurance.

Conditions of Employment:
Successful completion of a criminal history background check.
Application Procedures:
To be considered for this position a candidate must apply online through the Olympic College website and submit the following required materials:
Olympic College Online Application
Resume
Cover Letter
Unofficial college transcripts. Official transcripts and copies of mandated certifications will be required of the successful candidate.
As part of the E-Reference feature, applicants will be required to provide contact information for at least three (3) references. The references will be contacted via email at the time of application with a secure link to submit a reference. These references will remain linked to the application. Duplicate applications will result in duplicate requests to your references.
All application materials become the property of Olympic College.

For technical support, contact NEOGOV at 855-524-5627 between 6am and 6pm Pacific Time, Monday-Friday.

Corrected or extended notices for this recruitment will be posted in the Human Resource Office and the Olympic College web site.

Company & Property Description

Whether traveling on a ski trip to Aspen or taking a romantic escape in Santorini for a special anniversary, it is the simple things that are most important to the guests of Auberge Resorts Collection. At Auberge, we offer the opportunity to create personal memories and stories; tasting freshly picked fruit in Cabo San Lucas, horseback riding with a local cowboy in Costa Rica, or planting coral gardens in the South Pacific. People who know us, choose to return for shared experiences that connect them to local cultures and which will be forever embedded in their soul.

Role Summary

Join our team as the Catering and Events Manager for Bishop's Lodge, serving the needs of the business, our guests, and our colleagues by overseeing the planning, execution and service of Catering & Event functions, working as a liaison to client and hotel to create unique and memorable experiences for our guests.

Core Responsibilities

Please note that this is not an exhaustive list of everything that needs to be done! Within the Auberge family, our people always find new ways to look after the business, their guests, and their team-mates. Within this, the key responsibilities for this position are:
Create Menu and Event Proposals, Contracts, Banquet Event Orders, Catering Resumes, and Daily Events Report
Actively prospect and solicit, develop, and maintain social catering accounts through telephone, personal sales calls, on-site entertainment, entertainment, FAM trips, trade shows, etc.
Finalize the requirements of catering and group events while maximizing revenue potential through up-selling and ensuring effective communication both written (Resumes, BEO, Daily Reports) and personal contact with all departments for the success of the event. Prepare for and lead weekly BEO and Resume review meetings.
Supervise the execution of banquet events and corporate events at Bishop's Lodge. Review all function space with the event team. Ensure the satisfaction of the client at the outset of all events.
Find solutions to the inevitable challenges and glitches that arise while groups are on the property and keep the Executive Committee promptly and fully informed of all problems or unusual matters so prompt corrective action can be taken where appropriate.
Maintain knowledge of hotel facilities, capacities, and dimensions of meeting space and basic operational needs of all operating departments.
Make timely and impromptu decisions, which balance the client's needs with the financial, safety, and staffing goals of the hotel.
Identify new markets and business opportunities to increase sales.
Exhibit a professional demeanor through appearance and by maintaining a positive attitude toward all team members and guests.

Develop strong relationships with on property front office team and food & beverage and culinary team to ensure working in unity and always striving to achieve the same goals.
Assess additional training needs based on data gathered and interaction with the sales team from property visits.
Develop relationships within the community to strengthen and expand the customer base for sales opportunities.
Required Qualifications
High School Graduate
Proven success in a similar role, prefer 4 years of Catering, Event & Wedding experience in a luxury market.
Experience in hotels/resorts or event planning is required.

Weekends are mandatory when events are on the property. Also, when social function site inspections will need to be conducted over weekend periods.
What Else?

At Auberge, we are passionate about our mission to be the best-loved operator of one-of-a-kind luxury properties and experiences. We are storytellers and story-makers, delivering simple pleasures and creating indelible memories. Born in Napa and inspired by the most relaxing places in the world, we prize simplicity, comfort, and beauty. Whatever role we play in Auberge, and wherever we reside and work, we all live by the view that our core purpose is to enrich people's lives.

If that philosophy resonates with you and you feel that our approach is aligned with your own passions and beliefs, then please talk to us about becoming part of our family.

DIGITAL MARKETING
MANAGER
WILMINGTON, NORTH CAROLINA | FULL TIME

Job Description:

The Digital Marketing Manager will develop/execute HALF UNITED's marketing and social strategies and manage the brand's consumer-facing messages. This role is responsible for speaking to our global customer base and engaging them with our brand to drive sales.

Our ideal candidate will have a track record of success with growth marketing initiatives across all digital channels and owning a P&L. S/he has a creative eye understands our brand aesthetic and can articulate it through creative assets.

This position reports into the COO

Key Results Areas

1. Increase website traffic and conversion. Plan and execute all acquisition/prospecting efforts including affiliate management, paid search, 1:1 marketing (email, SMS). Report weekly results with recommendations on spend/strategy changes.

2. Partner with Founder and Content Manager on the development of creative assets each season to ensur wholesale’s requirements are met

3. Own and manage a seasonal and annual marketing calendar; partner with design, planning and creative to ensure that messaging, promotions and CTAs are in line with financial plans and design direction

4. Improve customer retention and cross-category spending through the development of a VIP customer program

5. Oversee website merchandising to ensure product presentation, product descriptions and customer user experience meets brand standards

6. Stay ahead of the competition by contributing innovative and creative ideas to engage the customer and elevate the brand. Partner with COO on constantly researching and vetting new technology platforms.

7. Lead, manage and develop the marketing team

Responsibilities
Driving traffic and sales on HALFUNITED.com; increasing customer lifetime value (CLV)
Sets targets on key KPIs - traffic, conversion, engagement; and partners cross-functionally with planning, sales, graphic design to execute marketing strategies to meet those targets.
Reports weekly to CEO and COO on productivity of marketing spend by channel
Ensures all communications and social media channels reflect the brand's tone and properly leverages seasonal creative assets
Innovates new ways of connecting customers to HALF UNITED through collaborations, partnerships and unique/high-impact events
Owns the customer experience - from the first visit to our website - to receiving a package; plans and executes strategies to improve the experience
Partners with PR agency on all press and marketing initiatives; owns weekly meeting and follow-up action
Partners with wholesale sales to plan and provide proper creative assets every season
Able to articulate the brand through presentations/decks, press releases and digital messaging
Key qualifications

1. Digital Platform Knowledge. Expert level understanding of FB Ads Manager, Pepperjam,
Google Analytics with proven trackrecord of driving customer acquisition and e-commerce sales.

2. Analytical and reporting prowess. Able to analyze multiple sources of data, present key insights and provide actionable recommendations.

3. Creative mindset. Understands brand aesthetic and can evolve our story-telling to the customer through visuals and experiential marketing. Experience working with digital media agencies a plus.

4. Executive level presentation skills. Creates clear, concise and influential presentations that articulate key ideas. Excellent written and verbal skills. Comfortable presenting to a large audience.

5. Strong business mindset. Owns the marketing budget and can calculate ROI by channel.
Able to collaborate cross-functionally with planning and finance.

Additional requirements:
Minimum 5+ experience in digital marketing, including in-house at an e-commerce company
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, communications, or related field required;
MBA/graduate degree a plus
Passionate about cultural marketing trends
Sense of urgency and an ability to prioritize
Able to work productively in an entrepreneurial environment and across multiple departments (Design, Planning, Sales, Finance)
Able to think strategically and solve problems
Experience managing and developing a team

fashion : 5 years (Preferred)

Company Description
Who is Opus?

We are a collective of innovative minds who are always looking to be on top of market changes. We use research-based, experiential marketing to create brand-awareness, consumer loyalty, as well as produce customized campaigns that boost acquisitions, while our clients focus on their core expertise.

Our Vision:

Our goal and vision is to elicit return business for our clients, growth for our company, and professional advancement for our team by embracing the creativity and teamwork necessary to help clients branch out into new markets.

All of this is possible with Opus due to the development of expert marketing managers who are efficient with clients and consumer acquisitions, and who build long-lasting relationships, which result in growth for our clients.

Opus is an in-store marketing company that represents leaders in home entertainment, inside some of the largest retailers in the world.

Likewise, we are passionate about delivering quality and results, for both our customers and clients.

We value teamwork within our agency and strive for great partnerships across all platforms.

About Us
At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers trillions of requests per month. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare have all web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was recognized by the World Economic Forum as a Technology Pioneer and named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list.
We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!
What you'll do
The America's Field Marketing and Events Manager will be an innovative leader who will define and execute a wide variety of events, designed to drive pipeline generation and won-business. This includes sponsored trade shows, Cloudflare hosted roadshows, lunch and learns, and CXO dinners. You will have the opportunity to lead a very talented team and to continue to build and grow the team throughout the year. This is a key leadership role on the Cloudflare's fast-growing marketing team.
Other responsibilities will include:
Create the America's field marketing and events strategy, manage budgets, and drive our pipeline and revenue goals in each sub-region.
Manage and grow a high performing team and effectively hire, recruit, and develop top-talent.
Build a team of field and event marketers who can drive innovative and impactful programs to achieve our goals.
Partner with the sales leaders to drive a highly productive and tightly aligned field marketing plan.
Identify the most successful field marketing campaigns and events and ensure best practices are shared across teams.
Operationalizes team processes and lead generation, and collaborates with cross-functional team members.
Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
8-10 years of experience leading events and field marketing functions.
5+ years experience managing a high-performing team.
Experience leading events and field marketing for a SaaS or technology company.
Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.
Ability to effectively influence both internal and external stakeholders across all levels of
the organization.
Willingness and ability to travel (~25%).
Experience managing vendors and negotiating contracts.
Agency, sponsorship, and budget management experience.
Ability to manage ambiguity and navigate unforeseen obstacles gracefully.
Results oriented with experience using qualitative and quantitative metrics with a focus on revenue, conversion, sales, and other marketing goals.
What Makes Cloudflare Special?
We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.
Project Galileo: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.
Project Athenian: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.
Path Forward Partnership: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.
: We released to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy policy and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.
Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!
Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.

If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

Summer 2020 (June - August) Digital Design Internship

Are you a hyper creative design student, interested in brand pop-ups, interactive digital experiences, consumer events and mobile tours? Ever wondered who is creating one-of-a-kind experiential events? Then, TH Experiential is looking for people like you! We are seeking hardworking, creative individuals who have a strong eye for digital design and a possess a genuine interest in Events + Marketing. This is a multi-faceted opportunity where you will work closely with our Design and Creative Strategy teams, as well as the rest of our company to help bring our events to life. Looking for enthusiastic candidates who are available to start in early June 2020.

A little bit about TH

Here at TH Experiential, we offer full service experiential live and digital event production based in New York City. We specialize in developing non-traditional, custom campaigns based on the objectives of our clients. How do we do it? Through advocacy building campaign concepts, and a holistic 360-degree approach in everything we do. From large-scale activations to events, mobile tours, installations and sampling-driving consumer engagement and brand loyalty is at the heart of everything we produce.

The goal at TH is to be the ultimate resource for our clients, providing insight, ideation and superior execution while creating authentically shareable experiences that position brands as innovators in their respective fields.

www.THExperiential.com

What you'll be doing
Combine your creativity and technical skills to produce digital graphics and animations for virtual event concepts
Creating 2D and/or 3D Graphics
Concepting and implementing interactive design
Work with artists and illustrators in the conceptualization phase to produce mock-ups and proof of concepts
Assist in the production of wireframes, prototypes, concept sketches, interaction designs and user flows using key tools such as Omnigraffle and Microsoft Visio
Help to create clean and simple user-centred designs
Create prototypes and wireframes
Intern alongside the creative team to design and create graphics, environments and experiences
Contributing to creative brainstorms to develop and deliver amazing experiences
Learn about the entire production process and how they're implemented
Participate in awesome, one of a kind events
Work alongside industry professionals
We are looking for individuals who have:
Immediate availability for at least 4-5 days per week
Creative design thinking and a user-centric mindset
Understanding of interaction design principles
Knowledge of industry tools such as Sketch, InVision, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Zeplin and OmniGraffle; proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite strongly preferred
Business know-how: Understanding of business metrics and the ability to translate company goals and objectives into digital experiences
An interest in Graphic and Environmental Design and Experiential Activations
A desire to meet and achieve goals in a resourceful independent manner
Ability to build relationships with senior level professionals
Ability to work hands on and assist where needed
Must have clear and concise communication skills
An interest in event production / experiential marketing
The ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
Effective problem solving, time management and organization skills
Intellectual curiosity
Relevant work and/or internship experience are a plus
3D design or experience with interactive technologies is a plus
What can TH Experiential offer you?
An opportunity to learn from the best what the industry has to offer with the potential for a full-time position after the internship is over
Mentoring program under talented & seasoned Operations, Design Team, + Production professionals
Daily lunch reimbursement and a monthly unlimited MetroCard (must intern at least 3 days per week to receive MetroCard)
Participate in culture events at the office including field trips to relevant design/art events
A dog-friendly workplace
Please note that this is an unpaid opportunity.

Amazon Web Services is seeking a talented Event Marketing Manager with the drive and enthusiasm to manage the execution of live events in the Americas. This is a unique opportunity to play a key, visible role in an exciting, fast-growing business.

The Event Marketing Manager is a critical role in the Americas Field Marketing team. The ideal candidate has a deep passion for events. They will have a hands-on approach with their event management style, will work closely with our Field Marketing team and Sales team to plan and execute events at the highest level. They will also continuously raise the bar on content and the customer experience with the goal of educating existing customers.

The ideal candidate will be self-directed and have a proven track record of building and executing events of all sizes, from round table executive meetings to large-scale events.

Key Responsibilities:
Strong ability to execute events while seeking the right programmatic approach to scale
Align event activities with business priorities across stakeholder groups, including interfacing directly with sales leadership and sales teams
Manage the event agency relationship and build processes for repeatable and scalable event activities
Execute events with operational and logistical excellence
Manage the content, speaker selection, agenda, and overall event experience with a customer obsessed mindset
Quantify business results of all activities with data-driven analysis
Manage all event budgets
Willingness to travel up to 60%
Basic Qualifications
Minimum 5 years of events marketing experience in a technology environment
Demonstrated success delivering on live event programs that align to the customer journey and field sales goals
Experience interfacing directly with sales stakeholders
History of agency management pre and post event as well as onsite

Build the solution that transforms the real estate industry!


Want to infuse a $25B sector of the insurance and real estate industry with predictive analytics and a tech-forward customer experience? Yearning for a startup culture within a profitable nationwide company? Join States Title and send an entirely new type of real estate model into the wild.

About Us


States Title is a top 10 title and escrow provider, and through its family of companies - NATC & NATIC - is able to impact 90% of real estate transactions in the US. States Title is intelligently transforming closings by applying machine intelligence to the age-old processes and procedures in the $25B Title and Settlement industry. Making residential real estate simple and efficient, and allowing lenders to close more loans, faster, and at a lower cost.

About The Role


States Title is now seeking a Digital Events Manager will be responsible for leading, creating and delivering our integrated events strategy, for all online and in-person events. Responsible for driving growth and adoption efforts as the States Title solutions footprint capabilities increase. This role reports to the VP Marketing.

Responsibilities
Develop and implement an overarching integrated event strategy to leverage to drive demand generation efforts for States Title.
Establish a KPI dashboard to track ROI on events results and share reporting with analysis on a frequent regular basis.
Build an engaged following for States Title webinar and podcast content.
Own the strategy, execution playbook, calendar, and execution of the States events channel.
Create and moderate weekly webinars for different audiences at different stages in the funnel.
Manage coordination, logistics, and execution of the company's presence at national industry events.
Coordinate with the Marketing and Brand & External Comms teams to ensure brand consistency and create engaging video, copy and photography assets.
Manage event vendors, budgets, and administrative logistics.
Serve as the in-house subject matter expert on event trends with a practical lens on how those trends can be best leveraged by states title.
Collaborate with teams across the organization to source speakers and content for webinars that would be subject matter experts that can pull a high volume of attendees.
Collaborate with the marketing team to create pre-webinar promotions, post-webinar follow-ups, and nurtures.
Report out on the effectiveness and make recommendations for continuous improvement.
Develop a deep understanding of our personas, verticals, and solutions to develop webinar plans that resonate.
Stay abreast of competitors' developments and tactics as they relate to event marketing.
Staying informed and ahead of event trends and emerging technologies and creating strategic, data-driven recommendations for pursuing or bypassing trend.
Outcomes of success


You will be measured by your ability to:
Successful delivery of on time and on budget projects/tasks pertaining to the campaign roadmap.
Ability to continually optimize content to exceed KPIs.
Delivery to defined KPI's, consisting of MQL's, MQA's and Engagement metrics.
Skills & Experience
3+ years of experience in hands-on managing and optimizing online and in-person events for B2B products.
Comfortable delivering live events and familiar with LinkedIn and Facebook live events
Highly effective webinar/experiential marketing coordination and production skills (examples of past work will be required)
Working knowledge of personas, audience segmentation.
Ability to write compelling on-brand content
Competence with tools like Marketo, Salesforce, and Zoom Webinar.
Skills within relationship management, negotiation, budget, and financial tracking are vital
Demonstrated experience managing the coordination, logistics, and execution of corporate events.
Experience sourcing and building a network of influencers and speakers
Strong analysis, strategic thinking, creative thinking, team leadership, planning, organizing, problem-solving skills, and a passion for using data, insights, and trends to understand customer behavior.
Marketing Innovation: Ability to identify and develop innovative ideas in order to create a proprietary advantage.
Ability to value collaboration with - and inclusion of - a diverse team of both technical and non-technical colleagues.
Comfortable working with a remote team.
Bonus Skills & Experience
Omnichannel experience and proficiency in other digital channels
Experience in fintech, insuretech or real estate
Experience in either content management, communications, or social media
Knowledge of regulatory considerations (e.g. RESPA or TILA) specific to title insurance

Job Title: Chattahoochee Main Street Outreach and Events Coordinator
Job Description:
Chattahoochee Main Street Outreach and Events Coordinator

Chattahoochee Main Street is working to create a thriving Main Street District as the community rebounds from the devastation caused by 2018's category 5 Hurricane Michael. The goal of the program is to establish communications systems with the residents that will improve the effectiveness and viability of the local Main Street businesses. Through regular event planning and promotion, citizens will be better engaged which will foster a more cohesive community as it recovers from the devastation caused by Hurricane Michael.
Further help on this page can be found by
clicking here.

Member Duties : VISTA will develop and implement an outreach and communications system for the residents of Chattahoochee, FL. Additionally, a public relations campaign will be designed and managed to promote the mission of the Main Street project, including local media interviews and social media postings. VISTA will maintain an inventory system of local downtown businesses and promote opportunities for business expansion. Finally, quarterly local events will be re-established, including all planning and promotion with the goal of generating funds for the Main Street District.

PAS Global seeks an experienced senior regional field marketing manager to join our high-growth marketing team. Reporting directly to the CMO, this role will be responsible for regional marketing strategy in partnership with sales leadership and execution of in-region marketing events and activities. The role will also partner closely with other marketing team members to execute digital campaigns in support of regional objectives. The ideal candidate has 5+ years’ experience leading an international field marketing team or leading field marketing for a major region in a B2B software business.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Partner closely with sales leadership to define marketing objectives in line with bookings and pipeline targets
Play a lead role in marketing campaign planning efforts to represent regional needs, objectives, and priorities
Develop and maintain global events calendar in partnership with senior sales and marketing leadership
Ensure high-quality, high-impact execution of in-region marketing events by team members (from abstract and/or contract submission to post-event lead management)
Ensure campaigns are set up properly in marketing automation and CRM systems
Track regional marketing results accurately and timely
Support the execution of regional digital marketing activities (e.g. webinars, paid search/advertising, content syndication) as part of global campaign plans
Regularly update sales leadership on marketing planning activities and results, providing a focal point for bi-directional, continuous communication between marketing and sales teams
Act as a key ‘voice of the market’ within the marketing team to communicate regional business drivers and messaging priorities
Support reference and case study development and collaborate with sales to identify potential new references
Manage regional marketing budget and forecast; ensure actuals are within budget
REQUIREMENTS:
5 years’ experience leading an international field marketing team (preferred) or leading a major region’s field marketing efforts in a growth focused B2B software business
Strong written and verbal communication skills
High attention to detail
Strategic thinking balanced with “get it done” attitude
Proven ability to execute through influencing others
Strong experience with MS Office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel
Bachelor’s degree in marketing or other business field, MBA a plus
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time
LOCATION:
Houston or Austin, TX

Job Title: AR/VR Regional Channel Marketing Manager, US & Canada
Job Description:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.AR/VR is looking for an experienced, business minded and highly talented marketer to drive awareness, trial, and new customer acquisitions programs for AR/VR products in US market. The AR/VR team is developing the future of virtual reality and bringing products to consumers that transform entertainment and social experiences. In this role, the Channel Marketing Manager will partner with sales to drive best-in-class in-store experiences, effective channel online marketing and on the ground events that drive new customer acquisition.

Responsibilities:

Develop the go-to-market programs for assigned accounts regions to optimize awareness, trial and conversion
Define, manage and communicate quarterly integrated marketing plan
Create retail marketing programs to drive sales such as bundles, promotions and content offers
Develop business briefs to inform in-store and online merchandising vision and requirements for assigned accounts
Manage the performance of channel marketing programs and iterate to drive efficiencies
Review and approve brand execution of all assets in the channel to ensure on brand execution
Manage online and in store retail presence to create best in class consumer shopping experiences across territory
Partner with sales on account marketing opportunities and account negotiations on placements
Partner the sales teams to build effective retail partnerships and support them with operational needs around retail programs
Influence and product position by providing regional briefs with local insights and data to product marketing teams
Travel 50%
Mininum Qualifications:

8+ years experience in consumer marketing
Experience selling consumer goods within both online and retail with experience of the leading Carriers and CE
Experience building presentations
Experience in project management
Experience prioritizing plan, and execute projects
Preferred Qualifications:

Comfortable working in start-up like environment

FIELD MARKETING MANAGER

Company Overview:

Metrasens is the world’s leading provider of advanced magnetic detection technologies. Our innovative products are designed to address deficiencies in conventional screening methods, to make us all safer and more secure. Our mission is to take great science from the laboratory and use it to create revolutionary, award-winning products which meet the real needs of our customers.

Metrasens’ core technologies have an extremely wide range of potential applications. Our growth to date has been achieved through the ability of our team to clearly identify and prioritize the areas in which our technology can make the most significant impact, solving acute problems. We embody our technology in solutions that are easy to adopt and simple to use. Innovation is at the core of everything we do – from research and development, through to customer service and training. Metrasens products are already making a real impact in a range of sectors, from medical imaging departments to correctional facilities, and we’re just at the start of our journey.

Description:

The Field Marketing Manager is responsible for leading and executing marketing programs and campaigns, as well as managing the marketing relationship with the field sales teams. You will be responsible for aligning marketing goals with sales objectives and being accountable for delivering results against established budget requirements and key performance indicators. Key program areas include, but are not limited to tradeshows, content creation, email nurturing, social media management, appointment setting, and account-based marketing program management.

Roles & Responsibilities:

- Create and deliver the field marketing strategy to drive sales pipeline growth and acceleration, and ultimately revenue objectives.

- Manage components of the annual marketing budget and accurately forecast costs.

- Develop ideas and create content that is most impactful across the content lifecycle: top-of-funnel, middle-of-funnel and bottom-of-funnel.

- Manage lead nurturing programs ensuring alignment of field marketing with broader lead generation and account-based marketing programs

- Partner with field sales teams to develop region/product specific campaigns that complement broader marketing programs

- Work with field sales teams to ensure leads are being reviewed and acted on according to the lead management process.

- Manage social media channels and further develop Metrasens’ brand and content messaging

- Develop sales activation tools, including, but not limited to, sales presentations, collateral and digital sales solutions

- Efficiently manage trade shows including contracts, logistics, pre-show communications plans, on-site execution, and post-show communications plans

- Identify speaking and call for presentation opportunities associated with conferences

- Measure and report on pipeline growth and acceleration, campaign effectiveness, and ultimately ROI

Required Experience & Skills:

- Demonstrated experience in creating engaging content

- Vendor management experience, including work with external agencies

- Strong knowledge in working with CRM (Salesforce.com) and marketing automation (Pardot or other)

- Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects effectively

- Self-starter that is eager to succeed and grow

- Strong organizational and project management skills

- Able to work both independently as well as in collaboration with others as part of a team

- Must be able to originate marketing campaigns and show strong ideation skills

- Excellent communicator, both verbal and written

- Strong marketing analytics skills and data-driven

Education:

- Bachelors’ Degree in Marketing, Communications or related field

- 5-7 years of experience in high-tech B2B marketing

Travel:

- Up to 25%, with some international travel

Job Announcement Digital Advertising and Events Manager

United Way of King County's mission is to bring caring people together to give, volunteer, and take action to help people in need and solve our community's toughest challenges. Our culture fosters leadership, open communication, teamwork and collaboration, integrity, and, accountability.

We are currently seeking a Digital Advertising and Events Manager to join the Marketing Team.

This position helps United Way of King County connect with new donorsboth online and in person. Charged with creating the annual advertising plan and strategy to attract and convert new donors, this person executes all digital advertising and works closely with the social media specialist and creative team on content. They work with the affinity group marketing team to create and execute an annual event planfor both in person and virtual events. Position is accountable for budgetary preparation and compliance for assets of between $250-$400k.

United Way of King County is an equal employment opportunity employer and all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law. We strongly encourage people of color to apply.

The recruiting salary range is $73,500-76,500 DOE. This position is open until filled; first consideration will be given to applications received within two weeks of posting.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Creates and executes the annual digital advertising plan including remarketing, display and search ads on Googleas well as traditional media.
Manages the development and implementation of fundraising and organizational special events for United Way of King County, various major donor cultivation and recognition events, and ad hoc events that capitalize on United Way's community relationships.
Selects and procures sites for special events; promotes events and works to ensure that they support the overall communication strategy of the organization.
Negotiates and manages contracts with media organizations and event venue and vendors.
Communicates directly with volunteer leadership including campaign chairperson(s), Million Dollar Roundtable chairs, and/or deputies to coordinate events, and acts as a trusted liaison from United Way of King County.
Manages annual budget for advertising and events.
QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Communications, Marketing, Public relations or related field. At least five years' experience in marketing, media and event planning. Previous volunteer management experience strongly preferred. Awareness of latest marketing/sponsorship trends and best practices helpful.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Demonstrated success with paid digital ads, specifically Google Ad Words
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) and ability to communicate United Way's brand value
Proven project and events management skills with the ability to direct projects and people simultaneously
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills
Strong strategic and organizational skills
Demonstrated time management skills including ability to manage multiple events in an efficient and resourceful manner
Proven team player and collaborator
Demonstrated high level of accuracy and thoroughness
Proven negotiation skills
JOB CONDITIONS AND DEMANDS

Job encounters frequent new and varied work situations due to the cyclical nature of volunteer leadership and annual redesign and management of events. Job involves a moderate degree of complexity or difficulty due to management requirements of multiple tasks and time constraints. Position determines own practices and procedures and contributes to the development of new ideas and concepts. Position operates independently with minimal supervision. Job has responsibility for creation or innovation of new programs, methods, systems and procedures. Errors in work could impact United Way credibility and affect public relations.

Position works under constant time requirements/constraints in a hot/cold and noisy environment. Work requires attending evening meetings. Position requires occasional travel, the ability to work early mornings, late nights, and occasional weekends.

DISCLAIMER

This job position performs other assignments and performs other duties as deemed necessary by United Way of King County. The contents of this job description may change as deemed necessary by United Way of King County.

Interested in leading the acquisition for Amazon credit cards? We are looking for a Marketing Manager to lead acquisition efforts for the Amazon Prime Rewards Visa Card and the Amazon Store Card. The Amazon Payments Team is looking for a high performing marketer who thrives in a fast paced environment and enjoys testing and scaling advertising and marketing campaigns.

In this role, you will drive acquisition of Amazon Credit Cards. You will be responsible for building an annual plan, championing marketing initiatives to open up new and existing digital advertising channels for payments. Key channels you will focus on are Amazon.com, Search, digital ads, and influencer marketing. You will lead projects from end to end, partnering with a team of high caliber marketers, data science, design, and product managers across Amazon. The role requires creativity, you will build and execute customer focused messaging and advertising. You will define the right message, at the right time, to encourage customers to apply for a card. In parallel, you will pay special attention to regulatory and compliance requirements. You will be responsible for diving into the data and sharing the performance of your initiatives - course correcting and scaling to deliver results. You will share your acquisition and awareness results on an ongoing basis with senior leaders within Amazon and with our bank partners.


The ideal candidate will be an experienced marketing manager who can think strategically and execute flawlessly. To be successful youll need to be an effective thought leader and a strong communicator who can earn trust with key stakeholders across multiple teams. You will influence other teams, as you build business cases to open new channels for payment products. If you are organized, analytical, and data driven, with an interest in independently owning your channel roadmap, this is a great role for you. We are seeking a detail-oriented marketer to open new marketing channels both on and off Amazon, and optimize the results by testing and learning.

Key Responsibilities
· Lead initiatives end to end, working with cross functional teams legal, finance, product, design, data science, and bank partners to optimize, execute and deliver campaigns,
· Work with internal partner teams such as Prime, Amazon Advertising, and devices, to open, learn and execute in new and existing marketing channels on Amazon.com.
· Create on-brand, best in class content, tailored to appropriate customers and effectively build acquisition campaigns for our credit products.
· Manage internal and external design and research agencies to create acquisition marketing campaigns and market research studies.
· Analyze the performance of campaigns, and share results of campaigns with senior leaders and stakeholders.
· Coordinate initiatives with key financials partners, working backwards to ensure a streamlined execution and approval process to launch initiatives.
· High attention to detail including precise and effective customer communications and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelors degree or equivalent relevant work experience.
+4 year brand or consumer marketing experience.
+4 years of marketing experience in a digital environment.


Preferred Qualifications

Excellent verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and share test results with stakeholders.
-Ability to organize, plan, prioritize, and meet deadlines through process improvements and communication practices.
- Ability to manage multiple competing priorities.
- Amazon is an equal opportunity employer
