Marketing Mix & Attribution Modeling Lead


Job Description :

Marketing leads the development of integrated marketing strategies across 90 plus business lines and national geography. The group is responsible for brand strategy and advertising, database and experiential marketing including, integrated program and product development, market research and related customer analytics, and diverse segments strategy and business development.

The newly formed Marketing Insights & Analytics team will build a best-in class decision support organization that can provide insights to inform our business/customer marketing and product strategy, as well as our broader strategic initiatives. Marketing Measurement is a critical team within the Marketing Insights & Analytics team that is responsible for understanding the performance of marketing campaigns in online and offline channels. In addition, the team is responsible for analyzing and establishing the cumulative impact of all marketing in both the short-term and long-term.

The role of Marketing Mix & Attribution Modeling Lead is a highly quantitative role with responsibilities including:

•Build, maintain and evolve market level mix models to estimate causal impacts of marketing activities on financial outcomes in the short and long term

•Build, maintain and evolve customer level attribution models to explain longitudinal behavioral shifts associated with exposure to a varying combination of touch point exposures

•Measure the long-term impacts on customer behavior

•Automate input ETL, iterative solution search and operationalization of models

This person will have significant interactions with other analytics teams in Marketing Insights & Analytics and is expected to provide analytical thought leadership and bring cutting edge statistical knowledge to solve complex marketing problems. Deep technical skills, ability to continuously learn from industry and academic work, and strong communication skills will be determining factors in selection.

A successful applicant will demonstrate:

•Ability to deliver critical insights and analysis

•Collaborative partnership and strong influencing skills

•Ability to extract insights to identify growth opportunities and effectively communicate outcomes and recommendations

•Lead effective data analysis that may suggest risk or opportunities

•Partnership/collaboration with marketing business partners and other enterprise teams

Required Qualifications:

•8+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling or a Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling

Desired Qualifications:

•Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis

•Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy

•Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

Other Desired Qualifications:

•8+ years of experience in regression based modeling

•5+ hands-on experience programming marketing mix modeling solutions in SAS

•Expertise on hierarchical Bayesian and MCMC approaches

•Proven history of developing innovative, cutting-edge causal measurement capabilities across the range of marketing activities, including TV, print, radio, OOH, paid search, display, online video, owned media, sponsorships and promotions

•Significant experience coding and maintaining stand along SAS-based applications

•Deep knowledge of statistical areas such as ANOVA, Multiple Regression, Time-series Modeling, Principal Component Analyses, Decision Trees, Clustering, etc

•Experience programming in R, SQL, Python and GAMS

•Experience working in marketing/ customer analytics organizations

•Demonstrated ability to play a leadership role in large, complex analytical projects

•Strong sense of ownership, relentless curiosity, and self-driven approach to problem solving

•Consistent pattern of digging into the raw respondent data

•Exceptionally strong technical background

•Experience/ exposure to data and analytics in Banking and Financial Services industry

Salary : $ 120k- $160k

collaborating with external agencies and global influencer managers and stakeholders* Budgeting and forecasting a substantial annual budget, while constantly pushing for cost efficiency* Strong negotiation skills - run point on high profile celebrity and talent deals, while mentoring and growing a talented, ambitious team with a high volume deal pipeline* Demonstrated cross-functional leadership and collaboration: You will work closely with the creative, user acquisition, organic social, global brand, and executive leadership teams* Oversee the regular reporting of influencer activities and results to executive leadership and cross-functional teams, always ready to optimize for feedback and learnings in real-timeRequired experience, knowledge, and skills:* 10+ years experience in social media, influencer, marketing, and/or strategy roles* The rare "unicorn" blend of: 1) Hyper analytical, strategic, and able to measure the impact of influencer marketing activities to inform strategy and 2) Creative and charismatic firepower - love brainstorming, collaborating with different personalities, and constantly sharing new ideas and pushing innovation for influencer marketing* In-depth knowledge of influencer and social media trends, social and meme culture, and how a clearly defined brand can cut through* Solid understanding of the nuances of influencer deals among major established and emerging social media platforms (with a particular emphasis on Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube)* Promoting continual creative improvement and actively contributing to a culture of innovation, excellence and accountability* Passion for the Bumble brand, mission, and cultureAbout you:* An inspiring leader able to nurture, motivate, and advocate for a passionate, ambitious, growing influencer team* Take initiative in handling projects with minimal direction and proactively anticipating needs* High attention to detail* Self-starter: thrives on taking ownership of initiatives with limited oversight* Outstanding time-management and prioritization skills, with the ability to excel at multiple priorities under short deadlines* Unafraid to hustle, hustle, hustle and network, network, networkPlease apply by submitting your resume along with a cover letter explaining your potential impact on Bumble and why you're the ideal candidate for this role! As growth is one of our core values, the ideal candidate will be able to strategically make data-driven decisions to drive Bumble's success and growth.To learn more about life at the Bumble Hive, click here: https://thebeehive.bumble.com/careers/Applicants are expected to have current work authorization in the country that the role is located.ABOUT BUMBLEBumble, the women-first social networking platform, was founded by CEO Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014. With nearly 90 million users, Bumble connects people across dating, friendship and professional networking. No matter the type of relationship, women make the first move on Bumble. Bumble recognizes the importance of relationships and how crucial they are to a healthy, happy life. They've built their platform around kindness, respect, and equality - and their users play an important part in that. Bumble holds its users accountable for their actions and has zero tolerance for hate, aggression or bullying. Bumble is available in 150 countries. Since 2014, Bumble has facilitated over a billion women-led first moves and over fifteen billion messages sent. Bumble is free and available in the App Store and Google Play.

Additionally, the event coordinator will be in charge of generating his/her own leads and having a successful conversion rate. SUMMARY:

The Regional Marketing Manager will work to establish, strengthen and manage agency relationships on behalf of the company.Responsibilities include managing existing agency relationships and developing new ones, fostering relationships through in-person communication, working closely with the underwriting department due to the technical portfolio of business, and assisting with other projects as assigned

Job Description
Alphalete is actively seeking a motivated Advertising Trainee to work on groundbreaking campaigns with an advertising and marketing firm in the DFW region. This innovative firm was founded by dedicated people looking to push the envelope by using cost-effective marketing campaigns and advertising strategies. Their goal is to provide the same advertising as the standard firm but at a fraction of the price. As a progressive company in the sales and marketing industry, this firm continues to set the standard for excellence in customer acquisition and establishing a repeat customer base for clients. By providing personalized sales and marketing services to some of the largest retailers globally, this firm continues to increase the market shares of clients through proven sales and marketing strategies.

The Advertising Trainee position is a valued team member in the marketing and advertising department. The position is considered entry level to start during training which includes a comprehensive overview of basic marketing strategy, direct advertising, promotional techniques, visual merchandising, and consumer market research. After successful completion of the program, an individual would be considered a team leads in the marketing department. The Advertising Trainee reports directly to the Executive Marketing Manager.

Responsibilities:
Assisting in the daily growth and development of assigned campaigns
Assisting with efforts of customer acquisition and retention
Expertly manage the needs of external customers.
Developing strong leadership and interpersonal skills
Driving sales through retail promotional campaigns
Build brand recognition through local events and experiential marketing
Strategize, execute and manage with the Brand Ambassador teams
Interact and communicate with customers
The personalized focus of the campaigns is a refreshing alternative to more general mass sales and marketing strategies, but it is also responsible for the company's unprecedented growth and stability. The management team prides itself on recognizing top performance, integrity, and a winning mindset for continual internal promotions. If you possess a passion for marketing, sales, or retail and would enjoy learning how to manage the varying dimensions of a business, this position could be an excellent fit for the right candidate.
Must be able to work full-time hours and some weekends for special events.
Ability to excel in unsupervised solo assignments as well as team projects
Great communication skills
Must be able to work in an energetic, fast-paced environment.
Self-starter, creative thinker, problem solver
Why work here?
Full Training
Market Competitive Pay Structure: Weekly Bonuses and Incentives
Rapid upward mobility
Community involvement and Charitable opportunities
A fun, high energy work environment! No cubicles here, we work closely together as a team!
Apply today for immediate consideration!

Job Description:
Morrison Healthcare is a leading national food and nutrition services company exclusively dedicated to serving more than 600 hospitals and healthcare systems. Morrison's hospital kitchens, restaurants, and cafés feature socially responsible practices and exceptional guest experiences. The company's comprehensive Mindful Choices® wellness and sustainability platform includes the latest in healthful eating and an understanding of behavioral change in food consumption. Morrison's alignment with Partnership for a Healthier America's (PHA) Hospital Healthy Food Initiative positively impacts up to 41 million patients and 500 million hospital meals annually. Morrison has been named one of Modern Healthcare's "Top 100 Best Places to Work in Healthcare" for the past five years, and Training Magazine's Top 125 organizations for the past six consecutive years. The company is a division of Compass Group and has more than 1,200 registered dietitians, 300 executive chefs, and 17,000 professional food service team members.
Job Summary
Field Marketing Manager

This position travels 90% of the time.

The Field Marketing Manager (FMM) develops and implements marketing and visual merchandising. FMM employs key visual merchandising strategies through training and working with a team of retail and marketing counterparts to fully implement initiatives consistent with Morrison Marketing Retail Plans. The FMM also provides leadership and guidance for field operations This includes on-site support of retail openings and retail training initiatives. The Field Marketing Manager reports to the Senior Director of Retail with Morrison Healthcare.

New concepts and promotions
Regional Support
Attend and present Retail Marketing strategies at regional meetings.
Increase Retail Unit participation of Business Partner Promotions through the implementation My Marketing Plan and compliance reporting.
Support the development and implementation of culinary and marketing standards for all retail operations.
Administrative
Manage SG&A.
REQUIREMENTS
Five + years’ experience in restaurant marketing, merchandising and/or retail sales.
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, business or sales.
Consumer oriented with a proven marketing background.
Must have valid driver’s license.
Must be able to travel 90+%
Ability to lift a minimum of 40 lbs

Job Description:
Do you have a passion for making a difference in people’s lives?

AHRC New York City is a family governed organization committed to finding ways for people with intellectual and other developmental disabilities to build full lives as defined by each person and supported by dedicated families, staff, and community partners.

The Regional Marketing Manager (RMM), under the supervision of the Assistant Director and Director of Business Development will be responsible for (a) geographic region; regions are assigned by Director of EBS and/or Vice President of Business and Program Development. The primary objective of the RMM is to create jobs for the people EBS provides services to, to identify and to build a team of Account Executives who will bring jobs, promote our programs and/or stablish partnerships throughout the City with the goal of promoting and creating jobs for people we support.

The RMM will have specific performance goals to be met periodically; such goals will be provided by the assigned supervisor, at the minimum, the RMM must meet the contractual placements’ levels as outlined in addendum #1 under this Job Description. Addendum #1 is part of this job description. Addendum #1 will be reviewed and modified as needed based on the assessment of existing and newly procured contracts.

The RMM will actively work in promoting and creating vast network of business relationships with the objective of creating new employment opportunities, person centered employment for each person we support, and develop new business opportunities for our Affirmative Enterprise businesses.

As per Region assignment, the RMM will actively work in identifying and create JOBS for Experienced Hudson River Services’ employees– a list of candidates will be provided to the respective RMM in order for each manager to plan and to place individuals in new jobs.

This professional will receive periodical feedback from her/is immediate supervisor, at minimum a comprehensive 6 month performance review will take place and followed by an annual performance review. This role will be subject to close performance monitoring in order to ensure all goals and objectives of role are met such as placements and points.

The RMM is a senior management and supervisory position responsible for coordinating job development activities in an assigned region and overseeing Account Executives.

The RMM will be required to work a flexible or extended schedule from time to time. The RMM may be asked to assist other regions in the city or assist other departments when needed for cross-departmental projects and other assignments.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Oversee and supervise Marketing and Sales Region assigned
Develop employment opportunities for people supported as outlined in the Addendum #1 attached
Promote widespread, positive image/knowledge of AHRC’s Employment& Business Services.
Hire and supervise of Account Executives (AE)
Assess performance of Account Executives under direct supervision, train new marketing staff, and coordinate placement activity
Ensure excellent customer service to all customers
Actively participate in internal and external networking events
Actively organize networking events to develop linkages with potential employers and to promote AHRC brand
Develop and maintain marketing strategy targeting successful creation of jobs for people supported
Create and complete action plans targeting a specific line of business, employers, type of job, etc.
Develop valued relationships with businesses/ employers. Maintain and expand customer base
Provide best job matching for job seekers and employers
Ensure customized employment is a priority for the marketing team
Coordinate the day to day responsibilities of Account Executives
Ensure program placement goals are met for each program in region
At a minimum, the RMM will be required to bring new business, in the form of a service contract that provides employment to two or more people supported on a quarterly basis
Develop employment opportunities for existing NYSID workers in experienced porter positions. At a minimum, six employees will need to transition from NYSID contracts
Required to travel throughout the 5 boroughs and in and out of state as needed
Prepare and deliver marketing presentations as needed
Conduct other responsibilities as assigned
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s in Arts or Bachelor’s in Science, plus 2 years marketing/sales/related experience or Associate’s Degree with 5 years of experience, required
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Great motivational skills
Experience with people with disabilities/youth a plus
Ability to work collaboratively with senior EBS operations and program managers and to develop and maintain sites, disseminate information, and provide top quality customer service to all EBS customers.
NYS driver’s license preferred. Must have clear driving record
Annual Salary: $70K-$80K depending on experience and education.

Overview


Working with us is an opportunity that can pay off for years to come – with skills, knowledge, experiences and friends that can last a lifetime!

A Seasonal job with us can lead to a successful future. That’s because you will:
Develop resume-building skills to help achieve your career goals
Work in a welcoming and diverse environment
Gain knowledge through training programs and work experience
Assists in planning, organizing and overseeing numerous large Park events, festivals, promotions (both on-site and off-site) and meetings.

Responsibilities


You’ll Make a Difference:
Interact with our guests and make their day amazing through meaningful connections
Share your passion for creating a warm and welcoming environment with your team
Deliver fast and accurate service
Contribute to our exceptional track record for safety
Minimum Duties and Responsibilities:
Assists in the scheduling and coordination of large Park events, festivals, and promotions (both on-site and off-site)
Helps plan, organize and oversee numerous Season Passholder events throughout the season
Works closely with numerous radio and TV partners to coordinate broadcasts, live remotes, and promotions
Plans and oversees on-site meetings and promotions for all partners of Dorney Park. This includes Burger King, Dunkin’ Donuts, Subway, Wendy’s, etc
Collects and maintains reporting figures brought into the Park by promotions conducted by the Marketing Department (i.e. redemption tracking, etc.)
Writes complete operations memos for park-wide events. These are used and distributed to all Park Personnel for events
Enters data into database, as needed
Conducts exit surveys and mini surveys throughout the Park when necessary
Provides guest service according to Cedar Fair standards when serving the guest or working with subordinates, including initiating guest interactions, answering questions and giving directions.
Maintains cleanliness and safety in assigned work area and performs all duties in compliance with Cedar Fair Safety guidelines and requirements and reports all unsafe or unusual conditions to supervision.
Meets scheduling availability requirements, including nights, weekends, and holiday periods to meet business needs.
Meets Cedar Fair's attendance requirements as outlined in Cedar Fair's attendance policies.
Adheres to Cedar Fair's Rules of Conduct including specific costuming and grooming standards as outlined in Employee Guidelines and other park/division specific policies and procedures. Other duties may be assigned.
Qualifications


We’re looking for:
A genuine interest in making people feel welcome using your smile and positive nature
Keen to be a part of something you believe in, providing fun while having fun at work
Openness to learn, grow and develop skills
Commitment to your team by being on time and working scheduled shifts
Desire to be outdoors for extended periods in all weather conditions
Minimum Qualifications:
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English at a level sufficient to conduct employee meetings; provide detailed direction to staff, guests, and vendors; and write policies, procedures, reports and other business related documents and correspondence.
Ability to solve practical problems with minimal supervision and effectively deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists
Ability to organize and prioritize to meet deadlines

Additionally, the selected candidate must be charismatic and comfortable pitching to industry executives and will have a demonstrated ability to be creative and strategic, in order to launch effective partnerships and programs across various industries in the lifestyle brand, music, and tech spaces, thrive in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment, and able to connect the dots between brands and their audiences. Data Scientist- Leader


Data Scientist-Leader

We are looking for an experienced data scientist to lead the development of this analytical effort for the enterprise and deliver value to our customers by understanding them in ways that our traditional approaches have not been able to achieve. Responsibilities include:

•Development of an offer success measurement plan to include non-sales outcomes like customer satisfaction and engagement

•Creation of next-generation models that use both traditional and un-/semi-structured data to better predict customer needs and outcomes

•Partnership with the technology and sales teams to ensure alignment on deliverables/timelines/implementation

•Analytical management of small, pilot programs to test new offer ideas in targeted markets

•Integration with enterprise modeling efforts in partner organizations (Enterprise Data & Analytics/Risk/Finance) to ensure that the lead & offer optimization engine is cross-compatible with existing modeling frameworks

•Leadership of the data strategy around collection, structure and syndication of lead & offer data

•Mentoring junior staff on modeling techniques and providing guidance on analytical approaches

•Leading cross-functional and cross-LOB project teams

The group is responsible for brand strategy and advertising, database and experiential marketing integrated program and product development, market research and related customer analytics, and diverse segments strategy and business development.

Required Qualifications:

•10+ years of experience in analytics, modeling or a combination of both or a PhD in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 7+ years of experience in analytics, modeling, or a combination of both

Desired Qualifications:

•Ability to translate and present complex technical data across technical and non-technical groups

•Ability to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple priorities.

Other Desired Qualifications:

•Experience modeling non-traditional data (e.g. free-form text)

•Experience coding in R/Python and/or experience in big data environments (e.g. Hadoop/Aster)

•Experience with traditional data science techniques including machine learning (e.g. random forest, gradient boosting, neural networks).

Job Expectations:

•Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.

The Event Manager is responsible for increasing the exposure of the Bath Fitter brand and its market share by generating new leads for the Branch through malls, shows, and exhibits in a wide variety of venues to help the Branch meet or exceed their sales goals. To achieve these goals, the Event Manager will select, supervise and train regular show workers who will, with the Event Manager, constitute a separate operating unit within Bath Fitter that is dedicated to generating Bath Fitter customer leads. The Event Manager will have substantial discretion in making the decisions that will produce a maximum number of quality customer leads for Bath Fitter.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Generate quality leads by participating in events in order to meet or exceed set sales objectives.
Meet established goals for the cost of advertising related to Events.
Develop and update an events plan and budget.
Select, recruit and hire the equivalent of at least two full-time, qualified and permanent show workers.
Supervise and coach show workers according to guidelines and in compliance with Company policy and procedures.
Submit all required paperwork on time, including show applications, requests for checks, and show evaluation forms.
Collect, review and submit all staff time records for payroll in a timely manner.
Direct the set-up and tear down displays at shows or malls as needed.
Negotiate and obtain leases for Bath Fitter mall displays and store fronts.
Select and maintain inventory displays, making certain each display is kept clean, well-stocked and maintained to always represent the Company in the most professional manner.
Select mall leads and submit to the office at assigned intervals.
Ensure quality of cards received meet established guidelines (complete name, phone number, email address).
Research and develop new marketing venues and networking opportunities
Develop new and innovative approaches to the business.
Network with other vendors at show locations to develop new show locations and techniques
Attend and participate in regular branch and/or regional meetings and training sessions.
Always wear Bath Fitter uniform on the job, observing rules of good grooming and hygiene.
Abide by all Bath Fitter policies and procedures.
Adhere to all Bath Fitter safety policies and procedures.
Realize the Event Manager's role as the personal representative of Bath Fitter while in uniform and while driving a company vehicle and act accordingly.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Exercise broad supervision of its unit and be responsible, for the unit’s results.
All applicants must have a clean driving record, pass a background check, and pass a pre-employment drug screening.

Job Description
White Oak Communications is seeking a Publicist. The individual in this position should have 2-3 years of agency experience managing high level accounts in the food / wine / spirits industry, or in the real estate / travel / lifestyle industry.

Strong candidates will demonstrate experience in writing and editing, knowledge of their given industry, ability to research, ability to work independently and ability to stay on top of trends. We are looking for someone with natural charisma and excellent presentation skills, and who possesses a passion for Public Relations and the ever-evolving media landscape. You are comfortable dining with media at meals and hosting them at press events. Candidates should be able to manage accounts and comprehensively report up to a senior team member.

This position offers a competitive salary and benefits package, along with a unique opportunity to work and advance in a dynamic, growing agency.

Interested candidates may submit their cover letter, and resume.

Who You Are

You thrive in a fast-paced environment where decisions are made on the fly. You think for yourself and often do before being asked to do. You’re creative and witty, and we’d know one of your pitches if we saw it. You can produce on-brand, creative deliverables on a deadline.

You’re obsessed with hospitality & travel and have a rock-solid understanding of creating, promoting, and distributing shareable content across multiple platforms.

Have a demonstrated ability to write, pitch and get press placements, as well as work on a minimum 5 accounts.
Have a passion for writing pitches, press releases, and biographies, developing interesting press angles, and staying constantly abreast of the trends of the industry
Build & maintain strong relationships with high-level local, regional and national online, print and broadcast media contacts
Proofread and edit
Collaborate with and offer ideas to the events team and the social media team
Brainstorm creative ideas and strategies for campaigns building out media strategies for your clients
Compile & maintain media lists in order to pitch to various media outlets throughout the world
Secure media coverage for your clients to ensure their monthly goals are being met
Interface and liase with clients, handling their day to day communication and requests, working closely with the account supervisors and senior management
Track coverage and deliver weekly reports to clients
Qualifications:
2 years minimum agency experience
Must be a strong, creative writer
Must have strong local media connections, with a desire to build
Must have excellent phone demeanor
Must have excellent grammatical and proof reading skills
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills
Must be detail oriented
Must be able to handle a large volume of work
Must have excellent organizational skills
Must be able to handle multi-faceted projects with strong follow-through
Must know how to prioritize
Must have strong work ethic, and understand the non-traditional hours of agency life

Discovery Senior Living is a family of companies which includes: Discovery Management Group, Discovery Development Group, Discovery Design Concepts, Discovery Realty Group, Discovery Marketing Group, and Discovery At Home, a Medicare-certified home healthcare company. With almost three decades of experience, the award-winning management group has been developing, building, marketing, and operating upscale, luxury senior-living communities across the United States. With a flourishing portfolio of more than 9,500 existing home or homes under development, Discovery Senior Living has become a recognized industry leader in creating world-class, resort-style communities.

Discovery Senior Living is looking for a Recreation & Events Coordinator to join our community Discovery Village at Melbourne (US1 between Parkway & Post).

Assist in the development and oversight of resident activities.

Job Title: Senior Field Marketing Manager - AWS Training & Certification
Job Description:
Amazon is seeking a talented, self-directed marketing expert to generate awareness and increase adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) training and certification (T&C) offering in North America. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an exciting, fast growing training and certification business.

Job Responsibilities
· Develop and own the strategic marketing plan to drive demand for AWS Training & Certification services with new and existing customers, across all audiences and sales segments (SMB, Mid-Market and Enterprise).
· Primary business partner to North America Training Business Development (BD) teams, responsible for gathering requirements, developing and executing a cohesive field marketing strategy for defined training offerings.
· Develop comprehensive annual marketing strategy and plan that is aligned with T&C Americas BD, and AWS US and Canada Marketing. Marketing plan inclusive of digital marketing programs, campaigns and in-person and virtual events.
· Plan and deliver demand generation programs to acquire new customers and market to existing customers, including integrated campaigns, events, and digital marketing.
· Introduce new approaches to digital marketing and content syndication to elevate awareness around our content and messaging distribution.
· Work closely with the Americas Training BD team to understand their priorities and enable them to meet their objectives with focused lead gen activities.
· Participates as key stakeholder and business partner with the US and Canada Training Delivery Manager(s), product marketing and field marketing leadership regionally. This includes participating in business reviews, providing monthly and quarterly marketing updates, and providing ongoing updates to key stakeholders teams.

Basic Qualifications

· Minimum of 10 years experience in a high-tech B2B marketing role
· Demonstrated experience working with sales leadership and sales teams in driving pipeline and revenue.
· Bachelor Degree in marketing, economics, business, IT, engineering or related discipline
· Strong team player and leader with the ability to influence, work cross functionally, build relationships with key stakeholders and thrive highly collaborative fast paced environment
· Outstanding communications skills written and verbal
· Extremely well organized and detail oriented
· Deadline driven

Preferred Qualifications

· Proven track record of creating and executing integrated marketing campaigns using tactics that include digital advertising, lead nurture programs, live events, webinars, and social media
· Ability to work independently and autonomously
· Solid quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills - comfortable with data analysis and able to use data to make recommendations and drive decisions
· Expertise in managing and prioritizing multiple projects and has great attention to detail
· Not afraid to try new things driven to constantly improve results

Job Title: Senior Field Marketing Manager, Strategic Accounts
Job Description:
Experienced marketer sought to develop and execute bespoke outreach and engagement strategies for several Amazon Web Services (AWS) top customers.

In this role, you will plan and execute programs and campaigns to gain mind share, deepen relationships with influencers and key decision makers, and increase overall account engagement. You will utilize exceptional program management skills to direct and communicate on the programs you own, ensuring all stakeholders - sales, business development, marketing, agencies - are working together to deliver a high-quality experience for the customer.

The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated history of building and executing high-impact, data-driven marketing programs. They should be able to build foundational marketing mechanisms, while thinking big on behalf of their customer. They will have experience partnering closely with sales teams to deliver joint, in-account content and programs. They will have a broad understanding of channels and tactics used in the enterprise marketing space, and how they work together to form a measurable, integrated campaign (research, content and storytelling, offline events/direct mail, online email/webinars/paid media/social media). They will have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills, executive presence, as well as project and account management skills.

Strong preference that this role sits in San Francisco/Bay Area or Seattle. Open to remote near US AWS office. Relocation assistance within US available.

· 7+ years in marketing, with proven, measurable experience across a variety of disciplines: B2B, agency/consultancy, field, account-based, alliance, digital, event and/or industry marketing
· Experience in the enterprise technology and/or cloud space (players, trends, challenges, etc.)
· Familiarity with modern marketing platforms/tools, such as Marketo, SalesForce, social media channels, etc.

Preferred Qualifications

· Bachelors degree in marketing, business, communications, or relevant field of study
· Ability to measure marketing and sales success; ability to set targets and build a proactive plan to achieve them.
· Deep understanding of marketing metrics, and the analytical capabilities required to understand or interpret program success
· Solid professional writing skills
· Highly organized, data-driven and detail oriented.
· Thrives in a fast-paced environment with the ability to prioritize, pivot and problem-solve.
· Interested in building and processes from the ground up and comfortable in ambiguous environments.
· Superior oral and written communication skills with an innate attention to detail.
· A strong team player comfortable and motivated working in a collaborative environment.

Strong preference that this role sits in San Francisco/Bay Area or Seattle. Open to remote near US AWS office. Relocation assistance with US available.

“Here’s a job where you’ll create the stuff you actually want to see in your own feed.”

MMC is next-gen comms agency that uses influence and culture to catapult business and get the world talking. The creative department is looking for an agile Senior Copywriter - steeped in pop culture (partnered with a Senior Art Director) - who can bring the conceptual heat to every assignment. From shareable content series to opportunistic social campaigns to engaging experiences that make eyes bulge and jaws drop. You’ll work across a range of CPG and consumer clients who are demanding ideas that earn people’s attention and engagement because they’re just that amazing.

WE SHOULD TALK IF:
You fight against mediocrity in idea and execution
You’re a collaborative and strategically responsible boundary pusher who works quickly - at the speed of culture
You have 5+ years of experience in integrated campaign development, shareable content and experiential marketing
You’re a firm believer that it’s no longer about :30 TV spots and print ads
It’s a brand-new marketing world out there with traditional advertising on life-support. You see the massive potential for comms agencies to lead the way
The future is highly-shareable content, immersive experiential marketing, social media campaigns and thought-provoking digital experiences
You search for and find connections others miss
You’re on top of pop culture, trends and bleeding-edge ways to use social platforms
You find it perfectly acceptable to experiment often and aren’t afraid to push the limit
You’re a builder of ideas
You write up your ideas to sell and are engaging in presentations with clients
Collaboration with a diverse group of people and functions is not only fun, it leads to the best work
ABOUT US:

MMC leverages its PR heritage and today is a data-driven, 3.0 modern communications company that delivers scaled influence, cultural relevance and brand talkability to our Fortune 200 consumer and healthcare brands. Our goal is to do innovative work and drive business results for our clients. Innovators at heart, we love to build and challenge the status quo. That’s why The Holmes Report awarded us both 2018 Global Consumer Agency of the Year AND Campaign of the Year. For the entrepreneurially minded, working at MMC is an amazing opportunity to get people talking, thinking and behaving differently.

Our team is a deeply committed and somewhat quirky bunch of content creators, brand builders, growth hackers, storytellers, experientialists, artists, mad data scientists, tech junkies and trend sensors. All armed with powerful ideas and a strong point of view and drive to win. We’re relentlessly curious, always creating, innovating often, agile and responsive.

MMC is moving fast and we have doubled our business in the last 5 years. Can you keep up? If you fit our qualifications, we have a spot for you.

When applying, please include your portfolio link along with a tweet-length description of why you're the one we should hire.

THE COMPANY: OPENPATH SECURITY, INC. (www.openpath.com)

You know smart homes. Now think smart offices.

Founded in 2016 and launched onto the market in May 2018, Openpath combines sleek hardware with an app, enabling employees to enter the office using their smartphones and making office management easier than ever. This is a world-class team of proven startup veterans with multiple exits, top-notch technologists and NSA-level security experts leading the modernization of the workplace with a new industry-leading platform that streamline access while tightening security. Openpath allows employees to enter their work just by having their mobile device on hand providing a frictionless experience for the built environment.

We are always looking for smart and hard working people who are passionate about building and being part of a fast growing start-up.

Highlights…

Be part of a company “innovating the long-stagnant $6B access control industry.”
Led by proven serial entrepreneurs with a track record of scaling successful global enterprise technology companies.
Initial $7M round led by co-founders along with Sorenson Ventures, Bonfire Ventures, Pritzker Group Venture Capital, Fika Ventures and others.
Institutional round of $20M Series B led by Emergence Capital (the first institutional VC to fund Zoom).

THE OPPORTUNITY: Marketing Manager - Channel
We are seeking a creative and enthusiastic Marketing Manager - Channel to join our LA-based team. Reporting to the CMO this position will work cross-functionally to evangelize the Openpath brand within the channel partner ecosystem, which is largely made up of security system integrators, low voltage technicians, and access control installers. Openpath products are only sold via the Channel and you will be foundational in creating and executing Openpath’s Channel Marketing program. In conjunction with the Director of Channel Alliances & Partnerships this role will drive awareness leading to engagement and productivity reinforcing the highly disruptive nature of the Openpath frictionless access control solution.

What you’ll do & more...

Develop and execute a comprehensive channel marketing program in driving adoption and productivity to include (but not limited to) training, tool kits, educational materials, incentive plans.
Work on competitive and channel insights and related research
Account Management in segmenting and prioritizing accounts to drive long term success
Work within the Partner Portal to ensure it depicts Openpath clearly and effectively across training, sales collateral and other enablement tools
optimize user flow in partner portal, keep dashboard updated and dynamic
create separate dashboard, catering to various personas
increase utilization of co-marketing programs and materials
In partnership with the CRM team, create a comprehensive program for effective channel comms
Develop reports and insights for other key stakeholders demonstrating program efficacy
Create CRM campaigns and related channel communication programs
Collaborate with other marketing team members to take broad based programs into the channel utilizing paid, earned and owned media.

What skills and experience do you bring?

EDUCATION: Bachelor's Degree in either Marketing, Communications, or related discipline.
Experience + aptitude/attitude count more.
4 + years with channel and partner marketing preferably with the company/brand
A self starter who can own the program and build relationships across the channel spectrum for the greatest impact.
Ideally B2B experience combining software/hardware as a Cloud (SaaS) solution
Humility to admit mistakes, correct them, and move forward.
Experience in a fast-paced startup or brand highly preferred.
Experience with Salesforce/Hubspot is a plus
Solid communication skills that span writing, speaking, and presenting.
Versed across digital media platforms including email, website, social media, and more.
Ability to creatively problem solve, adapt to shifting projects and moving targets, and work highly collaboratively.
Time management skills and ability to juggle competing priorities with ease.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves, be additive when and where you can, and support team tasks to help out the company when necessary.

Position: Marketing Manager

Location: Madison, WI

Full-time/Part-time/Temporary: Full-time

Travel (%): 10%

International: No

Job Summary

Duties and responsibilities of the Marketing Manager – Kid Trax, include managing the brand’s strategic growth through developing and maintaining a consistent positive image for the brand both online and offline. Supporting and assisting the Director of Marketing in all activities related to the brand.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Brand Marketing Responsibilities (30%)
Assists Director of Marketing in building a 1-3 year marketing strategy that connects the passion points of our consumers with our brand, product, and corporate strategies and objectives.
Defines, plans, and launches annual and seasonal campaigns and priorities for the business.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of the brand, category, competitors, and consumers to ensure relevant insights to fuel all marketing elements.
Manages internal and external partners to support the activation of integrated marketing plans. Establishing strong partnerships and processes with our internal teams (Creative services, PR, Sales, Retail, Product, Legal, Customer Service, and Finance) to effectively execute marketing campaigns.
Tracks and manages brand business performance. Analyzes and reports key marketing metrics with a view to strengthening marketing plan / activities for the future.
Manages the Kid Trax marketing budget, spending efficiently to achieve our marketing goals.
Strategically assesses current activation of assets across media, experiential marketing, spokespeople, festivals, and event properties to identify strategic white spaces where our brand should be.
Kid Trax Ecommerce Merchant (30%)
Define and execute our direct to consumer sales strategies for KidTraxToys.com.
Work collaboratively with sales and product management to establish and manage the online assortment including establishing pricing.
Build and execute digital marketing programs and campaigns to drive traffic and profitable sales on KidTraxtoys.com.
Collaborate with the digital marketing team on enhancing SEO and UX.
Manages and executes the Email Marketing program delivering growth in email database and growth in sales conversion.
Content Marketing Duties (20%)
Leads the creation and execution of consumer programs, campaigns, and annual high-profile product launches.
Evaluates creative ideas and thinking with a critical eye and understanding of the brand equity, vision and strategic priorities.
Manages the influencer program, seeking out, vetting, and selecting appropriate individuals to represent the Kid Trax brand.
Develop content for the brand website; keeping in mind brand voice and consumer journey optimization.
Maintain awareness of brand standards and guidelines, and make sure they are implemented for all assets before they are deployed to digital channels.
Measures/analyzes performance of all web activity; including traffic, content views, and demographics, and provide insights and key learnings to affiliated teams.
Social Media & Digital Marketing (10%)
Drives a holistic social media channel strategy that considers brand & product representation.
Build and manage all aspects of multiple social media accounts, including community development and content creation.
Create sharp, enticing content (including, but not limited to Facebook posts, Tweets, Instagram Posts, Instagram stories, and short format videos) which engage the brand’s audience across social channels.
Manage and implement a paid digital and social paid media advertising plan, using data, driven decision making.
Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.
Other Duties Assigned (10%)
Assist in presenting at key customer meetings on key Kid Trax initiatives.
Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
Follows internal controls and company policies set by Pacific Cycle Inc. and Dorel Sports.
Contributes to the success of Pacific Cycle Inc. by leading or assisting with other projects and tasks as assigned.
Minimum Requirements
College education ideally with degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications.
Masters study or degree a benefit.
At least five years experience in marketing role with social media responsibilities.
Experience in selling directly online
Enthusiasm and energy for the position
Passionate about marketing
Outstanding communicator and writer
Exhibit Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) computer skills
Must have own transportation
Will work on site during regular business hours
Team player who enjoys working with others
Dependable
Outgoing and friendly
Self-motivated and creative idea generator
Key Competencies
Innovative
Proactive and takes action without being prompted
Creativity
Generates original ideas, encourages new ways of thinking, explores options, and develops innovative solutions
Functional/Technical Expertise
Remains current in their area of expertise and serves as a resource in that area of the organization
Change Agility
Adaptable
Embraces needed change and modifies their behavior when appropriate to achieve organizational objectives
Effective in the face of ambiguity
Results Orientation
Maintains an appropriate focus on outcomes and accomplishments
Motivated by achievement, and persist until the goal is reached
Conveys a sense of urgency to make things happen
Respects the need to balance short- and long-term goals
Influence
Skilled at directing, persuading, and motivating others
Ability to flex their style to direct, collaborate, or empower, as the situation requires
Ability to establish a personal power base built on mutual trust, fairness, and honesty
Environmental Factors

A large percentage of work time is spent sitting. During events you may be on your feet for 5 or more hours. The noise level in the work area can be moderate.

Essential Physical Demands and Frequency
Standing: Occasionally
Driving: Yes
Sitting: Frequently
Bending: Occasionally
Lifting: Occasionally up to 50 lbs. unassisted
Other: Traveling

Job Title: Restaurant, Hospitality, and Food Services Experience Wanted!!!

Job Description
Senior Activation Planner, Platform Activation Team

Sensory Interactive’s architects, designers, and project managers are combining technology and architecture to develop a new generation of dynamic and engaging places. We’re using our understanding of space, materials, and construction methods in new and totally innovative ways, creating immersive environments that emphasize communication, interaction, and community building.

The Sensory Interactive team works around the world on high-profile projects that include digital urban experiences, interactive educational exhibits, sports arena display programs, and Times Square LED spectaculars.

Sensory Interactive’s Platform Activation Team designs and delivers the experiences that draw crowds, entertain visitors, and build brands. This includes producing content for digital signs, static signs, event and activation spaces, web and mobile sites, social media feeds, and more. We are responsible for all non-revenue content that plays across all media assets in the Promotional Platforms that we construct for our clients.

As a team member at Sensory interactive, you'll let the world know about how we combine digital experiences with physical spaces to foster new kinds of user interactions. Our multidisciplinary approach and cross-industry project portfolio are putting our firm on the leading edge of technologies and business models that are changing built environments around the world.

The Position:

We are seeking a Senior Activation Planner in our Austin office. The Senior Associate will lead Sensory Interactive’s team to concept, plan, budget, schedule, and execute content. Interfacing with the Activation Strategist, Account Executive and Client, the Senior Associate oversees the overall activation from pre-production through successful execution, anticipating any issues along the way. The position requires a blend of creativity and strategy, excellent communication and time-management skills, and self-motivated leadership focused on team collaboration; all while carrying the responsibility of the project’s outcome.

The Planner works closely with an Activation Strategist who develops and maintains the brand and creative vision across all content and experiences.

Qualifications:

You must be a highly organized and self-motivated person comfortable engaging with a wide variety of people and organizations. Specific qualifications include:
A bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Public Relations, Marketing or related field.
Eight or more years of experience managing complex projects in an event production firm, experiential marketing firm, advertising agency, or similar firm.
Mature project management methodologies with a collaborative focus.
Knowledge of both B2B and B2C engagements.
A proactive outlook combined with the ability to manage change as project requirements evolve.
Ability to work with and manage groups with many stakeholders.
Experience establishing and maturing relationships with executives and senior clients.
Experience drafting, reviewing, negotiating, and executing RFPs.
Ability to travel as required.
Responsibilities:

As a Senior Activation Planner, you will be responsible for building positive, consultative relationships with high-level clients, and providing them the utmost in customer service.
Lead our internal team to define the experiences that we will deliver across project sites and the required scope, schedule, and budget.
Engage directly with senior clients and other stakeholders as necessary to ensure the smooth delivery of the desired experience.
Work closely with an Activation Strategist and Account Manager to plan, contract, execute, and operate experiences across project sites on a multi-year basis. Manage and “own” the timeline, day-to-day budget, and project operations from end to end.
Oversee the creation of detailed annual plans for visitor-facing experiences. This includes planning, creation, and refresh of static graphic, digital animation, video, and interactive content; web, mobile, and social media content; and events including fitness classes, sponsored health fairs, farmers markets, art installations, holiday festivals, and more.
Manage the execution of all visitor-facing experiences in coordination with the project’s Strategist and Account Executive.
Maintain and report on detailed schedules for each content category.
Manage, in coordination with the Account Executive, creation and execution of all RFPs or other contracting models for all content.
Manage, in coordination with the Account Executive and Strategist, development and delivery of all content (including graphic design, animation, and video production, interactive content, digital and mobile content, social media content, events, and other content) whether by internal or contracted resources.
Manage, in coordination with the Account Executive, onsite operational and logistics needs for all events (e.g. insurance requirements, load-in and load-out, signage and product deliverables, payment processing needs, electricity, wifi, security, storage cages, and other onsite operational needs to deliver the intended experiences).
Develop, maintain, reconcile, and report on annual budgets including both expenses and revenue.
Benefits:
Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
401K profit-sharing plan
Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) and Holidays
Employee cell phone plan reimbursement
Employee referral bonuses
Wellness incentives
Continuing education

Company Description
Sensory Interactive is a consulting firm that designs and implements digital media projects for the built environment. We provide owner representation services from initial concept through operations for large-format digital out-of-home projects, sponsored promotional platforms, and multi-user interactive walls.

We have learned from experience that owners unfamiliar with digital media are often challenged to efficiently steer a project from design and programming through construction and long-term operation. In response, we have built our business on guiding clients through the full development and implementation process for dynamic media environments.

Job Description:

Dealer Channel Marketing Manger

Pentair currently has an opening for a Dealer Channel Marketing Manager to join our team at our Brookfield, WI location. In this role, the Dealer Channel Marketing Manager will be responsible for driving growth in the dealer channel in our exciting and critical Pentair Water Solutions residential filtration systems Business Unit. As the Dealer Channel Marketing Manager, you will drive growth by delivering channel expertise and overseeing marketing, promotions, channel go-to-market programs, customer experience, and analytics to deliver P&L goals. This role reports to the Director of Marketing for Residential and Commercial Filtration Systems, and must align with the Business Unit leader and their respective teams in Product Management, Sales and the broader Marketing function.

We will:
Create career growth and rotational opportunities within various areas of the organization
Pay competitively
Provide on the job training and mentoring in Pentair's proven best practices
Offer health benefits & coaching
Support your long term retirement goals through a competitive 401K matching and stock purchase plan
Offer employee discounts
Protect you with life insurance and other options
Tell you more about all the great benefits - just ask!
You will:
Develop a deep understanding of the dealer channel, and generate insights and implications to inform program development and share across the cross-functional teams
Build and execute data-driven growth strategy for the dealer channel through competitive, market and end user analytics and insights
Partner with Sales and Product Management teams to develop, implement and deliver channel-specific performance and co-op marketing programs to support growth
Build sales and channel development pipeline in concert with the Sales team
Develop campaigns that drive product visibility, sales growth and market penetration; evaluate existing marketing programs and recommend improvements
Provide strategy and support for key accounts; manage sales contracts and agreements with channel customers; address sales related issues and conflicts in a timely manner
Partner with Demand Marketing Manager to drive cross-channel new product launches and associated campaigns into the dealer channel, and ensure that customers are up-to-date with new products and enhancements
This position will share with the Strategic Marketing Manager, Demand Marketing Manager and Product Category Leaders, responsibility for hitting growth targets and KPIs
Performance of channel campaigns in order to grow revenue
Provide execution of campaigns/programs and communication to customers
Develop new dealer partners and expand share in existing channels
Develop and execute successful product launches
Provide strategy and execute merchandising tactics and support
Help Strategic Marketing develop product positioning, messaging and value proposition that differentiates our products and programs for all customers in channel: end user, dealer, etc.
Collaborate with Content and Digital Marketing on sales enablement and training activities, communication of value proposition along with developing tools to support the selling process.
Collaborate with the product team, educate both our internal and external stakeholders about our product features and their benefits
Own the Pentair Residential Filtration dealer channel marketing budget, performance metrics, KPIs and customer targets
Inform new product development pipeline with key insights, pain points and new product opportunities that fit the dealer channel
Provide excellent customer services to ensure customer satisfaction and retention
Participate in sales meetings and Kaizen events that require industry knowledge as an input for success
Participate in marketing team discussions to ensure strategies and activities are aligned with vertical market plans
You should:
Have a BS or BA degree in business marketing or communications; advanced degree preferred
7+ years of experience as a Marketing professional
Experience with two step-distribution (B2B2C) and dealer marketing and channel development
Preference for B2C experience - additionally, big box B2C experience a plus
Proven record of driving revenue and growing volumes for a consumer products and/or services business
Preference for working in a collaborative, cross-team capacity. This role requires working across functions and departments to bring a product to life; constantly interacting with teammates and prospects
Thorough understanding and successful experience working in teams developing integrated marketing communications plans and product launches
Past experience in digital marketing, product marketing, and/or product management helpful
Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills; ability to speak and present internally and externally to promote our products and communicate campaigns
Demonstrated project management capabilities; setting acceptable timelines for initiatives, putting together project plans and calendars, and hitting deadlines
Must have very strong project management skills - be able to construct project plans with aggressive but not unreasonable timelines and hit deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
You will be self-motivated, a self-starter with a sense of urgency. You will be personable with an extroverted personality
Proficiency with PC, Microsoft Office Suite required. Knowledge in use of personal computers, and common business productivity tools such as word processors, spreadsheets, databases, project scheduling tools, etc.
We like, but don't require:
Self-driven and results oriented; ability to work independently
Ability to prioritize time to maximize success in driving tangible business outcomes
Ability to work cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders inside and outside of the Marketing function
Experience working on teams, developing successful integrated communications plans
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Ability to work under pressure and manage many tasks simultaneously
Ability to think analytically
Additional Information:
Percent of Travel Required 10% - 25%
Diversity and Inclusion:

With our expanding global presence, cross-cultural insight and competence are essential for our ongoing success. We believe that a diverse workforce contributes different perspectives and creative ideas that enable us to continue to improve every day. Race, gender, ethnicity, country of origin, age, personal style, sexual orientation, physical ability, religion, life experiences and many more factors contribute to this diversity.

We take ongoing action to improve the diversity of our workforce by:
Ensuring leadership involvement and ownership
Attracting and retaining diverse talent at all levels
Fostering a globally aware, inclusive culture
Ensuring our practices are fair and non-discriminatory

The ACCOUNT MANAGER - TRADE SHOW EXHIBIT DIVISION ensures that client needs are met by guiding and managing day-to-day, account tactical and logistic activities and by maintaining an effective level of direct contact with assigned clients. The account manager shares responsibility for the account's profitability and the development of the account coordinator(s) assigned.

Reports directly to the Account Director or Vice President, Client Relations

Duties

Minimum Experience Requirements:

Experience in managing, mentoring and developing assigned staff
Excellent time management, customer service, project management, leadership and organizational skills

PC Skills with proficiency level experience using MS Outlook, MS Excel, MS Word and PowerPoint
Experience in working under tight and changing deadlines
Able to travel as needed

The Role: Field Marketing Manager

Grade (relevant for internal applicants only): 9

The Location: Houston or Denver

The Team: Team is responsible for creating and implementing comprehensive marketing plans to achieve assigned objectives. These objectives can include regional demand generation programs, audience acquisition at live events/conferences, and other customer facing programs. You will partner closely with other functional teams to achieve your goals.

The Impact: We provide market driven insights to the energy and commodities industries. Through our campaigns, we connect, engage, educate, and drive to selection the portfolio of Platts products and services. Marketing contributes 25% of sales and over $6.0 million in direct revenue from conferences.

Whats in it for you:
Opportunity to shine as a strong individual contributor
Freedom to explore and test new tactics and strategies
Gain experience by working with a dynamic team in a role that is fast paced and fun
Professional and personal development from specific trainings and workshops
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the development of marketing plans consisting of multi-touch, multi-dimensional programs including both inbound and outbound tactics
Engage with in house creative team to create compelling collateral, web pages, online exposure, and more
Budget acumen and responsibility for delivering the targets within budget guidelines.
Research, choose, design and manage live events to be included as tactics in the overall marketing mix, and ensure there is a cohesive pre-event, at-event and post event strategy to increase engagement and response rates
Forecast, measure, analyze and report on impact of programs
What Were Looking For:

Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years of B-to-B sales cycle knowledge including demand creation and pipeline contribution/acceleration
Superior project management skills ability to organize new work efforts and establish metrics to track progress
Knowledge and experience using key business applications - MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Sharepoint as well as SalesForce, Marketo, and HTML
Well rounded marketing execution experience in both inbound and outbound, physical and virtual events, social and digital marketing and ability to match tactics with appropriate objectives and outcomes
Strong oral/written communications skills
Strong consultative marketing approach in order to effectively engage with sales and other functions (content, product, operations)
Preferred Qualifications:
Build and manage customer data (targeting, segmentation, campaign sizing, propensity modeling)
Industry knowledge energy & commodities markets.
Ability to demonstrate track record of success in all key areas of responsibility
At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. Were the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.

S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com.

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state or local law. Are you looking to be part of a team that desires to see lives impacted for Christ? As an intern at the Ridgecrest Conference Center, you will have the experience to grow professionally, spiritually and personally as you join our team in pursuing Ridgecrest's mission: Cultivating experiences, nurturing relationships, impacting lives for God's glory.
You will receive on-the-job training, and learn the skills needed to serve in a fast-paced Christian hospitality environment. Leaders will coordinate your work schedule, daily responsibilities, and special project assignments. Our program also includes weekly bible study and fellowship with other team members. You will be provided unique opportunities for your growth and development through enrichment and service.

Job Title: Regional Marketing Manager - South, Amazon Flex
Job Description:
At Amazon we are building a world class last mile operation, significantly complimented by Amazon Flex. Amazon Flex works directly with independent contractors - called delivery partners - to make deliveries to our customers. With Amazon Flex, individuals can now be their own boss delivering Amazon packages. Amazon Flex is powered by a mobile app that works in concert with our advanced systems that allows delivery partners to on-board, schedule delivery times, guide them through their deliveries with in-app mapping and navigation, and more. The approach and technology are nothing short of disruptive, and promise to challenge traditional approaches, and change the way the industry operates.

We are looking for a Regional Marketing Manager to own the strategic management of our Delivery Partner populations in the South region. This includes deeply understanding the composition of Delivery Partners in Amazon Flex cities in the South, creating targeted marketing strategies to acquire new Delivery Partners and engage our existing Delivery Partners, and executing regional marketing communications and events. This position is remote, and will include travel within the South.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage key performance indicators for your region, including acquisition and engagement metrics for Delivery Partner populations
Work with Amazon Flex Marketing to understand national marketing plans and tailor them for your region
Execute regional marketing strategies for acquisition, including managing local marketing campaigns
Execute regional marketing strategies for engagement, including regional events
Test and learn in your region and propose new concepts for national rollout
Act as the primary point of contact for outbound communications within your region, for all events that may impact local Delivery Partners
Monitor Delivery Partner sentiment in your region and act as the expert on their needs, including communicating back to corporate team in Seattle
Basic Qualifications
BA/BS in business, marketing, or related field
3+ years of experience working in a business or marketing function
Able to travel at least 25% of the time
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
