Job Title: Field Marketing Manager - Medical Device Diagnostics
Job Description:
At Veeva, we build enterprise cloud technology that powers the biggest names in the pharmaceutical, biotech, consumer goods, chemical & cosmetics industries. Our customers make vaccines, life-saving medicines, and life-enhancing products that make a difference in everyday lives. Our technology has transformed these industries; enabling them to get critical products and services to market faster. Our core values, Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed, guide us as we make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do.

The Role

We are looking for a highly charged and passionate Field Marketing Manager to build, evangelize, and deliver world-class demand creation and lead development programs for our industry cloud solutions for the medical device industry. In this role, you will create brand awareness and visibility of our Medical Device & Diagnostics solutions across Europe and execute an integrated marketing plan to support our pipeline goals. The Field Marketing Manager will work closely with sales, market strategists, and product marketing in a fast-paced and rapidly growing market.

Remote candidates will be considered.

What You'll Do

Oversee and drive lead/demand generation and field marketing plans to support Veeva MD & D revenue objectives growing existing base and acquiring new customers
Own development and successful execution of targeted marketing plans that include but are not limited to user events, industry tradeshows, webinars, demand campaigns/nurture programs, content syndication, social media, etc.
Work with market owners to develop content, such as blog posts, whitepapers and social posts, to drive awareness and demand within the target market
Understand complex buying/selling processes involving multiple decision-makers
Oversee the timely execution of demand generation and field marketing plans, aligning with regional and global stakeholders.
Measure campaign effectiveness based on appropriate KPIs, present program results to Director of MD & D Marketing, market owners and sales.
Requirements

5+ years experience in field marketing and demand generation for an enterprise software or cloud based solution provider
Experience in building and executing integrated marketing programs, managing program budgets, and reporting
Content marketing experience, including writing blog posts, email campaigns, whitepapers, case studies, etc. to support integrated marketing campaigns
Hands-on, collaborative, multi-tasker, creative, strategic thinker and analytical
Strong project management skills and ability to manage multiple priorities and projects at the same time with excellent attention to details
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Proven ability to excel in a dynamic, fast-paced environment is extremely important
Excellent team player with a positive attitude and strong sense of ownership
Experience with sales and marketing automation systems
Proven ability to build relationships across a number of stakeholders including sales, SDR, customer success, subject matter experts, and product marketing
Bachelor's degree required
Nice to Have

Experience with , Pardot, and LinkedIn preferred
Life sciences industry experience is a plusVeeva's headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

The primary role of the Field Marketing Manager is to provide local/regional marketing planning and implementation to Beltone’s network of dealers and retail owned stores covering the following Western states: Washington, Oregon, California, Arizona, Idaho, Nevada, Utah and Colorado.

This is a key marketing leadership position and is responsible for working closely with regional operation and sales directors as well as owners of hearing aid stores to develop marketing plans and help implement local outreach programs. The Field Marketing Manager must have experience in advertising, direct mail, digital and be well versed in implementing local marketing/outreach tactics. This position reports to the Director, Field Marketing and will be the liaison between corporate and local marketing.

This is a telecommuting position working from a home office. The position can be based anywhere, however residence in one of the locations listed above is preferred. There is 40% per week travel in the Western US region. Experience in franchise/dealer marketing in one of the following industries -- QSR, telecom, hospitality, medical, automotive (Tiers 1-2) or advertising/marketing agency experience with franchise/dealer clients -- is a MUST.

Responsibilities:

Field Marketing
Key field marketing liaison between corporate marketing department, operations and sales directors/managers.
Strong marketing advisor with a can-do attitude to develop and implement local/regional marketing plans.
Work alongside operations, sales and Director, Field Marketing to develop local market plans for owners and operators, identify local marketing opportunities and troubleshoot, as needed.
Work with the Director, Field Marketing to create a seamless process to share and gather information, provide advice and lead integration locally/regionally.
Participate in conference calls & or meetings with regional clients to discuss marketing opportunities and share Beltone marketing capabilities.
Provide experience and data-backed advice when requested on:
General effectiveness of specific marketing ideas in a given market
Recommend timing of various marketing vehicles to maximize impact
Advice on how to maximize marketing ROI
Lead all implementation of marketing programs and follow up with results and refinements.
Project Execution
Lead the execution of customized local marketing programs for owners and corporate owned stores integrating and leveraging internal and external resources. Projects include managing traditional channels with corporate such as direct mail, print and broadcast as well as building local plans that deliver on KPIs such as referral and outreach programs, local extension of national launches and programs, grand openings, lunch & learns and community centric marketing.
Must have exceptional project management skills, building/maintaining the local/regional marketing calendar, overseeing budgets and meeting fast moving deadlines.
Have experience developing marketing plans from a bottoms-up budgeting approach
Understand marketing strategy
Able to follow marketing process
Have strong analytical skills
Must be able to juggle lots of projects at once in a very fast retail environment
Must be able to work with a variety of people with different marketing experience (or none), and inform, educate and mentor
Reporting
Responsible for documenting marketing data for analysis.
Responsible for providing and presenting to small groups on multiple reports detailing accounts, projects and efficacy of programs where applicable.
Responsible for providing and presenting a quarterly summary report to assigned sales region representatives & marketing peers.
Strong analytics
Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required
Minimum of 7-10 years marketing experience.
Experience in retail, franchise/dealer marketing in one of the following industries -- QSR, telecom, hospitality, medical, automotive (Tiers 1-2) or advertising/marketing agency experience with franchise/dealer clients -- is a MUST.
Excellent verbal presentation and written communication. Phone and email are main communication platforms.
Detail-oriented and results-driven
Ability to multi-task and prioritize work with a variety of internal and external customers.
Ability to work well with customers to understand their objectives, align on recommendations and execute against plan to achieve goals
A proven ability to generate buy-in on marketing recommendations
Ability to work with multiple projects simultaneously and deliver flawless execution
Ability to effectively communicate the strategic rationale of various marketing programs as they relate to driving growth in each account
Ability to understand opportunity identification and prioritization as it relates to achieving goals

Job Title:
Regional Marketing Manager

Requisition Number:
20-5773

Job Description:
LogistiCare is the nation's largest manager of non-emergency medical transportation programs for state governments and managed care organizations. LogistiCare was founded in 1986 as a logistics software solution developer offering data technology to the ambulance industry. Seeing the challenges our clients faced managing transportation operations, we entered into the transportation consulting business. By the mid-1990s, we switched our focus to non-emergency medical transportation (NEMT) services as our sole line of business.

In 2019, the company managed over 63 million trips for more than 24 million eligible riders in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. Its range of services includes call center management, networking credentialing, vendor payment management and non-emergency medical transport management. Every member is unique in our eyes and we do our best to ensure they receive the highest quality of service possible because every member and every ride matters.

As the healthcare industry continues to experience unprecedented expansion and disruption, there is an increasing opportunity for LogistiCare to provide more effective access to healthcare services via new initiatives and offerings. The successful candidate will be able to work in a growth-oriented organization and be able to simultaneously tackle both daily operational challenges as well as strategic initiatives. The growth of the organization presents both challenges and opportunities for the successful candidate to guide LogistiCare in continuing to lead the access to healthcare industry.

As Regional Marketing Manager, you will support our markets across the country, enabling organizational alignment towards critical business objectives and lead the organization's implementation of company-wide strategic activities.

You will work closely with the sales team, client services, network development and operations managers to develop and execute effective marketing programs and events targeting MCO, hospital and health system executive buyers. We are looking for someone who is experienced in driving, planning and implementing regional marketing programs targeting both prospective and existing customer buyers. The ideal candidate will have experience managing field marketing programs that target healthcare executives.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Create and execute targeted regional marketing programs to meet demand generation goals, including client and prospect marketing, events, local association relations, and operations communications.
Work closely with sales teams and key technology partners to craft account-level marketing plans for top strategic accounts.
Identify, develop, and implement local programs that supplement national activities in order to achieve sales and profit targets and build the brand.
Gain operational alignment on the brand programs by working together with the Marketing Team and operation leaders so that national programs are successfully implemented.
Act as the primary liaison between corporate marketing and operations.
Gain alignment on local and national marketing programs to ensure participation in the marketing initiatives at the Operation Center level.
Understand brand strategies and incorporate them into the local brand plans.
Combine local and national needs into market specific plans.
Understand the local market conditions and their potential marketing value to protect the current and create new market share.
Collaborate with network teams to build and sustain strong provider networks.
Partner with operations' liaison teams to build strong partnerships with local facilities, state health plan associations, and National Kidney Foundation on a market level.
Manage across marketing, design, sales and operations teams to develop market and account specific presentation and support materials, including slide decks, print and web content, email campaigns, infographics, collateral, white papers, event content, and more. Define and create post meeting follow up materials and leave behinds.
Develop and manage reports and analytics on field program impact
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS
Proven success developing sales-driven programs to accelerate results; field marketing, sales enablement or equivalent expertise in a B2B organization (healthcare preferred)
Track record of creating business development-focused marketing programs
Ability to organize a plan (national, regional, sales roles specific) and sell it to stakeholders (head of sales, sales leaders, key sales influencers)
Experience/knowledge of CRM systems (preferably Salesforce) and marketing automation (preferably HubSpot) to effectively partner with Digital Marketing Manager on digital execution
Experience with and comfortable in working with geographically dispersed colleagues
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Ability to manage multiple workloads simultaneously with strong organizational skills
Self-motivated, able to work autonomously and communicate with remote management
Outstanding work ethics with high performance and quality standards, enthusiastic and diligent with meticulous attention to detail
Passion for results, measurement and optimization to continuously drive ROI
Strong understanding of sales cycles and large deal complexity
Experience marketing and/or selling to hospital and health system executives is preferred
Able to travel to various markets where we have offices and operations centers; approximately 20% of the time
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree in Marketing or Business, or relative experience
Minimum five years of B2B (business to business) regional marketing experience leading and managing marketing strategy
Healthcare industry experience strongly desired
Detail-oriented with the ability to manage projects from inception through execution
Ability to think creatively and apply new approaches, programs and techniques.
Good problem solving skills, ability to act on your feet and make critical decisions.
Proven experience interfacing with internal & external constituents.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The position reports to the Director of Marketing and will work cross-functionally with senior managers across the organization
Director of Marketing is located in the Atlanta office. This position can be based in Atlanta, Boston, or Denver.
This position will travel to our corporate offices (Atlanta, Boston, Denver) as well as several of our operation centers (20 across the country)
Dynamic, high-growth, fast paced, environment
LogistiCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Work Location(s):
Denver,CO, Boston,MA

Full-Time/Part Time:
Full-time

Job Description
Company Background:

bluemedia, Inc. is the leading provider of experiential marketing support in the areas of large format print, projection mapping, environmental graphics, complex custom fabrication and related installations. Typical customers include the NFL, Arizona Coyotes, Arizona State University and many of the largest agencies and brands in the world. Our superior execution of critical events such as the Super Bowl, college bowl games, PGA tournaments, and Comic-con activations has resulted in a reputation unparalleled in the industry. The successful candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, positive operating environment that builds and installs multiple products in a wide variety of locations.

Position Overview:

The Senior Accountant supports bluemedia’s commitment to excellence by bringing their “can do” attitude and high energy to work every day. This position is a full time, salaried, exempt position and reports to the Assistant Controller and EVP of Finance. This position is responsible for accurately capturing, reporting, and analyzing revenues and expenses and managing the accounts payable process to assure venders are paid timely. This position is responsible for all sales tax reporting.

Responsibilities:
Oversee day to day general ledger activities, general ledger maintenance, and review the work of the Accounting Clerk.
Review weekly accounts payable batches for proper expenditure approval levels and ensuring proper general ledger account coding.
Assist with the evaluation of revenues recognized in accordance with ASC 606.
Recognize or defer revenue and cost in the proper period.
Prepare monthly journal entries and reconciliations including cash, prepaid expenses and various liability accounts.
Manage all monthly standard/non-standard journal entries in collaboration with the Assistant Controller to ensure an accurate and timely month-end close. Present to the EVP of Finance and recommend account adjustments on a monthly basis.
Assist the Assistant Controller with monitoring the accuracy of company job costing procedures and reporting.
Manage the weekly payroll posting and month-end related accruals to the general ledger.
Record appropriate revenue and cost at a line of business and profit center level.
On a period and ad hoc basis, analyze financial information, collect data and call attention to trends and report on variances.
Manage sales tax filings.
Assist with implementation of Infor Syteline ERP (CSI) system.
Develop new internal controls and propose them to management.
Complete and maintain 401k trust reconciliations. Prepare annual 401k census.
Serve as primary contact for the 401k third party providers and manage and facilitate the annual 401k audit.
Take a lead role in developing the annual budget and periodic forecasts.
Assist in the preparation of tax returns and audits in conjunction with external advisors.
Keep abreast of new techniques in financial reporting, analysis or new technology.
Assist in the preparation of tax returns and audits in conjunction with external advisors.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in accounting with a minimum of 2-4 years of accounting experience.
Infor Syteline experience a plus.
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office/Excel: Ability to manage multiple projects within deadlines. And, ability to perform vlookups, pivot tables and chart functions.
Self-starter with a strong results orientation.
Resourceful with exceptional problem solving and decision-making skills with a flair for process improvement and innovation.
Assist in the preparation of tax returns and audits in conjunction with external advisors.
Sales tax reporting experience a must with Avalara experience a plus.
Highly proficient in the use of Microsoft Office. Ability to manage multiple projects within deadlines.
Ability to effectively deliver oral presentations to audiences of all varieties, including size, organizational level and experience.
Strong written, verbal, organizational and analytical skills.
Demonstrates initiative with an established bias for action in a team environment.
What We Offer: A comprehensive salary and benefits package including health, dental, vision and a 401K Plan.

Posting Details

Job Posting Title Special Projects - External Events Coordinator (Temporary)
Location Los Rios Community College District (Sacramento City College)
Department Location Campus Operations
Posting Number C00580P
The Institution

About
The Los Rios Community College District (LRCCD) is the second largest, two-year public college district in California, serving approximately 75,000 students in the greater Sacramento region. The district’s 2,400 square mile service area includes Sacramento and El Dorado counties and parts of Yolo, Placer, and Solano counties and is comprised of four uniquely diverse colleges – American River, Cosumnes River, Folsom Lake and Sacramento City colleges. In addition to each college’s main campus, the district offers educational centers in Placerville, Davis, West Sacramento, Elk Grove, Natomas and Rancho Cordova.

The Los Rios district office is centrally located in the heart of the Sacramento valley. The growing Capital Region has strong communities and emergent arts and dining scenes, and is nearby some of the most celebrated tourist destinations in the country – Lake Tahoe, Napa Valley, and San Francisco. The Sacramento area is a great place to live and work!

Strengths
The district has approximately 4,000 employees throughout our four colleges and district office in dozens of different departments that provide welcoming, inclusive, and equitable environments for Los Rios students, employees and community partners. Each and every district and college department strives for the highest quality in all programs, services, and activities, and is focused on improving educational outcomes for the students we serve.

Our Vision
Our colleges offer equity-minded, academically rigorous, student success centered education. Our objective is to help our students successfully achieve their academic goals, whether they want to transfer to a four-year college or university, earn an associate degree, or obtain one of more than 100 certificates in high demand career fields.

The Los Rios Community College District’s Human Resources Department is committed to diversity, equity, and to ensuring an inclusive, thriving environment for all of its employees, students, and surrounding communities. To that end, the Human Resources Department is intentional in recruiting, hiring, and retaining diverse employees, to reflect the diversity of our colleges’ student populations.
Position Summary

The External Events Coordinator, under the direction of the Operations Director and/or Supervisor, will assist with external rental of athletic and other miscellaneous events held at Sacramento City College’s facilities, as required by the Campus Operations Department.

This position is assigned to the Campus Operations department.

NOTE: Temporary classified positions are limited to 135 work days per fiscal year, per board regulation.

For additional information or concerns, please contact Margaret Lednicky, (916) 558-2543.

Job Description
Job Summary:

Most companies spend the largest portion of their marketing budgets on events. Yet very few can tell with certainty whether that expenditure was worth it. The Event Farm platform, recently acquired by MemberSuite, Inc., is a established and fast-growing event engagement and experiential marketing platform that helps its customers—like Google, GOOP, JPMorgan Chase, Exxon, NASCAR, SpaceX, and more—determine how their offline events are providing return on investment through engagement. Our product and engineering teams work in lockstep to create industry improving software. We need a Senior Software Engineer who can affect the Full Stack and build high quality, beautiful interfaces alongside our UX/UI teams while delivering efficient back end data processing and management.

Responsibilities and Duties:
Work closely with our User Experience Designers and translate their interaction design and data needs into our web applications.
Design and implement PHP/JavaScript code base and work with your fellow Front-End and Full Stack engineers in the application team to ensure the application interactions are seamless, reactive and performant.
Be willing to work across a diverse set of technologies.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science.
3+ years of experience in a fast-paced environment as a Software Engineer/Developer or Architect.
Hands-on experience with PHP.
Experienced in multiple functional technologies, including ReactJS, VueJS, GoLang.
Knowledge in programming and working with APIs and Restful Web Services.
Write automated test suites.
Work with product managers and designers to define the scope of each new feature/product.
Good communication. Both written and face-to-face communication is a key part of building a great product.
Team mentality. This role requires you to work and collaborate well with other engineers, designers, and those from other teams.
Passion for learning new technologies, and is quick to learn them.
Driven by results and delivering a high-quality product to our customers.
Company Overview:

Event Farm is a MemberSuite company that offers an industry-leading event engagement software platform to commercial and non-profit organizations. Currently, the company works with many of the Fortune 1000 including Nike, JP Morgan Chase, Levis, Microsoft, Guess, etc. as well as leading upcoming brands in the experiential marketing space including BeautyCon, GOOP, MediaLink, and dozens of agencies. We combine our extensive event expertise and suite of engagement technology—modernized registration tools, mobile check-in, and badge printing, attendee mobile apps, real-time attendee text messaging, wearable tech (NFC), and cutting-edge event websites—to make your innovative events possible.

Who are we and what do we do?

Edible Brands, the parent company of Edible®, is a leader in the gifting category with delicious, hand-crafted offerings soon expanded to a range of gifts and treats for every moment. From our signature Edible Arrangements®, Dipped Fruit® boxes, fresh fruit smoothies and more, Edibles exceptionally crafted gifts and treats continue to fill the world with goodness. Through Edibles 1,000 independently owned franchise locations, the mission of the brand - no matter how big it gets - is to WOW you with every piece of fruit thats dipped, box thats filled or arrangement thats hand-delivered. Everything at Edible® starts and ends with our 5Ps: our promise, our products, our places, our people, and most importantly, our purpose - to celebrate whats good in life.

Who were looking for:

We're looking for a Senior Filed Marketing Manager to join our incredible team in Atlanta. This position will be responsible for developing and executing Edibles local co-op marketing strategy within top DMA markets for the brand. The role is responsible for stewarding and executing National Brand Marketing efforts while developing and supporting execution of local marketing plans in multiple markets. The Sr. FMMs priorities are to attract and engage guests, increase sales and traffic at the local level, build brand awareness, and grow local community engagement in a measurable way.

How youll make an impact:
Youll develop, execute, and manage large and influential co-ops within the system, leading local marketing strategies and meeting goals and objectives within assigned DMAs.
By implementing, monitoring, and measuring local media campaigns to support broader marketing initiatives.
Providing guidance and partnering closely with local co-op agencies of record to develop co-op marketing plans, establish KPIs and analyze results. Owner of agency relationships within their assigned markets and stewards national brand initiatives while ensuring local market effectiveness.
Exploring and identifying new emerging ways to drive sales and in-store traffic at the local level within assigned DMAs.
Monitoring, directing and coaching the spend against local co-op budgets and accruals.
Providing flawless, consistent communication to the markets, assessing needs and stewarding insights and results.
Staying current and assessing the competitive activity of a local market.
Partnering with local agencies to ensure marketing strategy aligns with national marketing and overarching business goals; monitor KPIs and reporting of regular sales results by DMA.
You will engage with operational and franchise partners building local marketing skill set and driving one system communication.
Continually staying connected to national marketing team to guarantee one system marketing voice and confirm all local marketing efforts adheres to brand standards.
And heres what we think youre like:
7+ years of marketing experience, preferably with consumer centric brands or services in the retail, restaurant and/or hospitality industries.
5-7+ years of experience in co-op/franchise environment - field marketing preferred
Bachelors degree in marketing, communications, business, advertising, English, or other related field of study
Working knowledge of current marketing trends, tactics and best practices
Demonstrated success in local media planning, across traditional and digital
Working knowledge of how data and analytics shape local calendar strategy

ANSYS is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, ANSYS helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

SUMMARY

The Field Marketing Manager will develop, manage and evolve marketing programs for the ANSYS regional sales teams. This position works closely with key program stakeholders including product marketing managers, industry marketing managers, product managers, support teams and ANSYS regional sales teams. The primary objective of the role is demand generation through successful campaign execution and understanding of key industry trends, strategic market opportunities and sales priorities.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Plans demand generation marketing programs to grow sales pipeline for the sales organization
Executes strategic global marketing campaigns and regional industry campaigns at the territory level
Identifies new tactics to connect with market across all personas including users, managers and executives
Builds a community of customers, prospects and students through PR, social media, webinars and other digital tactics
Nurtures existing leads through digital content, events and other persona appropriate marketing methods.
Monitor lead flow within the territory to ensure the appropriate sales channels are receiving and following up on leads
Creates and manage territory program budget; measures ROI of field marketing tactics through metrics analysis and reporting.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree required
5 years of experience in marketing
Proven ability to work closely and successfully with a sales organization
Proven ability to successfully execute a variety of marketing programs, including targeted direct mail and email, field events, social media, executive engagements, awareness campaigns
Experience with marketing automation systems to successfully run campaigns
Ability to work very independently and collaborate with cross-functional teams
Strong analytics, reporting, and written communication skills
Rigorous attention to detail and focus on quality of deliverables
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
An MBA or other advanced degree is a plus.
Experience in B2B and B2C demand generation environment preferred
Ability to travel up to 25%
CULTURE AND VALUES

Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs – guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:
Customer focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork
WORKING AT ANSYS

At ANSYS, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at ANSYS are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at ANSYS, it’s about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It’s about the “what’s next” as much as the “mission accomplished”. It’s about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At ANSYS, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.

Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, ANSYS has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

ANSYS is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

ANSYS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

ANSYS does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of ANSYS. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Job Title: Regional Marketing Manager Acute Care & Preventive Drugs - NA
Job Description:
# Job Description SummaryAs part of the BDM - Pharmaceutical system division, the Regional Marketing Manager Acute Care & Preventive drug \(Anticoagulant & Vaccines\) NA is accountable for planning, executing and measuring a range of multi\-touch marketing programs in NA for a defined set of customers in the therapeutic class defined as: Acute Care specialities & preventive drugs\. Key activities of the role will include to drive Acute Care specialities & Preventive drugs revenue, to own Acute & Preventive drugs revenue care account\-based planning and intelligence gathering, to drive demand creation and sales enablement and to support branding\. The role requires Acute care & Preventive drugs segment knowledge and product expertise in the area of Pre\-Fillable syringes\.

# Job Description
*Responsibilities:**
+ Prioritize and group accounts by common attributes in the acute care & Preventive drugs segments

+ Oversee offer creation and determine the optimal tactic mix for the acute care & Preventive drugs accounts\.

+ Partner with sales to develop and execute account planning

+ Understand and analyze accounts portfolio including how key accounts contributes to the overall acute care& Preventive drugs revenue

+ Work X\-functionally especially with Sales, portfolio marketing, demand generation, commercial excellence to define and establish workflows eg: campaign personalization and execution, leads hand\-offs

+ Partner with portfolio marketing, business directors to provide on\-going data & insights into acute care & Preventive drugs accounts from internal & external sources to drive relevance and timely execution

+ Define and execute marketing programs on behalf of sales and demonstrate to sales account manager how to execute program element on their own

+ Provide light customization of campaigns according to analysis of buyer journey & needs, Acute care & Preventive drugs market trends

+ Determine which internal marketing campaigns and assets to leverage for acute care & Preventive drugs account planning

+ Work with demand generation, digital teams to adapt campaign messaging and improve response and opportunity conversion rate

+ Provide sales enablement to drive customer centricity and revenue impact

+ Partner with commercial excellence to establish, forecast and report against key success metrics ex: \#qualified marketing leads, leads conversion rate, marketing led revenue for chronic, pipeline of opportunity creation; SOS
*Qualifications:**
+ Sales or marketing experience in pharmaceuticals, medical devices, or as a supplier to the pharmaceutical industry\.

+ Usage of sale force automation system \(CRM\), marketing automation platforms \(Marketo\)

+ Experience in goal setting and account specific marketing planning

+ Demonstrated experience in campaign management and demand creation processes

+ Demonstrated experience in insight gathering and analysis from multiple internal and external data sources \( data providers, engagement scores, brand audit\)

+ Demonstrated creative capabilities to drive marketing campaign personalization and relevance

+ Leadership skills in orchestring, customizing and executing campaigns\. Tracking and measuring performance using dashboards

+ leadership skills and cross\-functional participation with the ability to manage internal and external stakeholders

+ Superior verbal and written communication skills\.

+ Strong presentation, selling, and negotiation skills\.

+ Influence & persuasion skills

+ Problem solving

+ Customer focus

+ Thrives in an ambiguous environment

# Primary Work LocationUSA NJ \- Franklin Lakes

# Additional Locations

# Work Shift

Job Title: ASSISTANT ACTIVATION TOUR MANAGER - CDL DRIVER
Job Description:
Job Title

ASSISTANT ACTIVATION TOUR MANAGER - CDL DRIVER

Category

Operations Management, Touring

Job Type

Full-time

Job Description

Feld Entertainment is the worldwide leader in producing and presenting live touring family entertainment experiences that lift the human spirit and create indelible memories. Feld Entertainment's productions have appeared in more than 75 countries on six continents with 30 million people in attendance at its shows each year and include Disney On Ice, Disney Live, Monster Jam, Monster Energy Supercross, Marvel Universe Live, Dreamworks Trolls the Experience, Jurassic World Live and Sesame Street Live. The meaningful result: Creating lifelong memories, one act at a time.

The Assistant Activation Tour Manager will report directly to the Activation Tour Manager and be part of an activation team for a touring experiential marketing campaign traveling throughout North America. Main functions will include assisting with operation of a tractor trailer/race hauler, managing the logistics of setting up, activating, and tearing down program equipment at national off-road festivals, tradeshows, and other event activations throughout the calendar year; communicating with local event management teams; assisting with overseeing a consumer Utility Terrain Vehicles (UTVs) experience that involves consumer demonstration and ride experiences; and acting as part of a team traveling with the Activation Tour Manager who will help with the program production and operations.

Essential Job Functions

Responsible for documenting and reporting critical tour information back to the Global Partnerships account team including photos, attendance records, inventory reports, and other activation metrics.
Operate a touring tractor trailer experience throughout North America to, from, and between events and other locations in a safe and timely manner.
Manage set-up, activation, and tear-down of the experience for multiple displays in a week throughout the calendar year.
Coordinate event logistics with local retail managers and/or venue management staff ensuring venue is properly informed and prepared for the activation and that the tour team is maintaining a safe, efficient, and timely schedule.
Willing to work nomadically while on the road.
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently with Activation Tour Manger and office team regularly.
Responsible for operating and maintaining UTVs, including ensuring cleaning, checks and routine maintenance occur regularly. (Training to be provided).
Responsible for ensuring the integrity of the brand experience while keeping the safety and security of the consumers, audience, and company at the forefront of priority.
Responsible for assisting in the management of a UTV product demonstration experience both on closed tracks as well as open trail systems.
Able to travel on the road full time for a multi-year opportunity.
Ability to assist in and step into the leadership role when Activation Tour Manager is off site or unavailable
Maintain professional appearance and demeanor while representing the activation.
Responsible for operating and maintaining tour assets and equipment properly, including ensuring cleaning, checks and routine maintenance occur regularly. (Training to be provided).
Actively look for ways to make the program more effective. Identify areas of concern and opportunity and present them to the office team for consideration.
Must successfully complete training on activation operations as required by company and client, to include product, safety, maintenance and guest experience training.

Job Requirements

3+ years’ experience managing and activating for experiential marketing campaigns on a national level is preferred.
Must have a current CDL-A driver’s license with a clean driving record.
Must have at least 2-5 years UTV or recreational off-road trail riding experience, with preferred experience in 2 and/or 4-wheel racing and group trail riding.
Adaptability in multiple scenarios, ability to operate UTVs on dirt paths with obstacles.
Ability to lead in a fast-paced environment and be an integral part of the team environment.
Experience managing a footprint of over 1,000 square feet and multiple locations that are live simultaneously.
Experience managing remote guided expeditions.
Experience in instructional roles and group management and organization.
Preferred experience with similar demo programs in a lead and chase format.
Preferred experience in mechanical maintenance for tractors, generators, UTVs and other powersports equipment.
Proven ability to work closely with supervisor(s) in receiving, understanding, and executing event details and direction.
Be socially engaging and comfortable interacting with diverse audiences, including client and client representatives, guests, vendors, and teammates.
Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot, maintain, and repair tour assets.
Be physically fit with an ability to be on your feet for extended periods of time.
Ability to lift and carry 75+lbs.
Strong attention to detail, a positive attitude, and a team player.
Must be comfortable booking own travel through corporate site.
Mechanical knowledge, tractor, generator, UTVs and other powersports equipment; mechanical maintenance a plus.
Ability to speak enthusiastically to a large group of people; emcee experience a plus.
Ability to learn quickly to become an expert on client initiatives.
Ability to educate, manage and lead consumers.
Critical thinker and team player as this position has a teammate for the season.
Comfortable speaking to large groups of diverse people.
Ability to lift larger items during set-up and tear-down of the display.
Demonstrated computer proficiency with working knowledge of Excel and Word.
Ability to operate within a fast-paced environment.
Effective verbal and written communication skills. Should be able to adapt communication style to suit different audiences.
Feld Entertainment is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace.

Location

TOURING SHOW/TRAVELING POSITION - ELLENTON (HQ), FL 34221 US (Primary)

Travel

90-100%

SUMMARY OF POSITION

The Designer (Digital) is an integral member of the Creative Department, primarily responsible for the creation of immersive digital experiences for both live and virtual events for a range of brands. This consists of driving the design process, integrating with strategists and designers from within the Creative team, and collaborating with internal cross-functional teams, and external partners to ensure client needs are being met with premium design ideas and creative solutions. The Designer (Digital) will be a critical component in the generation of 360 marketing campaigns, developing art direction and new branding, creating still and motion graphics, and other creative tasks as assigned.

The hands-on nature of event marketing work requires a willingness to observe, adapt, research, explore, execute, revise, and refine creative elements in a fast-paced environment. The superstar that fills this role will embrace interdisciplinary creative projects, multi-tasks with ease, have an insatiable appetite for design, thrive when working with top-notch brands, and have an excellent attitude that inspires others.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
CONCEPTING: Offer strategic design solutions and create working drawings, storyboards, layouts, mood boards, and mockups to evaluate and present ideas in initial project phases.
DESIGN: Generate top notch designs across existing and emerging digital and experiential platforms. Create 2D and/or 3D designs to demonstrate concepts in support of strategies developed for assigned projects. Efficiently manage presentation documents, digital assets, print assets, and all other creative components on assigned projects.
PRESENTATION: Develop presentation skills by being involved in both internal and client presentations and conversations.
INTERNAL COMMUNICATION: Coordinate with internal teams leading up to and during activations to ensure approved creative materials are delivered on a timely basis, always maintaining consistency and quality.
EXTERNAL COMMUNICATION: Coordinate with outside resources, including vendors, printers, and contractors as needed for completion of the design and build out. Coordinate with freelance or contract creatives, supporting their integration into the team and streamlining design deliverables for client when relevant.
PROJECT & TIME MANAGEMENT: Work with cross-functional teams to establish and manage creative deliverable timelines to ensure work is on-time and of high quality.
INSPIRE: Seek out inspiration and share insights with internal teams to help educate and inspire.
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

EDUCATION

Bachelor's Degree in Graphic Design, UI/ UX design, Product Design, or similar discipline.

EXPERIENCE
2+ years experience as a digital designer creating digital assets (websites, banner ads, marketing emails, social media content, apps etc.)
Strong portfolio of creative work to demonstrate design for both digital + physical applications, +mobile or interactive design skills.
ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES
2D DESIGN: Expertise in Adobe CC (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.), proficiency required. Knowledge of print file prep, printing techniques and materials is a plus.
UI/ UX: Experience in design prototyping tools (Adobe XD, Sketch, etc. ) + working knowledge of HTML and CSS. Knowledge of JavaSCript and other coding languages or software is a plus.
MOTION GRAPHICS + VIDEO EDITING: Expertise in After Effects, Final Cut Pro, Premiere, or similar animation and editing software.
SOCIAL MEDIA + INFLUENCER: Understand the ideation, development and deployment of content for Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc. PRESENTATION: Keynote, Powerpoint, Google Docs/Slides, proficiency required.
ADMIN: Microsoft Office, Google Docs, Dropbox, proficiency required.
OTHER QUALITIES AND SKILLS
Possess excellent organizations, interpersonal, and written communication skills.
Articulate design solutions to team members and clients effectively.
Translate strategic vision into tangible project design deliverables that meet project needs and garner approvals.
Multi-task while coordinating multiple projects + resources.
Embody a strong work ethic and ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic workplace.
Make smart decisions in accordance with company policies + procedures.
Be a team player who collaborates easily + brings creative momentum to projects.
High energy and stamina and flexibility in working non-traditional hours as needed (some nights and weekends).

Job Description
Regional Marketing Manager

Edgewood Management Corporation is a 45 year old, premiere affordable property management company, responsible for 27,000 units in fourteen states and the District of Columbia. Edgewood's portfolio represents a variety of multifamily product that includes high-rise, mid-rise, garden and townhouse style rental units.

Edgewood Management Corporation provides superior management services for a variety of residential properties and has an exceptional track record to resolve problems and reposition troubled assets in all areas: operations, administrative, financial and physical. Edgewood Management Corporation recognized as the 9th largest manager of Affordable Housing by the National Affordable Housing Management Association and the 50th largest manager by the National Multi-Housing Council.

Our reputation for providing high quality services with integrity has earned us the trust of our clients and our employees. Edgewood Management Corporation offers a supportive environment where employees are encouraged to develop their skills and talents to their fullest potential. Edgewood is always looking for positive, motivated, and hardworking individuals to join our Edgewood Team.

We are seeking a polished and professional individual for the role of Regional Marketing Manager. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential as the Regional Marketing Manager interacts with all levels of the organization. The qualified candidate should be comfortable working independently and adjust smoothly to changing priorities to accomplish the most critical/sensitive issues on a timely basis. Must be able to balance priorities, and take initiative.

We're seeking a positive individual who is always ready to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.

Job Description:

The Regional Marketing Manager (RMM) will directly support an assigned portfolio of properties by delivering impactful property marketing campaigns, and influence leasing and training programs. The RMM will collaborate with operations leadership and Community Managers to maintain and/or improve occupancy and rental income at the sites through the creation and implementation of effective marketing and leasing efforts.

Essential Duties:

The duties below are a general guideline for the Regional Marketing Manager position and do not constitute all tasks or initiatives expected of the person. There may be other duties assigned to the Regional Marketing Manager by his/her supervisor to effectively manage the portfolio. This position will include roughly 10%-20% travel to assigned properties.
Leads in the development and execution of marketing strategies and programs that support achievement of the portfolio’s financial performance goals by implementing action plans around marketing, advertising, leasing, new development presentations, and client communications.
Partners with regional leadership and community managers to implement creative marketing and advertising strategies and solutions that adhere to budgeted guidelines, including the use of online advertising, corporate and property websites, SEO/SEM, social media, referrals, signage, outreach and email marketing, and other tactics, and appropriately selects marketing techniques that fit the property’s desired resident profile and market conditions.
Create and maintain targeted and relevant online content for property websites, social media and advertising, including copy, video, and photography. Monitors multi-channel advertising (weekly, monthly and quarterly) results and makes adjustments as necessary.
Provides additional marketing support to under-performing properties by analyzing the current traffic and leasing performance, troubleshooting and identifying factors contributing to the performance, developing and implementing aggressive marketing, advertising, pricing, and promotional campaigns, and closely following up to evaluate results and make any necessary changes.
Oversees and manages the development of models/curb appeal deliverables, creative communication pieces, promotional materials, presentations, websites, reports and training materials for assigned portfolio of properties.
Takes the lead in making presentations to owners/clients by preparing proposed marketing and advertising plans and developing/delivering reports that highlight the property’s marketing plans and success, as well as new opportunities.
Identifies and meets with marketing vendors, reviews proposed service contracts for preferred and favorable rates, recommends creative service providers, and monitors and manages advertising partners for product and quality on a monthly or quarterly basis.
Monitors markets for trends, forecasts, job growth, and other economic conditions which may impact occupancy and leasing effectiveness within the portfolio, recommends changes and response strategies to offset market downturns or opportunities, and provides feedback and recommendations to property management on improving struggling asset performance and maximizing revenue generation on performing assets.
Collaborates and shares best practices with marketing team, supports corporate events and initiatives, and is a brand leader within the Edgewood and Vantage organizations.
Train new and existing employees on digital marketing tactics and brand standards, including best practices for social media efforts and online reputation management.
Required Skills and Experience:
Minimum 5 years of experience in the multifamily housing industry with a focus on leasing and marketing.
Minimum 5 years of experience handling marketing responsibilities for a diverse portfolio of communities including new construction, lease-up, renovated, affordable and conventional.
Minimum 5 years of experience with or general knowledge of social media campaigns to include: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, GMB, Blogs and others.
Ability to travel within assigned portfolio roughly 10%-20% of the time
High integrity, ability to communicate concisely, strong interpersonal and partnership skills, achievement drive, and intellectual curiosity.
Superior verbal and written communication skills including a capacity to effectively present to a variety of audiences, summarize reporting and make solid recommendations to optimize marketing campaigns.
Creative and innovative, must be able to set and maintain high standards.
Proactive, takes initiative, works independently and as a part of a team, strong listening skills and can receive and provide critical feedback.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize in an environment of shifting deadlines.
Self-starter with strong time management skills who excels at working in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment.
Proficient with MS Office Suite, CRM software, Mailchimp, SurveyMonkey, property management software, Venngage, Adobe Creative Suite and other creative software.
BA/BS Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or equivalent field
Additional Desired Skills:
Is an active member in the property management industry and associations, advocating for best practices and trends within our organization.
Edgewood prides itself on offering a competitive salary and extensive, market-competitive health and welfare BENEFITS including:
Medical, Dental & Vision
Prescription Drug Program
Paid Vacation & Holiday
Paid Personal/ Sick Leave
Company Paid Life Insurance
Company Paid AD& D Insurance
Company Paid Short- Term
Company Paid Long-term Disability
Supplemental Life Insurance
Dependent Supplemental Life Insurance
Educational Assistance
Financial Planning
Retirement Savings Plan with company matching
Company outings and events
Edgewood Management Corporation is a growing company that is looking for talented professionals who want to be part of a strong team focused on providing superior management services to our residents and owners. If you share our desire to be the best for our residents and communities, then you belong with Edgewood.

Edgewood Management Corporation is committed to a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Full Time Brand Promoter and Sales Representative
Job Description:
Job Description
If you are a customer service focused with the ability to connect with people and succeed in delivering extraordinary service, let’s talk!

About Us:

We have a strong work ethic and the ripple of that is growth and development for our clients. We are focused on creating a welcoming environment, with a laid back, yet professional approach to achieving our client’s goals. The link we create through an effective face-to-face approach between our client’s products and services and their potential customers is what makes our direct marketing strategy so effective.

Requirements:
Previous customer service experience is desirable however not essential
Thrive working in a fast-paced, electric environment
Confident, outgoing & approachable
Capable to work under pressure & meet deadline
Flexible to working patterns and able to work at least 3 full days per week between Monday-Saturday
What you can expect from us:
Skills for life: how to solve problems, how to adapt to change, and how to tough it out in the face of adversity
In-house leadership programs - extraordinary advancement opportunities
Top-notch paid training!
A workplace that’s never boring
The opportunity to make someone’s day, every day
Rewards and recognition as you blaze your own trail and ignite your career
Successful applicants will be invited to meet face-to-face with the management team to establish the most suitable position for their skill set.
Company Description
Sparks Worldwide is an outsourced experiential marketing firm. Sparks Worldwide started with five highly motivated individuals that understand the clients goals and more importantly the opportunity provided likeminded individuals work together to achieve a common goal. Since expanding here to Savannah, GA in April 2019 we’ve grown to 30+ and people and are looking to continue expanding into multiple markets through our enthusiastic ideas.

Being a part of the Experiential Marketing Team means you are adding onto the excitement of a typical day at the Zoo. If you love the spotlight, you’ll love the chance to do meet-and-greets as a Character Ambassador! Plus, gain experience in onsite marketing as you assist with the production and execution of events, promotions and fundraisers. We’re looking for creative, hard-working, enthusiastic contributions to our team who aren’t afraid to do what it takes to make it happen!

Performs as costume character ambassador/guide during on-site and off-site promotional events.
Assists in the set-up, implementation and clean-up of all Experiential Marketing Happenings.
Drives golf carts to transport guests to and from Zoo locations during events.
Works a flexible schedule including weekends, weekdays, evenings and holidays as necessary.
Functions as a strong team member in the Marketing Department, assisting other areas and performing other duties as assigned.
Creatively engages guests through a variety of hands-on activities. This may include, but is not limited to, leading interactive games, creating positive crowd participation and promoting zoo events to our guests/patrons.

Must be at least 18 years old.
High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
Computer knowledge/skills.
Detail-oriented and excellent organizational skills.
Previous experience in children’s theatre, recreation, education, costume character performance or related job is helpful but not required.
Able to handle the demands of working in full body costume: e. work in very hot conditions, move “freely” with limited peripheral vision in an oversized costume required.
Must be between 5’0” and 5’8” in height.
Weight must be proportionate to height, to be able to fit in required costumes.
Able to balance multiple assignments successfully.
Able to work in varied weather conditions (i.e. extreme heat, rain).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Able to provide excellent guest service by positively interacting with guests and upholding the Make it G.R.E.A.T. standards required.
Able to maintain courteous and helpful behavior.
Able to maintain appropriate employee appearance.
Able to work flexible schedule including weekends, evenings and holidays.
Subject to BMV check.
Subject to Criminal Background check.
Subject to Drug Free Workplace Policy.

Job Description
We are looking for a Regional Marketing Manager (Banking) to join our team! You will be responsible for overseeing marketing policies and programs, as well as identify areas of improvement to increase brand awareness.

Description

Client is among the largest commercial banks headquartered in California. We are looking for outstanding people to join our winning team. We reached our current strength because of our employees, customers, and shareholders believe in the same fundamental goals: Delivering a wide variety of financial services with a superior customer service guarantee.

Bank is a 130-year-old community bank with $4.9 billion in assets and 88 branches throughout Northern and Central California. We have been a profitable quarter in and quarter out for 23 years. Industry associations and rating agencies routinely rank Bank among the top community banks for asset quality, capital ratios, safety and soundness and overall financial performance.

Job Description:

Recruit, manage, coach and motivate a team of Business Relationship Managers, Business Banking Officers, and Business Banking Managers, along with other employees within a defined geographical region of the bank. Oversee and maintain excellent service standards and promote growth in profitability with the use of Sales Culture. The development of direct reports in a sale driven environment is critics for this role. Solicit large prospects and assist direct reports with large customers and prospects with joint calling efforts.

Further duties include:
Understand the commercial real estate and C & I markets within your geographical location.
Ability to differentiate client Bank from the competition and use those differences as coaching tools to your direct reports.
Ability to read, understand and compare financial statements.
Develop calling plans with each officer to take advantages of competitive strengths within each market.
Establish and maintain relationships with key community leaders and achieves a significant presence in the community to promote the Bank.
Provide Senior Management with reports, feedback and areas of opportunity with the region.
Offer weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting with forecasts and details about sales growth in lending. Deposits and Non-interest Income.
Insure compliance with all Bank and Regulatory requirements.
Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting and Finance is required.
Five + years of sales management, outside sales and customer service experience in the financial services industry.
Adherence to policies, procedures and regulatory banking requirements.
Previous experience in marketing or other related fields
Experience in a managerial role
Strong project management skills
Strong leadership qualities
Deadline and detail-oriented
Preferred Experience and Skills:
Highly developed verbal and written communication skills including familiarity with basic word processing applications software.
Ability to analyze financial statements.
Ability to prepare and effectively deliver sales presentations using applicable support materials.
Strong sales and sales presentation skills.
Effectively solves problems, present solutions and resolve conflicts.
Ability to recruit, train and coach a sales team.
Demonstrate strong leadership skills, always projecting a positive attitude and provide an environment of professional excellence.
Responsibilities:
Oversee and coordinate product development and marketing trends
Determine product demand and customer awareness
Develop pricing strategies to maximize return on investment
Coordinate marketing campaigns with sales activities
Review and optimize marketing budget
Monitor and report on customer satisfaction
EOE

Real-Time 3D Game Programmer
+
JOB DESCRIPTION

Inhance is a leading interactive animation and immersive studio seeking real-time or game programmers to build exciting AR/VR, multi-screen 3D interactive presentations, multi-player immersive environments, experiential marketing installations, and casual games. You will be responsible for designing and implementing custom applications in Lua, C++, and C# using Unreal, Unity and/or our proprietary real-time 3D game engine. This is a wonderful opportunity in a creative company with high-profile customers and excellent growth potential.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Write applications to create engaging AR/VR, interactive installations, networked multi-screen experiences, high-quality 3D presentations, educational modules, and iOS/Android apps

· Program and script unique custom solutions using 3D game engines

· Utilize state-of-the-art XR technology, as well as stereoscopic 3D, multi-touch displays

· Take responsibility for interpreting and implementing designs and customer requirements

· Contribute ideas and improvements to project designs, pipelines and tools

· Commit to delivering high-quality, polished and reliable software

· Document, organize, and maintain new code, helping to grow the company’s code base

REQUIREMENTS

· At least one completed, commercially-shipped game title or interactive 3D product

· Experience programming with recent PC or console game engines or 3D frameworks

· In-depth knowledge of sophisticated high-level scripting

· Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with team members of varied backgrounds

· Self-motivated, with strong problem-solving and time-management skills

· Must be reliable, flexible and punctual

DESIRED SKILLS AND PLUSES

· Expert knowledge of ARKit, ARCore, Unity and/or Unreal Engine

· Experience with WPF and .NET on Microsoft Surface an advantage

· Knowledge of JavaScript, ActionScript, Python, PHP, HTML, SQL a plus

· Experience with client/server networking and audio/video streaming a plus

· Experience interfacing with varied multimedia hardware and software technologies a plus

· B.S. in computer science or equivalent job experience

This position requires a strong understanding of value proposition creation and then various marketing tactics to communicate those propositionsThis role will work closely with sales, brand advertising, marketing technologies, marketing insights/analytics, supply chain, and product management to develop, implement and measure integrated, comprehensive marketing programs that align with the businesses strategic priorities while increasing demand and preference for Carrier products and services. Analyze programs and recommend strategic and annual improvements based on distributor and contractor/engineer voice of customer.* Participate on cross-functional teams on channel programming, promotion & incentives objectives.* Plan and guide activities in accordance with strategic plans, annual objectives and profit plans to improve market share, sales levels, profit margins, and return on capital employed.* Develop content, strategy for trade advertising, channel websites, social media and apps.* Lead the development of alternative channels to market while working to enhance the current contractor/engineer conversion process.* Create an effective, integrated lead management process.* Synthesize competitive intelligence and market trends to develop strategies in promotional planning versus competitors. Seek customer input on needs and requirements that lead to new, more competitive products, applications and services.LEVEL OF RESPONSIBILITY:* Responsible for several components of a project or a complex component of a larger project.* Contributes to their team or department by applying their knowledge of one or more functional areas.* Fully developed professional able to work without direct guidance or direction from others.* Has in-depth knowledge of the discipline and role.TYPICAL EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:* BA/BS degree w/4-7+ years experience* MA/MS degree w/2-5+ years experienceKEY QUALIFICATIONS:* 5+ years in HVAC and/or similar industry. Experience must include product management, business development and/or sales and marketing with a proven record in achieving project milestones under tight schedules.* Proven ability to develop business strategy and drive implementation within a multi-channel setting.* Thorough understanding of marketplace dynamics including industry trends and assessment of key competitors' programs.* Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to pull data from assorted sources and synthesis in both graphic and verbal format, so that it is easily understood by the target audience.* Successful experience in working in a matrix environment.* Proven capacity to communicate professionally in written and verbal format across a wide audience.* ACE Associates certification desired.* Advanced level skills with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Skills with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Premiere, InDesign, Illustrator) a plus.* Highly organized with strong attention to detail, while also able to manage multiple priorities.* Fluency in English required, knowledge of French & Spanish is a plus.Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
