Job Title: Sales & Events Coordinator Best Western Inn & Suites
Job Description:
Benefits for full-time associates:
2 weeks of vacation pay your first year
4 sick days/year
2 hours paid volunteer time/month
Holiday pay
Medical, dental, and vision insurance plan options
Short term disability, long term disability, and life insurance plan options
401k retirement plan with company match
Discounts on hotel rooms worldwide
Direct deposit payroll
Get to know us! Facebook Instagram Twitter LinkedIn

As a family-owned business built on genuine relationships, the character and quality of our staff is integral to delivering the culture of service our clients expect. Members of our team serve each other, our partners, and their community with kindness and respect, while inspiring successful returns for everyone. The diverse and intimate size of Naples Hotel Group encourages each associate's voice to be heard, fostering a dynamic environment of communal creativity that's rife with opportunities for advancement.

Overview

We are seeking a high energy, creative, results-oriented individual to join our dynamic sales team. You will report to the Director of Sales while working in a fun and upbeat environment where your creative input is valued. In this position you will receive training on Delphi FDC sales system, Best Western sales tools and Opera inventory management. Responsibilities include conducting property tours, preparing group agreements, develop packages, inventory management, client consultations and event management, reporting using Microsoft Office Suite and effective communication with the operations team.

Responsibilities
Generate leads through internet prospecting, networking, and telemarketing.
Qualify sales leads generated by General Manager and Sales Management Team.
Coordinate and help plan events with clients, manage vendors and ensure proper execution of functions.
Develop social functions at the hotel and Tiki Bar that are open to the public and guests. Ensure proper execution and marketing of these events.
Assist in the development of packages with area golf courses, wedding venues and wellness get-a-ways.
Confidently conduct property tours with clear communication of hotels' amenities.
Participate in company sales blitzes and outside sales calls on a regular basis.
Represent the hotel in public affairs in the surrounding community and in the hospitality community in your region. Generate guest room and meeting revenue for the hotel by booking inquires (rate guidelines will be provided).
Handle individual reservations for clients/groups as needed. Ensure that all arrangements, including upgrades, are handled properly, coordinating with other departments through oral and written instruction.
Assist with follow-up on cut-off date, rooming lists, billing and other logistical requirements for upcoming groups and events.
Qualify and send leads to Centralized Sales Team through the business evaluation process.
Assist in training Front Desk Team to sales and revenue management initiatives.
Complete weekly sales activities to assigned hotel.
Participate in weekly/monthly/quarterly/annual meetings.
Implement and communicate revenue management reports: IE. Daily Detailed Report, 10 Days RevMax, etc.
Ensure the prompt servicing of groups and events. Assist with major group and event arrivals as needed.
Organize, file and retrieve documents in appropriate files/binders to maintain essential records used in the department operation.
Follow consistent sales office procedures by updating account database; record account activity, call reports, activities, and history in Delphi FDC.
Uses various computer word processing and other software packages to enter data, produce contracts, correspondence, forms, memorandum and other documents.
Be required to be cross trained with other departments and may be required to perform such task on a periodic basis.
Greet each guest that you encounter during your shift with a friendly smile.
Ensures uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional.
Follow hotel procedures for reporting and turning in lost and found articles.
Coordinate with other departments as necessary to resolve service requests or problems.
Ensure guest and associate safety by following established security procedures including emergency procedures, key security and protecting guest and company confidential information.
Follow all company and safety procedures; report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; and complete safety training and certifications.
Qualifications
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Interpersonal and time management skills
Direct sales skills
Guest relation skills
Problem solving/ service recovery skills
Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays
Strong Microsoft Office skills, specifically Excel
Appropriate professional appearance and demeanor
Passion for excellence and exceeding expectations
Attention to detail and organizational skills are a must
Love to learn
(ref. 26986)

Introduction

IBM Quantum is an industry first initiative to build universal quantum computers for business, engineering and science. This effort includes advancing the entire quantum computing technology stack and exploring applications to make quantum broadly usable and accessible. With a worldwide network of Fortune 500 companies, academic institutions, researchers, educators, and enthusiasts, we are committed to driving innovation for our clients in the IBM Q Network and the Qiskit Community.

Your Role and Responsibilities

IBM Quantum is hiring an Events Coordinator to help the Community Team execute in teaching the world about quantum computing and grow our community of researchers, students, educators, and coders on the path toward achieving quantum advantage. This is a position for a self-directed creative thinker, tinkerer, and doer who can assist a high performing team in helping to shift this very large organization into a community-first mindset. This job is internally focused.

The ideal candidate must possess communication skills appropriate for engagement with internal team members, developers, and scientists, but must be able to articulate strategy and execution metrics to a C-level audience. You need to be comfortable viewing problems that have very little definition and then planning the steps needed to move forward. Above all, you must be a dot connector across many internal and external stakeholders, comfortable with complex problem solving, ambiguity, and able to deliver clear content and creative strategies to address how a team can scale while still effectively collaborating and communicating with each other. This is a challenging job, but also very fun for the right candidate.

A successful candidate should be prepared to:
Collaborate with the Community Team to accomplish administrative tasks quickly and create norms and procedures in places they don't currently exist (including but not limited to new hire onboarding, scheduling team events, organizing attendees for client meetings, etc.)
Lead and coordinate a large community of Qiskit Advocates by helping to write & track CFP submissions, organizing digital meetups, reaching out to potential new members, and own a metrics dashboard.
Assist the Community team with internal and external communications, expense tracking, business operations, and program administration.
Align with the client success teams needs to staff external facing events; scheduling speakers, guest lectures, small workshops, meetups, etc.
Managing internal communications between IBM Q teams to ensure all parties are working diligently towards the same goals.
Work from the IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center (located in Yorktown Heights, NY) at least 2x a week.
Help with planning and organizing large events and conferences to give people hands-on time with quantum computing and provide access to professionals.
Assist with the scaling of existing internal programs (intern program, advocate program, internal research team events).
Manage various orders for the team and local events (food, supplies, furniture, etc.) and maintain communication with necessary stakeholders.
Manage swag fulfillment and shipments for various global events. This includes preparing all necessary customs forms and working with the shipping department at Yorktown to ensure timely delivery of event materials.
Required Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience with event planning and management; Experience with community management; Experience with Qiskit; Interaction with software development in large global teams.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience with open source projects and leadership; Background in quantum computing; Background in software development or project management.

About Business Unit

IBM Systems helps IT leaders think differently about their infrastructure. IBM servers and storage are no longer inanimate - they can understand, reason, and learn so our clients can innovate while avoiding IT issues. Our systems power the world's most important industries and our clients are the architects of the future. Join us to help build our leading-edge technology portfolio designed for cognitive business and optimized for cloud computing.

Your Life @ IBM

What matters to you when you're looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities - where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust - where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBM

IBM's greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.

Location Statement

NA

Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Job Description
About Us:

IDEA Lab Kids is a S.T.E.A.M. themed (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Math) enrichment educational center that offers unique and cutting-edge classes, summer camps, birthday parties, workshops, enrichment classes, after school programs, and event experiences. Our mission is to equip students with a diverse and solid educational and social foundation, so that they are prepared to lead in a rapidly changing, global society. We have an engaging, proprietary curriculum that is interdisciplinary, such as drone engineering, 3D Printing, Culinary Arts, Augmented Reality, Coding, Science Investigation, Robotics, and Entrepreneurship. Our students not only learn fascinating concepts, we also focus on developing crucial life skills: critical thinking, creativity, communication, collaboration, confidence, and perseverance. We exist to strengthen our community by serving our families and investing in children. We are hiring for our Ballantyne location for an Event Coordinator and Event Hosts. Learn more at www.Ballantyne.IdeaLabKids.com.

Are you a good fit?

Do you LOVE planning parties and events? Are you passionate about working with school-aged students? Good, because kids are at the heart of all that we do and parties and events are a BIG part of that. Do you want to join a highly collaborative, energetic and fun team? Life is too short to work with people you don't like. Do you love to learn, imagine, discover, explore, and achieve? The love of learning is contagious to the students you work with. If you share our passion for kids, teamwork, and learning, you'll love Idea Lab Kids.

Coordinator Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the Owner to create amazing parties for our clients ranging from Birthday Parties, S.T.E.A.M Fairs, Bar & Bat Mitzvah events to Open Houses, Girl Scout and Boy Scout Troop events and a Holiday Market - just to name a few.
Coordinate the details and logistics of all events both on and off the campus
Research and coordinate local events in which Idea Lab Kids can participate
Maintain the events decor and set up materials
Review and learn the Idea Lab Kids curriculum and materials before starting the party
Be the lead "Day Of" coordinator for events
Prioritize flawless execution and Happy Parents and Kids at every event
Find new opportunities for Idea Lab Kids to surprise and delight our families with high quality events both on and off of our campus
Hosts Responsibilities:
Support the Coordinator at events on the "Day Of"
Prioritize flawless execution and Happy Parents and Kids at every event
Research and coordinate local events in which Idea Lab Kids can participate
Be very familiar with the Idea Lab Kids curriculum and materials before starting the party
Assist with set up and clean up at events
Qualifications and Requirements:
High School Diploma - for Coordinator / Hosts may be current High School Students Grades 10-12
Event Management and Coordination Experience
Experience working with Children
First Aid / CPR (Certification Training will be provided if needed)
Clean background and drug test check
Self Starter, High Energy, Punctuality, Reliability, and Professionalism are must haves
Offering:
Coordinator, Part Time / Full Time
Monday - Friday: Day and Evening hours
Saturday - Sunday: Events as scheduled
$12 - $14 / hour depending on experience; Commision available for Events Secured by you
Hosts, Part Time
Saturday - Sunday: Events as scheduled
$10-$14 depending on experience
Extensive training and strong mentor support for Manager and Director opportunities as IDEA Lab Kids expands throughout Charlotte

Job Description
About Leap:

At Leap we’re building a world-class platform to drive growth for emerging brands by developing and operating branded retail stores. On the Leap platform, brands can easily open stores to connect with more customers and drive profitable growth - both offline and online. Branded stores *powered by Leap* deliver impactful and memorable customer experiences while helping brands to capture more customers, data and powerful insights that accelerate product innovation and overall growth. In our first year we've grown to 12 stores for 9 brands across New York City, San Francisco, Chicago and Miami and are set to grow even more rapidly in 2020 and beyond.

Mission for the position:

The Growth Marketing Manager, will work in partnership with the VP of Brand Management and the Leap Leadership Team in developing scalable, programmatic approaches and marketing plans to drive local traffic to the branded stores (and Brand websites) on the Leap platform. To do so, the CRM & Growth Marketing Manager will leverage Leap’s large customer file and build marketing programs and a ‘always on’ approach through Leap and Brand owned assets (email, CRM, social) and paid media (social, web, OOH, radio, direct mail, etc) at both the local and regional level. Understanding the full cycle of strategy, creative, buying, implementation, tracking/optimization will be paramount for success in this role.

Key responsibilities:

Develop and execute a marketing strategy across owned and paid channels
Create and deploy store-level email CRM programing and flows setup inclusive of post visit NPS survey, product/store reviews, cross selling to other products and cross selling to other brands/stores
Create and deploy paid digital utilizing the audience & geo-targeting strategies to drive ramp new store openings and drive traffic to Leap powered stores (i.e. FB/IG paid media, google)
Partner with internal & external creative resources to create assets needed for owned assets and paid media activations
Explore and build offline marketing strategies that create synergies across brands to boost store performance (i.e multi-brand Direct mail, OOH)
Manage Leap owned assets (Instagram, Website, Twitter, Linkedin)
Collaborate directly with partner brands for regional test & learns that drive traffic to stores (Email CRM, Digital, Social, OOH, Print, Radio, etc)
Support the marketing and stores team in the development of brand-centric components of overall retail strategy (i.e. experiential marketing, sales process / content for staff trainings, etc.)
Manage budgets (by channel/brand), KPIs, optimizations and synthesis of results
Create and define benchmarks, recommendations and optimizations
Partner with the marketing, retail operations team and store managers synthesize and analyze marketing program performance and results
Create recommendations, case studies and guides to help brands understand marketing activations and investments that work to drive store performance
Drive new channels and cutting edge activations
Explore new technology, tools and platforms that can drive traffic & store performance both in marketing campaigns and in-store with test and learns.
Competencies & attributes for success:
+5 years experience in marketing with focus to email CRM, social & digital activations and brand building
Experience working at smaller, scrappy startup preferred with knowledge of retail, DTC, luxury and fashion brands landscape.
Well versed in direct (non agency) social media management (buying, deploying, measuring)
Experience in designing & creating digital content & printed collateral or working with external resources (i.e. freelancers)
Exceptional written and verbal communication ability
Strong creative and problem solving skills
Strong teamwork and leadership skills
Self starter, humble, quick learner, with high aptitude for self-improvement
Extreme attention to detail; ability to understand the big picture while operating in weeds
Outcomes & measures of success:
Successful email & digital program deployment and ongoing management including strategy, implementation, reporting, analysis and optimization, as measured against program performance targets for contribution to email performance, store traffic and sales.
Consistent timely delivery of marketing program performance reports
Development of new marketing programs for brands to opt into
Successful implementation of Leap Brand owned asset strategy by deploying engaging content and growing follower counts
Consistent successful collaboration with direct report management, store managers and staff and corporate administrative functional leaders (e.g. HR, etc.)
Contribution to the development of a team-oriented high performance culture within the firm

Hirschfeld Marketing Solutions (HMS) is seeking an experienced Fabrication Supervisor to oversee the day-to-day operations of the Fabrication Department, leading a team to create specialized experiential marketing assets.

We work with many different brands and business sectors, making every project unique. Our highly-skilled fabrication department is passionate about quality, customization, and focusing on the details. Projects include building and and up-fitting custom client assets such as enclosed customized trailers, vehicles and displays per client design specifications and may include up-fitting of interior flooring, seating, electronics, lighting, or other components.

HMS is an experiential marketing and lifestyle engagement agency located in Cornelius, NC. Since 2006, industry-leading companies have turned to HMS to develop creative ways of using sports and entertainment to connect their brands to the consumer. From event marketing and mobile tours to sponsorship and hospitality, HMS delivers innovative solutions that produce results.

Learn more about Hirschfeld Marketing Solutions at: www.hmsworldwide.com

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Fabrication Supervisor supports the operational performance of the Fabrication Department by:
Coordinating and directing activities of Fabrication Department, assigning tasks and working alongside staff to complete projects.
Establishing timelines and prioritizing to meet stringent deadlines.
Reviewing blueprints, drawings and other specification instructions to ensure accuracy.
Procurement of materials and equipment required to complete projects.
Instructing staff on procedures or methods and providing assistance as needed.
Overseeing and performing fabrication duties including but not limited to: Welding; setting up, adjusting, and operating both basic and specialized tools and equipment (including but not limited to: hand and power tools, drill press, mill, lathe, grinder, sander, saws, and other metal forming and shaping equipment).
Continuously inspecting work in progress and final products to ensure quality and accuracy.
Coaching, training, and monitoring team performance.
Monitoring adherence to company policies and procedures.
Promoting continuous improvement activities and collaborating with other departments when necessary.
Managing maintenance of equipment and machinery, providing technical support where necessary.
Ensuring safety and environmental practices throughout fabrication area.
Other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum 8 years of welding and fabricating experience in a shop environment
Proven ability to prioritize, organize, and manage multiple projects with strict attention to detail and quality
Excellent communication skills
Understanding of budgeting principles and supply chain management
Strong leadership ability
Proficient computer skills
Team oriented with ability to work under pressure
ADDITIONAL PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Previous supervisory experience
Project management experience
Experiential marketing experience
MIG and TIG welding experience
Electrical experience
Basic carpentry and electrical skills
POSITION TYPE AND EXPECTED WORK HOURS:
Full time salaried position. Minimum 40 hrs. per week.

Job Type: Full-time

Carpentry: 1 year (Preferred)

Position: Marketing Manager

Location: Madison, WI

Full-time/Part-time/Temporary: Full-time

Travel (%): 10%

International: No

Job Summary

Duties and responsibilities of the Marketing Manager – Kid Trax, include managing the brand’s strategic growth through developing and maintaining a consistent positive image for the brand both online and offline. Supporting and assisting the Director of Marketing in all activities related to the brand.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Brand Marketing Responsibilities (30%)
Assists Director of Marketing in building a 1-3 year marketing strategy that connects the passion points of our consumers with our brand, product, and corporate strategies and objectives.
Defines, plans, and launches annual and seasonal campaigns and priorities for the business.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of the brand, category, competitors, and consumers to ensure relevant insights to fuel all marketing elements.
Manages internal and external partners to support the activation of integrated marketing plans. Establishing strong partnerships and processes with our internal teams (Creative services, PR, Sales, Retail, Product, Legal, Customer Service, and Finance) to effectively execute marketing campaigns.
Tracks and manages brand business performance. Analyzes and reports key marketing metrics with a view to strengthening marketing plan / activities for the future.
Manages the Kid Trax marketing budget, spending efficiently to achieve our marketing goals.
Strategically assesses current activation of assets across media, experiential marketing, spokespeople, festivals, and event properties to identify strategic white spaces where our brand should be.
Kid Trax Ecommerce Merchant (30%)
Define and execute our direct to consumer sales strategies for KidTraxToys.com.
Work collaboratively with sales and product management to establish and manage the online assortment including establishing pricing.
Build and execute digital marketing programs and campaigns to drive traffic and profitable sales on KidTraxtoys.com.
Collaborate with the digital marketing team on enhancing SEO and UX.
Manages and executes the Email Marketing program delivering growth in email database and growth in sales conversion.
Content Marketing Duties (20%)
Leads the creation and execution of consumer programs, campaigns, and annual high-profile product launches.
Evaluates creative ideas and thinking with a critical eye and understanding of the brand equity, vision and strategic priorities.
Manages the influencer program, seeking out, vetting, and selecting appropriate individuals to represent the Kid Trax brand.
Develop content for the brand website; keeping in mind brand voice and consumer journey optimization.
Maintain awareness of brand standards and guidelines, and make sure they are implemented for all assets before they are deployed to digital channels.
Measures/analyzes performance of all web activity; including traffic, content views, and demographics, and provide insights and key learnings to affiliated teams.
Social Media & Digital Marketing (10%)
Drives a holistic social media channel strategy that considers brand & product representation.
Build and manage all aspects of multiple social media accounts, including community development and content creation.
Create sharp, enticing content (including, but not limited to Facebook posts, Tweets, Instagram Posts, Instagram stories, and short format videos) which engage the brand’s audience across social channels.
Manage and implement a paid digital and social paid media advertising plan, using data, driven decision making.
Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.
Other Duties Assigned (10%)
Assist in presenting at key customer meetings on key Kid Trax initiatives.
Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
Follows internal controls and company policies set by Pacific Cycle Inc. and Dorel Sports.
Contributes to the success of Pacific Cycle Inc. by leading or assisting with other projects and tasks as assigned.
Minimum Requirements
College education ideally with degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications.
Masters study or degree a benefit.
At least five years experience in marketing role with social media responsibilities.
Experience in selling directly online
Enthusiasm and energy for the position
Passionate about marketing
Outstanding communicator and writer
Exhibit Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) computer skills
Must have own transportation
Will work on site during regular business hours
Team player who enjoys working with others
Dependable
Outgoing and friendly
Self-motivated and creative idea generator
Key Competencies
Innovative
Proactive and takes action without being prompted
Creativity
Generates original ideas, encourages new ways of thinking, explores options, and develops innovative solutions
Functional/Technical Expertise
Remains current in their area of expertise and serves as a resource in that area of the organization
Change Agility
Adaptable
Embraces needed change and modifies their behavior when appropriate to achieve organizational objectives
Effective in the face of ambiguity
Results Orientation
Maintains an appropriate focus on outcomes and accomplishments
Motivated by achievement, and persist until the goal is reached
Conveys a sense of urgency to make things happen
Respects the need to balance short- and long-term goals
Influence
Skilled at directing, persuading, and motivating others
Ability to flex their style to direct, collaborate, or empower, as the situation requires

Overview

When you join Hines, you will work alongside innovative leaders who set the standards responsible for our reputation as an industry leader today, and you'll be a part of shaping our future in the years to come.

Responsibilities

As an Event Coordinator - Facilities Logistics with Hines, you will support the delivery of internal meetings and events, inclusive of furniture and equipment setups. Working with your Facilities Events & Amenities Team colleagues, you will liaise with Event Hosts, key collaborators (Facilities, Culinary, Reception, Transportation, Security and Audio-Visual teams), and vendor partners to ensure an optimal onsite event experience. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
In conjunction with campus Event Planners, support the full life cycle of internal meetings and events across the Facebook Campus
Manage campus-wide event space calendars
Respond to assigned meeting and event requests through the Internal Events Platform within the designated SLA (service level agreement)
Become an expert on all campus policies and event space capabilities; ensure all building and team procedures are adhered to, provide Event Hosts with information on event space configurations and capacities, and recommend the most effective setup for the event type and size based on event space availability
Communicate effectively with Event Hosts, key collaborators, and vendor partners to ensure all equipment and setup requirements have been captured prior to each event
Set up and manage event spaces on the day of the event, including: execution of appropriate room configuration, fulfillment of requested event materials, communication with internal teams and vendors, and troubleshooting for the Event Host as needs arise
Partner with campus Event Planners to collect and record employee and vendor feedback; identify opportunities for operational and service improvements
Maintain a working inventory of conference room furniture and equipment for meetings and events; conduct regular inspections to maintain functionality and aesthetic integrity of conference facilities and equipment
Coordinate load-in, setup, and strike of external vendors; facilitate the collection of vendor documentation, including site access agreements and certificates of insurance
Assist with the delivery of Amenities offerings, including pop-up shops, onsite services, conveniences, and perks, as needed
Collaborate with supervisor and Facilities Team to order new supplies and equipment as needed
Create, maintain, and update internal team documents, resources, and tools as required
Assist other Facilities departments as necessary
Qualifications

Minimum requirements include:
Bachelor's degree preferred; High school diploma or equivalent from an accredited institution required
One or more years of general events experience
Knowledge of the event planning process, with a focus on logistics
Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Experience navigating the constraints of high-rise buildings and partnering with municipal agencies and departments preferred
Must be able to proactively think, plan, and execute in a deadline-driven environment
Strong customer satisfaction focus, interpersonal skills, and ability to engage with interdepartmental teams
Ability to work creatively, collaboratively, and independently to deliver on responsibilities
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, coordinate, and complete tasks with a high degree of accuracy and timeliness, and with minimal supervision
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated knowledge of Windows operating systems and Microsoft Office Suite software, including but not limited to Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, PowerPoint and graphics software
Experience with collaboration platforms, including Google Drive, Quip, and Sharepoint
Experience with graphic design programs preferred, including Adobe Creative Suite
Must be able to lift at least 25 pounds
Closing

Hines is a privately owned global real estate investment firm founded in 1957 with a presence in 219 cities in 23 countries. Hines has approximately $124.3 billion of assets under management, including $63.8 billion for which Hines provides fiduciary investment management services, and $60.5 billion for which Hines provides third-party property-level services. The firm has 148 developments currently underway around the world. Historically, Hines has developed, redeveloped or acquired 1,362 properties, totaling over 449 million square feet. The firm's current property and asset management portfolio includes 514 properties, representing over 222 million square feet. With extensive experience in investments across the risk spectrum and all property types, and a pioneering commitment to sustainability, Hines is one of the largest and most-respected real estate organizations in the world. Visit www.hines.com for more information.

Job Title: Regional Marketing Manager Acute Care & Preventive Drugs – NA
Job Description:
Job Description Summary
As part of the BDM – Pharmaceutical system division, the Regional Marketing Manager Acute Care & Preventive drug (Anticoagulant & Vaccines) NA is accountable for planning, executing and measuring a range of multi-touch marketing programs in NA for a defined set of customers in the therapeutic class defined as: Acute Care specialities & preventive drugs. Key activities of the role will include to drive Acute Care specialities & Preventive drugs revenue, to own Acute & Preventive drugs revenue care account-based planning and intelligence gathering, to drive demand creation and sales enablement and to support branding. The role requires Acute care & Preventive drugs segment knowledge and product expertise in the area of Pre-Fillable syringes.

Prioritize and group accounts by common attributes in the acute care & Preventive drugs segments

Work X-functionally especially with Sales, portfolio marketing, demand generation, commercial excellence to define and establish workflows eg: campaign personalization and execution, leads hand-offs
Partner with portfolio marketing, business directors to provide on-going data & insights into acute care & Preventive drugs accounts from internal & external sources to drive relevance and timely execution
Define and execute marketing programs on behalf of sales and demonstrate to sales account manager how to execute program element on their own
Provide light customization of campaigns according to analysis of buyer journey & needs, Acute care & Preventive drugs market trends

Work with demand generation, digital teams to adapt campaign messaging and improve response and opportunity conversion rate
Provide sales enablement to drive customer centricity and revenue impact

leadership skills and cross-functional participation with the ability to manage internal and external stakeholders

Problem solving
Customer focus

Position Overview
This role supports and contributes in the development and management of our Channel Partners to maximize the impact of marketing campaigns. Impacts sales results by co-coordinating and executing marketing and product launch activities among others. Responsible for driving alignment and amplification of Autodesk’s marketing within the assigned partners. This position requires a full understanding of how to apply Autodesk’s marketing strategies effectively along with our channel partners to drive exceptional business growth.

Working closely with account managers in the sales organization to drive partner success & developing best in class marketing with our partners. We are searching for an exceptional Channel Marketing Manager to help our channel partners drive unprecedented business growth in for Autodesk software. The Channel Marketing Manager is responsible for developing marketing plans and activities through our channel partner network to support Autodesk business goals. This role includes engaging directly with our partners to ensure marketing plans are understood and executed, as well as working closely with account managers in the sales organization to drive partner success. The ability to consult and support tactically at the point of marketing execution with all levels within the partner organization, including innovating and influencing at senior levels, is key to success in this role.

Responsibilities
Responsible for driving alignment and amplification of Autodesk’s marketing within the assigned partners. This position requires a full understanding of how to apply Autodesk’s marketing strategies effectively along with our channel partners to drive exceptional business growth
Establish a trusted advisor relationship with partners by demonstrating a strong understanding of the partners business
Develop strong relationships with partner managers and strategic internal teams to drive partner success & developing best in class marketing with our partners
Innovating and influencing at senior levels in our partners, plus the ability to consult and support tactically at the point of marketing execution.
The role requires a blend of marketing acumen applied to business development with our partners
Implementing channel campaigns to expand market share and pursue aggressive growth targets.
Actively support partner marketing planning process including quarterly and annual marketing plans
Review Sales/POS/ Promotions analysis to provide strategic, actionable recommendations for channel offerings, demand and campaign planning.
Create and manage communications with channel partners to drive awareness of campaigns, product updates, and business news
Increase partner marketing capability through consistent marketing training
Support Autodesk marketing compliance through our partners to increase alignment
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in related field such as business or marketing
5 years of professional work experience, ideally managing external partners
Must be a confident communicator and presenter

Experience managing marketing budgets ideally within a channel marketing setting
An eye for detail and acute stakeholder awareness to ensure internal and external alignment
Stakeholder management experience with the ability to build trust quickly
To be adaptable to changing priorities
Strong critical thinking skills
Innovation Management: Identify and bring ideas to the market by effectively managing the creative and implementation process
Travel is required 25" of time
Bilingual in Spanish and/or Portuguese is highly desirable

POSITION: Resident Service Associate (Events/Life Enrichment)

POSITION SUMMARY:

In this rewarding position, you will develop, plan and implement a wide variety of stimulating, high-quality programs that meet the intellectual, spiritual, emotional, and individual needs of a diverse community. The successful candidate will work directly with the residents leading and participating in various activities and outings. If you are looking for a fast-paced and fun work environment, this might be the right place for you!

ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

·Coordinators will help facilitate socials, games, crafts, cooking, movies, outings, outside time, and many other fun activities on any given day

·Work with the Activities Department to bring new and exciting ideas to Balfour’s monthly calendar and encourages new suggestions

·Develop a written recreation plan of care for each resident, under the supervision of the Director/Manager

·Plans of care should identify the problems, needs, and goals of the resident

·Document progress of residents according to state, federal and Balfour Senior Living requirements

·Utilize the standard assessment tool and care plan information in providing daily services to residents and maintains confidentiality of all resident information

·Document 1:1 contact with residents and attendance at all therapeutic and recreational programs

·Support resident spiritual needs

·Work with the Chaplain and/or community clergy to provide services (e.g., spiritual reading material, visits, religious programming)

·Integrate residents with the outside community through internal activities and outings (e.g., intergenerational programs, community service projects, trips, maintaining resident connections with outside community organizations)

·Attend all in-service education programs mandated by Balfour Senior Living, state and federal guidelines

·Demonstrated talent for interacting with a wide variety of people, particularly the elderly and their family members

·Ability to communicate openly, honestly and responsibly with others

·Ability to maintain a customer focus treating others with respect and integrity

·Ability to adapt and work effectively as part of a team and independently

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE,& SKILLS:

·Effective verbal and written communication skills required

·Basic ability to read, write, understand, speak and follow direction in the English language

·Must be able to drive a company vehicle (town car and 14 passenger van - training is provided)

·Must possess a current driver's license and ability to meet approved driver requirements

·Must be at least 21 years old (insurance purposes)

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE,& SKILLS:

·Previous experience in organizing activities or event planning preferred

·1 year Activities or Recreation Services experience preferred

·Ability to read a map and/or be familiar with the surrounding area (based on location)

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORKING CONDITIONS:

·Ability to push/pull objects and lift/carry between 20-50 pounds unassisted on a frequent basis (pending location or requested job duties)

·Ability to sit, stand, and/or walk for long periods of time

·Must be able to work weekends/holidays as needed

·May be exposed to unpleasant odors, contagious diseases and blood borne pathogens

·Balfour is a pet-friendly community; you may be exposed to animal hair and dander

·Our communities provide assisted living, assisted living memory care, and skilled nursing (pending location)undefined

BENEFITS:

·Medical, dental, and vision plan (full-time and ¾ time employees only)

·PTO& Sick Time

·Tuition Reimbursement Program

·Employee Referral Bonus Program

The overall strategy and planning of tradeshows, conferences, and client events; Marketing Development Funds management; event planning policies and procedures; event contracts and budgets; monthly reporting to leadership.

Works with Alliance Manager to build and maintain relationships with local organizations where Logically has a presence to drive attendance for branded and educational events

Capable of resolving escalated logistical issues that requires coordination with other departments

Bachelors degree
At least 3 years planning events for a mid-size company
Able to work independently
Work well under pressure and meet deadlines;
Strong written and verbal skills
Good understanding of basic Office software and ability to learn Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software
Proactive and enthusiastic attitude
As the Field Marketig Manager this position is occasionally required to drive to tradeshows, conferences, and client events to build, network and maintain relationships with vendors, prospects, event staff, event attendees on occasion may encounter weather related conditions such as hot, cold, wet, windy, humid conditions.

Wellness program

"If you don't love interacting with people, tinkering with the latest technology and traveling, you're on the wrong page of the Internet. If you do, we want to chat with you! Our Event Managers have a blast working on spiffy events, with fancy customers, in memorable locations." - William Griggs, CEO of VirtualRealityRental.co

1. Three things that make you totally awesome
Why you'd like to be a part of the VirtualRealityRental.co team

If you repeated the word "nope" as you read through the list above, this is probably not the job for you. If you repeated the word "yup" over and over— keep reading…


Who is VirtualRealityRental.co?

VirtualRealityRental.co is a group of talented and passionate people that help companies like Cadillac, Twitter, and Nike deliver smiles to their event attendees. We are looking to grow our team with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for pushing the envelope of live events and delivering smiles all around the world.


Our Culture:
Builders: We were born to build
Leaders: We lead others to success
Learners: We never waste a failure or think we know it all
Strategists: We are expert resource allocators
Action Heroes: We have a bias towards action
High Fivers: We give credit where credit is due


How the Role Works

The Event Manager's role is to manage and execute client events on site. In the process, the Event Manager will be responsible for promoting the VirtualRealityRental.co brand and further developing client relationships. The Events Manager will work closely with our internal Operations team to create transformational event experiences for strategic clients around the world. You must be upbeat, disarming, polished, able to handle adversity with grace, disciplined, enthusiastic, able to think on your feet, and mentally resilient. Not to mention, you must love to travel.

This is a part-time, remote, events-based position. You will be classified as a 1099 contract worker, and can expect a non-fixed work schedule. At this time, we are only looking to bring on new team members who live in Austin.

As an Event Manager you will...
Get to attend some of the coolest parties/conferences/conventions out there
Set up virtual reality stations, and wow all of the event attendees with awesomeness that is VR
Be responsible for the execution of all on-site event activities
Be the main point of contact for our clients on-site
Be proactive and fully prepared for every event
Provide status updates for each event from start to finish
Be an ambassador for VRR.co while at the event
Conduct post-event review to support continuous improvement of processes and practices for future events
This role requires someone who is highly motivated, loves to make people smile, and has proven experience crushing the responsibilities listed above.

If you're still here reading and believe you are a good fit, we're over the moon excited to hear from you!

About Enel X

Enel X is an innovative Silicon Valley provider of electric vehicle (EV) charging solutions built upon a disruptive business model: by selling our market-leading JuiceBox smart-grid EV charging stations into a rapidly-expanding electric vehicle market, we provide immediate benefit to EV owners and charging station operators while simultaneously delivering valuable, cloud-based load management services to utilities and grid operators. As a result, drivers receive fast, IoT charging and eMotorWerks shares in “energy services” value generated by these distributed energy resources.

Our mission is to dramatically accelerate EV adoption through advanced technologies and innovative solutions. The company's flagship residential product, a connected level 2 EV charging station and mobile app, has already helped over 35,000 drivers go electric.

We are looking for a revenue-centric marketer with experience developing and deploying multi-channel campaigns to drive demand for our commercial and residential EV charging stations. This position will support sales in all verticals with a specific focus on automotive sales.
The ideal candidate will have significant experience in B2B and B2B2C demand generation for technology products. Experience working with automotive manufacturers and developing programs to support sales to and through car dealerships is preferred.
Demand programs will include but will not be limited to channel marketing programs, online and email marketing programs, in-person and virtual events, targeted content development, sales collateral.

- Design and deploy demand generation programs across all marketing and sales channels with a focus on automotive sales
- Work collaboratively with our Global and North American Automotive sales team to design effective sales collateral for the automotive channel
- Work with our Online Marketing Manager and Web Development team to create automotive e-stores.
- Collaborate with Online Manager to monitor inventory, track sales revenue and maintain sales forecasts on all automotive estores
- Develop targeted automotive content assets
- Manage assigned marketing budget to reach revenue goals for the automotive channel and provide support for other verticals as needed
- Report and track marketing KPIs (demand generation metrics, revenue generation, marketing ROI, margins, etc.)
- Build segmentation strategies and execute cross-channel marketing strategy to optimize programs
- Leverage existing digital marketing and graphic design vendors, and recommend additional vendors as needed
- Work closely with the Global and North American Marketing, Communications, Client Success, and Products teams to support Enel X automotive strategy in North America
- Investigate and test new demand generation tactics, technology, and processes to drive greater effectiveness and efficiency
- Identify optimization opportunities, implement testing, and adjust programs to maximize marketing
- Develop a deep understanding of our customers, our product, our target audience, and the buyer’s journey.
- Maintain and report competitive analysis for the automotive channel
- Develop, maintain, and execute a quarterly demand generation plan for the automotive channel
- Measure, analyze, and report campaign performance
- Work closely with the Global and North American Sales, Communications, Client Success, and Products teams to support Enel X automotive strategy in North America
- Investigate and test new demand generation tactics, technology, and processes to drive greater ROMI
- Identify optimization opportunities, implement testing, and adjust programs as needed

DESCRIPTION


Ring is searching for a Channel Marketing Manager who will join the Channel Marketing team based at our HQ in Santa Monica, CA will report to the Head of Channel Marketing.

The CMM will be responsible for developing shopper marketing/channel marketing programs, in collaboration with Ring, Channel Marketing and Sales, to optimize engagement of smart home/home security shoppers at key accounts while providing a platform for strategic selling and drive increased sell through. To be successful, the CMM must strive to develop and maintain strong working relationships internally and with retailers collaborating with stakeholders to identify new opportunities, developing strategies, designing programs, and then executing, measuring, and evaluating them against agreed upon business goals and objectives.

Responsibilities:
· Lead channel marketing program development at the key accounts. Collaborate with Sales on assortment discussions, distribution expansion requests, the CMM owns the retail experience from a product, category, training, visual, and brand development perspective.
· Work with the teams to leverage marketing programs for strategic selling opportunities. Ensure that all relevant lenses are taken into consideration when developing retailer strategies and plans – the shopper, the retailer, and Ring.
· Project manage all of the creative submissions and work closely with the Creative Director to deliver assets against timelines, properly allocate the creative resources needed for the specific project kick offs, and budget management for all creative asks and agency support.
· Build and implement processes to scale marketing initiatives globally, create systems for creative project submissions to ensure efficiency and visibility across all cross functional teams including marketing, sales and go-to-market.
· Thorough understanding of online, offline, and direct marketing principles and practices to develop and sustain strong partner relationships to deepen leadership position in category across strategic growth retailer, managing our existing portfolio as well as new product launches.
· Manage retailer specific marketing needs and overall execution including: promotion strategy execution, creative development, in-store POP and display execution, retailer .com and digital media and content needs.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS


· 3+ years of marketing experience
· Experience using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements
· Experience using Microsoft Excel to manipulate and analyze data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


· 5+ years of experience with marketing programs, building and managing retail marketing programs and operations in technology, CE, or retail industries.
· Bachelor’s Degree.
· 2+ years of channel marketing experience working with 2-3 retailers, such as Best Buy, Target, Bed Bath and Beyond, Kohls, Costco to create marketing plans with the specific account, execute the marketing plans against a budget and MDF and review ROI of the different marketing plans
· Business oriented strategic thinker with an ability to implement and make sound decisions quickly and efficiently.
· High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
· Composed, poised and professional demeanor with the ability to work in high pressure environment.
· Demonstrated ability to clearly communicate and influence stakeholders outside of immediate team – sales, leadership, regional teams and other functions within Marketing.
· Strong project management experience aligning cross-functional teams to properly execute creative, account marketing plans and in-store programs.

DEPARTMENT: Marketing

POSITION: Field Marketing Manager (4 Field-Based Positions: Dallas, Orlando, Chicago, Phoenix)

REPORTS TO: National Field Marketing Manager

PGA TOUR Superstore is an exciting, fast-paced and high energy environment, and supports the operations of nearly 50 retail locations across the U.S. We are seeking a qualified candidate to fulfill the role of Field Marketing Manager.

Position Summary

The Field Marketing Manager, reports directly to the National Manager of Field Marketing. This role is responsible for overseeing and support consistency in marketing standards and execution throughout assigned territory. Responsible for evaluating and providing feedback to store leadership and reporting up to District and Regional Managers. This leadership role models the PGA TOUR Superstore core values of cultivating our customers and developing our associates. The position utilizes strong business acumen and retail knowledge to formulate goals, develop objectives, and improve merchandising processes. In addition, this leader will build strong relationship of support and collaboration with their assigned District Manager and the General Manager’s within their territory.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities:
Responsible for 8-10 retail locations minimum.
Communicates and implements the company's marketing brand and media strategy in assigned regions to assist in achieving sales, profitability and traffic goals.
Identify local store initiatives based on trade area data to supplement the system wide media plans and develop local store marketing calendars to support system wide media plans
Evaluate all Local Partnerships Media Value as applicable
Ensures marketing resources are applied effectively and efficiently to maximize individual store or district performance.
Takes a leadership role in the marketing planning for new store openings in assigned territory in partnership with Store Operations, Brand Marketing including Local Media and Event planning
Conduct regular in-market visits with store leadership to discuss recent and upcoming marketing initiatives; provide guidance and feedback as needed and to ensure quality and consistency with marketing calendar and plans. (requires approximately 50% travel)
Create Opportunity and Competitive store specific plans to improve performance of stores in assigned territory as needed
Responsible for developing and driving the local marketing strategy for assigned territory in addition to coordinating and executing various elements of national campaigns with Brand Media Lead
Weekly visits to stores within driving distance, quarterly to remote location. Travel schedule will be provided.
Communicates weekly with the National Field Marketing Manager and acts as a communication conduit by providing key marketing leadership with feedback received from operations partners.
Communicates regularly and conducts weekly reviews with Regional Managers/District Managers – highlighting performance areas of opportunity and needs of their assigned territories.
Communicate with brand marketing team on communication issues (bulletins), marketing opportunities and media planning.
Responds to request for feedback, information or other marketing needs within 24 hours or in a timely manner.
Ability to balance multiple projects across stores in territory.
Minimum Qualifications:
Education: The knowledge, skills, and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor’s degree from four-year college/university or equivalent.
Experience: Five (5) years of experience in multi-unit Field Marketing or Advertising Agency with local media planning and account services experience. Passion for Golf and Tennis is highly desired.
Communication: Candidates must possess strong listening and interpersonal skills. Must be able to influence and communicate in both written and verbal form with conviction and credibility, adapting message to suit level of audience. Must have ability to influence decision making using consumer and business insight to drive results
Analytical: Candidates must have strong strategic skills, forecast business needs, and develop comprehensive solutions to complex problems. Strong analytical abilities and understanding of business model and profitability issues. Experience in planning and managing budgets.
Flexibility: a positive attitude, enthusiasm and excellent collaboration skills
Computer: Candidates must have strong computer skills utilizing the internet, Outlook and Microsoft Office Suite including MS TEAMS
Organization: Candidates must be able to effectively multi-task and manage competing priorities across multiple store locations, as well as properly ensure resources are allocated to meet objectives.
Scheduling: Field Marketing Manager role must be able to accommodate a retail schedule (flexible, including nights, weekends, and holidays), and must be willing and able to travel for business including overnight travel. As well as possess the ability to work independently and with teams.
Physical Requirements:
Field Marketing Manager role must be able to stand for extended periods of time, climb up and down a ladder, move around the store, and lift a 30 lb. box overhead. Regular travel required within respective territory. Travel by plane is a requirement.
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

AKEEP KSL-BUD Event Coordinator

To use AKEEP programs as tools and resources that empower students in low-income communities, minority groups and under-represented immigrants to achieve their best academically by identifying their leadership potential for local educational and economic prosperity. AKEEP focuses on two core programs, KLC (Korean Language and Culture) and the BUD (Bridge of Unity in Diversity) Project. KLC programs include a 3-week youth summer camp governed by the National Security Agency and the National Foreign Language Center as well as youth and community language courses and cultural art education workshops. The BUD Project is composed of youth leadership training, and character building, comprehensive arts and theater production, and bridging community relations.
Objectives:
Develop annual events calendar including but not limited to the Korean Cultural Experience, Taste of Korea, appreciation events;
set up participation in external events that support A-KEEP’s mission, values and vision in the first quarter;
Establish fundraising goals, plan fundraising efforts and track progress throughout the service contract term;
Manage new and current donors through appropriate identification, cultivation and solicitation throughout the service contract term;
Work closely with the public relations and marketing team and graphic designer on the creation of event publications, signage, enhancing the event visibility in the local and regional community at minimum 1-month prior to each events’ start date;
Develop target markets, business opportunities and program participants through data mining, research, community involvement, and other experiences;
Update quarterly and monthly calendars and collateral, as information becomes more relevant and detailed, events should drive usage and retention;
Ensure proper execution of events;

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for developing and executing local marketing campaigns in assigned markets to gain and retain new and existing customers. Collaborates with key cross functional teams and outside vendors to support campaigns. Manages on-going compliance with assigned expense budgets and adheres to purchase request and expense reporting guidelines

Collaborates with cross functional teams in aligning efforts, resources and budget allocations.

Provides excellent internal customer service and maintains open communication with all associates, management and contractors

Demonstrated project management and organizational skills; proven ability to manage multiple projects and priorities with excellent follow-through
Strategic thinker who can articulate objectives into actionable campaigns that produce results
Excellent written and oral communication skills

The primary role of the Field Marketing Manager is to provide local/regional marketing planning and implementation to Beltone's network of dealers and retail owned stores covering the following Western states: Washington, Oregon, California, Arizona, Idaho, Nevada, Utah and Colorado.

This is a key marketing leadership position and is responsible for working closely with regional operation and sales directors as well as owners of hearing aid stores to develop marketing plans and help implement local outreach programs. The Field Marketing Manager must have experience in advertising, direct mail, digital and be well versed in implementing local marketing/outreach tactics. This is a telecommuting position working from a home office. The position can be based anywhere, however residence in one of the locations listed above is preferred. There is 40% per week travel in the Western US region. ABOUT THE JOB

We are looking for a Field Marketing Manager, Central to join our Marketing team. OneStream Software, a leading corporate performance management (CPM) platform for the office of finance. The candidate will be responsible for the design, implementation, and execution of field marketing and ABM campaigns and events. S/he will work closely with marketing and sales teams to create and execute on demand generation activities which drive the creation of pipeline.

Primary responsibilities:
Develop field marketing plan quarterly, utilizing tactics like email marketing, online marketing, direct mail, live events, etc.
Plan and complete field marketing campaigns after conducting preliminary research
Plan and manage relevant regional events, to meet or exceed projected lead targets
Maintain relationships with 3rd-party vendors and venues for event planning/logistics
Plan and manage ABM campaigns for region
Develop knowledge of all product lines/services and positioning
Manage messaging for social media activity surrounding field marketing campaigns
Track expenses and budget in an organized fashion
Report regularly on the status and performance of field marketing activities
Document and share lead/customer intelligence with sales team
This is an exciting opportunity to help build our fast-growing international company, your career, as well as the careers of others. The ideal candidate will be passionate about developing and helping others within our company and the community, and have a high interest in the OneStream mission and being an integral part of a collaborative, tight-knit firm. A passion for technology and learning, and the ability to grow others are vital for success in this role.

QUALITIES OF A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE
3-5 years experience in field marketing, B2B SaaS business a plus
Strong oral, written, and verbal communication skills
Experience with marketing automation tools, HubSpot a plus
Demonstrated track record in field and promotional marketing
Exceptional leadership and management skills
Strong organizational skills with emphasis on time management
Strong interpersonal skills and negotiation skills
Ability to work independently or in groups including account managers and sales mgt.
Self-motivated with demonstrated flexibility and adaptability
Strong analytical skills with focus towards details
Ability to handle pressure and work in a constantly changing atmosphere
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Knowledge and Experience

Excellent organization and ability to work independently.

Personal Attributes
Organized.

Strong reasoning skills

Sound decision making skills

Experience with OneStream Software not required.
WHO WE ARE

OneStream Software is a privately held software company created by the same team that invented the leading financial solutions of the last decade. We provide a unified Corporate Performance Management (CPM) platform which enables the enterprise to simplify financial consolidation, reporting, budgeting and forecasting for complex organizations. Our powerful extensibility enables the enterprise to deliver additional analytic solutions without adding any technical complexity. By delivering multiple solutions in one application, we offer increased capabilities for financial reporting and analysis while reducing the risk, complexity and total cost of ownership for our customers. We are driven by our mission statement that every customer must be a reference and success.

We are equally fanatical about our OneStream family members (formally known as employees). We are a team in every sense of the word. Everyone here is approachable and excited to pitch in and help. We work hard and play hard. The right candidate is someone who is easy to get along with, always willing to lend a hand, excited about coming to work, and happy to contribute to the team. We have a casual dress environment and modern office with onsite gym!

WHY JOIN THE ONESTREAM TEAM

Benefits at OneStream Software OneStream employees are passionate, hardworking individuals who go above and beyond to keep our customers happy and follow through on our mission statement. Marketing Mix & Attribution Modeling Lead


Job Description :

Marketing leads the development of integrated marketing strategies across 90 plus business lines and national geography. The group is responsible for brand strategy and advertising, database and experiential marketing including, integrated program and product development, market research and related customer analytics, and diverse segments strategy and business development.

The newly formed Marketing Insights & Analytics team will build a best-in class decision support organization that can provide insights to inform our business/customer marketing and product strategy, as well as our broader strategic initiatives. Marketing Measurement is a critical team within the Marketing Insights & Analytics team that is responsible for understanding the performance of marketing campaigns in online and offline channels. In addition, the team is responsible for analyzing and establishing the cumulative impact of all marketing in both the short-term and long-term.

The role of Marketing Mix & Attribution Modeling Lead is a highly quantitative role with responsibilities including:

•Build, maintain and evolve market level mix models to estimate causal impacts of marketing activities on financial outcomes in the short and long term

•Build, maintain and evolve customer level attribution models to explain longitudinal behavioral shifts associated with exposure to a varying combination of touch point exposures

•Measure the long-term impacts on customer behavior

•Automate input ETL, iterative solution search and operationalization of models

This person will have significant interactions with other analytics teams in Marketing Insights & Analytics and is expected to provide analytical thought leadership and bring cutting edge statistical knowledge to solve complex marketing problems. Deep technical skills, ability to continuously learn from industry and academic work, and strong communication skills will be determining factors in selection.

A successful applicant will demonstrate:

•Ability to deliver critical insights and analysis

•Collaborative partnership and strong influencing skills

•Ability to extract insights to identify growth opportunities and effectively communicate outcomes and recommendations

•Lead effective data analysis that may suggest risk or opportunities

•Partnership/collaboration with marketing business partners and other enterprise teams

Required Qualifications:

•8+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling or a Master’s degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling

Desired Qualifications:

•Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis

•Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy

•Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

Other Desired Qualifications:

•8+ years of experience in regression based modeling

•5+ hands-on experience programming marketing mix modeling solutions in SAS

•Expertise on hierarchical Bayesian and MCMC approaches

•Proven history of developing innovative, cutting-edge causal measurement capabilities across the range of marketing activities, including TV, print, radio, OOH, paid search, display, online video, owned media, sponsorships and promotions

•Significant experience coding and maintaining stand along SAS-based applications

•Deep knowledge of statistical areas such as ANOVA, Multiple Regression, Time-series Modeling, Principal Component Analyses, Decision Trees, Clustering, etc

•Experience programming in R, SQL, Python and GAMS

•Experience working in marketing/ customer analytics organizations

•Demonstrated ability to play a leadership role in large, complex analytical projects

•Strong sense of ownership, relentless curiosity, and self-driven approach to problem solving

•Consistent pattern of digging into the raw respondent data

•Exceptionally strong technical background

•Experience/ exposure to data and analytics in Banking and Financial Services industry

Salary : $ 120k- $160k

They are three steps ahead of what's trending, with a creative eye on how to shape compelling, impactful, data-driven content, and have a zeal for knowing what will resonate socially and how to respond to trending cultural and mission-driven moments in real time.This position reports to the Vice President, Communities and New Platforms, and will be empowered to run large scale campaigns on an autonomous basis.Responsibilities:* Scale Bumble's influencer marketing strategy and team to translate our brand messaging and mission to new audiences, with the goal of both increasing brand awareness and user acquisition* You must have previous experience measuring and quantifying the impact of influencer investment* Lead the growing influencer marketing team, responsible for both high-touch, strategic celebrity and talent relationships, as well as "always on" influencer volume* Optimize the extended influencer team for impact - collaborating with external agencies and global influencer managers and stakeholders* Budgeting and forecasting a substantial annual budget, while constantly pushing for cost efficiency* Strong negotiation skills - run point on high profile celebrity and talent deals, while mentoring and growing a talented, ambitious team with a high volume deal pipeline* Demonstrated cross-functional leadership and collaboration: You will work closely with the creative, user acquisition, organic social, global brand, and executive leadership teams* Oversee the regular reporting of influencer activities and results to executive leadership and cross-functional teams, always ready to optimize for feedback and learnings in real-timeRequired experience, knowledge, and skills:* 10+ years experience in social media, influencer, marketing, and/or strategy roles* The rare "unicorn" blend of: 1) Hyper analytical, strategic, and able to measure the impact of influencer marketing activities to inform strategy and 2) Creative and charismatic firepower - love brainstorming, collaborating with different personalities, and constantly sharing new ideas and pushing innovation for influencer marketing* In-depth knowledge of influencer and social media trends, social and meme culture, and how a clearly defined brand can cut through* Solid understanding of the nuances of influencer deals among major established and emerging social media platforms (with a particular emphasis on Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube)* Promoting continual creative improvement and actively contributing to a culture of innovation, excellence and accountability* Passion for the Bumble brand, mission, and cultureAbout you:* An inspiring leader able to nurture, motivate, and advocate for a passionate, ambitious, growing influencer team* Take initiative in handling projects with minimal direction and proactively anticipating needs* High attention to detail* Self-starter: thrives on taking ownership of initiatives with limited oversight* Outstanding time-management and prioritization skills, with the ability to excel at multiple priorities under short deadlines* Unafraid to hustle, hustle, hustle and network, network, networkPlease apply by submitting your resume along with a cover letter explaining your potential impact on Bumble and why you're the ideal candidate for this role! The Virginia Quilt Museum is hiring for a Part-Time Marketing Coordinator and Event Planner. The Virginia Quilt Museum was founded in 1995 and is the Official Quilt Museum of the Commonwealth of Virginia. Charged with a mission of “celebrating and nurturing Virginia's quilting heritage," the Museum offers three floors of rotating, curated gallery space. Each round of exhibits features quilts from the Museum’s collection as well as traveling exhibitions. Heirloom quilts, contemporary quilts and art quilts are also typically featured simultaneously, allowing our visitors the chance to marvel at the extreme variety of styles, techniques, and themes present in quilts.

The Part-Time Marketing Coordinator and Event Planner will be responsible for creating and maintaining digital and print marketing content and materials, website management and social media presence. Also responsible for coordinating events including: planning, designing and managing event details under project guidelines. Must have excellent verbal, writing and editing skills: English usage, spelling, grammar, punctuation, and vocabulary. The ability to manage multiple tasks and projects with attention to detail and timeliness. An ability to effectively use judgment and produce a quality work product within tight time constraints. Excel at building relationships and work collaboratively with Museum staff and volunteers and attend staff meetings. Excellent communication, effective listening, and interpersonal skills a must. Will work closely with the Executive Director and Events Committee. Must work at the museum 20-25 hours per week, including events which will occur on the weekends and after hours and one Saturday per month.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Marketing:
Create, design, and update website.
Create and design high quality digital and print marketing content for brochures, promotions, advertisements, etc.; manage ordering process.
Proactive in meeting important deadlines.
Be highly organized.
Build, design and gather content for digital newsletter sent out monthly.
Update all brochures as needed; create flyers, rack cards, press releases, community calendars, and reach out to quilt guilds, museums, historical societies, and national quilt shows.
Identify and recommend implementation of digital and/or social media tools as needed.
Educate internal and external staff on the implementation of new technologies.
Stay current with all social media industry and best practices.
Be willing to work with students, volunteers, committees, and interns.
Other duties as assigned.
Non-Profit experience is preferred.
Event Planning:
Event planning, design and production while managing all project delivery elements within time limits.
Conduct market research, gather information and negotiate detailed contracts prior to securing any venue.
Propose ideas to improve event quality.
Organize facilities and manage all event details such as decor, catering, entertainment, location, invitee list, special guests, equipment, promotional material etc.
Ensure compliance with insurance, legal, health and safety obligations.
Specify staff requirements and coordinate their activities.
Develop and implement marketing strategies to promote and publicize venue.
Proactively handle any arising issues and troubleshoot any emerging problems on the event day.
Conduct pre- and post – event evaluations; provide feedback and reports to management.
Research market, identify event opportunities and generate interest.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Online and print marketing experience required.
Proven experience as an events coordinator or organizer.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Exceptional organizational and time management skills.

Morrison Healthcare is a leading national food and nutrition services company exclusively dedicated to serving more than 600 hospitals and healthcare systems. Morrison's hospital kitchens, restaurants, and cafés feature socially responsible practices and exceptional guest experiences. The company's comprehensive Mindful Choices® wellness and sustainability platform includes the latest in healthful eating and an understanding of behavioral change in food consumption. Morrison's alignment with Partnership for a Healthier America's (PHA) Hospital Healthy Food Initiative positively impacts up to 41 million patients and 500 million hospital meals annually. Morrison has been named one of Modern Healthcare's "Top 100 Best Places to Work in Healthcare" for the past five years, and Training Magazine's Top 125 organizations for the past six consecutive years. The company is a division of Compass Group and has more than 1,200 registered dietitians, 300 executive chefs, and 17,000 professional food service team members.
