ABOUT US
TravSolo is a planning app for solo travelers, where you can create your itinerary on the go, meet people and bring back home a story to tell. It helps people to solo travel much easier than ever.
We want every solo traveler to be able to plan their trip, meet people, and stay safe – all while sharing memories of their journey on the go.
It is an exciting time to join the TravSolo team as we continue to grow!
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Lead Designer will be the driving force of our interaction design for TravSolo, working with the team to bring us to life. We are looking for an individual who is:
Passionate about traveling
Eagerness to learn
Wants to be part of a growing team
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively
Ability to work without much supervision
NY resident is preferred
Direct opportunities to pitch to investors for team investment will be provided, along with equity if deemed a fit

Create a design strategy, identify key interactions of the product, create prototypes to test concepts and stay current on technology and trends that will impact users.
Make sure our app work and function in the hands of users.
Create and designing layouts, features of both website and app
Take ownership for Website and App UX/UI Design, bringing research from concept to hi-fidelity design to testing.
Help with maintenance and additions to the website.
Assist in social media designs, when needed
Writing and editing content
Creating back up files

* Strong sense of design aesthetic and understanding of TravSolo’s service and brand
* Experience leading a variety of creative campaigns, including integrated experiences with both above-the-line and below-the-line initiatives
* Ability to build and synthesize briefs, conceptualize, and execute
* Experience working across disciplines
* Expertise in Creative Suite and willingness to learn new software, as needed
* Experience in digital, social, print and experiential marketing/advertising
* Strategic thinker with the ability to solve problems, even when they are not fully defined
* Ability to work in an ever-evolving environment
* Illustration and photography skills are a plus
* Ability to present and sell creative ideas
* Must be a team player
* Self-driven, organized, detail-oriented, and able to multitask
* Bachelor’s Degree in graphic design, or equivalent
Must be available for a minimum of ten (10) hours a week on a trial basis.
This is a "get things done" position, where you are allowed to fail, learn, repeat = hustle
Let us inspire people to travel more together!

Job Description
Alphalete is actively seeking a motivated Advertising Trainee to work on groundbreaking campaigns with an advertising and marketing firm in the DFW region. This innovative firm was founded by dedicated people looking to push the envelope by using cost-effective marketing campaigns and advertising strategies. Their goal is to provide the same advertising as the standard firm but at a fraction of the price. As a progressive company in the sales and marketing industry, this firm continues to set the standard for excellence in customer acquisition and establishing a repeat customer base for clients. By providing personalized sales and marketing services to some of the largest retailers globally, this firm continues to increase the market shares of clients through proven sales and marketing strategies.

The Advertising Trainee position is a valued team member in the marketing and advertising department. The position is considered entry level to start during training which includes a comprehensive overview of basic marketing strategy, direct advertising, promotional techniques, visual merchandising, and consumer market research. After successful completion of the program, an individual would be considered a team leads in the marketing department. The Advertising Trainee reports directly to the Executive Marketing Manager.

Responsibilities:
Assisting in the daily growth and development of assigned campaigns
Assisting with efforts of customer acquisition and retention
Expertly manage the needs of external customers.
Developing strong leadership and interpersonal skills
Driving sales through retail promotional campaigns
Build brand recognition through local events and experiential marketing
Strategize, execute and manage with the Brand Ambassador teams
Interact and communicate with customers
The personalized focus of the campaigns is a refreshing alternative to more general mass sales and marketing strategies, but it is also responsible for the company's unprecedented growth and stability. The management team prides itself on recognizing top performance, integrity, and a winning mindset for continual internal promotions. If you possess a passion for marketing, sales, or retail and would enjoy learning how to manage the varying dimensions of a business, this position could be an excellent fit for the right candidate.
Must be able to work full-time hours and some weekends for special events.
Ability to excel in unsupervised solo assignments as well as team projects
Great communication skills
Must be able to work in an energetic, fast-paced environment.
Self-starter, creative thinker, problem solver
Why work here?
Full Training
Market Competitive Pay Structure: Weekly Bonuses and Incentives
Rapid upward mobility
Community involvement and Charitable opportunities
A fun, high energy work environment! No cubicles here, we work closely together as a team!
Apply today for immediate consideration!

A&S Party Rental is looking for qualified candidates that have a passion for helping people and the ability to work collaboratively to join their team as an Event Coordinator/ Delivery Driver. You will assist with events from start to finish which includes staging, loading, driving, unloading, customer service, set up, take down and restocking at warehouse. Ideal candidates will have a positive and can do attitude, flexible work schedule and good driving record. Our goal is to expand our operations by opening more locations in the future while being the premier event rental company in the industry.

Arrange events while following all company and safety standards.
Organize products for scheduled events that include but are not limited to linens, tents, tables, chairs, inflatables.

Deliver all items for events that adhere to customer requests and schedules.
Work with customers to provide excellent service in setting up everything before events.

Keep warehouse organized and orderly throughout the year.
Assist with day to day operations to maintain a smooth-running warehouse.

Strong customer service/interpersonal skills that include building and maintaining relationships with a diverse network of individuals and organizations.
Strong organizational skills with attention to details and the ability to multitask.

Time management skills and the ability to prioritize a large volume of tasks to meet deadlines.
Self-motivated with enthusiasm for the job at hand without needing constant supervision.
Problem solving skills to quickly find solutions when problems occur while maintaining a calming presence for customers. Must be adaptable to your environment and all tasks needing to get accomplished on a day to day basis.

Do you have a passion for making a difference in people’s lives?

AHRC New York City is a family governed organization committed to finding ways for people with intellectual and other developmental disabilities to build full lives as defined by each person and supported by dedicated families, staff, and community partners.

The Regional Marketing Manager (RMM), under the supervision of the Assistant Director and Director of Business Development will be responsible for (a) geographic region; regions are assigned by Director of EBS and/or Vice President of Business and Program Development. The primary objective of the RMM is to create jobs for the people EBS provides services to, to identify and to build a team of Account Executives who will bring jobs, promote our programs and/or stablish partnerships throughout the City with the goal of promoting and creating jobs for people we support.

The RMM will have specific performance goals to be met periodically; such goals will be provided by the assigned supervisor, at the minimum, the RMM must meet the contractual placements’ levels as outlined in addendum #1 under this Job Description. Addendum #1 is part of this job description. Addendum #1 will be reviewed and modified as needed based on the assessment of existing and newly procured contracts.

The RMM will actively work in promoting and creating vast network of business relationships with the objective of creating new employment opportunities, person centered employment for each person we support, and develop new business opportunities for our Affirmative Enterprise businesses.

As per Region assignment, the RMM will actively work in identifying and create JOBS for Experienced Hudson River Services’ employees– a list of candidates will be provided to the respective RMM in order for each manager to plan and to place individuals in new jobs.

This professional will receive periodical feedback from her/is immediate supervisor, at minimum a comprehensive 6 month performance review will take place and followed by an annual performance review. This role will be subject to close performance monitoring in order to ensure all goals and objectives of role are met such as placements and points.

The RMM is a senior management and supervisory position responsible for coordinating job development activities in an assigned region and overseeing Account Executives.

The RMM will be required to work a flexible or extended schedule from time to time. The RMM may be asked to assist other regions in the city or assist other departments when needed for cross-departmental projects and other assignments.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Oversee and supervise Marketing and Sales Region assigned
Develop employment opportunities for people supported as outlined in the Addendum #1 attached
Promote widespread, positive image/knowledge of AHRC’s Employment& Business Services.
Hire and supervise of Account Executives (AE)
Assess performance of Account Executives under direct supervision, train new marketing staff, and coordinate placement activity
Ensure excellent customer service to all customers
Actively participate in internal and external networking events
Actively organize networking events to develop linkages with potential employers and to promote AHRC brand
Develop and maintain marketing strategy targeting successful creation of jobs for people supported
Create and complete action plans targeting a specific line of business, employers, type of job, etc.
Develop valued relationships with businesses/ employers. Maintain and expand customer base
Provide best job matching for job seekers and employers
Ensure customized employment is a priority for the marketing team
Coordinate the day to day responsibilities of Account Executives
Ensure program placement goals are met for each program in region
At a minimum, the RMM will be required to bring new business, in the form of a service contract that provides employment to two or more people supported on a quarterly basis
Develop employment opportunities for existing NYSID workers in experienced porter positions. At a minimum, six employees will need to transition from NYSID contracts
Required to travel throughout the 5 boroughs and in and out of state as needed
Prepare and deliver marketing presentations as needed
Conduct other responsibilities as assigned
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s in Arts or Bachelor’s in Science, plus 2 years marketing/sales/related experience or Associate’s Degree with 5 years of experience, required
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Great motivational skills
Experience with people with disabilities/youth a plus
Ability to work collaboratively with senior EBS operations and program managers and to develop and maintain sites, disseminate information, and provide top quality customer service to all EBS customers.
NYS driver’s license preferred. Must have clear driving record
Annual Salary: $70K-$80K depending on experience and education.

Job Description:
Job Code: 20-380
Location: Arden Hills, MN
Job Status: Regular Full Time

Position Summary:
This position is primarily responsible for coordinating, executing and supporting the marketing and event activities of the Financial Services Marketing Department. Primary job duties include coordinating tradeshows and events, digital marketing efforts and general marketing support. The Sales & Marketing Events Coordinator must be highly organized with impeccable project management skills, prioritization skills, and able to juggle multiple events with a high attention to detail and accuracy in a deadline-driven environment.

The Work

Digital Coordination
Work with and/or build templates for email campaigns using Pardot.
Create and coordinate branded content and engaging posts.
Work with marketing director to build monthly digital content calendar and project manage the execution of each marketing initiative, including but not limited to scheduling, posting, community managing, analyzing the performance, and light copywriting.
Act as webmaster and social media guru on the development and posting of digital content, including posting content and optimizing it with keywords and targets to drive traffic.
Conduct analysis to assess the performance of each marketing channel and make any necessary recommendations for follow up action plan in order to increase marketing effectiveness.
Set up campaign reporting, monitor campaign success, recommend strategies to optimize conversion rates, and execute testing.
Execute other duties as assigned.

Marketing Support
Supports the Marketing Department in initiatives and projects and provides regular and consistent communication regarding project updates.
Coordinate the creation, production and/or printing of marketing materials and PowerPoint presentations.
Assists in the maintenance and management of Sharepoint, various databases (RFP), CRM (Salesforce), marketing automation platform (Pardot) and electronic mailboxes (Info).
Creating and maintaining campaigns in Salesforce and Pardot.
Segment and pull data from Pardot and/or Salesforce as needed for campaigns.
Set-up and manage specific lead generation campaigns for each individual person in sales.
Managing marketing calendar for all email communication and event activity.
Conduct online research through Salesforce and ZoomInfo to generate new leads
Provide support to marketing team on various projects as needed.
Act as the key point of contact for all Associations. Understanding the membership benefits, the attendee rosters, any company information posted to the Associations site, etc.

Position Responsibilities:
Tradeshows and Events
Conduct and communicates pre event research in order to determine the potential value of each event.
Coordinate the planning and logistics of events, including scheduling, registration, producing webinars, ordering materials for events and ensuring that materials are returned in a timely manner.
Maintain event calendar in real-time.
Develop and deliver communications that informs key personnel of upcoming tradeshows and if necessary, their role regarding the event.
Work with show attendees to effectively secure hotel rooms (or cancel reservations) for tradeshows and ensure the attendees understand the logistics.
Work with the marketing director to coordinate the development of advertising materials, marketing materials and sales information needed for each event.
Work with marketing director to develop an event write-up for announcement in the tradeshow’s materials as well as announcing on the RevSpring website. Post upcoming events, as well as removing past events from the website.
Track and report on leads generated per an event, meetings held, cost of leads per a show, status of leads generated per a show, expenses for each show. Understanding overall costs per show and cost per lead.
Maintain an inventory of event assets and coordinate the production of new asset needs.
Keep track of budget and expenditures for all trade shows, in all company required formats.
Facilitate contracts against allocated budgets and proper distribution of information.
Coordinate post-show debrief meetings.
Update event information in Salesforce.com and Pardot.
Coordinate any post show mailings and give away fulfillments necessary.
Serves as internal liaison for events to ensure the success of each event.
Education, Knowledge and Skills
Four-year Bachelor’s Degree from college/university required
Three years related experience
Experience with Salesforce, Pardot, WordPress, Oktapost, InDesign, MS Suite
Experience with writing and managing email campaigns is a plus
Attitudes and Habits
Strong communicator that shares results, ideas and project status regularly
A driver who can (with little direction) take the ball and run with it. Need to be driven by results and metrics
Strategic and critical thinker
Resourceful
Strong time management and organizational skills
Ability to handle multiple projects with shifting priorities at once
Enjoy working on a fast-paced team where projects and initiatives can change quickly

Preferred Education & Experience:


Desired Knowledge & Skills:

Overview


Working with us is an opportunity that can pay off for years to come – with skills, knowledge, experiences and friends that can last a lifetime!

A Seasonal job with us can lead to a successful future. That’s because you will:
Develop resume-building skills to help achieve your career goals
Work in a welcoming and diverse environment
Gain knowledge through training programs and work experience
Assists in planning, organizing and overseeing numerous large Park events, festivals, promotions (both on-site and off-site) and meetings.

Responsibilities


You’ll Make a Difference:
Interact with our guests and make their day amazing through meaningful connections
Share your passion for creating a warm and welcoming environment with your team
Deliver fast and accurate service
Contribute to our exceptional track record for safety
Minimum Duties and Responsibilities:
Assists in the scheduling and coordination of large Park events, festivals, and promotions (both on-site and off-site)
Helps plan, organize and oversee numerous Season Passholder events throughout the season
Works closely with numerous radio and TV partners to coordinate broadcasts, live remotes, and promotions
Plans and oversees on-site meetings and promotions for all partners of Dorney Park. This includes Burger King, Dunkin’ Donuts, Subway, Wendy’s, etc
Collects and maintains reporting figures brought into the Park by promotions conducted by the Marketing Department (i.e. redemption tracking, etc.)
Writes complete operations memos for park-wide events. These are used and distributed to all Park Personnel for events
Enters data into database, as needed
Conducts exit surveys and mini surveys throughout the Park when necessary
Provides guest service according to Cedar Fair standards when serving the guest or working with subordinates, including initiating guest interactions, answering questions and giving directions.
Maintains cleanliness and safety in assigned work area and performs all duties in compliance with Cedar Fair Safety guidelines and requirements and reports all unsafe or unusual conditions to supervision.
Meets scheduling availability requirements, including nights, weekends, and holiday periods to meet business needs.
Meets Cedar Fair's attendance requirements as outlined in Cedar Fair's attendance policies.
Adheres to Cedar Fair's Rules of Conduct including specific costuming and grooming standards as outlined in Employee Guidelines and other park/division specific policies and procedures. Other duties may be assigned.
Qualifications


We’re looking for:
A genuine interest in making people feel welcome using your smile and positive nature
Keen to be a part of something you believe in, providing fun while having fun at work
Openness to learn, grow and develop skills
Commitment to your team by being on time and working scheduled shifts
Desire to be outdoors for extended periods in all weather conditions
Minimum Qualifications:
Ability to read, write, speak and understand English at a level sufficient to conduct employee meetings; provide detailed direction to staff, guests, and vendors; and write policies, procedures, reports and other business related documents and correspondence.
Ability to solve practical problems with minimal supervision and effectively deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists
Ability to organize and prioritize to meet deadlines
Ability to follow written and oral instruction
Ability to effectively communicate to motivate small and large groups of people
Must have a valid driver's license Must have knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and other software
Ability to work nights, weekends and holiday periods to meet business needs.
Ability to pass a mandatory (or random) drug test, per Company policy, unless prohibited by state or provincial law.
Ability to pass a background check, if 18 years of age or older, which may include, but is not limited to, credit, criminal, DMV, previous employment, education and personal references, per Company policy, unless prohibited by federal, state, or provincial law.
Ready to start your future now? Apply Today!

About Discovery Senior Living
Discovery Senior Living is a family of companies which includes: Discovery Management Group, Discovery Development Group, Discovery Design Concepts, Discovery Realty Group, Discovery Marketing Group, and Discovery At Home, a Medicare-certified home healthcare company. With almost three decades of experience, the award-winning management group has been developing, building, marketing, and operating upscale, luxury senior-living communities across the United States. With a flourishing portfolio of more than 9,500 existing home or homes under development, Discovery Senior Living has become a recognized industry leader in creating world-class, resort-style communities.

Discovery Senior Living is looking for a Recreation & Events Coordinator to join our community The Summit.

Responsibilities:
Assist in the development and oversight of resident activities.
Plan, schedule and conduct programs that provide physical, intellectual, social, emotional and spiritual opportunities for our residents in our community.
Attend all community planned functions and help coordinate the event from beginning to end including set-up, running, and breaking down for the event.
Assist in preparing and organizing a calendar of events.
Must be willing to work flexible hours (evenings and every other weekend) for planned activity events.
Qualifications:
Associate s Degree in social work, recreation, sociology, psychology or related field preferred
One to three years experience in assisted living or long term care working with memory care patients preferred
Proficient verbal, written and presentation skills.
Ability to encourage and motivate older adults.
Computer skills including Microsoft Word and Excel.
Demonstrated creative ability.
Strong skills in organization, delegation and consensus building.
Benefits

In addition to a rewarding career and competitive salary, Discovery offers a comprehensive benefit package.

Eligible team members are offered a comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurances, paid time off and paid holidays. Team members are eligible to participate in our outstanding 401(k) plan with company match our Employee Assistance Program and accident insurance policies.

Thank you for your interest in Discovery Senior Living careers. If you have any questions about the position you are applying for, please contact the community directly.

EOE/M/F/D/V

Job Description:
Cashmere Agency is a lifestyle marketing collective comprised of creative minds from the worlds of entertainment, advertising, and new media. We build authentic campaigns, pieced together by a creative mix of marketing and public relations strategies that resonate with today's ever-evolving audience. Our client base includes a number of TV networks, motion picture studios, major recording artists, tech companies, and top-tier brands.

Cashmere Agency is currently seeking a talented and thoughtful Vice President of Business Development - Digital Partnerships to join our team. The ideal candidate has a background in marketing and business development disciplines and has a track record of achieving great results through partnerships and product launches. Additionally, the selected candidate must be charismatic and comfortable pitching to industry executives and will have a demonstrated ability to be creative and strategic, in order to launch effective partnerships and programs across various industries in the lifestyle brand, music, and tech spaces, thrive in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment, and able to connect the dots between brands and their audiences. These are partnerships that range primarily in activations across social and digital landscapes.

Responsibilities:
Strategically identify new business prospects and their key decision-makers
Confidently develop and lead pitch presentations
Build & lead the partnerships capability across multiple industry verticals for clients
Manage, optimize, and document business development plans while working with internal stakeholders to plan and execute the marketing strategy
Develop budgets and scopes of work for awarded accounts
Formulate new business strategies that pivot marketing briefs into transformational opportunities
Evaluate historical accounts and uncover new opportunities from the evolution of our strategic portfolio of work
Represent Cashmere with partners and platform holders in the tech ecosystem such as Google, Samsung, Amazon, Spotify, Twitch, Facebook, Tik Tok, YouTube, and Instagram
Navigate internal & external stakeholders to run the partnership discussions end to end; including identifying the right opportunities, framing win-win structures, negotiation and contractual closure
Scope each customer engagement, with attention towards clear and well-defined objectives and success criteria.
Identify and implement trendsetting ideas that thrive in the digital/social landscape
Screen potential business deals by analyzing market strategies, deal requirements, potential, and financials; evaluate options and resolve internal priorities
Ownership of each account to ensure a timely and successful execution
Develop and negotiate contracts; integrating contract requirements and onboarding clients to the agency
Develop insightful, client-facing documentation that highlights Cashmere's digital partnership capabilities
Lead, drive, and new business goals for Cashmere's digital partnerships clients
Oversee digital experience business from concept to execution
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders across Accounts, Creative, Social, PR, Influencer Marketing, Experiential, and Production teams to execute campaigns.
Requirements/Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, or closely related field preferred
10+ years of experience in Digital and Partnership Marketing
7+ years in Sales and Business Development
Existing book of business of highly preferred
Agency experience highly desirable
Must possess vast network contacts and established book of business
Must have robust knowledge in the content streaming space
Current and relevant knowledge and experience of today's social media and streaming platforms such as Twitch, Facebook, Tik Tok, YouTube, and Instagram is required
Strong attention to detail, precisely and effectively navigating client communications
Strong and proven ability to manage multiple and competing priorities
Experience leading digital marketing partnerships and campaigns
Expert ability to present to executives and lead cross-functional teams
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Strong Excel and Google Suite (Slides, Sheets, Docs, Calendars) proficiency
Must be proficient in using Mac computers
Must be able to travel up to 25% domestically and possibly internationally
Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without sponsorship
The ideal candidate in this role has vast experience working with various senior-level marketing clients from Lifestyle Brands, Travel, Technology, and Entertainment.

Cashmere's core values are:
Own the work. Elevate each other.
Seek to understand. Speak with intent.
Spark Something. Challenge everything.
Make room. Make change.
Set the standard. Be undeniably dope.
Cashmere is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

If you would like to become a part of one of the most influential, multicultural agencies, then apply today!

Job Description Summary:

The David Rubenstein Forum seeks to meet the need for a University-wide facility for scholarly and academic discourse on campus. The venue will support and promote inquiry, the open exchange of ideas, and the power of academic, interdisciplinary convening. The Forum will be located on the site at East 60th Street between Woodlawn Avenue and Kimbark Avenue. It will serve as a place where scholars can gather and exchange ideas through activities that range from talks and workshops to multi-day conferences that span academic disciplines. The facility will provide spaces and amenities that are not currently available on campus, including highly collaborative, well-appointed meeting and event rooms commensurate with the types of conferences, special events, workshops, and meetings that University faculty and academic departments host. The project has a sustainable design target of LEED Gold.

Job Description Summary:
Supervises sales and events team. Provides sales efforts to achieve property sales objectives with overall responsibility for achieving booking goals and property revenues. The Sales & Events department serves as the primary liaison between The David Rubenstein Forum and University of Chicago groups or associations, alumni, education or external corporate clients. He/She is responsible for revenue generation at the property to include direct sales, meeting package sales, catering sales and food and beverage sales. He/She is responsible for space and logistics planning to optimize the group space to revenue ratios, contract negotiations and function space management through Delphi.fdc, and other related software or interfaces. Will assist clients with event design consultation and overall meeting & event management.

Job Description:

QUALIFICATIONS: EDUCATION, KNOWLEDGE, TRAINING, & WORK EXPERIENCE
Knowledge of group sales, marketing, and revenue management
Conference Services and/or Catering planning experience required
Experience with the University of Chicago preferred
Minimum three - five years Hotel/Resort/Conference Center industry sales experience
Minimum one - two years supervisory experience preferred
Local market knowledge preferred
Bachelors degree preferred
Experience managing to brand standards
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Prior use of Delphi, or similar Sales & Catering system, required
General knowledge of contract laws
Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office suite
Assertive, outgoing and self-motivating individual with pleasant personality
Must have valid driver license and ability to travel
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:


Be the Difference:
Understand all aspects of Benchmarks Be the Difference culture
Set the example
Lead and inspire all employees to Be the Difference
Hold each team accountable for delivering the experience
Leadership:
Know the business
Set a positive direction

Data Scientist- Leader


Data Scientist-Leader

We are looking for an experienced data scientist to lead the development of this analytical effort for the enterprise and deliver value to our customers by understanding them in ways that our traditional approaches have not been able to achieve. Responsibilities include:

•Development of an offer success measurement plan to include non-sales outcomes like customer satisfaction and engagement

•Creation of next-generation models that use both traditional and un-/semi-structured data to better predict customer needs and outcomes

•Partnership with the technology and sales teams to ensure alignment on deliverables/timelines/implementation

•Analytical management of small, pilot programs to test new offer ideas in targeted markets

•Integration with enterprise modeling efforts in partner organizations (Enterprise Data & Analytics/Risk/Finance) to ensure that the lead & offer optimization engine is cross-compatible with existing modeling frameworks

•Leadership of the data strategy around collection, structure and syndication of lead & offer data

•Mentoring junior staff on modeling techniques and providing guidance on analytical approaches

•Leading cross-functional and cross-LOB project teams

The group is responsible for brand strategy and advertising, database and experiential marketing integrated program and product development, market research and related customer analytics, and diverse segments strategy and business development.

Required Qualifications:

•10+ years of experience in analytics, modeling or a combination of both or a PhD in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 7+ years of experience in analytics, modeling, or a combination of both

Desired Qualifications:

•Ability to translate and present complex technical data across technical and non-technical groups

•Ability to execute in a fast paced, high demand, environment while balancing multiple priorities.

Other Desired Qualifications:

•Experience modeling non-traditional data (e.g. free-form text)

•Experience coding in R/Python and/or experience in big data environments (e.g. Hadoop/Aster)

•Experience with traditional data science techniques including machine learning (e.g. random forest, gradient boosting, neural networks).

Job Expectations:

•Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.

The Event Manager is responsible for increasing the exposure of the Bath Fitter brand and its market share by generating new leads for the Branch through malls, shows, and exhibits in a wide variety of venues to help the Branch meet or exceed their sales goals. To achieve these goals, the Event Manager will select, supervise and train regular show workers who will, with the Event Manager, constitute a separate operating unit within Bath Fitter that is dedicated to generating Bath Fitter customer leads. The Event Manager will have substantial discretion in making the decisions that will produce a maximum number of quality customer leads for Bath Fitter.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Generate quality leads by participating in events in order to meet or exceed set sales objectives.
Meet established goals for the cost of advertising related to Events.
Develop and update an events plan and budget.

Collect, review and submit all staff time records for payroll in a timely manner.

Negotiate and obtain leases for Bath Fitter mall displays and store fronts.
Select and maintain inventory displays, making certain each display is kept clean, well-stocked and maintained to always represent the Company in the most professional manner.
Select mall leads and submit to the office at assigned intervals.
Ensure quality of cards received meet established guidelines (complete name, phone number, email address).
Research and develop new marketing venues and networking opportunities
Develop new and innovative approaches to the business.
Network with other vendors at show locations to develop new show locations and techniques
Attend and participate in regular branch and/or regional meetings and training sessions.
Always wear Bath Fitter uniform on the job, observing rules of good grooming and hygiene.
Abide by all Bath Fitter policies and procedures.
Adhere to all Bath Fitter safety policies and procedures.
Realize the Event Manager's role as the personal representative of Bath Fitter while in uniform and while driving a company vehicle and act accordingly.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Exercise broad supervision of its unit and be responsible, for the unit’s results.

Job Description


About Endeavor Global Marketing:

Endeavor Global Marketing (EGM) is the cultural marketing agency within the Endeavor network, which includes preeminent talent agency WME, sports and fashion industry pioneer IMG, and other leading organizations from across the cultural landscape.

Its position within Endeavor provides EGM and its employees with unrivaled cultural insight, access, and understanding of the audiences the world’s leading brands need to reach.

Our approach to cultural marketing generates elevated ad campaigns, relevant PR strategies, humanized digital marketing platforms, and unparalleled experiences, with more than 9,000 experiential events around the world annually. In short, we build brand- and business-driving platforms and programs, rooted in human and cultural insights.

Being a part of the team that delivers these solutions means being a part of the agency that is defining the new frontier of marketing. For anyone with the drive to seek out new challenges and the commitment to craft effective solutions shaped by insight and defined by excellence, the opportunities for growth and exploration are endless.

Endeavor Global Marketing is now more than 700 employees strong globally, providing expertise in brand strategy and activation, advertising, digital and social marketing, public relations, sports and entertainment marketing, social impact marketing, influencer strategy, experiential marketing, original content and business intelligence. We work with major brand clients including Audi, AB InBev, Marriott, Visa, Coca-Cola, Papa John’s, Bumble, E. & J. Gallo Winery, and Microsoft, among more than 200 others.

Overview:

This position is for an Account Manager role at Endeavor Global Marketing working with the Account Services team. The Account Managers within Endeavor Global Marketing are the company’s internal and external “evangelists”, providing comprehensive client expertise regarding their needs…their brands…their company…and their industry. Account Managers are expected not to ask for solutions, but provide them through your own expertise, your research and the support of your colleagues and management team. Successful members are those who deliver under the most challenging situations, exceeding client expectations while ensuring internal alignment from creative and executive teams. In exchange, Fusion provides you the autonomy to “own” your business, exposure to high-level clients, engagement in complex and challenging projects, competitive pay/benefits, and career growth potential in a fast-paced, fun agency environment.

Responsibilities:
Day-to-Day client contact
Build and maintain a strong, long-lasting client relationship
Develop a trusted relationship with the creative, digital, XM field and production teams
Ensure timely and successful delivery of projects
Track key program metrics
Identify and grow opportunities
Implements Training Development
Develops training manual and program materials
Works hand-in-hand with field managers to oversee and monitor success of program
Assist in final recap
Perform additional duties as assigned
Travel to build team and client relationships
Competencies:

Proven account management experience. Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively to both clients and creative teams. Experience in providing solutions based on client/brand needs. Ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to adapt to a fast pace, growing agency environment while delivering client needs of and/or those of the agency. Ability to think and lead strategic conversations with confidence; gain internal team alignment on a message and prepare the team to deliver a presentation to clients. Ability to manage and grown junior staff members.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing/Advertising or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of agency account management experience including brand building and experiential marketing.
Beverage experience a plus
Field marketing / Shopper marketing experience a plus

Job Description:
Job Description
White Oak Communications is seeking a Publicist. The individual in this position should have 2-3 years of agency experience managing high level accounts in the food / wine / spirits industry, or in the real estate / travel / lifestyle industry.

Strong candidates will demonstrate experience in writing and editing, knowledge of their given industry, ability to research, ability to work independently and ability to stay on top of trends. We are looking for someone with natural charisma and excellent presentation skills, and who possesses a passion for Public Relations and the ever-evolving media landscape. You are comfortable dining with media at meals and hosting them at press events. Candidates should be able to manage accounts and comprehensively report up to a senior team member.

This position offers a competitive salary and benefits package, along with a unique opportunity to work and advance in a dynamic, growing agency.

Interested candidates may submit their cover letter, and resume.

Who You Are

You thrive in a fast-paced environment where decisions are made on the fly. You think for yourself and often do before being asked to do. You’re creative and witty, and we’d know one of your pitches if we saw it. You can produce on-brand, creative deliverables on a deadline.

You’re obsessed with hospitality & travel and have a rock-solid understanding of creating, promoting, and distributing shareable content across multiple platforms.

Have a demonstrated ability to write, pitch and get press placements, as well as work on a minimum 5 accounts.
Have a passion for writing pitches, press releases, and biographies, developing interesting press angles, and staying constantly abreast of the trends of the industry
Build & maintain strong relationships with high-level local, regional and national online, print and broadcast media contacts
Proofread and edit
Collaborate with and offer ideas to the events team and the social media team
Brainstorm creative ideas and strategies for campaigns building out media strategies for your clients
Compile & maintain media lists in order to pitch to various media outlets throughout the world
Secure media coverage for your clients to ensure their monthly goals are being met
Interface and liase with clients, handling their day to day communication and requests, working closely with the account supervisors and senior management
Track coverage and deliver weekly reports to clients
Qualifications:
2 years minimum agency experience
Must be a strong, creative writer
Must have strong local media connections, with a desire to build
Must have excellent phone demeanor
Must have excellent grammatical and proof reading skills
Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills
Must be detail oriented
Must be able to handle a large volume of work
Must have excellent organizational skills
Must be able to handle multi-faceted projects with strong follow-through
Must know how to prioritize
Must have strong work ethic, and understand the non-traditional hours of agency life
Must have complete knowledge of Cision
Must have willingness to work evenings and weekends, if needed
MUST LOVE FOOD, FUN, TRAVEL, AND EVERYTHING IN THE REALM OF HOSPITALITY! Tell us your favorite last meal! Where have you traveled. We want to know!

Founded in 2014, White Oak Communications has quickly grown into one of the most sought after agencies in the country. From traditional press campaigns, to influencer outreach, content creation and social media management, to experiential marketing & events, the agency is redefining what it means to shape your narrative.

Alpha Capital Partners (Alpha) is a fast-paced, growing real estate firm looking for a Regional Marketing Manager. The Regional Marketing Manager will work directly with the Marketing Director and deliver in-house marketing and leasing support to the properties. The Regional Marketing Manager will directly support all properties by providing impactful property marketing campaigns and influence leasing and training initiatives.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Lead the development and execution of property marketing strategies and programs that support the property?s financial performance goals

Mentor and coach leasing/sales consultants on effective advertising and sales tactics including additional marketing support to underperforming properties

Assist in building and maintaining a positive online reputation for Alpha?s communities, review customer experience survey trends and work with property teams on improvement opportunities and action plans
Monitor local and regional market trends and economic conditions that may impact occupancy and leasing effectiveness
Maintain a standard to measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs), present results and recommendations to marketing leadership

Experienced in Multifamily/Residential Real Estate Marketing

Highly creative individual with enthusiasm to conceptualize and implement programs that are disruptive while maintaining brand elevation

3+ years of professional experience managing digital marketing channels preferably for a real estate, lifestyle or hospitality brand
Experience in SEO/SEM, social media, email marketing, outreach marketing, and other tactics
Proficient with MS Office Suite, email marketing platforms, CRM software, property management software, and online reputation platforms

Job Title: Recreation & Events Coordinator - Activities Assistant (Memory Care)

Discovery Senior Living is a family of companies which includes: Discovery Management Group, Discovery Development Group, Discovery Design Concepts, Discovery Realty Group, Discovery Marketing Group, and Discovery At Home, a Medicare-certified home healthcare company. Job Description:
Job Description
Development Event Manager

POSITION SUMMARY
This position is responsible for the implementation of events to meet or exceed goals through volunteer recruitment and engagement as well as through corporate development. Measurable outcomes for this position include: achieving designated financial and participant goals through team and individual fundraising, corporate solicitation, community partnerships, as well as increasing event awareness and visibility in the community. Based in the Greater Dayton, OH area this position requires frequent travel within the assigned territory.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for recruitment of volunteer community leaders and training, coaching, and management resulting in the attainment of revenue and team goals.
Build relationships with key volunteers, participants, sponsors and community leaders as well as existing and new corporate partners.
Responsible for overall volunteer committee development, team recruitment and retention strategies, budget, timeline, marketing/PR, logistics and best practice implementation.
Through volunteer networks, prospect, cultivate and teams, sponsors and walkers to achieve development goals.
Execute plan for maximizing team participation to achieve revenue goals by retaining existing teams, attracting new ones from all sectors of the community and by providing fundraising guidance and support.
Maintain year-round relationships with key corporate sponsors and constituents to ensure involvement in all relevant chapter activities and recognition opportunities.
Work with the volunteer planning committee to organize outreach activities that promote company’s mission, including community presentations and corporate engagement opportunities.
Ensure event standards are being followed.
Responsible for other duties as assigned.
Actively participate in learning opportunities for professional growth and self- improvement.
Minimum requirements
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
3-5 years of proven experience in recruiting and mobilizing volunteers to achieve goals
Strong business development skills, must be comfortable engaging and cultivating relationships across all levels of management
Preferred peer-to-peer fundraising experience or equivalent sales background
Confident, goal-oriented, positive self-starter able to work independently with limited supervision and collaboratively with internal and external partners
Demonstrated ability to form and develop corporate relationships and partnerships
Ability to manage large numbers of volunteers at different levels of expertise with diplomacy
Ability to work with diverse communities and demonstrate inclusion
Excellent interpersonal skills including verbal and written
Ability and willingness to travel up to 50% within the assigned territory by car. Travel in this case, is considered time spent away from the office, in the community, to fulfill the job goals.
While most such travel is same day, occasional overnight travel or air travel may be required.
Must have valid driver’s license, access to reliable vehicle, good driving record and proof of automobile insurance.
Ability and willingness to work evenings and weekends as required for the job
Ability to bend, stoop, lift and transport up to 25 lbs of materials
Strong computer skills, proficient with Microsoft Office products and social media; experience with, or ability to rapidly learn, Luminate/Convio software

Job Title: Senior Field Marketing Manager - AWS Training & Certification
Job Description:
Amazon is seeking a talented, self-directed marketing expert to generate awareness and increase adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) training and certification (T&C) offering in North America. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an exciting, fast growing training and certification business.

Job Responsibilities
· Develop and own the strategic marketing plan to drive demand for AWS Training & Certification services with new and existing customers, across all audiences and sales segments (SMB, Mid-Market and Enterprise).
· Primary business partner to North America Training Business Development (BD) teams, responsible for gathering requirements, developing and executing a cohesive field marketing strategy for defined training offerings.
· Develop comprehensive annual marketing strategy and plan that is aligned with T&C Americas BD, and AWS US and Canada Marketing. Marketing plan inclusive of digital marketing programs, campaigns and in-person and virtual events.
· Plan and deliver demand generation programs to acquire new customers and market to existing customers, including integrated campaigns, events, and digital marketing.
· Introduce new approaches to digital marketing and content syndication to elevate awareness around our content and messaging distribution.
· Work closely with the Americas Training BD team to understand their priorities and enable them to meet their objectives with focused lead gen activities.
· Participates as key stakeholder and business partner with the US and Canada Training Delivery Manager(s), product marketing and field marketing leadership regionally. This includes participating in business reviews, providing monthly and quarterly marketing updates, and providing ongoing updates to key stakeholders teams.

Basic Qualifications

· Minimum of 10 years experience in a high-tech B2B marketing role
· Demonstrated experience working with sales leadership and sales teams in driving pipeline and revenue.
· Bachelor Degree in marketing, economics, business, IT, engineering or related discipline
· Strong team player and leader with the ability to influence, work cross functionally, build relationships with key stakeholders and thrive highly collaborative fast paced environment
· Outstanding communications skills written and verbal
· Extremely well organized and detail oriented
· Deadline driven

Preferred Qualifications

· Proven track record of creating and executing integrated marketing campaigns using tactics that include digital advertising, lead nurture programs, live events, webinars, and social media
· Ability to work independently and autonomously
· Solid quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills - comfortable with data analysis and able to use data to make recommendations and drive decisions
· Expertise in managing and prioritizing multiple projects and has great attention to detail
· Not afraid to try new things driven to constantly improve results

Job Title: Senior Field Marketing Manager, Strategic Accounts
Job Description:
Experienced marketer sought to develop and execute bespoke outreach and engagement strategies for several Amazon Web Services (AWS) top customers.

In this role, you will plan and execute programs and campaigns to gain mind share, deepen relationships with influencers and key decision makers, and increase overall account engagement. You will utilize exceptional program management skills to direct and communicate on the programs you own, ensuring all stakeholders - sales, business development, marketing, agencies - are working together to deliver a high-quality experience for the customer.

The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated history of building and executing high-impact, data-driven marketing programs. They should be able to build foundational marketing mechanisms, while thinking big on behalf of their customer. They will have experience partnering closely with sales teams to deliver joint, in-account content and programs. They will have a broad understanding of channels and tactics used in the enterprise marketing space, and how they work together to form a measurable, integrated campaign (research, content and storytelling, offline events/direct mail, online email/webinars/paid media/social media). They will have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills, executive presence, as well as project and account management skills.

Strong preference that this role sits in San Francisco/Bay Area or Seattle. Open to remote near US AWS office. Relocation assistance within US available.





Basic Qualifications


· 7+ years in marketing, with proven, measurable experience across a variety of disciplines: B2B, agency/consultancy, field, account-based, alliance, digital, event and/or industry marketing
· Experience in the enterprise technology and/or cloud space (players, trends, challenges, etc.)
· Familiarity with modern marketing platforms/tools, such as Marketo, SalesForce, social media channels, etc.

Preferred Qualifications

· Bachelors degree in marketing, business, communications, or relevant field of study
· Ability to measure marketing and sales success; ability to set targets and build a proactive plan to achieve them.
· Deep understanding of marketing metrics, and the analytical capabilities required to understand or interpret program success
· Solid professional writing skills
· Highly organized, data-driven and detail oriented.
· Thrives in a fast-paced environment with the ability to prioritize, pivot and problem-solve.
· Interested in building and processes from the ground up and comfortable in ambiguous environments.
· Superior oral and written communication skills with an innate attention to detail.
· A strong team player comfortable and motivated working in a collaborative environment.

Strong preference that this role sits in San Francisco/Bay Area or Seattle. Open to remote near US AWS office. Relocation assistance with US available.

Job Description
Who We Are:

Envision Horizons is an Amazon Advertising and strategy firm. We are experts in all things Amazon and bring brands selling on the world's largest online marketplace to the next level. We specialize in working with brands within the beauty, wellness, fashion, and parenting categories. We are a fast growing team based in the heart of Manhattan's Chelsea. Envision Horizons launched in early 2017 and we manage multi-million dollar brands on Amazon and are looking for those seeking a fast growing startup.

Our Core Values:

Be Inquisitive - be naturally curious, love working with data, and determined to find an answer.

Be A Boss - think like a business owner and be confident in your knowledge and expertise.

Get It Done - It is nearly impossible to know everything about Amazon, but the name of the game is being self-sufficient to find the answer and to get it done.

What You Will Do:

As a Content manager you will be in charge of the production and the tracking of content performance. You will be in charge of taking our current initiatives and building out incredible programing. The purpose of this role is to position Envision Horizons as a thought leader within the Amazon ecosystem. Needless to say, no two days will be the same!

How You Will Make A Difference:

You will be a key player in taking Envision Horizons from a firm that is well known within small circles, to an established thought leader within the ecommerce space. You will have the opportunity to take our small following and grow it into something substantial.

Key Responsibilities:
On The Horizons Events - Every 6-8 weeks we host an industry event. You will be in charge of organizing the content of the panel/event, facilitating the panelist, attendees and other logistics. We design these events to intimate and exclusive to key design makers within our space. We also record the events via video and use it for more content creation post event.
Blog - You will contribute your own blog posts, ghost write for the co-founders, and produce short write ups when industry news hits. SEO optimization of the website
Podcast - Collaborate with the CEO in producing the “On the Horizons” podcast. Assist with editing and finding guest to be featured on the podcast.
Social Channels - Linkedin in our main channel focus, but with the“On the Horizons” content and we are slowing developing our Youtube channel to be positioned as a thought leader.
Qualifications:
1-3 year(s) experience
Bachelors Degree
Experience with event planning
Proficient in Excel must be able to do vlookup, pivot tables, and other basic formulas
Organized and able to multitask
Savvy with technology
Photo and Video editing experience is preferred but not required
Must Love Ecommerce: We talk and live ecommerce all day every day, thus you have to be passionate about the topic to be a rock star in this position.
Hours:

This is a full-time position. Candidate must be willing to commit extra hours when necessary for important events or time-sensitive tasks.

Compensation & Benefits:

The compensation for this position, which is commensurate with experience, is comprised of a base salary plus performance bonuses.

What We Offer:
Competitive pay plus commission!
The ability to get in on the ground floor of a fast-growing startup
Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance
Two Weeks Paid Vacation
Flexibility work from home during the holiday weeks. ie. Christmas/New Years Week. Closed all major holidays
Discounted Gym Memberships
Professional Development Opportunities, training, conferences etc.

"Best Places to Work 2019" -SF Business Times


We are building a world-class Channel Sales & Marketing team and are looking for an analytical, strategic and creative individual to join as a Senior Channel Marketing Manager. You will be instrumental in helping us drive expansion and launch key strategic projects in collaboration with our valued current and future channel partners.

This opportunity involves rapidly capturing and optimizing current opportunities and generating new ideas to raise brand awareness, increase market share and achieve our growth goals. You will be working across online, offline and experiential programs, ensuring our shoppers and partners are delighted, informed and inspired at every touch-point in their journey. It’s an exciting time to come aboard, as we work towards bringing clean air to everyone, in every room.
What's in it for you:
Career Growth: progress and learn, stability, career development/path
Work Environment: autonomy, ownership, recognition of achievements, life-work balance(see what we did there), challenges
Culture: transparency of goals and plans, support, collaboration, trust, community, passion, growth mindset
Benefits: time off, no cost family health insurance, matching 401K, flexibility (ie: work day start and end times, occasional work from home)
Compensation: fairness, timeliness, compensation system
What you will own:
Channel marketing strategy: Create, manage and execute to ensure goals are achieved/exceeded, across online and offline channels
Sales acceleration plans: Partner with the Channel Sales team to develop and execute effective ways to grow awareness and drive sales
Pitching strategy: build and deliver quality pitches to key external stakeholders
Channel marketing assets: Own and distribute marketing asset kits, inclusive of brief creation for cross-functional partners
Promotional planning: Own promotional calendar, budget and ROI analyses - ensuring channel parity, while minimizing grey market activity
Campaign management: Manage multiple retailer campaigns at once, involving a high amount of organization and multitasking
Performance tracking and insights: Make on-going recommendations for improved performance, while collaborating both internally and externally to achieve mutual goals
Channel marketing budget: Ensure spend is within or below budget guidelines. Work cross functionally with sales and finance.
In-store POP displays & program management: Collaborate with Retailers, Molekule Creative Team & 3P agencies for creation, installation and maintenance. Create workback schedules, lead cross-functional meetings, track performance and make recommendations for improvement
Manage 3PL field teams for in-store merchandising, training and brand advocacy
GTM Planning: Support global new product introduction needs. Serve as the Channel SME in cross-functional product planning
Category management & market research: Proficient at researching the market to identify current trends and make recommendations for strategic channel optimizations
What you bring to the team:
Strong project management, planning and prioritization skills; ability to multitask and be adaptable
Independent and driven: a self starter. Able to pave the way for new and innovative programs to drive sales.
Collaborative: able to serve as the liaison between sales, creative, product marketing, and operations to build cross-functionally sound marketing plans
A do-er and a thinker: we not only need you to design ways to drive sales, but have the grit and capability to execute just as well.
Strong communication and presentation skills (internally & externally)
Analysis and tracking tools (Excel, Google Sheets, Tableau, Power BI)
Presentation tools (PowerPoint, Google Slides, Keynote)
What else you will bring:
Bachelor of Arts/Science degree
7 years of managing successful channel marketing programs for Tier 1 national Retail/Etail/B2B partners, preferably within the Consumer Electronics industry. Experience working with retailers such as Amazon, Best Buy, or similar is preferred.
Comfortable digging into the numbers, gleaming insights and making informed decisions (via analysis and tracking tools: Excel, Google Sheets, Tableau, Power BI)
Strong communication skills in all forms (both internally & externally). You’re not afraid to build a deck or two and deliver the content in a meaningful way (via presentation tools like PowerPoint, Google Slides, Keynote)

We are Molekule and we’re changing air purification. Molekule uses 20 years of breakthrough science to destroy airborne pollutants, leaving behind truly, clean air. Our mission isn’t just making air purifiers, but cleaning the air everywhere. It’s a lofty goal, but that's why we need you.

Molekule Values:
Humility
"Check your ego at the door."
Determination & Grit
"We believe in what we're doing, that's why we persevere through problems."
Ownership
"We roll up our sleeves, do the work, own the outcomes, and are proud of our contributions (no matter the size)."
Community
"We're all in this together."
Passion
"We're devoted to changing the world for the better."
Growth Mindset
"I know that I don't know everything, there's always more to learn. I learn from my mistakes."
Communication
"Candid, Effective, Respectful. Assuming Good Intentions."

Organizational Philosophy
The objective of all organizational processes is to turn our organization into something scalable, repeatable, and efficient that reflects our culture.

Our organizational philosophy is "Every great accomplishment is the result of a team working in harmony, not just individuals. We believe teamwork and a sense of egalitarian" responsibility is fundamental to building a great organization.

“Here’s a job where you’ll create the stuff you actually want to see in your own feed.”

MMC is next-gen comms agency that uses influence and culture to catapult business and get the world talking. The creative department is looking for an agile Senior Copywriter - steeped in pop culture (partnered with a Senior Art Director) - who can bring the conceptual heat to every assignment. From shareable content series to opportunistic social campaigns to engaging experiences that make eyes bulge and jaws drop. You’ll work across a range of CPG and consumer clients who are demanding ideas that earn people’s attention and engagement because they’re just that amazing.

WE SHOULD TALK IF:
You fight against mediocrity in idea and execution
You’re a collaborative and strategically responsible boundary pusher who works quickly - at the speed of culture
You have 5+ years of experience in integrated campaign development, shareable content and experiential marketing
You’re a firm believer that it’s no longer about :30 TV spots and print ads
It’s a brand-new marketing world out there with traditional advertising on life-support. You see the massive potential for comms agencies to lead the way
The future is highly-shareable content, immersive experiential marketing, social media campaigns and thought-provoking digital experiences
You search for and find connections others miss
You’re on top of pop culture, trends and bleeding-edge ways to use social platforms
You find it perfectly acceptable to experiment often and aren’t afraid to push the limit
You’re a builder of ideas
You write up your ideas to sell and are engaging in presentations with clients
Collaboration with a diverse group of people and functions is not only fun, it leads to the best work
ABOUT US:

MMC leverages its PR heritage and today is a data-driven, 3.0 modern communications company that delivers scaled influence, cultural relevance and brand talkability to our Fortune 200 consumer and healthcare brands. Our goal is to do innovative work and drive business results for our clients. Innovators at heart, we love to build and challenge the status quo. That’s why The Holmes Report awarded us both 2018 Global Consumer Agency of the Year AND Campaign of the Year. For the entrepreneurially minded, working at MMC is an amazing opportunity to get people talking, thinking and behaving differently.

Our team is a deeply committed and somewhat quirky bunch of content creators, brand builders, growth hackers, storytellers, experientialists, artists, mad data scientists, tech junkies and trend sensors. All armed with powerful ideas and a strong point of view and drive to win. We’re relentlessly curious, always creating, innovating often, agile and responsive.

MMC is moving fast and we have doubled our business in the last 5 years. Can you keep up? If you fit our qualifications, we have a spot for you.

When applying, please include your portfolio link along with a tweet-length description of why you're the one we should hire.

Position: Marketing Manager

Location: Madison, WI

Full-time/Part-time/Temporary: Full-time

Travel (%): 10%

International: No

Job Summary

Duties and responsibilities of the Marketing Manager – Kid Trax, include managing the brand’s strategic growth through developing and maintaining a consistent positive image for the brand both online and offline. Supporting and assisting the Director of Marketing in all activities related to the brand.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Brand Marketing Responsibilities (30%)
Assists Director of Marketing in building a 1-3 year marketing strategy that connects the passion points of our consumers with our brand, product, and corporate strategies and objectives.
Defines, plans, and launches annual and seasonal campaigns and priorities for the business.
Maintains an in-depth understanding of the brand, category, competitors, and consumers to ensure relevant insights to fuel all marketing elements.
Manages internal and external partners to support the activation of integrated marketing plans. Establishing strong partnerships and processes with our internal teams (Creative services, PR, Sales, Retail, Product, Legal, Customer Service, and Finance) to effectively execute marketing campaigns.
Tracks and manages brand business performance. Analyzes and reports key marketing metrics with a view to strengthening marketing plan / activities for the future.
Manages the Kid Trax marketing budget, spending efficiently to achieve our marketing goals.
Strategically assesses current activation of assets across media, experiential marketing, spokespeople, festivals, and event properties to identify strategic white spaces where our brand should be.
Kid Trax Ecommerce Merchant (30%)
Define and execute our direct to consumer sales strategies for KidTraxToys.com.
Work collaboratively with sales and product management to establish and manage the online assortment including establishing pricing.
Build and execute digital marketing programs and campaigns to drive traffic and profitable sales on KidTraxtoys.com.
Collaborate with the digital marketing team on enhancing SEO and UX.
Manages and executes the Email Marketing program delivering growth in email database and growth in sales conversion.
Content Marketing Duties (20%)
Leads the creation and execution of consumer programs, campaigns, and annual high-profile product launches.
Evaluates creative ideas and thinking with a critical eye and understanding of the brand equity, vision and strategic priorities.
Manages the influencer program, seeking out, vetting, and selecting appropriate individuals to represent the Kid Trax brand.
Develop content for the brand website; keeping in mind brand voice and consumer journey optimization.
Maintain awareness of brand standards and guidelines, and make sure they are implemented for all assets before they are deployed to digital channels.
Measures/analyzes performance of all web activity; including traffic, content views, and demographics, and provide insights and key learnings to affiliated teams.
Social Media & Digital Marketing (10%)
Drives a holistic social media channel strategy that considers brand & product representation.
Build and manage all aspects of multiple social media accounts, including community development and content creation.
Create sharp, enticing content (including, but not limited to Facebook posts, Tweets, Instagram Posts, Instagram stories, and short format videos) which engage the brand’s audience across social channels.
Manage and implement a paid digital and social paid media advertising plan, using data, driven decision making.
Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to assist in better positioning and to help optimize strategy in real-time.
Other Duties Assigned (10%)
Assist in presenting at key customer meetings on key Kid Trax initiatives.
Plans, manages, and executes brand event activities nationally and locally
Follows internal controls and company policies set by Pacific Cycle Inc. and Dorel Sports.
Contributes to the success of Pacific Cycle Inc. by leading or assisting with other projects and tasks as assigned.
Minimum Requirements
College education ideally with degree in Business, Marketing, or Communications.
Masters study or degree a benefit.
At least five years experience in marketing role with social media responsibilities.
Experience in selling directly online
Enthusiasm and energy for the position
Passionate about marketing
Outstanding communicator and writer
Exhibit Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) computer skills
Must have own transportation
Will work on site during regular business hours
Team player who enjoys working with others
Dependable
Outgoing and friendly
Self-motivated and creative idea generator
Key Competencies
Innovative
Proactive and takes action without being prompted
Creativity
Generates original ideas, encourages new ways of thinking, explores options, and develops innovative solutions
Functional/Technical Expertise
Remains current in their area of expertise and serves as a resource in that area of the organization
Change Agility
Adaptable
Embraces needed change and modifies their behavior when appropriate to achieve organizational objectives
Effective in the face of ambiguity
Results Orientation
Maintains an appropriate focus on outcomes and accomplishments
Motivated by achievement, and persist until the goal is reached
Conveys a sense of urgency to make things happen
Respects the need to balance short- and long-term goals
Influence
Skilled at directing, persuading, and motivating others
Ability to flex their style to direct, collaborate, or empower, as the situation requires
Ability to establish a personal power base built on mutual trust, fairness, and honesty

About Our Benefits

Zeno Group offers a creative and differentiating benefits package including a variety of medical and dental choices, vacation, optional and sick time. We also offer a 401(k) plan, pretax flexible spending accounts, tuition assistance, a prescription drug benefit plan, a vision plan, long-term and short-term disability, life insurance and programs that support flexibility and promote work/life balance.

In addition, our unique ZenoFit wellness program offers financial support to pursue the wellness activity of your choice. Zeno Group's culture is innovative and energetic. If you thrive on a creative challenge and are looking for an opportunity that offers plenty of growth potential and career development, then we are looking for you!

Say hello on Twitter: @zenogroup. Join us on Facebook: Facebook.com/zenogroup

Do you share Hornblower's passion for providing amazing experiences? If you're an enthusiastic team player who thrives in an environment where communication, creativity, and cooperation are encouraged, this may just be the opportunity for you. As we say at Hornblower, why work when you can cruise?

An Event Manager is the person who is responsible for the success of an event. They are the person that the guests, client, crew, and other management look to as the leader of an event. They have been chosen and trained by management because they have shown that they possess the qualities needed to be an Event Manager. Some of these qualities include leadership, organization, time management, dedication, excellent communication; as well as proper judgment and perspective.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Review events in HELM at the beginning of the work week for discrepancies, conflicts, or questions. Communicate any issues to the ADFB.
Report to the Abbey for contract or boarding report. Review with lead chef and sales manager.
Prepare diagrams based on guest count, client needs, and staffing level.
Gather additional items needed for event (beverages, supplies, paperwork, etc.)
Be on board yacht at scheduled in time for crew, ready to start pre-shift meeting.
Supervise and manage crew while on HCE premises (yacht, Abbey, pier, ticket booth, etc.)
Review all contract details with the crew and set expectations for the event. Be clear and concise.
Assign and direct crew in their position related responsibilities, including side work, resets, and cleaning of F&B areas.
Monitor and evaluate all food, beverage, and service quality during events.
Take corrective action to ensure a successful function.
Support the onboard Operations staff with all safety requirements, while communicating essential information regarding the event.
Completion of Senior Deckhand training, including, but not limited to, vessel operations, fire safety, CPR/AED, line handling, and First Aid.
Keep all vessels in "Show-Ready" condition.
Email MOD and ADFB any shortages. Email "Work Order" for any maintenance issues. Email sales manager for any event related challenges.
Responsible for accurately filling out incident reports for any crew injury. Confirm information with the captain and have them send to appropriate parties.
Additional job duties and responsibilities
Minimum Qualifications:
3 years working in the hospitality industry
Minimum 1 year as a Manager/Supervisor in Food & Beverage
Understands the importance of safety in the workplace and adheres to all mandated standards
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Have or be able to acquire a valid California Serve Safe certification as well as a TWIC and MMC
Hornblower has been the leading yacht and public dining cruise company in the United States for more than 38 years. Companies within the Hornblower family include Hornblower Classic Cable Cars, Hornblower Cruises and Events, American Queen Steamboat Company, Victory Cruises, Boston Harbor Cruises, HMS Global Maritime, Statue Cruises, Alcatraz Cruises, Niagara Cruises and NYC Ferry, operated by Hornblower.

Hornblower is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Additional, Hornblower participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations.
